Review_Date: Colin C wrote a review Mar 13
Review_Title: High price and very average service.
Review_Text: In my experience I found that the Sofitel hotel in Marrakesh was not a good value for money when it comes to using their pool. They charged a fee of 100 euros per person just to enter the hotel and access its amenities which I believe is an exorbitant amount. Moreover I noticed that the prices seemed to be higher for Western guests which is unfair and can leave a bad impression on visitors.    Overall I was disappointed with the service provided by the Sofitel hotel in Marrakesh and I do not recommend it to other travelers who are looking use their facilities.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great 5 star staff and hotel with some service improvement needed.
Review_Text: As a visually impaired person (VIO) traveling with a disabled mother the staff were fantastic caring and compassionate throughout. Although on arrival the twin bedded room wasn‚Äôt allocated at arrival although asked for. The initial check in wasn‚Äôt Ss welcoming no Moroccan Tea etc. Had to insist on our specific room which they gave but communication was an issue.  At breakfast Khalid served us and was exceptional such a lovely guy. Zachary‚Äôs also made us welcome and was very professional as was a lovely lady Emile. Hakim was also lovely and helpful. Breakfast was nice but for a 5 star would have liked more choice ie pancakes almond croissants etc. the staff were always very kind. The room service menu however was limited but ok. Asking for specific teas or milk was often hard work as lost in communication and had to often ring several times. For that reason I felt a lack of a 5 star experience.  I always ask myself as part of my stay whether I‚Äôd stay again or recommend to others. Yes for the comfort and kindness not for the dysfunctional service and believe that to be poor management. More staff better pay may help as the hotel is highly priced. It does need transforming to make it s total 5 star experience. On check out I heard another resident speaking to the duty manager about poor service so not alone.  Finally thank you to all of the staff again including Miriam who cleaned our room she was lovely and kind to my mother. From security staff door staff and breakfast crew you are truly wonderful and deserve a pay rise!  Thank you mom amis‚Äô!

I like the outside area close to the garden the asian map was soo good just the need more creativity on the side of the cocktails.  Thank u every for the experienceüôèüôè

Review_Text: This is a lovely hotel. The rooms have all you need. Breakfast buffet is amazing! I‚Äôve never seen so many choices and it‚Äôs all very fresh. The food in the restaurants is delicious. The hotel is conveniently located yet quiet. The pools are beautiful.

Review_Date: barbara b wrote a review Mar 1
Review_Text: Rachide Is the best. He was so kind and took care of us. The shisha here was exellent the vive in this place Is great . We will definetly come back in this place .  The Vine i suggest here Is the Maroccan one :)

For a high end hotel/resort I expected it to be in a lot better condition. It was great don't get me wrong. But the details were not paid attention to. Cushions on the patio/pool chairs especially at the elite diamond member infinity pool were pulling apart at the seams the loungers were badly in need of fixing dated rooms. The suite was very very dated. Everything was very clean expect for the dust from the desert air landing on things but that's to be expected. We stayed over xmas holiday and couldn't get a confirmed yes or no wrt the holiday meal and if they were having one. The cleaning staff were amazing and went above and beyond to help you. The front end staff were friendly enough but didn't have the added touch of making sure you got what you needed and often we found having to contact them several times to get things fixed when issues arose. With some modernizing it would be amazing again but feels quite old once inside the hotel. For the price I'd assumed better attention to details

Review_Title: Update your website if its 3 years since you done Sunday Brunch and dont gaslight your guests for arriving expecting it
Review_Text: U promote a Spectacular Sunday Brunch all over the internet and your own website but it doesnt exist. We had planned to celebrate a very special occasion at the brunch but were laughed at by reception. Ohh brunch we havnt done that since b4 covid. We are like are u sure look here are all the links. We even booked. More laughs no no no. We dont do brunch. Try somewhere else.

Very good experience especially with Rachid 10/10 hospitality with shisha and cocktails and heating. Good selection of cocktails and mocktails and great music! Would 100% recommend to anyone who is in Marrakech.

Review_Date: Vinay D wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: If you find yourself in Marrakech at least a few days at this classy establishment will make you think you've died and gone to heaven. The rooms amenities food and service are of the highest calibre. The breakfast buffet was out of this world with a selection that blew our minds.    We would like to recognize every member of the staff we interacted with including the restaurant reception concierge bellhops housekeeping ground crew and security. Calling out just a few from the restaurant staff--Rachida Bachkar Ilham Ibrahim Quorfi Hicham Nohaila Abderrahim Farah--as well as the concierge Adil (who selected some great tours and our wonderful driver Ali).

Review_Title: Excellent Base To Both Chill Out And Explore
Review_Text: We enjoyed another excellent stay at the Sofitel (our fourth visit in 12 years) staying this time in the Spa side which just means bedrooms which are fairly modern and not in a Moroccan style. A continuing highlight from previous times was the incredible breakfast bar with a huge range of delicious options and wonderful attentive staff especially Rachida and her other waiter and waitress colleagues Backar Ilham Quorsi Hicham Farah and Zakaria who looked after our every need in an exemplary way.  For us the attractions of the hotel combined: a largish modern comfortable hotel with beautiful pools and fabulous breakfasts plus brilliant staff; located outside the Medina but within easy access to it also the modern Gueliz area to the north; and French owned - so there was a guaranteed minimum standard from a European visitor's point of view.  A perfect base to either chill out or to explore the sights at will.  I used the very decent gym for the first time on this occasion. Note that if you go and want advice you need to fix a time with Abdul the coach (who does not speak English) if you want him to explain the equipment. If you want him to help with training sessions he will charge for them. But asking him to give an initial explanation is free and part of his duties.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: One of my favorite hotels of the trip. I felt the room was very comfortable. I overlooked the pool. Had a balcony wish it had been a but warmer to enjoy sitting out there. The grounds are very well maintained. Bed comfortable. Staff were friendly. Lots of breakfast choices. There are walkable restaurants in the area of varying price points and cuisines. The area is pleasant.

Review_Date: wei z wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: Horrible experience with the recommended ‚Äúluxury‚Äù private tour.
Review_Text: I booked a tour through the concierge at the hotel lobby. He seems ambitious and knowledgeable. He told me the private tour for Marrakesh is a wonderful choice. With Sofitel brand you put such trust in them so decide to do this. Starting by concierge asking for all cash payment I paid him $150 Euros. He promised me with private driver and private guide it gonna to be great tour with focus on history buildings ( I told him I am an architect).    The day of the tour starts at 10 AM they starts to drive me around neighborhoods outside of the Medina old town later on I realize this just to kill time and demonstrate the car is ‚Äúuseful‚Äù. So the guide took me briefly visited the Dar el Bacha then ask me either need to visit Ibn Youssel school I told him you are the guide he said it is very similar to Dar el Bacha. I persisted to visit it. It turns out it is unique and not ‚Äúsimilar‚Äù. The guide shows no interest to do his job as guide rather passing the time and get rid of this duty. After this he took me to the carpet shop furniture shop and oil shop even after I told him I am NOT interested in shopping. It was totally waste of time. I told the concierge that I am architect and solely interested in buildings and history culture it doesn‚Äôt seem the guide gets the message. After passing the market the final stop was the Saadien Tomb. I asked him if there anything else after this. He said nothing. I was surprised that the city has such little to see. But later on it proves wrong the city has way much to see such as the palaces and many other places. We barely used the driver and car and the guide showed me only three landmarks plus his planned shopping which I told him at beginning I am NOT interested to do. All this for $ 150 EUROS? I have to call it a total rape off and surprisingly enough it was from Sofitel concierge recommendation. It is a shame for such international brand as customer in a new place you put all the trust in them it is quite an unfortunate. I will never stay with this brand again.

Review_Title: Beautiful Hotel, wonderful suite and fantastic breakfast
Review_Text: Booked one suite for my wife and I and one room for my sister for 9 nights.  As an All Accor Diamond Member we were all looked after by a fantastic team in room hospitality and the breakast experience was superb even at busy times.  There is a heated pool and unheated pool at ground level which are both worth checking out.  On the upper level there is a Privilaged Area with heated pool for Diamond members and guests which is exceptional.  On occasion I believe you can pay to use this facility which unfortunately happened during our stay and resulted in 2 seperate couples meeting up and causing mayhem with shouting and swearing being their preference.  The hotel is not far from most attractions in Marrakesh and occasionally the walk to the Medina via the park is worthwhile.  One downside is the hotel does not have an Executive Club Milliesime Lounge nor provide the Lounge afternoon tea you would expect in most Sofitel's therefore the price is somewhat expensive for less 'benefits' but some of this ismitigated by the wonderful staff....look out for Fatima at breakfast she is wonderful.

Review_Title: Filthy hotel, with a terrible staff attitude to boot
Review_Text: An absolutely filthy hotel. I was given a filthy hotel room with mold all around the bathroom dirt on the walls various liquid stains on the ground and stains on the bed.    There was constant dragging noise from the upstairs neighbour all night like someone was dragging a couch or chair across a wooden floor. I found it really hard to sleep.    The staff's attitude was horrible. Staff were so unfriendly.    On check out they accused me of taking something from the minibar. I told them I didn't as I hadn't. They kept asking me and asked me to sign a CONTRACT saying that I didn't use anything from the minibar. A horrible experience.

Review_Date: kim t wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: We have been coming to this hotel for years. However this was our first visit since Covid struck. It has had a major facelift and beautiful refurbishment yet still managed to keep some of the original features which made us feel like we had come back ‚Äòhome‚Äô . Once you walk through the building you find yourself in an oasis with lush gardens and palm trees Spotlessly clean everywhere and the smell is divine.  . Set in the cosmopolitan area Hivernage you could not wish for a better location. Walking distance to all the fabulous restaurants/lounges and clubs. Yet within a 15 min walk approx are in the old town with the hustle and bustle of the medina .  The staff are amazing always with a smile . We would like to give a shout out to the staff of the L‚Äôorangerie restaurant - Souhayla Nounia Amine and Hitcham. A happy smiley welcome and fabulous food with great service. Thank you.  The concierge - helped us out in a very sticky situation with a fake purchase in a shop - going the extra mile they took us in a taxi to the shop. After many discussions I was finally presented with the legit sunglasses. Great thanks to Adil and Rida üôèüèª.  Every lunchtime we would have lunch by the pool. Great menu and wine selection.  We are planning our visit again for next year!!  This hotel offers something for everyone it‚Äôs not a huge sprawled out hotel it‚Äôs grand but welcoming. Would recommend 100%
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My two sons (ages 9 and 11) and I ate at The Orangery. Exceptionally friendly and quick service high quality food from a very balanced menu and soothing live jazz music. A special thanks to Mounia Trabchi Souhaila Igherzi and Sakima Chaukri for delivery of fine dining experience.

Review_Title: Four to five star facilities, two star service
Review_Text: I stayed at Sofitel Marrakech the first time around five years ago and had some very fond memories that‚Äôs why before booking this time I was somewhat surprised to see the average and negative reviews.  Facilities: The facilities (pool lobby etc) are nice but the rooms need updates. No kettle no nespresso machine no brochure to figure out how to call the reception etc. tried room service and the food was poor / very basic. Breakfast: the hotel is huge so the breakfast is like a canteen with stuff rushing around no smiles. The food selection is ok.  Other: Had a blow dry done at the spa as well. While the result was ok the spa is extremely dated and dark. The hairdresser didn‚Äôt speak English and was absolutely not motivated to be there.  Checkout: had to wait for 10 minutes to check out with only one person ahead of me and one staff member checking out. She clearly could have called another member of staff to help or send me to another reception but she was just not bothered. This was at peak checkout time at 12. Again poor service and disappointed. Sofitel please train the staff properly if you want to call this hotel a five star.

Never thought I‚Äôd say that about a hotel but it feels like family.    With every new stay seeing the staff back and being taken care with the same  or even better if possible kindness happiness is so heartwarming.    Huge Thank you to Ahmed el Mounzil for all of his work. So many other people to thank and congratulate starting with Fatima Zahra at the front desk the kitchen with Oussama Jamal Cheffe Afra and Reda the restaurants with Nouihi  Bachkar Ilham  Hicham Ibrahim Hadja Fatima Ouarfi and of course the sweetest of all the piscine staff members : soulaimane Youness abdelghani Hassan Hmamsi Abdelilah Rachid and Younes.    Also this time I could notice and appreciate the hard work of security with troublemakers thanks to Noredine and Abdoucheffi. Thank you guys for keeping us safe and sound.    In all √† staff like no others

Review_Text: Great place to relax and enjoy a vacation. very well maintained property with good people serving you. rooms are spacious and clean. Restaurants are good. great lobby an drestaurants in the hotel provide many choices in what kind of food you want to eat. Breakfast is very very good.

Review_Date: Cindy S wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: I've been a tour operator for over 30 years and never have I seen such incompetency between the booking agent Accor and the Sofitel. It took me at least 4 days to find someone who could help me with my group reservation. Luckily Oumaima in reservations and Zackaria( butler) were able to sort out the rooms with the guest names and to finally make my final payment. I personally had to be at the hotel to make payment which was ludicrous. This may not be an issue for solo travlers or couples traveling but it is a true reflection of the hotel management. I was also overcharged for a cocktail party for my group. For a 5 star hotel the management should be more competent. Otherwise the property is beautiful staff at the restaurants very pleasant and the rooms comfortable.

Review_Title: Not a true 5-star hotel, but good value
Review_Text: I will caveat my review by saying that I‚Äôm highly selective when it comes to hotel accommodations. The location is excellent and the property itself could be 5 stars but the service is 3 stars. The exception to this was Saed (baggage handler) who was absolutely excellent and went above and beyond to make us feel welcome - he gets 5 stars for his service. Unfortunately the front desk staff was quite rude unwelcoming and made us feel as if we were inconveniencing them. If you want a true 5-star hotel with 5-star service then pay a little extra and stay at the Four Seasons.

Saed (baggage handler) was amazing - shining star of the whole hotel!! Friendly helpful and very accommodating- he answered all our questions and showed us around. If it was just him I would have given 5 stars. Front desk service was just okay. Not much explanation as to where everything was. Rooms were clean.

The hotel is well located (which is quite important if you want to visit marakesh). Our room was very big clean and comfy (was not expecting this) and there was a large variety of food for lunch. We did not have the chance to test the hotel facilities (spa gym etc as our stay was short). Nothing to complain about this stay - it was short but very pleasant!

Review_Date: Inder Raj wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: The hotel fails its 5 star status on several accounts.    We arrived at the hotel around 11AM securing a booking for the previous day. Upon arrival we found out that we didn‚Äôt have a room ready. Our room was finally ready around 2:30PM by which point we were completely exhausted and tired of hanging out around the lobby and waiting for our too to be ready. The room that was provided to us was absolutely dirty (bathrooms were completely unclean and had several stains on and around the toilet bowl and the floors) and the room wasn‚Äôt what we paid for (we paid for a king room with a garden view only to get a double bed room with the view of the outer wall). It took an additional hour + to switch rooms.    Another oddity is the fact that the minibar check walked into our rooms at the most random and oddest times unannounced. Upon checking out we were assessed $180 for minibar items that we never purchased. The issues took several minutes to resolve at the reception.    On the second day during my stay I asked the concierge about getting train tickets to visit Fes and inquired if there‚Äôs an online method to purchase. The Concierge informed me that there‚Äôs no such me thing and that he‚Äôll send a valet over to the train station to buy my tickets and all I had to do was give him 800 dirham (taxi back and forth for valet + train tickets). I later found out that I was exorbitantly overcharged - two train tickets to Fes cost no more that 300 dirham and there was a method to purchase tickets online. It doesn‚Äôt feel good to be hustled and duped by the concierge in this fashion at all!    Lastly nearly $1100 worth of items were stolen from us during our stay. I‚Äôve contacted the hotel several times and not received a single response back.    Beware when staying here. There‚Äôs much to be improved in the hotel‚Äôs overall guest experience
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Can‚Äôt wait to return and wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to recommend it to anyone looking for somewhere to eat in Marrakech.

So happy specially want to mention about Ms. Sekaina ait kaddour. Wonderful hospitality experience. Never saw such care and affection. From the moment I checked in they kept asking if I need anything. I will definitely visit again.

Review_Title: Great hotel with great service and a great location
Review_Text: I go to Sofitel a handful of times throughout the year and it‚Äôs probably my favorite hotel in Marrakech. The hotel is in the Hivernage district which is in the new part of town but it it also within walking distance from the Medina. The area where the hotel is has some of the best hotels and cafes the city has to offer. The staff is very nice and the hotel has nice lounges restaurants and even one of the best nightclubs in town.

Review_Date: Travis H wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Title: Hotel with potential, but beware billing issues and prepare for little customer service
Review_Text: Visitors with non-local credit cards should be aware that the hotel now automatically charges you in foreign currency but for a 3.5% markup. They do not ask like any other merchant would. In the current era where travelers often have no foreign currency fee cards it‚Äôs an unpleasant surprise. Staff informed me that the automatic conversion without asking the customer what currency to pay in is policy.    I stayed here twice recently and rarely post negative reviews but this otherwise acceptable hotel had too many basic fixable issues. Staff and managers do nothing to actually fix problems but will dig the hole deeper and leave you frustrated.    Also prepare to either spend time confirming billed amounts are correct or just not mind being overcharged. Value of a guest‚Äôs time seemed a foreign concept whether when resolving issues or just waiting for something like a drink by the pool.    The hotel otherwise is acceptable with clean spacious rooms that work for multi-day stays and a very large pool. The gym is what international travelers would expect at a 3-star but might get one by. Housekeeping are very attentive if you go to them directly but seemed not connected to the desk.    This hotel could deserve 5 star reviews but especially for a place operating under an international brand has a lot of work to do to be competitive. I would think twice before staying here again or recommending it to anyone else.

Review_Title: Travelled Feb 2018; You cant win with the Travel Agents
Review_Text: We booked a room for 4 people. Not 2 but Love Holiday screwed us over.    the kids had to sleep on the sofa in the room. No bed was provided as a extra.    Even the hotel told us the room was not for 4 people but the booking confirmation we had said 4 on it.    The drinks discount was given after we had to fight for it. No discount was given as part of the package.    We booked a half board basis for 4 people but it was for 3 when we arrived.    indoor pool has a charge to use it & No kids could use that.    But this is a beautiful please and the heated outdoor swimming pool is nice.    the room is actually well decorated and we had no issues with the room itself / food or staff. All these were at a very high standard.

Review_Title: Horrific, shocking and disappointing - don't stay here!
Review_Text: I really do not like writing bad reviews especially as many of the staff seemed to be ok people. But it really is difficult to express just how bad the service was during my stay. We arrived at 2:00 pm 4 June and were asked to wait until 3 pm. Fair enough we went to the lobby waiting for the room. Service was horribly slow no welcome drink or tea. We got our room at 4:00 pm. I had requested a twin because I was with my mother. Unfortunately the easy answer is we are fully booked and we don‚Äôt have rooms.  I had requested a rollaway bed which was not set up when I went out to dinner at 8 pm. I reminded them. When I got back at 11 pm it was still not set up. I called them again and was promised: "within 10 minutes". A bed arrived very late.  The breakfast was a good professional staff and smiling during the service when I‚Äôm back from my breakfast I found out that my rollaway bed is gone. really I fell myself in a tent not 5 Start Hotel.  After c/out I got my car from the valley was damage when I asked the staff they told me to go to fix it and we will pay you what amazing service at 5* Hotel?????  I spend my money to get my Hight bled pressure during the weekend.

Review_Date: Hena P wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Title: Awful experience, terrible customer service , disrespectful staff, poor food choices, not five star hotel
Review_Text: We decided to book the sofitel after reading the reviews.    The first thing when we arrived was we were not offered any drinks or refreshments however people arriving at the same time as us were offered these.    We had booked three rooms for our holiday. Upon arrival they were trying to put myself in a connecting room to my parents who were celebrating their anniversary. The receptionist was very rude and stated that we could have the door locked for the duration of my stay. If I wanted to have a connecting room to my parents I would have booked that or stated it in the special requests.    Check in was meant to be at 15:00 yet one of the three rooms was not available till 16:30 and even then the housekeeping was coming into the room to put towels and water bottles.    On the morning of the next day myself and my sister in law woke up to none of the bathroom lights working in both rooms. We tried to phone reception through the phone provided in the rooms and they were not picking up. Upon which I came downstairs and spoke to the gentlemen at reception who informed me the technician would not be available until 9am when he starts work the time at the moment in question was 8am. So I was expected to have showers in the dark. I had to request the gentlemen at reception to have someone come to my room to check the lights before then to which the guy who came said the lights "had to be charged". We complained to the hotel manager Marianne about this and she did provide us with 4 spa massages as a good will gesture. There was five of us on the holiday.    During out 6 day stay majority of the time was spent at reception trying to sort out rhe various problems we were facing. Please bare in mind if booking this place you will face ridiculously long queues at reception and even when you manage to speak to someone they will be beyond rude.    Within the hotel there are four lifts half of which do not work. The doors within the lift do not open if there is a presence at the door so if being crushed by lift doors is what you want from a holiday then this is the place for you.    On the last day of our holiday our flight was at 10pm so we spoke to the hotel assistant manager the evening before whose name was Mariamme to ask if we could have our lunch on day of departure included within our half board. As we had not spent anywhere near our allowance during any of the days we were staying there She said that was fine. The morning on day of departure we had a conversation with her within which she stated that she had told the L'oasis resturant that we would be having lunch within our half board.    When it got to lunchtime we went to the L'oasis restaurant. Every single day this is the location we had lunch as within our hotel deal we had a half board offer. Bare in mind if you go for the half board deal with this hotel you do not get any drinks included within the allowance you get. Not even water so be prepared to pay for all beverages despite paying very large amount for the hotel stay.    Every day the service within the L'oasis bar was slow and delayed we would have to request every thing twice if not more times before it arrived. On the last day as they believed we were paying customers the service provided was quick efficient and very sweet. Abdelulah the resturant manager in particular changed over the level of service provided on the last day.    After our last lunch abdelulah told us to come with him to reception as it turnt out our lunch on day of departure was not included. The manager we had spoken to in order to confirm our lunch was included within the half board offer had left due to sickness. However when we messaged the number she gave us she replied back saying she was in meetings all day. We spoke to multiple members at reception including sukena and imen who all said that it was a misunderstanding that the manager said our lunch was included and forced us to pay for the bill as otherwise they would automatically debit the card we provided them during check in. Why we had to pay for lunch despite there being a misunderstanding on the manager part is unbelievable especially as we never used the full allowance on any of the days.    If you are booking the hotel due to the infinity pool the pool will not be ready until September due to some brick work problems which was another misleading advertisement on their website. The main reason for why we booked this hotel was due to the infinity pool upon arrival we were told that it was out of bounds.    On checkout they were trying to charge us for drinks out of the mini bar when we have not drank any of the drinks within the mini bar. We would walk over to Carrefour the supermarket 10min away and buy our drinks from the day. Despite this they charged us for mini bar drinks even after persistently saying we had not drank any of the bottles or drinks within the bar. The hotel staff members were so rude and abnoxious I have never experienced coming to a 5 star hotel and having to pay for drinks that we have not used.    Overall if you prefer your holiday to be spent in the hotel reception speaking to unhelpful and extremely rude receptionists. Who all stand in a line speaking about you and the issues you are facing instead of helping. With lifts and facilities which do not work. Along with restaurants which offer very limited vegetarian options then this is the hotel for you.    If you would actually like to receive the 5 star service you have paid for then this is not the hotel for you. If I could offer them less stars than a 1 I would as this hotel has completly ruined our holiday.

Review_Text: I visited the restaurant l‚ÄôOrangerie I passed a really good night and I enjoyed every second with my girlfriend and also for the service was really good and people who works (Hicham kebir Siham Sakina sohaila) their they are nice I want to thank this restaurant and the people who are organizing it for the good ambience and happiness they give to us

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sunshine J wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Title: Another fantastic stay, thanks to Imane!
Review_Text: Before Covid 19 I would regularly visit marrakech 2 or 3 times a Year and the sofitel is one of my favourite hotels to stay that is when they have availability. After 2 and half years away from Morocco and the Sofitel I was concerned it wouldn't feel or be the same but I shouldn't of worried as soon as I saw lovely Imane my stay become even better. She's absolutely wonderful and a true treasure! Sofitel hotel are very lucky to still have Imane working for them after all these years!  I would also like to thank lovely Reda the singing chef he's fabulous! Salah on cheese and salmon he's such a nice man! Afro Ibrahim Karim nouihi Meriem And Samad and Jamal all great and hardworking! And finally fashionable Zack he has a stunning shop in the hotel! ‚ô•Ô∏è

Review_Date: Robert L wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Text: Stayed in June 2022. First time in Marrakesh. Some positives but lots of negatives with the hotel.    Negatives:    1. Check-in was chaotic. The woman that checked us in was helpful but some male colleagues were very rude and disinterested. Check-in was very busy because the reception in the sister hotel was closed.  2. On two days the pool was extremely busy partly because people were reserving large numbers of loungers from 7 am (against hotel policy). I also wasn't aware that the hotel offered day passes to the pool for non-residents. Had I known this I probably won't have booked this hotel.  3. No designated non-smoking areas by the pool in the external restaurant or the external bars. I also noticed two people smoking inside and not being challenged by hotel staff including vaping by the internal breakfast buffet  4. The hotel restaurant was nice with the live band but service was dismal. Simply too few trained waiters.  5. I booked the hotel car to take us to the airport but reception failed to act on it which meant the transportation desk knew nothing about it. Took ages to resolve.    Positives:    1. Despite being crowded the pools were nice and clean  2. The spa was good but expensive and heavy emphasis on upselling products  3. The breakfast buffet was good  4. The superior room was a good size with a nice balcony  5. The hotel is about 25 minutes walk to the medina so no need for taxis    Overall for the cost the hotel is OK but if you want good service go elsewhere.

Review_Date: Gene D wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Title: One of the hotels in Morocco!!
Review_Text: This is the third time I have stayed at the Marrakech Sofitel and Spa in the past year. The rooms food. Spa and pools are excellent. But what made my stay in this Marrakech hotel perfect was the AWESOME staff! Touria Abderahim Oussama Imane and Wafa were so kind and helpful during each stay. Their warmth and professionalism is what I will remember most about my stay at the Softel. I DEFINITELY will return again and will DEFINITELY refer associates and friends to stay here.

The hotel obvious slogan is " We don't care".    Upon arrival to the hotel at 7:00pm the reception staff at turtle pace provided us with terrible disgusting rooms overlooking the hotel's Airconditioning compressors and claimed these were superior rooms? They are nothing but inferior rooms unfit for any guest.    We were it informed that the hotel was undergoing renovation and that we had to check in from a second side lobby? Any hotel that respects its guests should clearly state on their website and on all hotel search engines that renovation work was undergoing. The Sofitel did not even bother to leave an apology letter in the rooms to make up for the inconvenience their renovation has caused etc.    All group members complained that they cannot reach the reception or concierge or housekeeping or telephone operator from their rooms as all those departments simply DO NOT answer their phones.    If a guest staying at the Sofitel Marrakech is facing any kind of trouble or has a fire in their room - who cares?    We have stayed here brining several groups before but we certainly will never come here again.    Ashraf El Khadem  CEO  Egyptian Express Travel

The check in @ 3 pm which is preposterous now the front desk ask wants to see the transaction for booking whether it was a valid transaction üòí only because we were Indians rest of the Caucasians were not subjected to the similar treatment so much for ‚ÄúLive Limitless‚Äù when their heads are quite limited!

Review_Text: no vegetarian food only pizza at lunch by the pool time the staff seem stressed no time for guests at all hotel restaurant the supper big tennis flood lights are blinding could not see the very boring menu so sad

Review_Date: Hajar E wrote a review May 2022
Review_Text: Special thanks to Bahija who really took care of me. It was the best massage i had in my life. The facial was good too. She was both professional and friendly. If you are in marrakech you should definitely stop by and ask for her magical hands.

The hotel location and design is amazing however the hotel was full and the stuff at the front desk were overloaded nevertheless it does not give them the the right to be rude and impatient I have had an unpleasant experience with the receptionist staff they were extremely rude not attending to my requests. I have not received the deserved welcome for a Diamond member.  Also the pillow in the rooms are so uncomfortable I have neck pain. I‚Äôm extremely disappointed.

Review_Date: Naval J wrote a review May 2022
Review_Text: I visited the hotel in early April with my husband and my daughters. It has taken me a while to write a review but it does not take the shine away from the wonderful experience we had. I have stayed in many 5 star hotels but by far this one has been my favourite. Thank you to all the staff specially in breakfast pool and the lobby area for always making my daughters smile. Unknowingly we visited Marrakech during holy month of Ramadan. Despite the heat not even once we were given anything but a smile. That is something that will stay with me forever. We were given a junior suit with a massive balcony. I cannot tell you enough how amazing this room was. To the point that my husband and I are considering to visit this hotel once a year.  Once more thank you to all the staff in Sofitel.  Nawal

not the Sofitel quality we have experienced in the past. we are frequent customers but this particular property has disappointed us. staff service not the best food quality below average lots of choice at breakfast but not good quality of food. service is OK but very slow at pool for lunch time.

Review_Date: James R wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: We chose the Sofitel due to its location and ratings. I have stayed in several before including the Heathrow one the night before traveling to Marrakesh with BA.  There are some great aspects to the hotel but also some let downs.  Positives  - the location is really handy for the old town.  - rooms are large and very comfortable.  - the room was cleaned and towels replaced every day to a great standard.  - some staff are very helpful and friendly. My French is okay.. but staff speak English very well.  - the pool area is lovely.. thick beds and bar service.  Negatives  - check in was awful. No advice as to where anything was.. no guidance to check out times.. breakfast times. No offer of tours or advice on exploring Marrakesh.  - getting to the pool was through a restaurant area (often with groups eating.. which felt rude) or through a fire door with temporary stairs with scaffolding it was really confusing as with such an amazing pool and clearly scope to open up the reception area it would improve the feel of the hotel which felt dark and enclosed.  - lots of staff around but service was generally slow and poor.. one morning we asked 3 members of staff for a coffee and after 40mins gave up.  To sum up‚Ä¶ it was all a bit confusing‚Ä¶ the hotel has the potential to be amazing‚Ä¶ the rooms cleaning staff and pool area are 5 star.. but the service by waiters and reception/concierge is 3 star at best.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: It's really a good hotel especially in the restaurant l'orangerie  Everything's good with cleanliness i wish friend Ayoub for his fun spirit and his rational dealings with customers.  Thank you and for your service see you soon

Review_Date: Dave Hill wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: I had an early morning flight and was told the Sofitel would be a nice place to stay for a night. Wrong! My room overlooked the pool which had a bar/lounge blasting awful bass-heavy pop music. When I requested a room change I was told there was no such thing as a quiet room in the entire hotel. They all face the pool party. What a horrible design for a supposedly classy hotel! There are plenty of nice hotels in Marrakesh that somehow manage to have separate areas for fun and rest. DO NOT BOOK unless you like sappy thumping pop music shaking your walls.

Review_Date: A Aziz wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Text: This hotel is a real disappointment from the rude bartenders to the worn out furnitures in the hotel rooms. Add to that nosey staff and slow check in process. I strongly suggest to stay a way from this hotel if you want to enjoy Marrakech.

Review_Date: Ian H wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Text: First of all I can't fault the room or the grounds. It's a lovely building with beautiful immaculate grounds. The room was spacious and very comfortable. The pool was chilly but lovely and the breakfast was good. However the staff were singularly cold and unhelpful. There were no signs anywhere for the rooms and our group wandered around in a lost haze after being given no directions by the reception (who took a very long time to check us in) and having no help from a number of staff whom we asked for help. It just felt cold and sterile and lacking warmth or any sense of Moroccanness.....

Awful service came for lunch and the staff were so rude and could not wait to get rid of us. Kept disrupting us and the pool man on this date (19/03) was just terrible.  Would never stay here and the lunch was so bland and the service just the worst in Morocco

We love this place and have been three times in the last three years. It is classy but relaxing beautifully decorated and maintained and in a great location. The pools and gardens are so photogenic and a range of room offerings to suit every budget and occasion.

From arrival to departure the whole experience was just exceptional.  Although the country was just reopening for tourism this hotel was ready.  The hotel was immaculately presented from reception through to the spacious bedrooms. Housekeeping was like magic. We would go for breakfast and come back to a clean serviced room. The pool / terrace had lots of loungers etc to spend the day soaking up the sun. The waiting staff where always on hand to bring some refreshments. There are a selection of bars and restaurants to choose from. We loved the SO lounge in the evenings. Breakfast was a great experience. I wish I‚Äôd taken the name of the lady who looked after us. She was anazing. To be honest all the staff in this hotel are. I don‚Äôt think we passed a housekeeper with out them stopping and saying Bonjour! Really recommend this hotel. It and all the team are fantastic.

Review_Date: imad bz wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Title: Don‚Äôt go unless you like to be disappointed
Review_Text: We just stayed at Sofitel last night and had a disappointing experience.  We‚Äôre regular visitors to Marrakech and usually stay at other locations but decided to join couple friends who booked here and a lot of things went wrong this is not the Sofitel I visited in the early 2010‚Äôs‚Ä¶  - service became really bad. Calling reception for 25 minutes without an answer and being obliged to go down to ask for an iron was some of the things we faced  - the legendary Sofitel top-bedding is definitely not there anymore instead a blanket in a pouch delivers a very average sleeping experience‚Ä¶  - reading here some people are happy with the view. Definitely not our case with the 460->470 rooms facing an amazing double Parking space. Definitely not Marrakexh vibes. Be careful with the room you get and if you‚Äôre nice like us and too lazy to complain you‚Äôll get a poor view room for sure‚Ä¶  - the kids club is a joke don‚Äôt go with kids if you expect them to spend some time there or if they like kid‚Äôs clubs. They (4 and 8) both complained after 15mn about the lack of activities the darkness of the place and asked us to take them to the four seasons or fairmont ones their favorite in Marrakech. Also it closed too early at 16:00 on Saturday while it‚Äôs supposed to close later  - last but not least someone from the hotel entered our rooms yesterday night while we weren‚Äôt there and while our kids were sleeping with their nanny at 9:30pm scared them shortened our evening (we were out dining and came back as kids were crying) so basically made our date night out a complete failure‚Ä¶  Won‚Äôt step into this hotel again for sure and don‚Äôt if you expect a quality experience you‚Äôve got much better options in the city

I want to encourage you to improve service according to hotel standards and your customer service!  A lot of electrical appliances did not work. When we called reception for help we had to call multiple times in order for someone to actually come help us even though they answered and said they‚Äôd come every time.

Review_Date: G Mhee wrote a review Feb 2022
Review_Text: This was a wonderful visit. We had a very scary start to our time in Marrakech and ended up staying at the Sofitel last minute. We were looked after immediately. We met the concierge Reda who provided excellent restaurant recommendations. The other concierge (apologies did not catch his name) set us up with a local guide Ahmen/Ahmed who took us around very safely. He gave us some lovely information about the local setting and history. The facilities were great with only a few issues that were immediately resolved. All in all it very much saved our experience of Marrakech and would stay again.

excellent and friendly h√¥tel. rooms view is amazing while th whole hotel is very clean . what is really outstanding is the staff out there . Need to thank the lovely Manager of so lounge Souhaila and her team who have made our stay very enjoyable ighzi  roch sakina  boujmel amin and khaled. tarik  atika and kebir in the bar . bennali and abdilah for the amazing service . without forgetting the cuisine team chefs zaizi momo absi idriss zouliga azzed√Æe yassine and youness . but the big thank is for the direction Mr benkirane & Mme ikram for being present and very helpful.

Review_Text: The hotel is situated at a convenient location with an easy access to many places. The old city is at a walking distance where you can plan all your touristic and shopping activities.  The check in and out speeds are efficient. We came early for the check in and had to wait a little for the room to be ready while enjoying a welcome drink.  The room is big clean and cozy. All local touches were supported with a dark ambience. The sleeping comfort was excellent. The room has a balcony facing the fool or the city depending on your reservation.  The restaurant is amazing with all kinds of tastes for the breakfast.  The only disturbing point was the sound of a local music which is playing 16hrs a day I believe all around the hotel which is hearable from the room during midnight and also early in the morning.  There are 3 pools serving the guests. The colour selection of the poolside stuff are motivating you for a stay.  I suggest for all occasions and will come back definitely.

Review_Date: Rhys A wrote a review Aug 2021
Review_Text: Unfortunately not the best of experience. Property is nice with good location. Pool at rear of the hotel is quite nice. You are not allowed to bring any soft drinks or food into the hotel. It you have young kids please bare this in mind. The pool staff are very poor.    Around the pool to get anyone attention is hard work maybe under staffed not sure but the hotel wasnt busy. If you order food around the pool be patient as very very slow.    Concierge service are very helpful as are the reception staff. Breakfast is good as is the service.    Overall i would give 5/6 out of 10 for all over experience of the hotel.    Hope this is helpful.

Review_Title: Horrible, Appalling Service and Rude Staff and never again
Review_Text: Bad service is an understatement. Don‚Äôt be fooled by this hotels surprising reviews because it is just BAD. Bad service Rude Staff who have not clue. Try ordering something and you get passed from one staff to the other because no one wants to do their job. It‚Äôs just a JOKE. STAFF DONT WANT TO WORK SO you pay for service but no one to give you service. It‚Äôs ridiculous. Staff are just waiting for tips and when you tip them that‚Äôs the end. No more service. The staff Farah - Who kept coughing and grunting at breakfast buffet. How disgusting. It‚Äôs better to go to the bathroom and grunt until you‚Äôre throat is clear than to do this for 1 hours at breakfast - especially during Covid season. This is common teaching that you don‚Äôt grunt continuously at food/restaurants. And when we informed her manager because it was obviously unappealing someone coughing out cataar when you are eat for over an hour she gets upset and won‚Äôt serve us and won‚Äôt do her job. I mean honestly so your job. I‚Äôm not here to be your friend pleaSe do your job! The service at lunch by the pool is appalling. Staff keep passing the job to other staff and you end up getting no service. This hotel is to be avoided. The new bald head security guy is so rude. I mean I am your guest and a paying guest. I‚Äôm not here to be your buddy please do your job. Politeness is unheard of in this hotel. AVOID THIS HOTEL AT ALL COSTS

Review_Title: The most terrible stay in a Sofitel
Review_Text: Arrived at mid-night with my wife and my 18 months baby The balcony's table and couch were inside the room ( a total disaster ) Their was no water in the room at our arrival ( Only one used bottle in the dirty mini bar and another used bottle of sparkling water on the table). I asked for a cot for my baby they could not provide it after an hour and a half ( being tired and with all what happened i asked them just to ignore it because the baby was already asleep). Last but not least as i'am an accord frequent client i've used points to pay for my stay which they don't know how to handle. The points were deducted from my account at the time of booking. I was surprised at the check out with a totally different amount to pay they did not take into consideration my points. At the end they rededucted the points from my account ( i ended up having the points deducted twice). They really need to reconsider that hotel being a 5 stars. It is a shame
