Review_Date: Krisnadaia K wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: I`d like to compute our satisfation for the great attention of the waiter HAMOUDA that work in the Hotel Sofitel at our group composed of ten people. He was very kindness with us that made us happy. We stayed at the hotel for two days consequently we had two dinner there.  Thank`s a lot.

Review_Date: Laaziz M wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: Dear travelers    I like to have a good drinks in nice places  After my visit to Sofitel L'orangerie I Did enjoy the drink with the high end service from the L'orangerie Team begging with the most charming smile of Oumaim going true professional service from Omar Tariq  no3man  Jawad and Khadija with Souhaila   THEY ARE BEST BEST IN TOWN.

Review_Date: Ana C wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: This young waiter was very kind with our group of 10 people and even not able to speak portuguese he was tireless in serving us the best way possible during dinner the 2 nights we stayed at the hotel. Always polite and smiling he is really an example of genuine interest to provide a impecable service. Congratulations!

Review_Title: Great hotel, shame about the service
Review_Text: This hotel is beautiful with amazing gardens and pool areas with lovely day beds - perfect for some winter sun.    The bedrooms are clean and modern with plenty of space and a lovely bathroom. The rooms are also very quiet.    What let‚Äôs this hotel down is the service. Around the pool it felt like it was too much trouble to ask for even a menu. In the restaurant at breakfast it felt like the staff did not want to be there and everything was too much to ask. We asked five times at reception to have our air con fixed and after three nights gave up asking as we were leaving.    If you‚Äôre not going to be in the hotel much and aren‚Äôt too fussy about this service this hotel is great but a five star hotel should come with the same level of service.

Review_Date: Jeremy C wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Very good service and indeed tasty food! The environment as well as the waiters and waitresses provided my best experience in Marrakech so far. We ordered lamb shoulder and fillet of beef. Highly recommended. Will definitely stay here next time and enjoy the food here again. Thank you Sofitel!    Thanks for oumaima kebir hamouda noaamne jawad khadija tarik halima. Wiam ana souhaila siham and simo to also omar.

I‚Äôve spent four days (business for two days and and with family during weekend) in this very nicely located and very well managed hotel. All the employees were so kind (from the welcome teams to the restaurants concierge.... etc  bringing attention to all your needs and sometimes just asking if all is fine suggesting activities ... to sum up it‚Äôs one of my favorite places in Marrakech. A special thanks to Mr El Koutbia and all the reception team for their welcome.

I reserved this hotel for two nights because I am familiar with the Sofitel brand and I was willing to pay for a clean space and great service. The hotel itself is very clean but the staff knows nothing about customer service. It‚Äôs embarrassing that Sofitel would not invest in proper training for their staff. They would rather argue with a customer instead of finding a resolution to the simplest of issues. The staff is RUDE and mean. Do not go to this Sofitel if you expect any type of customer service.

Review_Date: Sonal D wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Service is beyond words. All areas from start to finish the service is amazing. Thank you for making our visit rememberable. Oumaima tarik youness jawad Omar noaaman simo atikA please come to this place it will make your visit memorable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Hatari S wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Aicha who is a Manager of Palais Darkum at the Hotel Sofitel Marrakech Lounge and Spa is just outstanding !    She is not only spectacular with her staff but also with the members of the customers staying at this hotel.    Aicha and her staff do NOT know how to say NO to the customers. Always very helpfull and ready to be at your service straigh away. She engages in her duties very professionally and with ut-most politeness.    Some of her other staff namely Ouassif Saber Mehdi Abderahim Mustapha Mohamed and Ismail were great too. Very helpful and polite.    They all are doing a great job and making this hotel a stand out from the rest.    I will go here again anytime.........!!    Sunny Shah

We v been in palais darkom many times and we like it each time  A lovely atmosphere a great wine & food attentive nice team specially Saber and mehdi i dont remember the other names but thank u all  Really It's a beautiful place ull be willing to go back to which is exactly what we did and we will always  Thank you for everything
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great band and staff at L Orangerie
Review_Text: Really enjoyed our time here for few drinks and great staff especially Oumiema.  Nice drinks and friendly staff would gladly return here as it‚Äôs got a good vibe with the live band. Drinks were well made by the bar staff and we were checked on regularly

Review_Date: Mohammd S wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: was such a great evening a big thanks to all the team speacially to ( oumaima she make me love this place coz she was respectful and kind ) wiam souhaila atika and halima omar naaaman khadija  they are friendly .. thank you for them and I will come back  I recommend this place if you want to be happy

I had a great time here ‚Äúlsofitel‚Äù anyway you will not regret if you come lovely service If you ever come deal with the beautiful lady ‚ÄúOumaima‚Äù she‚Äôs lovely and also forgot about the great welcome that we had me and my friend also the staff mehdi siham tarik omar khadija noaaman

Review_Date: Samy D wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: Sofitel is one of the good and beautiful hotels in marrakech u‚Äôll be amused and relaxed from the moment you enter the h√¥tel till u leave this year i came with my 2 friend to celebrate the 10 yers together in PALIS DARKOM we had ordered drinks and snacks some asked for food its a cosy place warm in this winter the mixed between the old threes an plantes style and the moderne was stunning the service was above the expectations the team was welcoming smiling all the time they were taking care of us  afterwards a walk till swimming pool was just amazing thank u for making our evening as good as it was

Review_Date: Louise C wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: Great chilled bar located in the Sofitel hotel.  Good selection of beer cocktails and spirits.  Relaxing vibe.  Dimly lit with sofas and cushions came in for a drink but they do serve tapas if you‚Äôre feeling hungry.

Stayed in Sofitel in January.  From start to finish it was really enjoyable.  Staff went out of their way to make us feel very wanted.  PS A very special mention of our house keeper Hayat she was amazing.  Thank you again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nozrul I wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: From start to finish i must say the service was excellent!! I have stayed at many hotels across the world but by far the staff at this hotel go above & beyond with their customer service. Would recommend to all!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sam S wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: Adil at the concierge was extremely helpful and provided best in class service. Adil arranged a sunrise camel ride in desert for 20 people the night before we wanted to go. He was so helpful answering all of our questions and truly made our incredible stay extraordinary. I highly recommend him as a best in class concierge in Morocco and the world!

Review_Date: Francean G wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: I went for dinner with my mum after spending a lovely 4 days in Marrakech in the Medina and we fancied some nice restaurant cuisine and the whole thing from start to finish was terrible. No drinks menus given when my mum ordered wine the waiter walked away and asked me 'Do you not like wine?!' I thought this was rude and insulting for all he knows I could be a recovering alcoholic (I'm not I'm just doing dry January) but more politely he could have asked would I like a glass or something less intrusive. Also the wine requested he said we dont have then brought the first choice out as per the original request. The bread plates weren't cleared away and the table was spilling over. I had some mint tea and another waitress came to pour some and it was empty and so was the glass and the just left it on the table without taking it away! The starters were wrong and when the right one did come the foie gras was awful. I ordered a medium rare veal and it arrived well done. My mum ordered shin of beef which was really fatty and looked like something from medieval times and adding to that they almost put the mains at the wrong table . At this point I said forget the main we just want the bill and I have never been looked at like this in a restaurant and asked 'Is there a problem?!' And the tone was rude. And yes there is a problem the whole thing was awful. We did only get charged for the starters and the drinks which still came to 900 dhs. All in all very uncomfortable and unenjoyable experience when I expect more from such a well known reputable chain. I have had better service in a McDonalds! Would not recommend in the slightest

Review_Date: Antoine V wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: Great host and perfect service in an ideal place close from the heart of the city.  I recommend this hotel for your stay in Marrakech the lounge being much recent than the Palais Royal but both Will welcome you with great staff

Review_Date: Robin C wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Title: Error in booking, they refused to adjust
Review_Text: My booking agent booked a nonrefundable rate BY ACCIDENT and called to ask to change it immediately. They said no. They constantly said no to changing it. It was a $1300 reservation and they caused SUCH HASSLE to do this. In the end my booking agent lost the money not me but it caused so much stress. They should have allowed us to change because we called IMMEDIATELY. VERY mean spirited of them and they should learn the lesson not to pinch pennies today because tomorrow they will realise that they have no more friends to pinch from.

Review_Date: Howard P wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: This is a very large busy venue. The rooms were contemporary large with excellent bedding and pillows. Modern bathroom with a walk in shower. Hotel dining was very good. Staff were well trained customer oriented and friendly. Highly recommend. Hope this helps.

Rooms are spacious with good view -but team is not professional in dealing with guest expectation -restaurant staff horrible in service each time we went there -breakfast was chaotic and breads are kept in restaurant's one corner -check out was horrible -one desk pushed to other desk because of their cashier available in old part of hotel only -reception team /cashier were rude -concierge was more helpful to taxi driver than our welfare !hair dryer in room was missing it took few hours after visit to room by HOUSEKEEPING staff that we are telling truth that no hair dryer in there in room !!constant noise in night from unloading of material in hotel

Very poor experience  We arrived at the Sofitel Spa hotel after a wonderful ten days in Morocco . 5 days in the Ryad Dyor in Marrakesh which was exceptional in every way and 4 days in Casablanca Four Seasons hotel  again a wonderfully comfortable hotel. So we were looking forward to our last night‚Äôs stay here . Not good from the start sadly  there was some confusion over the booking which we did resolve quite quickly and the young man dealing with it at reception offered us a free breakfast to make up for this  a nice gesture. He then went off duty and two rather rude female receptionists took over . They quickly retracted the offer of breakfast and asked us to prove we had been made this offer. She was more than rude and I can honestly say I have never been treated in this way before  checking into a hotel . It was embarrassing dismissive and poor service on every level . Having virtually accused us both of lying She then abruptly dismissed us  we went to our room to find someone else‚Äôs case in it and a welcome note that was not for us on the bed . We went back to reception  again the receptionist was dismissive  no hint if an apology either . They removed the case . The room we were given was old and tired looking and needed a revamp  the bed uncomfortable  stained carpets and grubby floors . There is a new section to the hotel and you need to ask to be here as the old part of the hotel is not good . We had a good meal in the restaurant but were served out of date flat beer  again no apology or replacement for this . We hoped to have a swim in the indoor pool but were informed there was a charge of ¬£25 per person for two hours  don‚Äôt think so !  So we will never stay there again and it definitely tarnished what had been to that point a wonderful stay in Morocco . I think some staff there need to understand what real customer service is and how to offer the high standard if care I am sure the hotel would want . So disappointed and upset by the whole experience .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sandra M wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Title: Nice hotel, nice shower, hard to find things.
Review_Text: We stayed there as part of a tour group-so we didn't pick the hotel. When we 1st got there we were given a room with 2 twins....so we went down to try to get a queen or king bed--they gave us another room which was ok but next to alley area so very loud at times. We were only there for a couple days so ok. But they really need to provide maps so that guests can find different areas. We never found the pool area. It was hard to find the breakfast area the 1st day.

Construction site in front of the door so that you cannot use the balcony. No air conditioning toilet without ventilation service is busy especially at breakfast. Completely inflexible when checking out even if it was only an hour. Old and expensive!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at the Hotel for four nights and would be hard pressed to find fault with the facility especially the pools grounds and location. Even the breakfast Buffet and dinners were above average. The reason for my low rating has to do with the attitude and indifference exhibited by the management toward it‚Äôs guests. For example we arrived very late and the hotel gave us what we believed were two of the worst rooms in the hotel one of which did not have a king bed (two twins pushed together) contrary to our reservations on the theory we were very late (true) and hotel was full. They also denied we had another reservation for a fourth nite but assured us all would be rectified the ‚ÄúNext Day.‚Äù The next day they did find the second reservation but said it was in a different wing of the building and they could not change either the rooms we were in or or consolidate the two reservations to stay the balance of our stay in the same rooms ‚Äúbut of course-would change the bed‚Äù. The manager told us to come back later in the evening and they would ‚Äúsee what could be done about putting us in the rooms consistent with our reservation‚Äù. Sure enough the evening came and nothing was done (not even changing the bed) and the manager said nothing could be done. This was totally unacceptable and after 30 minutes of arguing he relented and gave us the level of rooms consistent with our confirmation for two nites but advised us we still would have to move for the fourth nite; but to back each of the next two days. Nothing. On the fourth day they told us we had to move as incredible as that sounds and in spite of the fact that my wife was ill from a stomach illness. The manager called a Dr to visit my wife and said he would ‚Äúallow‚Äù us to stay in ‚Äúone room‚Äù so the Dr could examine her ‚Äúuntil 2 pm‚Äù. The Dr came about 11 am examined my wife found she had contracted a virus common from the food generally and prescribed medicine and to get at least a full day of rest. At 2 pm the manager called the room and said we had to leave. I replied my wife is sleeping and in bed his reply ‚ÄúOkay I‚Äôll Send a Wheel Chair to get Her‚Äù. At this point my wife dressed (we were already packed) and wanted to leave the hotel but my brother felt the damage had been done take matters up when we are home. I travel a lot still today maybe 75 room nights a year and when I owned a reasonably good sized company for 25 years traveled even more; and with all of the foul ups and problems traveling to every part of the world this was the most illogical and un-accommodating management I have ever encountered.

Review_Title: It could have been a very nice Christmas break, but...
Review_Text: As we booked our trip through Pin High because of the golf I wasn't able to add the points to my membership - which I understand. However being an Accor long term member I've never felt so unwelcomed in a hotel let alone 5 stars one. The first disappointment was during the check-in.    We were greeted by an unfriendly lady who asked for our passports and a credit card - no more word about anything or further information. We were offered tea a very talkative concierge came to offer tours and gave us a map. After waiting for over one hour we asked another receptionist (this time a friendly guy) what time we would be able to check-in and that we would like to have our documents back. The unfriendly lady was rude to the guy telling him that she had already told us that the check-in would be after 3 pm - WHICH SHE DIDN'T - as she didn't speak to us and we were waiting since noon. We asked for our luggage so we could change and go somewhere until we were able to check-in.    We came back around 4 pm with the hope that our room would be ready. Another surprise and another receptionist asking for our passports and credit card because he didn't have a clue that we already had done that and couldn't find anything under our names. In the meantime a third receptionist came with a machine and asked us to put our pin code to guarantee a deposit on our credit card. When were almost using our pin code to my surprise the credit card wasn't ours - it was from another guest. After waiting for this joke to be over we were given our key - but no luggage as it was stored in the hotel since noon.    We gave the luggage ticket to the receptionist who said he would take care of that and the luggage would be sent to our room. Another 40 minutes wait a call to the reception and the luggage was brought by someone who said the receptionist never told him to bring the luggage.    Unfortunately it was not the end of the joke as both suitcases were wet on the back including the cover with something that smells like alcohol. We called the reception and a lot of funny questions were asked. My husband went to the reception with his suitcase and showed to the "chef of the concierges" who questioned whether something wasn't broken in the suitcase because it wasn't possible that this could have happened there etc and that the suitcases were already like this when we left at the hotel.    My husband is a very patient person but he got very annoyed and brought the other suitcase to this gentleman who insisted it didn't happen there. Very bad service for a 5 stars hotel.    As nothing was damaged inside our luggage and the golf bags were fine we let this go for a moment. After less than 30 minutes the suitcases were dry which means that it definitely happened in the hotel and possible just before the suitcases were brought to our room. I spoke with this "chef of concierge" that it was almost dry and it indeed happened at the hotel. I had to hear from him that people start to use their minds and try to investigate things to find out what might have happened. At that stage I was looking for a hidden camera.    I have to admit that luckily we had the chance to meet nice people at the hotel: the lady who makes pancakes and three friendly waiters in the breakfast room.    We booked a tour to the Atlas and were given a price in EURO and were told that we should pay by cash - which is a bit weird - by a guy that was at the concierge's desk but wasn't the concierge or the "chef of the concierges". I asked for the price in Dirham and said I was going to book later. When we went to book the tour we gave the cash to the concierge and were expecting the change. When I asked for the change we got offended and threw the money on the desk and asked me to get it. It doesn't matter if the change is one or one hundred what is right is right.    I could carry on but I will conclude at the check-out. We got the bill and noticed that they charged us twice for the Christmas dinner: one on the 22.12 and the other one on the 24.12. We explained that it wasn't correct and after a lot of talk between the receptionist the lady who booked the dinner and another guy the concluded that we were indeed correct.    Our trip to Marrakech could have been spectacular however due to the lack of hospitality and proper training of the staff it wasn't. I can't recommend this destination neither this hotel.    The close this long story during my stay I contacted Accor Customer Service one day after we checked-in to complain about the check-in/ luggage experience and never heard from them. As an ALL member it just got more disappointing.    At the Sofitel Marrakech Lounge and Spa the customer is always wrong! Here is a customer who will never come back.

Brilliant from start to finish; we checked in early evening and the front desk reservations manager (Saad) was exceptional; his friendly approach and great customer approach made our check in fast and efficient; Saad is a brilliant asset to Sofitel. Rooms were recently refurbished and catered for our needs; breakfast is a must with a first class selection of foods; a big thank you to Mustafa who made sure we was well looked after. We booked a few activities with the hotel and again Adil (great personality and very helpful) and his team are always there to make sure your every needs are catered for. I would definitely recommend a trip to the Atlas Mountains via the concierge team. The hotel offers great facilities for families (outdoor heated pool); mini balls; table tennis and chess; there‚Äôs a charge to use the indoor swimming pool and kids under 16 cannot use the indoor swimming pool (which I completely disagree with) as I traveled with a young family and was quite happy to pay for the facilities indoor; decor of the hotel was nice; location is fantastic; hotel staff are one of the best I have encountered especially Saad; who would personally call you by your first name (a nice touch); just wished other hotels would be so forthcoming; rooms are cleaned twice a day; free complimentary water; beds are the most comfortable I have slept in. I would definitely come back again; (if only the spa could be welcoming).

Review_Date: Nick Bannister wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: We decided to spend a day of our holiday by the pool in the Sofitel Marrakesh. We had a lovely time enjoying cold drinks and a spot of lunch in the glorious winter sun. The service was excellent as were the facilities. Our every need was attended to by the brilliant and charming Mokhtar who made the stay even more memorable. Thanks to Mokhtar and all the staff for wonderful experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We arrived on a Friday night in the hotel. Very friendly greeting by the doorman. Then our first surprise. We did the Accor express check in from our computer at home and we got the reply that our room-key was waiting for us with the concierge. No way we had to queue for 15 minutes and had to go through the whole check-in procedure (showing passports signing forms etc.). Why proposing an express check-in when it is not considered at all!  We got to our Junior-Suite which was nice and also the views were as expected. The bellman arrived promptly with our luggage.  The next morning we asked the concierge if he had a sightseeing program for the Medina. He proposed a guided tour (4-5 hours) with a hotel guide for ‚Ç¨150 for 2 persons. After having confirmed with him that the guide would not escort us in ‚Äötourist traps‚Äò in the Souk we booked the tour for Sunday at noon which the concierge after a phone call confirmed. When we arrived at the concierge desk Sunday morning another concierge was not aware of our reservation. He started to make some phone calls and after 5 minutes he confirmed that the driver would come and the guide was waiting for us elsewhere. I assumed that the fee would be charged to our room (as it was supposed to be a hotel guide) but the concierge insisted on a cash payment which struck us as rather strange.  The friendly driver took us to Jardin Majorelle where the female guide was waiting for us. Next surprise we had to purchase entrance tickets which we assumed were included in the ‚Ç¨150 fee. No big deal but you get the feeling of being exploited.  At the Palais Bahia the same scenario. Until here we more or less liked the tour.  When in the Souk she did exactly what we did not want she took us into shops of her friends that wanted to sell us stuff. She did not appreciate at all that we did not like this kind of ‚Äösightseeing‚Äòand started to become less friendly. After 2 more attempts to make us do some shopping she quickly guided us through the Souk to arrive on the Place Jemaa el Fna which we crossed rapidly to meet our driver again on the main road who took us back to the hotel. The whole tour lasted less than 3 hours.  The whole event organized by the hotel‚Äôs concierge who pocketed the ‚Ç¨150 instantly was very disappointing for the quality you expect from a 5-star Sofitel.  It is very sad that such an experience troubles the good general impression of the hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jim C wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: Great hotel super nice staff good food in restaurants. Wait staff in Moroccan restaurant were excellent! Food selection was good the buffets were quite expansive and impressive. Overall I would stay at this Sofitel anytime and the brand was pretty impressive. I would entertain this hotel chain in the future.

Review_Date: Ilja B wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: This is an enormous hotel. Far too big and impersonal. We came to golf and the concierge knew nothing of our booking.  The restaurant Orangerie is dark and service is slightly muddled.  Rooms are greAt and the breakfast a feast even a little OOT.  If you like the rich and snob this is your kind of hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel is well located and used to be fantastic. It is now jaded and definitively needs a major uplift. The staff is trying hard but is "hit or miss". The staff is obviously not trained well enough: many people running around but no coordination. This was true at breakfast (boiled egg never arrived) as well as with the concierge service. Restaurant reservation " forgotten" no info as to the fact that the restaurant we were going to has two different locations. One concierge had no idea what the other had already done. The restaurant was also disorganised and the food was not good and extremely pricey at lunch. The exception was Fati at breakfast who was helpful. On a positive note: as I am a Platinum Accor card holder we were upgraded to a nice suite. But on the whole a disappointing experience.

Review_Date: Amine B wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: One of the best place in Marrakech nice team we woul like to say thank you to mr Noureddine assouag who welcomed us and assist us with his heart we can say it's a dinamic person and can take care of the guests. Thanks for the amazing time we will come back soon.

Stayed November 2019 for my husbands birthday. He and his friend were there for the golf - which was amazing so he tells me :-) A great stay and amazing people. We were very well looked after by Mohamed one of the butlers and his colleagues. Definitely would recommend for it‚Äôs location too.

We have spent a fantastic time here. The hotel is nice and central located. You have different kind of restaurants nearby. Various entertainment venues within walking distance.  Hotelroom clean friendly staff nice hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We went to the Sofitel on a day pass to spend some time unwinding. We originally planned to visit the spa (approx. ‚Ç¨19 or free with treatment) but as the weather was so nice we decided to relax by the pool (approx. ‚Ç¨40). The pool area is beautiful with two pools one heated one cool and a hot tub. The beds were comfy and the area clean. We enjoyed a delicious cocktail and bottle of ros√© during our visit. The cocktail was pricey (approx ‚Ç¨20) but the wine was reasonable (bottle approx ‚Ç¨29). The staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming. I‚Äôd highly recommend as a great escape from the medina.

Best view you can get for your money professionnel staff saurafouaachahira rachida and specially the gentlemen Anas he helped us to have the Best stay.we also like to thank yassine he is the F&B manager thank you sir again. So see you sooon.

Review_Date: Werner K wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Title: A Delight in a City of Wonders
Review_Text: Marrakech has been a wonder for centuries and our first visit was wonderful. It was made perfect by the Sofitel Marrakech. The rooms were spacious and bright with natural light. The balcony was perfect (2 floor) as it spilled out via a few steps to the large outdoor seating are where breakfast was served. Seating under awnings and umbrellas and sipping of fresh strong coffee was the perfect way to start our days.  The huge pool and spa area were available but our attentions were on visiting the old city and spice market.  A morning spent learning to cook in a tagine then enjoying our labors of the morning over lunch.  There are many wonders to see and using the Sofitel as a base was perfect.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Reda E wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: Such a lively place. The breakfast buffet is just wow.  One of the most amazing hotels I‚Äôve been to so far.  I also liked the night life next to the hotel. The most attractive places are next to it.  Keep it up

Review_Date: Asmae C wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: My experience in Sofitel was great all the people they work there are very friendly and very nice It‚Äôs been a long time without going to Marrakech I didn‚Äôt regret it at all I did the Moroccan Hammam it was amazing Fatima Zahra was amazing and very delicate she did a great job definitely I‚Äôm recommending her to the anybody wants to do the hammam at Sofitel.  Also the hairdresser at Sofitel he was so lovely and he did my hair every day for my 3 days of the events really good work and wonderful person. (Sorry I forgot his name).  The staff in the breakfast mo god they was so lovely all of them and so friendly I never had fun having my breakfast at any hotel.  Oussama  Iman  Reda  The woman who was making the Moroccan breads    I‚Äôm sorry if I forgot any names but everyone was so nice and good to us.  Except the changing of my room that they make me do everyday. Other side everything was great and every person was very nice.  Great team.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lorraine F wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: A very comfortable luxurious hotel with friendly polite staff.. Reda in the breakfast bar makes the best omelette ever!!  Mohamed the hairdresser in the Spa does the best blowdry I have ever had! and the Hammam was excellent.

Review_Title: Best hotel for quality and value
Review_Text: This hotel is the best for us.  The service has improved so much compared to last year.  The waiters were on the ball for breakfast. Tea please - Yes Sir. Salt and pepper - Yes Sir. Everything was yes and done. Last year it was yes and sometimes not done. So well done on all waiters for working so well together.    A big thanks to Omar by the pool. He was so friendly and provided us with excellent service.    The pool as good as usual and the sun beds. Maybe some broken one need to be replaced.    We cannot wait to see the new refurbished breakfast restaurant.    The orangerie food and tapas for dinner was also excellent.    We will come back next year definitely.    Maybe something to work towards is the kids club. Use kids club of four season as an example or kids club of hotel barri√®re le nouara.    As the kids club is not very inviting.    Also the kids club should be open all day and offer food for lunch for the kids. As when we got up and went to the pool at 12:00 the kids club was nearly closing. Then when it opened at 14:30 we usually went for lunch. Closing at 17:30 is also too early. It could be open till 18:30.

Stayed here for a couple of nights before staying in Adajar for 4 that turned out to be worse. However we felt this was a good base for the Desert Camp and Casablanca. How wrong we were.  Food was drink terrible probably on par with a wetherspoons and rooms were scruffy.  Was disappointing that we could not watch the rugby anywhere either as nowhere had it on.Just glad it wasnt the final I missed.  Decent kebab shop nearby but that was not enough for me to make a decent holiday.  Dont be fooled by 5* rating would rather stay in the 1* sea hotel in my home town.

This hotel is classy beautiful and the staff is wonderful.Rooms are very nice and up to date. It is clear that the staff cares about their guests. Pools are big and there is a pool where the children seem to be making for a relaxed adult environment The breakfast and lunch buffets are great with lots of variety..

Review_Title: Good hotel service could be better
Review_Text: Sofitel Lounge & Spa (Marrakech)  June 2019  4 stars    Great hotel - very central to all areas of the city and we managed to walk to Jema El Fna Square and the new town in around 10 minutes to each.    Huge room with large terrace massive bathroom and a very spacious seating area. TV in both bed area and seating area.    Staying with our son we found a few areas of the hotel not very pushchair friendly and found ourselves carrying it up and down stairs a few times a day. That‚Äôs aside the staff were very accommodating and promptly organised a bottle warmer / baby bath upon request.    Pool areas were great but they were not heated at this time of the year - not even the kids pool - which meant it was a bit too cold for our son. Wish they had made it clear in their webpage exactly when the pools are / aren‚Äôt heated.    Breakfast was good and the head chef organised anything we requested - such as fresh french toast on thin bread rather than the thick slices in the buffet. Waitresses were amazing with our son he loved them!    Concierge very helpful in directing us around the city and organised a private trip to the Atlas Mountains for us complete with baby seat in the car!    Our return flight was late in the day and staff promised us a room to get fresh in and mainly to let our son nap but when we went to collect keys for this room we were told it had been given to someone else so instead we had to make use of some toilets while staff stood outside to give us privacy - not the best end to our stay and was a huge inconvenience - would have been 5* had it not been for this

We fancied some Winter sun and found ourselves in Marrakech in this lovely hotel. The staff are super friendly and efficient and the hotel a great base for our stay. The concierge was a great help on our first day organising our private city tour. We have been impressed with the army of staff making sure the hotel/pool/facilities look spick & span. The location has been great for us being so close to the M√©dina and main square. The pool area offers a great respite from the hustle & bustle if the city. If you‚Äôre looking for a good location and fab accommodation look no further than Sofitel Marrakech Palais Imperial!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Room  Inside the hotel room is very plush and certainly deserves 5*. It is very relaxing. The rooms are decently sized and very clean. Sofitel beds are amazing. The bathroom is very clean but I feel like the tap water smells!    Pool areas  The pool area is a 3/4* the loungers needs to be replaced. They have cigarette burns in them. The pool food is ok but it is hard to eat with birds flying everywhere. A bird even pooed on the table and it was not wiped straight away. Also there was a lot of flys.    Not many staff speak English so It is hard to communicate.    Security  On one occasion I was stopped by security and asked if I was staying at the hotel. Even though I had seen that same guard three times that day in the same clothing. I was actually a little thrown back when he approached me.    Food  I ordered room service one night and it was vile. I ordered pizza and a chocolate brownie the pizza was like eating cardboard and the brownie was rock hard and cold. Upon check out saaud a receptionist was very helpful and removed the pizza from our bill.    The breakfast is good. They make the crepes then warm them up. I do not understand why they don‚Äôt just make them fresh as there is never a queue for them. The fresh juice was very nice and I recommend the cucumber and mint. One day we tried the buffet for lunch and it is extremely expensive for what it actually is. We paid 900 Dirhams for 4 non alcoholic drinks and 2 Buffet meals. The pool lounge food was very filling and much cheaper than the buffet.    Staff  Most of the staff are very helpful. I felt that the check in was very unorganised there were several receptionist fighting over two computers. When I was checked in a deposit was taken and I was told to sign forms. I was not told what time I should return to collect my door key. The service at restaurant is extremely slow! The manager in the Buffett is extremely helpful and welcoming.    One day we was getting ready to leave the hotel and house keeping walked in  without knocking and my husband was naked! I would have forgiven her but music was playing in the room so as soon as she cracked the door she should of heard it and left but she never!    We had a driver whilst we were staying in the Sofitel and he made it clear to us that the best service is in either Sofitel or four seasons. I have now stayed in both and the four seasons is much better.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: 14 of us stayed here to celebrate a birthday in September and had a fantastic time. I loved the pool area with the huge sun beds. It was hard to get 14 of us close together unless we got downstairs very early but understandable as we were a large group. Usual problem of towels being left on sun beds reserving them but no sign of an actual person on them.    Rooms were good and beds particularly comfortable. Hotel location also very good. The only reason I‚Äôve given the hotel only four stars was the slow service. All the staff we encountered were very friendly but did things in their own time.

Review_Date: Meryle L wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: Very nice hotel with beautiful pool areas. The service we received from Omar at the pool was outstanding beginning on our first day and continuing through our last day. Hats off to the hotel for hiring such an attentive individual.

Review_Title: Fabulous place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: We spent three nights at the Sofitel Marrakech following our arrival in Morocco. This is a beautiful hotel with excellent facilities and our room (Superior Room) was large and comfortable. We have to commend housekeeping as some of the best we have ever encountered ‚Äì rose petals and flowers every day! Oussama at reception was extremely pleasant and helpful. The breakfast buffet included in our room rate was outstanding and included both hot and cold options with plenty of healthy choices. Dinner on the terrace of the L‚ÄôOrangerie overlooking the infinity pool and beyond across Marrakech to the Atlas Mountains was delightful.

I‚Äôm here now. No hot water in my shower. Waited 45 min for engineer to come and finally went to dinner unshowered. Called when I returned and have so far waited a half hour and nobody has showed up.    This is just not good enough.

Review_Date: Dhia N wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Title: Great place to relax and great location
Review_Text: Great place to relax and great location accessible to all the hot spots a combination of modern and traditional Marrakesh which is what captures the essence of this special city. One of Morocco's charms is definitely its people the hospitality and warm welcome you receive will keep you coming back. Obviously your experience at the hotel is only as good as its staff make sure you seek out and ask for Hamza Jabri Sofitel's very own musician and entertainment manager his warm welcome and willingness to ensure we had a comfortable stay really added value to our stay with Sofitel. Sana also kept us smiling and took care of us from reception to breakfast and ensured our mint tea was was always full :). The baggage handlers security at the gate receptionists pool staff and breakfast staff are all commended but too many to name. There is something to suit everyone whether family single couples friends you can find it here at the Sofitel Marrakesh lounge and spa.

Review_Date: Bushra R wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: Stayed at the Sofitel hotel with the family.    Pro- Nice clean rooms a good selection at the breakfast buffets. Hotel is situated in a great area with selection of restaurants available in the area if you don‚Äôt want to eat in the hotel and just a 20 min walk to the Mernera Mall. Beds are very comfortable had a great night sleep every night. So lounge where shisha is served has a great vibe however music could be better maybe a little R&B. Hotel staff are great and very attentive.    Cons- you are charged for water Approx ¬£3 and standard fizzy pop drinks cost around ¬£6 i would never pay this much for a drink in the UK. Apparently the hotel does not like you bringing in your own water from outside.  At the end of the stay I had a ¬£30 charge for the minibar but I was certain I did not use the minibar but then I was told it was the water?!

Review_Title: Dinner in the restaurant food great but service disappointing
Review_Text: We went there to have dinner with friends. Lovely place and they booked a nice table for us. However you are seating on sofas and it is not comfortable at all to eat.  It took a while before to order but the food was very good so worth the wair. Service was very slow and not specially friendly.  It took us 20 min to get the bill which came wrong and another 20 min to have it sorted. The waiter who took the payment said he could not type the dot on the credit card machine and had to round it above which is very weird as his colleague could do it?!  Overall good food but the service brings everything down.

Review_Date: lane i wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: Nice service friendly and available staff buffet well provided.  My colleagues and I are happy with our adventure in this establishment. Mention Special to Yassin Zidane chardoud  Room service and Sara Ilham Nafisa Hayat. Housekeping for his benefit at the spa the sport teacher abdesadek.  Glad to find the quality service I've always believed...

Review_Title: Great renovation of Lounge and Spa. Some things to improve
Review_Text: I have regularly visited Sofitel Marrakech Lounge and Spa over the past few years and I am pleased to say that the renovations done to the Lounge and Spa part have made it more elegant. The rooms are modern contemporary clean (I did the dust test with my finger and found nothing) and well appointed. The only negative with the rooms is that they no longer have bath tubs which is a shame for a 5 star luxury hotel such as the Sofitel.    The service is good and attentive. The porter/doorman Said is an amazingly kind and great person. Fatima at breakfast who cooks the Moroccan mssemen bghrir harcha etc is always smiling loves her job and is so kind and a lovely woman. She seems to be the mother of the hotel. Said (porter/doorman) and Fatima (breakfast chef) are the stars of the hotel.    The pool service is slow it can be difficult to get a towel if your bed/sun-lounger doesn‚Äôt have one. The pool team could be improved.    Please note renovations are going on at the Palais Imperial section of the hotel and there is some noise distribution currently.    I found Mehdi on the Palais Imperial section is very rude and brash no conversation or smiles. I remember him from previous visits and he still has not improved.    It is a shame we were not offered a welcome mint tea or drink hot/cold towels and snack at check in like I have experienced here previously.    Overall a very good stay in September 2019 for 3 nights. Some things to improve on as I mentioned but overall very good.    J‚Äôai visit√© le Sofitel Marrakech Lounge and Spa beaucoup de fois dans le pass√©. Je suis content que les r√©novations sont bien fait et la partie du Lounge and Spa est plus √©l√©gante moderne et chic maintenant.    Les chambres du Lounge and Spa sont tr√®s propres (j‚Äôai cherch√© pour la poussi√®re avec mon doigt et rien). Les chambres sont comfortables et bien √©quip√©es mais c‚Äôest dommage qu‚Äôil n‚Äôy a pas de baignoire - c‚Äôest dommage pour un h√¥tel luxueux 5 √©toiles comme le Sofitel.    Le porteur Said est tr√®s gentil et aimable. La femme Fatima qui cuisine mssemen bghrir harcha etc pendant le petit d√©jeuner est aussi hyper gentille et une femme tr√®s aimable et souriante. C‚Äôest √©vident qu‚Äôelle aime beaucoup son travail et elle est magnifique avec tous les gens sans exception. Elle est la m√®re de l‚Äôh√¥tel.    J‚Äôai trouv√© que le service √† la piscine est lente et c‚Äôest difficile de trouver une serviette.    Mehdi qui travaille √† la reception du Palais Imperial est vraiment nul. Il n‚Äôest pas poli et il n‚Äôest pas joli et j‚Äôai remarqu√© √ßa pendant mes derni√®res visites.    C‚Äôest dommage qu‚Äôapr√®s un longue voyage √† Marrakech qu‚Äôon n‚Äôas pas re√ßu une boisson d‚Äôaccueil comme une verre du th√© marocain ou bien une serviette froide comme j‚Äôai re√ßu avant pendant mes derni√®res visites.    Attention: il ya du bruit a cause des r√©novations.    En conclusion un tr√®s bon s√©jour. Il ya des petites choses √† am√©liorer comme j‚Äôai d√©j√† mentionn√©.

Spent 4 nights at this hotel at the end of September. A last minute short break with my husband. Hotel is situated in a great part of the city. Just far enough away from the overwhelming noise and hussle of the city but close enough to walk to the modern part or a short taxi ride from the main square costing around ¬£5. There are restaurants and cafes within easy walking distance of the hotel if you don‚Äôt want to pay the prices of the hotel. The hotel is lovely with a gorgeous pool area. We stayed in the spa side of the hotel which was lucky as we heard many people complaining about the other side as they had some decorating works going on with lots of noise and banging.  The rooms are spotless with plenty of space good aircon. The shower looked promising with a large over head rainfall type head but the water pressure wasn‚Äôt great.  Pool area is stunning. Lots of really comfortable day beds and a beautiful huge pool with another slightly smaller pool and a kids splash area. The pool side service is the slowest I‚Äôve ever encountered. I‚Äôd say the pool area was only half full with plenty of staff available but on 2 occasions we waited over an hour for a bowl of french fries !! It‚Äôs easier to sit at the pool side restaurant and get table service the food is very good.  The pool Attendants are so helpful and welcoming. Always on hand to move your umbrella to shade you and while your swimming they come around straightening up your towel on the bed and making sure you haven‚Äôt left anything in the direct sunlight. The pool area was lovely and peaceful until people started turning up with their own music speakers no consideration for people around them. Management need to get on top of this and stop it. I also don‚Äôt approve of people being in the pool with drinks In glass bottles.  Breakfast is buffet style. It‚Äôs mainly egg bread and fruit. Hotel is beautiful in the evening all lit up with lanterns and candles. Great live band too.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: good location, comfortable, bad check in
Review_Text: Room for improvement:  1) pick up service 9/23: I was told over repeated emails that the driver will meet me at the airport arrival hall. I exited the baggage claim through security guard's door and found a bunch of men holding signs of their various hotels/riads. None for Sofitel. I waited for 10 minutes went to the information desk and gave the girl $2 to use her phone to call Sofitel. After a long time ringing and ringing and ringing a girl finally answered. When I asked her for my promised/verified/confirmed pick up at 10:40pm (I'd arrived early and waited until past 10:40pm) she said that the driver is there. I told her I'm staring at all the men who are staring right back at this solo female traveler. And none of their signs says Sofitel or my name. She kept insisting he's there. Then I ask "inside the airport at the arrivals' area as promised or outside the building?" She first said inside. Then changed it to outside. Decided to walk outside in the middle of the night to check and found him standing with a lot more men holding their signs. Would be better if he was standing with the fewer men INSIDE the building where the arrival's hall is like the other better pick up services did for their clients. Going outside alone at night isn't the safety I was promised when I'd reconfirmed the pick up.    2) check in staff would benefit from a class in customer service. When I arrived around 11:30PM on 9/23/19 the nice middle-aged bellman took me to the front desk. He was smiling and enthusiastic about his job. The front desk had a young man named "Ben---" something. No eye contact no smile. Bellman had to ask the guy more than once to check me in. Bellman asked for my passport and tried to give it to this Ben--- fellow. He tried to not take the passport. Then finally did. As if by checking guests in he is doing someone a favor. Then out came a young woman who started working on a separate computer. No eye contact no smile. No words from either of them. Ben--- typed on his computer she typed on hers. Then the bellman brought me a cold towel and asked me to sit on the couch farther away from reception. However then the front desk woman asked me for a credit card out of the blue. I thought this Ben dude was checking me in. So I asked if I should move myself over to her station. She and Ben loudly informed me "it's the same madame! I'm just trying to help him to make it faster!" Okay... maybe if either of them had looked me in the eye smiled or even said hello perhaps they wouldn't have had to scream at me in frustration. Oh well.    Woke up at 5am with a dog barking nonstop outside. Can't really be helped :)    Goods:  1) great facade and lobby is beautiful.  2) good bellmen/security guards. Good eye contact smile and hellos.  3) The next morning I spoke to other front desk staff: Chaimae Ali Ahmed (concierge). All laughing and smiling and willing to answer questions. Chaimae MAY have been the one who checked me in the night before but in the morning there was a big smile on her face and willingness to do her job. Perhaps she was sleepy tired or frustrated with having to help Ben--- the night before. However the Chaimae I met in the morning was good. Ali was actually amazing at his job. He manned the second reception and did everything with enthusiasm. He called the concierge for me when the concierge wasn't at the desk yet. Very nice people.  4) great breakfast spread  5) good pool  6) good location 30 dirham taxi to Medina but away enough to avoid the hustle-bustle.    I would stay here again.

Review_Date: Sylvia J wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Title: Great location with a bad experience!
Review_Text: This hotel is beautiful and very close to the M√©dina Koutoubia Mosque and the Jemaa el-Fina (square and market place). The views from our rooms to the pool area was just magnificent with excellent service from pool staff.  Hotel hallways and room seemed dark with very dimmed lighting.  Breakfast Buffet is the best part of this hotel - one of the best varieties of Moroccan and European dishes. Only flaw here are the Eggs weren‚Äôt great as they were pre cooked and cold.    Bad experience was I lost my bottle of perfume in my toilet bag which was in the bathroom on the first day of my stay in this hotel. I complained to the front desk and the Housekeeper who came in the evening to set the beds but no response or follow up from the staff.  They also need to improve the service of getting bags to rooms promptly after checkin. Ours took 30 mins to get to us.    All in all I would recommend this hotel due to location beautiful building  gardens spacious room and fantastic pool staff.

Great stay food is fantastic and pool area has ample beds and clean. Rooms are spacious and tidied everyday so of a very clean standard. Pool lounge staff couldn't do enough for you especially Goufal Younes Omar and Nourddine! Would love to come again :)

we stayed here for more than a week. There was a little problem when we did our check in but then everything was very good. Breakfast was amazing lots of choice and yummy. The pools were amazing and refreshing. The food by the pool was good and our waiter was EXCELLENT his name is Omar. He was really good always helping and being sooo nice. Might come back just for his own service. Such a happy human. Please thank him.  Regardless we had a great weather and we were by the pool most of the time.

Review_Date: Frank W wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: During an exhibition I stayed for 6 nights at this property. The hotel and its facilities Are ok and I would rate that with 4 stars. But when it comes to the service level I must admit that was the poorest experience for a very long time. With the exception of the housekeeping lady (which was excellent) and one person (in charge of making the fresh juices at breakfast) the whole team significantly underperformed. As an example - while we were having dinner and eating our main course a server came and asked us to fill out a form on our preference in room categories. Ordering tea without sugar basically a mission impossible. Overall the service level was unacceptable.

Review_Date: Fadel B wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: Oasis bar at Sofitel great atmosphere Adil the barman makes great cocktails and always smiling abdeliah the waiter was very welcoming and fantastic service it‚Äôs the best place in Marakech to have a beer or a great meal by the pool

Review_Date: Philip G wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: My wife and I spent three nights in this wonderful hotel in Marrakech in early September. We had a spacious and well appointed suite overlooking the pool.    The staff were amazingly friendly and on the first morning we were already being addressed by name. A special mention here for the concierge Adil who arranged a tour of the City with an English speaking guide and driver and also arranged our transport to and from our other  destination in Morocco the Sofitel Thalassa Sea and Spa Agadir.    The bar and restaurant were both excellent with many staff ready to provide a very good service.    We enjoyed our stay very much and hope to have the opportunity to return. Thanks to Adil and all the staff who made us feel  so welcome.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We made a reservation over the phone for SO Lounge but when we arrived we were told it was reserved for a private event tonight. Instead we were offered to go the terrace around the pool. It was a nice ‚Äúplan B‚Äù food was very good drinks were just ok as it seems is the normal thing in the city.  Waiter was very nice as everyone else we were in contact since we arrived.  Prices are expensive but we knew it before going there.  It is a good place to go and see another side of Marrakech very international and fancy.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tasneem A wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Title: Avoid like the plague!!! Zero stars if I could!
Review_Text: The hotel was beautiful and some staff like Soukaina and Ihram were genuine. However we had a terrible experience with the rest of the staff and it ruined our trip completely.  On the first 2 days we waited 15minutes just for a sun bed whilst other French-speaking guests were offered and shown sun beds instantly (they arrived after us). Then another guest took pity upon us and offered his sun bed to us as he saw we had a baby with us and were completely ignored by all staff at the pool. We then entered the pool and were inside for 1hour 30mins simply because staff at the pool could not be bothered to supply us with towels despite asking on 4 occasions (twice to the same member of staff who told us he is "tired"). This is the kind of service from a supposedly 5* international chain - ridiculous! This happened on 2 days so we felt victimised as we don't speak either of the native languages. We then complained to a manager called Yaseen who offered us complimentary access to the VIP pool for the rest of our stay along with free lunch for the day. This was lovely of him. However even though Yaseen has explained to staff at the VIP pool that we had access we were then questioned and denied access every day for the duration of our stay. Each time we had to then ask the pool staff to call the manager and confirm that we were allowed to use the VIP (extreme) pool. This was extremely embarassing and made us feel as if we were not worthy of using the facilities.  Upon check out it took 30minutes just for concierge to send a bellboy up to our room to collect our luggage. Then as we were settling our bill the hotel had charged us for usage of the VIP pool and for the free lunch for the day that we were offered. We then spoke to manager Yaseen again who told us "there's nothing he can do." On further debating and arguing he then decided to waive the cost of the access and lunch that had been offered to us for free. He then went to consult a colleague and was gone for more than 15minutes and left us sitting at the reception. We went to find him to see that he was having lengthy conversations with guests and waiters at the breakfast lounge whilst we were left waiting and needed to catch a flight. Due to this inconcvenience we then arrived at the airport to find that the bag drop counter had been closed we were sent to various counters only to find them closed and responses we got from staff were "it's not my responsibility." Therefore we missed our flight. I have never seen such lazy and incompetent staff in the world as I have seen in Morocco both at Sofitel and at the airport. They have cost us an arm and leg due to their sheer arrogance and incompetence.  I cannot believe how a 5* chain such as Sofitel is allowing this to happen as usually they are great in other countries and I frequently stay at Sofitel in different countries. It had ruined my holiday completely and this was to celebrate my anniversary. Thanks Sofitel for an awful time you will definitely be hearing from us further as this kind of disgusting behaviour and service is not acceptable.

Review_Title: Ideal location but there are some flaws
Review_Text: This hotel comes in two parts the traditional Moroccan side and a more modern wing I‚Äôve stayed in both. Pool is lovely DJ adds atmosphere but we found it odd that at 6.30pm we could only get room service no food was available outside. The service was also painfully slow we waited 45 minutes for a drink to be delivered. The hotel is perfectly placed for the Medina the setting is beautiful and the hotel shops are well priced with lovely products. Breakfast buffet is good eggs weren‚Äôt great but the staff are friendly and we really enjoyed our stay.

Review_Title: A massive miss and we got food poisoning!
Review_Text: We are a family of 4 (sons 16 and 14) who have traveled all over Africa and the Middle East. We had a wonderful week in Morocco beginning with 2 nights in La Mamounia (highly recommend: excellent service: very discreet and professional) and closing out (after doing a desert camp and overnights in Dades and Fes) at the Sofitel. We were really looking forward to this as our last night but what a disaster. Service was as some others have noted: disinterested and/or unresponsive. We were tired after coming from Casablanca and decided to eat in at the Terrace restaurant. Big mistake: First question was not how we were or would we like a drink but would we like a Sofitel credit card?! No. Second issue was the giant TV screens showing circuit loops of the nightclub (tacky) but worst of all by 1am my husband and I had dreadful cramps and all the usual food poisoning signs. Called the front desk at 7am to tell them and to ask if they had any pharmacy suggestions. The woman could not have been less interested and made no comment apart from saying she could call a doctor. I said we had a long day of flying ahead and needed to leave within the hour. She said there was nothing she could suggest: there was no apology no concern no questions. Hugely ironic that we‚Äôd eaten at random places all week with no issues and we got laid out on the last night in a supposedly 5 star hotel! I rarely write negative reviews but this was just not good and we had a very rough travel day. Would not recommend.

Review_Title: Well located and well run as you would expect.
Review_Text: This is a centrally located hotel 10 mins walk to the Centre and very well equipped in the rooms as well as large outdoor pool area. Generally good service and a relaxing stay. The only issue we had was ensuring that the hotel charged the correct rate what the hotel thought and what was on the Accor Central system seem to be two different things. There was a bit of messing around involved but it was resolved but we could‚Äôve done without it.

Review_Title: Beautiful Location. Beautiful Amenities. Poor Staff.
Review_Text: The hotel is located in the Hivernage area. Well located to Medina - The Old City and 15 Minutes from the airport. Its within walking distance to several hotels including a casino and several shisha bars and restaurants.    The hotel pool was absolutely beautiful. Unmatched to the So Lounge - where there is a shisha area and bar populated by all the wealthy of Africa.    The hotel restaurants had beautiful vibes but poor food and even worse service.    The hotel reception wouldn't pick up their phone and the few times that they choose to pick up their phone - they had an attitude. Housekeeping refused to clean and seemed like they wanted to clean on their own time - leaving mess with much of the room often staying dirty.    The pool staff would take 1 hour to give a simple water bottle it seemed that the hotel staff didn't want to pay you attention unless you were a man willing to buy a bottle or a woman that they were offering to you for the night.    I recommend the hotel but the staff need to realise their priorities.

Had a Nice time in sofitel!! Everytime when we order from the roomservice abdeljabbar was ready for us. He was from the roomservice and was so kind everytime suprising us with flowers. Good people good food and good vibes!!

i would like to thank all the team and stuf of the sofitel hotel in marrakech speacly Mr.abdeljabar of the room serves for his effert and time the host was relly in leavl and i liked the way in witsh they worked and recev clients

Review_Date: Mrr S wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: Very good place Soukaina very kind! Shisha was good and music fantastic!  Thank all the staff siham souhaila majda atika wafae omar youness tarik kebir anas khadija hamza omar and the manager wiam.  Great place we recommend it

Excellent place and friendly staff. Our waiter noaman was very helpful. The swimming pool was great and the Cafe on the terrace had very nice view. This must be one of the top hotels in marackech Will definitely come back.

Not happy with the fact that after being asked to write a review the lady takes my phone and inputs special mentions with different members of staff who I hadn't even had a conversation with. I found this so unprofessional. I felt like there was a pressure for me to write a positive review as she lingerd over me. With disappointment we left and felt like the worker 'Soukaina' had just used us for the review. She imputed in the review as follows 'thank all the staff especially soukaina siham souhaila Nouaamane Omar khadija Wafae and the manager Wiam.' How can a worker take a customer's phone and input more information so that they get praise. This is rude and unprofessional.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: reda e wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Sofitel bar lounge was a very good place to spend some quality time with friends family or even business meetings  i would recommend this place to everyone plus an excellent service  all the people who work there are extremely kind and helpful also accompanied with an amazing view and a good taste of music as well.  Thank all the staff especially soukaina majda siham atika souhaila omar youness nouaamane tarik kebir wafae and the manager wiam.

Review_Date: farhan m wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Title: Best hotel in Marrakesh and most staff very helpful apart from front desk and manager
Review_Text: The hotel looks amazing from out side and inside. Pool bar breakfast staff and cleaners very friendly and jolly. I have a lovely room 533 but the ac wasn‚Äôt working properly. Reception just kept saying we will send someone but each time I asked they said ok they will send someone again after speaking to the manager Hennah she managed to send a engineer who confirmed it‚Äôs not working she told he to change room after 3 days I told her it‚Äôs not easy to move  With 2 kids so she got the engineer to just fix no apology or nothing. 2 days trying to sleep in 23-29 degrees no ac! The hotel is very nice apart from that. The indoor pool is only available if you book a hamam/ treatment.

Review_Date: Frederikke P wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Really amazing hotel with a great staff and service. We will for sure come back! Thank all the staff especially soukaiDogo Canario na siham souhaila Omar nouaamane and the manager wiam for her help and kidness .üëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèº
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: James B wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: I just want to say that SOFITEL MARRAKECH is the best place in which I found my relax and I like it a lot  I thank especially soukaina siham souhaila omar nouaamane et la manager wiam.  I recommanded 100%

Review_Date: Tamika Q wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: I stayed at this hotel as a solo traveler as a base while completing a hike in the Atlas mountains. My intent was to be pampered after the hike and they did not disappoint! During your check in process they seat you on comfy couches and serve you traditional tea. My room was not ready but I was allowed to visit the many lounge and pool areas ( there are 3 massive pools multiple restaurants and beautiful views. I stayed in a standard king room with a large balcony overlooking a beautiful garden. The rooms were very modern and comfortable. Dinner in the L'Orangerie Restaurant was super fancy(almost too fancy to eat the food) and The lounge had live jazz music some nights. Overall a great stay.

Review_Date: Ibtisam A wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Title: Good choice for a vocation in Marrakesh
Review_Text: Excellent localisation at 10 minutes walk from the medina  very nice rooms staff so friendly and competent especially souhaila from restaurant orangerie was very kind and attentive and of great help for me and my family thanks also to wiam  siham  soukaina majda  atika  wafa  khadija  Kebir  anas  nouaman youness Omar  tarik  hamza ....see you soon guys

This hotel is gorgeous the spa is amazing and the pools are so inviting. They offered an upgrade to the premier suite but upon arrival we realized that the view was not as nice as the view promised in our original reservation (there was a tree blocking most of the view which was mostly a barren dirt landscape). They kindly moved us to the junior suite we reserved and it had a nice view to the area around the pool. The bed was very comfortable the amenities nice and the balcony was nice. A few things led to me giving 4/5: the pool staff members were not very hospitable bordering on unfriendly at times there were a few interactions that made us feel unwelcome and in our room one of the cabinet doors was unhinged when we opened it (a bit sloppy for a 5 star hotel). However many staff members were very hospitable especially at the spa and the restaurants and we would return.

Once again we enjoyed our stay at the Sofitel Marrakech. And like usual your team excelled in hospitality and client centric service. Some of the staff members we already know for more than 10 years and it is always a warm feeling to see them back.    I would like to take this opportunity to thank all the Sofitel staff for making our journey at Marrakech a wonderful experience. Unfortunately I don't know all the names but I can say they all contributed to the high quality standard. Let me thanks the following staff members in particular:    Thanks to Chef Ahmed & Chef Mustafa for the exquisite brunch. So far the best I had compared to others    Thanks to Mr Yacine (Restauration diretor) and to Brahim and his breakfast team for their personalized service: Karim Said Ilham Oussama Fatima Reda & Zakaria. Further I would like to thank following people unfortunately I don't know their names: the man that made the juices every morning for us the man that takes care of the charcuterie and the hadj that brought us every morning delicious pastries.    Hakim for his hospitality and joy and making the children's favorite    Reception: thanks to Wafae & Ayoub for her reception and Imane to offer us a wonderful view.    Raouf the baggagist for his lovely evening chats.    Adil for his concierge service    Pool: Soleiman and his pool team Younes Soufaine Hassan Ryad and Nourddine. They all made sure we had the nicest spot and took care of us during the stay. Thank you for the lovely chats.    Last but not least I would like to thank the security staff at the gate receiving us warmly and the team of valet service (voiturier)

Review_Date: Nazir Adam wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: As service and facilities wise very very good staff was very friendly and helpful hotel very clean and tidy poolside excellent breakfast superb food and great service room very nice and clean shower and toilet separate and clean room was noise proof    Nazir Adam  Leicester

Review_Date: Kima E wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: As usual the staff at the reception of Sofitel spa & lounge in Marrakech were outstanding! The service is always super! They are friendly and kind! Also the staff at breakfast were very nice and nothing was too much! Thank you again!

Review_Date: Elie K wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: I spend my honeymoon period in Sofitel Marrakesh it was great I love all the staff the concierge the reservation the reception even if they are not too nice and I want to thank enormously the SPA therapists the girls you are really adorable and also I want to mention your reception this nice girl who was called doha she is in her period of training I want to thank you and I wish you a good school career and also Youssef you are really capable and really professional. ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: So funny to be in the larence bar
Review_Text: I like to be in lawrence bar to have some rest with my self and my friends  I would like to thank all the staff especially Soukaina the hostess souhailamajdasihamatikayounesshamza and the manager wiam.  Just to mention the live band is too amazingreally i enjoy it.

It‚Äôs so amazing to be in the lawrence bar for having chicha and cocktails  We like the design of the bar  Special mention to soukaina the beautiful hostesssouhailamajdasihamatikayounesshamza and the manager wiam.

Review_Date: Chris J wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Title: Great hotel, great pool area, great location
Review_Text: We had a great 4 days at this hotel. The room was large with a nice view looking across the gardens. Bathroom was good with a bath and separate shower (not all rooms have that so check if you want one). The pool area was large with enough quality sun loungers to go round (although the hotel didn't seem full). Nice boule court too. Breakfast was good with a large selection of food at the buffet plus some other food stations for eggs etc. Spa was good too. Location was fine just outside the city walls and an easy 10 minute walk to the main centre and tourist sites with minimal hassle from anyone.    Only real downside was the smoking round the pool which most people seemed to do even with young children nearby. Ideally there would be a smoking area (or preferably no smoking at all round the pool).    The only other point worthy of comment is that the Sofitel for some strange reason seems to operate two hotels with two different Sofitel names out of the one large building. They have separate check-ins but share everything else. None of the staff could explain why there were two Sofitel brands there and it just seemed that there were different rooms types. Unnecessarily confusing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Er-rami S wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: It was so amazing to be her in Lawrence bar enjoy the live band relaxing the view of the pool with variety of fresh cocktails  I thank all the staff specially soukaina souhaila majda siham atika youness hamza wafae and the manager wiam.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: 2nd time of visiting this hotel and once again did not disappoint. Stayed in the lounge and spa side which is definitely my preferred choice. Rooms bright airy well maintained and clean.  Celebrated my birthday while away and girl friends who I was with also had birthdays 2 days before and the day after leaving. The birthday cakes that were presented to us were amazing including the breakfast singing of happy birthday from the catering staff.  Omar who worked at the pool bar was amazing he kept us well feed and watered and nothing was too much trouble. True asset to the hotel.  The head chef also went above and beyond by make french toast especially for us.    Highly recommend but do expect it to be expensive to drink and eat at the hotel( even compared to London prices).

Review_Date: Younn ait wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: We had a Good time in the so lounge!  Verry relaxed and chill  And aya And hiba helped us out the whole night    We definitely Will come back  We went after inside at the club..  Really Good music And atmosphere.

Review_Date: Niyati G wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Excellent food and service absolutely loved it here!  Soukaina souhaila majda siham atika youness hamza and the manager wiam were all amazing would definitely visit here again definitely get the passion fruit martini I you are ever around the l‚Äôorangerie restaurant! Would definitely visit again!

Review_Date: Anil M wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: A haven in Marrakech this place is pure luxury from the lobby area to the spacious pool area and the rooms are Sofitel luxury standard as always. Breakfast is five stars with a fantastic choice of food on offer.    A great place to relax with fantastic service Ali at reception Soulaimane & Nourddine by the pool area provided us with excellent service.    Looking to book another short break next year.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ghislaine D wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Title: Another amazing stay at Sofitel lounge and Spa
Review_Text: We just had a lovely week at Sofitel Marrakech. This is our 4th visit and it never disappoints. Thanks you Ibtissam (chef de patisserie) Fatima ( who makes the most amazing msamman) Hassan and yousuf and Zakaria for their attentive service and the lovely gardner for beautiful herbs. Until next time. Xx

Review_Date: Richard L wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Went for drinks in the outside lounge to start with. Hostess spent the entire time there taking Kim Kardashian style selfies of all the waiters there only one seemed to be actually working out of around 15. A vodka martini isn‚Äôt that hard... it was for the barman. Dry with a twist came back as a vodka martini mix with an olive. Tried the bar at the back. Just as bad. Tired slow service insipid cocktails and stupidly over-priced. A must not experience
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lynda Dupont B wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: I travel for a living and visit a new hotel 2 or 3 times a month; it takes a lot to impress me but the Sofitel in Marrakesh did just that. From the cleanliness of the hotel to the impeccable service of the staff I was hooked! On this occasion I travelled with my family and wow oh wow was this place kid friendly it couldn't have been easier. I have to thank a thousand times the lovely lady that cleaned our room each day and made it spotless - she really went over and above the welcome and helpfulness of Saad and Ahmed at the reception desk the friendliness of the people making sure we had a wonderful experience at breakfast (we did what a selection of food!). A big hotel with lots of room to wander close to the Medina if you can tear yourself away from the pools. We decided at the last minute to extend our stay that's how good it was. Thank you everyone for making a work trip much more than just that. My recommendation - go here if you are a family if you like great food if you want impeccable service if you like a bit of luxury and you are picky about cleanliness.

Review_Date: Leila gouaini wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: I would like to share my review with the direction I really appreciate the view of the pool the service and the food here.  Specially the staff soukaina souhaila siham atika youness hamza and the manager wiam.
