Review_Date: Daniel F wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: A gold member Accor I enjoyed staying in Sofitel Marrakesh nice rooms  great view  very nice shower very good breakfast amazing service and professional staff especially in restaurant Orangerien we had a nice diner with a stunning view...a special thanks to the assistant manager souhaila for her particular attention  manager wiam  soukaina  siham  majda  anas nouaman youness tarik  Thank you for the memorable vocation

Review_Date: Simon M wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: Do not book with this hotel. Ruined our recent visit to Marrakech.    Booked this hotel through Alpha Rooms. Upon arrival to the hotel we provided our voucher showing proof of payment. However the morning of check out Sofitel informed me they had not received the full payment from Alpha Rooms and were holding myself and wife accountable and demanded that we paid the full weeks accommodation directly to them. This was as we were leaving to get our flight home.    I completely understand they want to be paid for the service they provided but this is an issue with Alpha Rooms and the hotel themselves. We arrived on the 15th May departing on the 22nd and Sofitel decided to deal with the issue of non payment as we were leaving for our flight home. They had 7 days previous to resolve this. We refused to pay as we had already paid in full and found it completely unfair to demand us to pay again before letting us leave for our flight home.    After a discussion with Sofitel front desk they agreed to let us leave to catch our flight and agreed it was an issue between with Sofitel and Alpha Rooms and they would follow up with them.    The day after 23rd May I checked my account to see Sofitel have taken the full amount out of my bank account! I have already paid Alpha Rooms 2 weeks prior to arrival and now because of the incompetence of the booking agent and booking department of Sofitel I have now had to pay this hotel twice and I am ¬£1600 out of pocket.    Who knows how this will ever be resolved with the agent and hotel both blaming one another!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Raja M wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: A wonderful place to spend special time with family   We had a great relaxing time   Th√© buffet is treat and amazing  the service is tooop  The staff are professionnel especially souhaila   Soukaina  majda  siham  atika  and there manager wiam   See you soon

Review_Date: Ghita E wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: Excellent lounge with amazing cocktails and music. Service was amazing and especially Aya who assisted us throughout. We had a little issue with how little alcohol was in the drinks but in all it was great! And the purple lighting was breathtaking and made for amazing pictures.

I am currently staying at the Sofitel lounge and Spa in Marrakech. It is supposed to be a five star hotel. The hotel is very good. Room is fine and well looked after. Breakfast and lunch are excellent. Beautiful pool areas quiet and peaceful. In fact truly a five star hotel.... until 7pm when it becomes like a cattle market! Because of Ramadan the hotel is offering a buffet after sundown which is very well attended by outside guests. This is great for the hotel but for residents it is a disaster as it is very difficult to get a table even if you book in advance!! Last night we did not eat until 10pm tonight we are going to eat outside the hotel even though we are full board.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: mariam t wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: Such a great ambiance and the best service ever  actually it is not my first time visiting this amazing n fascinating place . i recommend it for everyone who wants to enjoy his time either with friends or with family  thanks soukaina souhaila siham majda atika youness nouaamane and the manager wiam.

The a/c did not work in our room on arrival and the front desk treated this report as an imposition. Hair dryer gave off a burnt smell bathroom light flickered towels were removed and not replaced and waiters at breakfast were slow to bring coffee. We stayed in 5 other Moroccan hotels with no such attitude and problems so we would avoid Sofitels in the future

My family just returned from a two week holiday in Morocco. We started in Marrakech at the Sofitel. It was a good hotel to transition from the US to Morocco.it was great to have the big pool available for the afternoons. The rooms were lovely. The food and the service was amazing in restaurant orangerie  I would love to thank Souhaila for her attention and smile  manager Wiam  Siham  Majda  Soukaina  atika  Anas Omar  Youness and all the staff

Amazing atmosphere excellent service from lamia said The best service from Aya she looked after us so well and was so friendly and made our stay so pleasant! Will definitely will be returning!! The atmosphere is impeccable and would recommend to anyone

Review_Date: Amy F wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: Came for shisha and have to say the place was amazing. We were given our own booth with no problem. Aya welcomed us at the door gave us the best location and was amazing with service . She is an attribute to the company And looked after us so well. She was so friendly and bubbly . Would definitely come back. The place is lovely to visit and would recommend anyone if visiting Marrakesh

The place is lovely to visit and would recommend anyone if visiting Marrakesh

Review_Date: Daniel F wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: A gold member Accor I enjoyed staying in Sofitel Marrakesh nice rooms  great view  very nice shower very good breakfast amazing service and professional staff especially in restaurant Orangerien we had a nice diner with a stunning view...a special thanks to the assistant manager souhaila for her particular attention  manager wiam  soukaina  siham  majda  anas nouaman youness tarik  Thank you for the memorable vocation

Review_Date: Simon M wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: Do not book with this hotel. Ruined our recent visit to Marrakech.    Booked this hotel through Alpha Rooms. Upon arrival to the hotel we provided our voucher showing proof of payment. However the morning of check out Sofitel informed me they had not received the full payment from Alpha Rooms and were holding myself and wife accountable and demanded that we paid the full weeks accommodation directly to them. This was as we were leaving to get our flight home.    I completely understand they want to be paid for the service they provided but this is an issue with Alpha Rooms and the hotel themselves. We arrived on the 15th May departing on the 22nd and Sofitel decided to deal with the issue of non payment as we were leaving for our flight home. They had 7 days previous to resolve this. We refused to pay as we had already paid in full and found it completely unfair to demand us to pay again before letting us leave for our flight home.    After a discussion with Sofitel front desk they agreed to let us leave to catch our flight and agreed it was an issue between with Sofitel and Alpha Rooms and they would follow up with them.    The day after 23rd May I checked my account to see Sofitel have taken the full amount out of my bank account! I have already paid Alpha Rooms 2 weeks prior to arrival and now because of the incompetence of the booking agent and booking department of Sofitel I have now had to pay this hotel twice and I am ¬£1600 out of pocket.    Who knows how this will ever be resolved with the agent and hotel both blaming one another!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Raja M wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: A wonderful place to spend special time with family   We had a great relaxing time   Th√© buffet is treat and amazing  the service is tooop  The staff are professionnel especially souhaila   Soukaina  majda  siham  atika  and there manager wiam   See you soon

Review_Date: Ghita E wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: Excellent lounge with amazing cocktails and music. Service was amazing and especially Aya who assisted us throughout. We had a little issue with how little alcohol was in the drinks but in all it was great! And the purple lighting was breathtaking and made for amazing pictures.

I am currently staying at the Sofitel lounge and Spa in Marrakech. It is supposed to be a five star hotel. The hotel is very good. Room is fine and well looked after. Breakfast and lunch are excellent. Beautiful pool areas quiet and peaceful. In fact truly a five star hotel.... until 7pm when it becomes like a cattle market! Because of Ramadan the hotel is offering a buffet after sundown which is very well attended by outside guests. This is great for the hotel but for residents it is a disaster as it is very difficult to get a table even if you book in advance!! Last night we did not eat until 10pm tonight we are going to eat outside the hotel even though we are full board.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: mariam t wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: Such a great ambiance and the best service ever  actually it is not my first time visiting this amazing n fascinating place . i recommend it for everyone who wants to enjoy his time either with friends or with family  thanks soukaina souhaila siham majda atika youness nouaamane and the manager wiam.

The a/c did not work in our room on arrival and the front desk treated this report as an imposition. Hair dryer gave off a burnt smell bathroom light flickered towels were removed and not replaced and waiters at breakfast were slow to bring coffee. We stayed in 5 other Moroccan hotels with no such attitude and problems so we would avoid Sofitels in the future

My family just returned from a two week holiday in Morocco. We started in Marrakech at the Sofitel. It was a good hotel to transition from the US to Morocco.it was great to have the big pool available for the afternoons. The rooms were lovely. The food and the service was amazing in restaurant orangerie  I would love to thank Souhaila for her attention and smile  manager Wiam  Siham  Majda  Soukaina  atika  Anas Omar  Youness and all the staff

Amazing atmosphere excellent service from lamia said The best service from Aya she looked after us so well and was so friendly and made our stay so pleasant! Will definitely will be returning!! The atmosphere is impeccable and would recommend to anyone

Review_Date: Malak Al Shaibani wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: Enjoyed our stay here the food was superb  service was excellent and a very good location . Only thing I noticed that if you wish to change currency ask for your receipt we did not get one and there is a tendency of not giving you the right amount
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alexandra D wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: The holiday in the hotel was going really well until one night during our stay at Sofitel my boyfriend and I decided to spend the night at a friend's. Since we were late and in a rush to leave the hotel for dinner I forgot to leave a very important necklace in the safe where all the other valuables were kept but left it inside a bag instead. The next day we came back and the necklace was not in the place where I left it anymore. Call me stupid for not remembering to put it in the safe but it is unacceptable that these things happen in a 5 star hotel. A hotel is given 5 stars if it makes you feel at home... these things in my home do not happen. Obviously even after the denunciation the cleaning lady was kept working there so you might want to watch out if you're planning a trip there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mohamed O wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: Wonderful grand hotel a short walk from the medina ( 15mins) or super quick cab ride ( 7mins). The staff spoke good english and everything seemed to work. Rooms are great - get the newly refurbished rooms and the pool area is beautiful. We are lucky with the service across the board. I could have given 5 stars if it wasn't for the security staff at the entrance. They seemed to have a deal with the rip off crass taxi drivers every time we asked the taxies they seemed to get the most expensive annoying & rude drivers and they will walk away when asked for help it was pretty awful. We finally resorted to walking to nearby hotel security at other hotels ( Novotel) who were courteous and helpful SAVING us lots of $$
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel was perfect the only little problem was maybe with the concierge service... i feel (at least each time we tried to reach him) was either not there or he was clueless. The location and the hotel as an all was beyond words.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: NAJIB J wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: it was a very good evening at the so lounge a warm welcome excellent service with a very good gastronomy and shisha very good show and a great thank to aya for this amazing service i‚Äôll come back soon

We stayed here for my wife's birthday in Dec 2018.  The hotel is fantastic but really could do with better signage.  Upon arrival it was not clear where the check-in was especially as the Sofitel Imperial Palace Hotel and the Sofitel Lounge and Spa are effectively the same hotel site but have different check-in with no signs to indicate this.  We pretty much got lost every time we went to our room!  There was no signs for the restaurants and there were all in fairly unusual places so signs would have been extremely helpful.  These are small issues really as the rooms were fantastic staff incredibly welcoming & helpful and the food incredible.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mohamed Zouhair B wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: I went to the hotel last week on new years eve it was a magical place.    I enjoyed my stay and especially the staff they were more than helpful for me. They were nice and shoutout to Ali the receptionist he gave us a suite with a pool view and a wonderful background ot the mountains that was very generous from him .    Sofitel marrakech is a magnificent place .

Review_Title: Been here an hour, still waiting for a room. Worse than useless
Review_Text: So booked here for the last night of our trip. A bit of luxury and lose to the airport for the flight. We arrived over an hour ago still don‚Äôt have a room (which was pre-booked). Sitting in reception and using their WiFi to write this review. Going to give them 5 more minutes before I cancel it and go somewhere else. In two words ‚Äòbloody awful‚Äô. The worst service from the most expensive hotel! Classic!

Review_Date: David B wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Title: Ok. Not as good as other Sofitels
Review_Text: I've stayed at a number of Sofitel and Pullman hotels. This is probably the worst for the lot. I'd say more 3 star than 5 star. The Superior room is...uninspiring. I'd at least expect a bath in a 5 star hotel.  While the staff are friendly they are disorganised. 2 hours to get room keys having to call at 4pm to get room services is just not good enough.  400 Dihrams to use the infinity pool (non residents can use too) isn't acceptable either for an expensive hotel.  Food is good.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Poor service, bad organized, simple rooms
Review_Text: Location:    This Sofitel Hotel is located in an exclusive part of Marrakech.    We have booked a double bed room of the category Deluxe Koutoub.    Check In:    Upon arrival late evening we have not received a warm welcome.  No water drink or sweets were offered.  But I was forced to give them my credit card although the room rate was prepaid.  After a longer discussion I got informed that they wanted to charge me in advance in case that I would take something out of the Mini Bar.  I have rejected this wish. Then I needed to pay the City tax in advance!    After this Check In we got guided to our room.    Room:    The room (176) was at the end of the building.    The room was dark like in a hole although the light was switched on!    And more important: The so named Deluxe room was as simple as in a 2 Star Hotel.    It has a small balcony facing a part of the garden and the street.    Bar at 1. Floor:    Then we visited the Bar located in the first floor.    The music was playing very loud like in a Discotheque.    It was almost impossible to hold a conversation.    Most of the staff was caring about themselves.    They were playing with their cell phones or holding a small talk.    Even when they stand in a group 3 meter away from us they have not cared or paid attention at us.    We ordered a bottle of Medaillon rouge red wine charged with 440 Dirham (about 45 ‚Ç¨).    In other exclusive restaurants in the city of Marrakech we got charged with 260-340 Dirham for the same wine.    On another day in the Bar of this hotel we had the same problems with the staff!    The day before our departure we have asked for the bill.    We got presented the booklet opened it and it was empty!!! There was no bill inside!    Breakfast:    Upon arrival we got asked for our room number.    Then a young waitress wanted to guide us to our table.    But she did not know where a free table was available.    After walking together more than 5 minutes I have asked her if she does know where a free table is.    She said yes and disappeared and let us stand alone.    So we went back to the entrance made a complaint and a supervisor brought us to a table which was not cleaned.    It took almost 10 minutes until it was done.    Even the table was not cleaned in a proper way.    Still bread crumbs were left. Then I got a cup for the coffee (out of a cupboard) which was still dirty.    Now we saw that 90% of the plates were empty and not refilled.    In general the choice of cold cuts was poor.    When trying to get strawberries out of a pot at the same time (!) a cook also tried to catch the rest of it to prepare a juice. He was unwilling to wait till the guest has picked his fruits!    The ambiance of this breakfast restaurant room is very simple.    Cheapest sofas and chairs are available in this 5 Star Hotel.    In general we found chaos in organizing this breakfast.    There is enough staff but most of them are unorganized and not well trained and not well organized.    Most have a very limited knowledge of English.    Finally I cannot recommend this hotel.    My subjective rating:    Check In: 1 point    Room: 2 points    Value for money: 2 points    Look of public areas: 4 points    Service: 1 point

Review_Date: Jakson R wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: The Sofitel Marrakech Palais Imperial is a landmark in the heart of Marrakesh and features stunning architecture inspired by the Maurice Arabes Palace. It is close to historic sights including the famous Jemaa el Fna square and less than 15 minutes from Marrakech light airport. Pamper yourself with the atmosphere of the palace which makes Sofitel an ideal place for a romantic or family holiday as well as wonderful workers and especially thanks to the chef Ayoub Hisham and Younss for their hospitality in providing healthy meals and receptions ...

Stayed in a superior room of this large chain hotel. Excellent service and close to medina. Pleasant outdoor terraces to sit on a spring evening. Breakfast buffet was outstanding and catered to all tastes. Recommend
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a great evening. Thanks to Simo for the great Turkish coffee.  The shisha was also good.  And to Aya and Abderrazak for the service.  You‚Äôll feel at home very comfortable.  We enjoyed it during our stay in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ali Najah wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: Hotel is exceptional and restaurant deserves larger tables. Her refined kitchen entices the most sensitive tastes. When the staff smiles does not leave anyone indifferent. The garden and the comfort in the rooms add finishing touches and the food is wonderful as you wish to do the desired shape. Thank you very much HishamAyoubyounes and Manal for their beautiful smile and good food I will always return and you will be safe.

Review_Date: Alicya monas wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: Pleased to stay at this hotel Sofitel Marrakech. The house is perfect the staff very friendly. We enjoyed the pool and the bar. Special thanks to Chef Afraa Ayoub Hicham Younes Ahmed and good treatment and diet and nutrition tips. Thank you very much.

Review_Date: Skip S wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: Spent three nights in a row at the hotel in Marrakesh. We took private tours throughout the area but returned to the hotel each night. Every morning we ate at the buffet breakfast dining room. Huge variety of food and heavily populated with service personnel. Eggs orange juice Ham coffee teas etc we're augmented with cold cuts cheeses fruit lots of different types of pastry etc. You needn't leave hungry. The bars are easy to find and we'll distributed throughout the property. The dinner dining room has excellent food and service too. Highly recommended.

Review_Title: stunningly serene and peaceful infinity swimming pool- a true oasis of calm
Review_Text: I always take an afternoon off from my busy work schedule to totally destress in this beautiful hotel gardens and swimming pools- the view is amazing and the staff are most attentive- I would like to particularly thank Aya for her amazingly friendly welcome and attention to my every wish - she is a true 'people person' with an amazing ability to engage warmly and genuinely with guests- positive attentive and bubbly I think she will go very far indeed.The food and drinks are exceptional too. Bravo!

Review_Date: laila h wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: I‚Äôm very satisfied about the service of Siham she‚Äôs lovely and majda it was amazing and a good experience to have  very friendly and warm atmosphere and Hamza he do a good job with chicha that I like manth specially  With the presence of chef wiam &momo ‚ù§Ô∏èüíã best regards

A very good experience at the lauwrence bar. Enjoyed the service by Siham and Soukaina the host and the manager Wiam. Could not recommend this place more highly to anyone visiting Marrakesh for business and personal travels.

Review_Date: Tracy C wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Title: We booked a birthday dinner reservation.
Review_Text: 1stly: We booked a dinner reservation at the So Lounge. However when we arrived to the hotel security paid no attention there was no signs or direction from anyone. So we walked in and hosted ourself where we felt the bar/restaurant would be. So we went outside to find the restaurant.    2nd: We sat down at the Omega restaurant however the woman was very fast to seat us down and it didn't look familiar to the pictures I had viewed of the reservation I had book previously as I booked a dinner and show which takes place in the So Lounge.  So we asked after ordering starters if we were in the right place to find out we wasn't and the lady who sat us didn't even check our reservation.    3rd: I had oraganised a mini surpise for my boyfriend at the hotel. Video play and a birthday cake which was displayed on the big screen on the lounge. Certainly a five star experience.    Key Tip: Can be expesensive if you spend the whole night there. Drinks aren't very heap.    Bad: External staff work within the hotel. The photographer who arrived during the birthday celebration charged us 660 dirham for 12 photos. However told me 60 dirham to print all 12. So I agreed that was fine until he came back and said no he said 660 dirham which is crazy.    He then said I could pay 400 dirham for 6 pictures.. (which is 32pound) for 6 pictures.  We were aware of how much images cost to develop and everything as the machine he printed it on is literally at the back of the lounge.    His answer was its 'sofitel' however he wasn't even a staff of Sofitel.    Was a total rip off. Hotel staff said they have no control over external staff. Its very bad for business when you are being charged 50pounds for 12 photos.    Great experince however disappoint during the celebration.    Great show GREAT singers.    We have visited MANY sofitel around the world. So will be back again!!    Please take pride in external staff the way you do for your own staff.    Thanks    Alexi '& Tracy
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have recently stayed at this hotel I have to say the staff are very friendly and helpful. In particular a lovely young lady called Noura who works at the So restaurant and nightclub she has been so welcomingkind and very informative. She is a great asset to the hotel!  The food has been of a good standard and overall it‚Äôs been a relaxing break for all of us.

Magnifique exp√©rience at the SOFITEL Marrakech my holiday was extraordinary with the beautiful team from reception and of cours the concierge there smile make my stay unforgettable .  The room was very confortable with the best view thank you guys ... see you soon !

Review_Title: Fantastic city hotel with buffet lunch
Review_Text: We came to this hotel with TUI. Initially it was advertised as Sofitel Palais imp√©rial but our rooms were on the side of Lounge and Spa. It was great as the rooms were fully refurbished or very clean as it looked immaculate.  We were 2 families travelling. So we had 4 rooms and they were connecting. It was a bit hard to get the connecting room but we got there at the end.    One of the manager showed me a suite for 3 to 4 people and we will definitely book this one next time we go.    We were a family of 3 and our friends a family of 5. If they would not have travelled with us they could have not got a room for 5. They don‚Äôt allow more than 2 people in 1 doubble room so they should have booked 3 rooms. I think they need to be a bit flexible on this. As in the suite you can easily put 5 people with an extra single bed at an extra charge. This would not heart them.    Also the website does not work very well when you come to add kids in it. The system always kicks you out so this is also something to work on.    Apart from that the bufffet breakfast till 10:30 is great amazing buffet and amazing food. You can eat inside on the terrace or in the garden. Rachida was there every day to serve us and she was lovely and very friendly.    Then we would use the heated swimming pool for families and the amazing sofa sunbed. The pool was great for kids and all the kids played together. Some parents were arguing around the pool which kept us entertained.    As we were half board we had buffet lunch with amazing couscous daily freshly cooked skewers merguez. But you need to ask for it if you don‚Äôt see it. Of course all the type of Mezze and aubergine mezze that I love. As I am french they could add a bit of cheese for lunch and ham :)    Every evening we were out for dinner. Walking distance there is the palace restaurant next to lotus that‚Äôs great. Also the Italian MOD. We also tried the Marrocan at the es Saadi resort which was great.    This hotel is in the main area of Marrakech. We have stayed at Pullman before that is also part of the same group but they could not cook good meat. And we also staying at four season for a change. But Sofitel is the best. We will definitely be back next year.    Another thing they could do to accommodate more the families is allow children in the indoor pool. Maybe not all day but between 2 and 4 or allow some time slots when it‚Äôs cloudy or raining as we did not know what to do when it was cloudy and the outdoor pool was not hot enough to go in.    But the beauty of this hotel outdoor and Indoor is just great.

Review_Title: Beautiful setting and poolside; very comfortable rooms
Review_Text: The setting of the resort focusing on the pool/poolside is beautiful the lunch/breakfast area by the poolside is glorious reasonably protected from direct sunlight. The rooms are large and well-laid out and ours had a large balcony with sofas that you could almost live in as well as a beautiful view of the sunrise (for those who are not enjoying the nightlife). For such a new high-end property it's a shame that the elevators are so small and dark that it can be difficult to even select the right floor or find the door open button in a hurry. Service quality issues like a backed-up shower drain on our arrival were quickly fixed. The most maddening problem was that because we were on a prepaid tour we paid for some meals by credit card and the waitstaff repeatedly charged us in US Dollars (to earn the extra fee) even though we asked in both French and English to pay in Dhiram.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Deirdra H wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Title: The Most Beautiful Hotel in Marrakesh
Review_Text: This hotel is so beautiful. It stands out from all other hotels. To me it's the most beautiful hotel in Marrakesh. The hotel decor is beautifully designed with a Moroccan theme. The rooms are spacious and very clean. The pools were so clean and very well maintained. The entire staff were excellent. We felt so special every day. We especially enjoyed Hassane Fatima Amine Abdlaha Aziz My Youssefe Sana Zanty and Krfi. I highly recommend this hotel. The location was perfect....a few blocks away from the Medina shopping malls and the horse carriages. We will definitely be back and will stay at the Sofitel. We especially love that the hotel had everything there: restaurant pool entertainment gym club....there was no need to leave the hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sina D wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: We stayed here in October 2017.  After spending time staying in the hustle and bustle of the medina it was nice to spend a few nights here. There was a stark contrast between how luxurious this part of town is compared to the rest of Marrakech.  The hotel facilities were beautiful with large pool areas and comfortable loungers.  The room was very spacious and tidy with a comfortable bed.  We felt well looked after by the wonderful staff here.  The breakfast was certainly one of the best I've experienced from a sofitel with a huge selection of delicious food.    Platinum perks: upgraded to suite access to the exclusive infinity pool area (we spent most of our time here) fruit bowl welcome amenity (not my favorite) welcome drinks.    Overall an excellent stay thank you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent such a pleasant day with our 2 kids at the sofitel pool area today....amazing heated pool with very good food and service. Waiters are so kind and it is really kids friendly! We recommend the hotel to all families and single couples since every one is most welcome. Karen & Redouane

Review_Date: Marvin S wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: This hotel is a 4 star maximum. Friendly staff however if you want to relax at the infinity pool as a hotel guest you have to pay 400 dirham. Which is approx 37 EUR per day. Furthermore the room was ok. The tv was hanging with an angle stains on the carpet. I was sleeping on the yardside but there was music every night. Can be good except if you have to sleep. And last but not least i had to leave two nights earlier and the hotel wouldn‚Äôt refund me two nights i have sent an e-mail requesting this but zero response. If the manager reads this don‚Äôt reply with your standard apologies answer get back to me on my e-mail and think with me to at least refund one of the two nights i haven‚Äôt slept in your hotel.

Review_Title: Accor you urgently need to change your gameplan
Review_Text: The hotel itself is very nice and has a very good location. We had booked a Junior Suite and one Deluxe Double Room but I have never seen a more unfriendly condescending and arrogant Reception and especially concierge in my life. At arrival at the hotel we have been greeted with a gesture to sit down at one of the lounges. The reception was crowded with staff but none of them made an attempt to check us in. So we waited and waited. At some point I just lost my patience so I went up to the reception and asked one of the ladies if she could kindly check us in. All I got was a "yes yes we will" but she made no attempts to do so instead she waited for another guy who was still busy with other guest to check us in. We counted six employees plus one concierge behind reception at that point and there is only one person who can check in guest? Seriously?  Later on that night two of us went to the reception again to get some money changed. I know what is coming is my own fault but please learn from my mistakes. We handed the man each 400 DHS to get changed into some smaller bank notes. He counted the money behind the desk and then just threw it in front of us. As I HATE counting money infant of people I just took the money and went to the bar where I counted the money. Here I had to notice that they had only given me 300 DHS although I gave them 400 DHS.  However the unfriendly and most arrogant concierge topped it all. We had different tours booked through our travel agency who left the pick up times with the concierge. So the day before our first trip we went up to the concierge and asked him for the pick up time. He didn't even bother to look if there was a massage but just condescendingly informed us "No no information!" So we called our travel agent who informed us that they had called reception two hours ago to inform them about ur pick up time. So the next morning we waited for the pick up and as after 20 minutes no one arrived we called the emergency hotline to ask when we will be picked up and where informed that they had called the hotel again in the afternoon and informed them that the pick up will be later. Nothing of this had been passed on to us.  We played the same game with the concierge again for the next tour after we confronted him that he had received the information but had not passed them on he just sent us away with a hand wave. However 20 minutes later at a quarter to eleven we have been slipped a note under the door with our pickup time. Every time we went up to the concierge his fist questions was did you book through us or agency if you told him that you booked through the agency he made no effort looking at all just straight away said his usual sentence "No no information for you" it was just as if they are withholding information from guest who have not been willing to book excursions and trips to their ridiculous high prices.  The service at the Darkum Bar has been very good although the prices are relatively high also compared to other hotels here. However there was one thing that really bugged us. It is without any questions to leave a tip but we do not want to be reminded to leave a tip every time we are handed the bill. By the third day the waiter knew our order by hard and he should have also known that every day we left a tip when we paid the bill. But still every time we have been handed the bill it was handed to us with the addition "also service charge not included!" I think this is rather rude to do so every single time.  The service at the pool was a whole other level. Prices are way too high and you have to wait ages for your order. We paid the waiter in cash and waited for the change for over an hour. After asking the waiter several times we just decided to leave it and never pay cash at the pool again.  Breakfast is good but service is very uncoordinated and the are just standing in the way of each other. There are so many employees standing around and orders are constantly passed on from one waiter to another. So how do they expect to get it right in the end? Wa have been waiting for a glas of orange juice for over 30 minutes until we decided to get it ourselves from the service station. Three white collars have been standing on the terrace and watched us but never made any attempt to actually do their job.  If you wanted the minibar to be refilled you literally had to beg at the reception for it. Also there seems to be a difference in service people received when booking a suite or a double room. At the suite we received a turn down service every day shampoo was refilled regularly etc. but not so much at the Double Room. Here after eight days we received the first and only turn down service. Some days the shampoo was not refilled so we had to take the soap cotton pads etc. were at the room. Every gust pays a fair amount of money so at least the amenities in the room should be the same for all guest.  It is a nice hotel but with a lot of room for improvement.

So good I really liked the welcome we got from Aya!! What a lovely hostess!! The terrasse is beatiful! Shisha is perfect! Service is great!    Definetley my favorite place in Marrakech! Thank you for everything!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Arrived today at the Sofitel. Hotel is beautiful! There‚Äôs no doubt about that. But as our room weren‚Äôt ready we decide to go for some lunch in one of the restaurants. Buffet restaurant we was told to be seated and someone would come over. We waited 45 mins and no one came. So went to the bar restaurant and waited 2 hours to be seen to. After placing our order we waited a further hour for a bottle of water to arrived. Followed 20 mins later by food! Not a good start. Finally gets to our room and so disappointed. This hotel states 5star luxury and we booked a superior room. This is a birthday present for my sister. There is nothing superior about this room! There‚Äôs a travel kettle shabby dated furniture. The bathroom is dark tiny and one robe. When I called to ask could we be moved I was told that was the room I‚Äôve paid for! This is my third visit to Marrakesh and always been impressed in other hotels visited! This I would never stay again or advise to come.

from start to finish more then perfect incheck warm welcome personal touch because accormember nice upgrade room clean and a lot of space beds gave a perfect nightcheck out very personal too and proffesional because we have to get a early flight no breakfast too bad but when we come back we we have breakfast for surewe could mention names of staff members but we cant mention everybody but the were all great ! and did their best to give us a good time kees
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Philippo A wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: We stayed here at the conclusion of a 10 day tour from Casablanca last weekend.. Have to say that it was excellent...comfortable rooms excellent attentive service great food and wonderful pool area.  I note that a couple of recent reviews found different levels service but this was not the case for my wife and myself.  Location is pretty good being in the new area. Bit of a walk to the old town but manageable. Plenty of restaurants and cafes around...just be careful to select ones that are frequented by locals and not just tourists.  Overall this venue was a great place for us to finish our tour.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: First the positives:    Great location within 5 minute walk of the medina and thus convenient for exploring the main sights in Marrakech. Also a short 10 minute taxi ride from the airport ( don‚Äôt pay more than 100 Dirham ).    The pool area is very nice with plenty of beds and lounging areas.    The pool bar / cafe also had a nice lunch menu and staff here were friendly and engaging.    Now for the negatives:    Emails to the hotel prior to arrival required chasing several times to elicit a reply. Taxi transfer from airport was quoted at ¬£50 for 4 of us ( regular taxi is ¬£8 for a 10 minute ride ) I specifically requested non-feather duvets and pillows due to an allergy. I finally got an acknowledgement and confirmation this would be provided but on arrival in room this request had not been fulfilled. A quick call to reception I hoped would resolve matters. Sometime later housekeeping attended to the matter. However later that evening I realised they had simply replaced feather pillows and duvet with  you guessed it feather pillows a duvet. Finally resolved by 1230am.    In general we found the reception staff to be abrupt arrogant and very unhelpful. Restaurant staff at breakfast were similarly inattentive .. we had to ask for coffee rather than it being offered and we got a distinct impression guests were seen as a bit of a nuisance rather than there to be served.    I left feeling that the majority of staff would benefit from some serious customer service training how to smile and engage with guests and proactively seek to meet their needs. I would not recommend this hotel sadly which is unusual for the Sofitel group where elsewhere I‚Äôve have found to be excellent. Marrakech misses the mark by a long long way.

We booked into the Lounge & Spa room was very well appointed clean modern balcony etc and very comfortable. Hard to find fault. The hotel is kept very well.    - Check-in was relaxing and effortless.  - Concierge helpful. All staff were really helpful actually.  - Breakfast is amazing with a significant selection of offerings. If you‚Äôre not happy with breakfast in this hotel you‚Äôd be very hard to please!  - SoLounge was unexpected and we really let our hair down one night! Live music was fab!  - We ate in L‚ÄôOrangerie restaurant. Food & service good but TV screen off-putting for a restaurant of this quality.  - BBQ buffet lunch also had a lot of options and was excellent albeit a little pricy compared to similar back home.  - Pool facilities are excellent. Pool service good and so many comfortable loungers.    I can not recommend this hotel enough. I am having withdrawal symptoms and would happily return again tomorrow! Thank you Sofitel! Two happy Accor Members!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Michelle P wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: We had an awful stay when we arrived we were greeted with a finger pointing to a sofa to sit there. I had a feeling this was going to be the start of a bad stay. We had to continually ask for towels face cloths etc... and a hair dryer -these aren‚Äôt in the rooms.    At breakfast the tables were dirty unset I asked for tea 4 times in two occasion and finally gave up and drank my husbands coffee.    The hotel is impersonal unfriendly and I would never stay here again. As a chef and a regular hotel user there needs to be some serious attention to staff training and customer service. If you want to operate large hotels make it personal other wise you won‚Äôt compete.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tahmina K wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: Amazing staff amazing food! Perfect music and atmosphere. Thank you Aya and Aziz gino  youness hanane brahim and chef zaizi  yassine aminechawki for the great service see you soon!!üòçüòçüòç‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏èüëçüèΩüëçüèΩüëçüèΩ
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: rothna k wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: Loving the lounge and the atmosphere.. Aya and brahim saidazizeaminegino youness was lovely and very polite!    be sure to come here.. love the drinks and the shisha.. Music was on point. Amazing time..

Review_Date: Cathryn J wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: Very picturesque location stunning for pictures and classy but comfortable decor inside. Staff AyaGino younesse brahimsaid azize amine very pleasant and kind. Second time visiting and will definitely be coming back. Had a great time at the nightclub and the lounge.

Review_Date: sue r wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: Just returned from a 3 night stay in this hotel and wow what a hotel it‚Äôs absolutely stunning. I had a double room beds and pillows really comfortable air con is a god send. The pools and areas around the pool are amazing. You actually have day beds with towels provided.    The only downside to this hotel is the prices for food and drink there ridiculously expensive a can of coke was ¬£4.00 as was the water. We had lunch one day and for 3 sandwiches and 3 waters it cost ¬£85.20.    The location of this hotel is perfect it‚Äôs a 5 minute taxi ride to the M√©dina.    I would stay here again but next time will not be eating here

Review_Date: Victoria M wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: I loved staying thereeverything was soo nice. But the best part was breakfast with a lot of pasteries and variety and a really nice staff. Lagouail one of the cooks Made me the best nutella waffles of my life and he was so kind to me every morning we talvez and it was really good.

Review_Date: Amy L wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: We went for drinks and desert at the So lounge at about 11pm people were doing Shisha and the DJ was great the atmosphere is very cool and service is great and friendly. Desert and drinks were also great definitely a great bar/lounge for after dinner or drinks!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have stayed here many times and other hotels in Marrakech but the Sofitel get better every time. The service from checking in by Mehdi and Taha was perfect. Room service from Siham who always greats us like family is beyond what you would expect. The food and service is always excellent. I would highly recommend the Sofitel if you want a 5 star service. Regards Abdul Qadir

We had the privilege of staying a couple of days here and our only regret is not staying longer so much more then you would expect outstanding hotel food and customer service that above and beyond the call when we had a reservation issue a warm thank you to Soufiane Mazzouj for taking care of us we look forward to coming back with the kids and spending a little longer.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Very nice hotel and value for money
Review_Text: -Breakfast very nice with a large spread and healthy.  -Value for money  -Rooms very large and spacious.  -They know how to throw a grand party  -Staff warm and friendly and always ready to help.  -Has a fitness center

Review_Date: Giannis K wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: We visited Marrakech in July to celebrate our birthdays and our first wedding anniversary. We wanted to pick a top 5* star hotel that would tick all the boxes and we indeed made the right decision. We arrived early and received a very warm welcome. The receptionist had been informed by our travel agent that we went there to celebrate our anniversary and kindly offered a complimentary room upgrade. Great first impression. We were offered a traditional mint tea and were given our room cards. The room was spacious with all necessary amenities and very good balcony view overlooking the pools and restaurants. The staff were fantastic extremely courteous always happy to go the extra mile to please us. The breakfast was second to none. Fantastic wide range fresh omeletes crepes french toasts; simply superb. Their pool service was very slow but if you are okay to chase the waiters a bit it does work. I would not recommend that you buy simple items like water or cokes / snacks from the pool bar as it can be super expensive. There is a local Carrefour where you can literally get them for 1/10 of the price. The pool bar's prices for drinks are unreasonable. Spa seemed lovely but again super expensive. We went for a more traditional option in the Medina that was superb and much cheaper. We decided to have the full Marrakech tour through the hotel and this was a great choice. Their concierge service is really good. Overall a fantastic and very pleasant experience staying at the Sofitel. We would definitely consider staying again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Naomi L wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: I have been coming to marrakech for years now and it is always changing but i ALWAYS make sure I stop off at the SO lounge.. DJ Akramb is always on point with the music.. if you are coming to marrakech why not stop off have some shisha and check out the cool vibes

Review_Date: Gelato P wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: Our week-end there was amazing. A really Nice staff excellent service great place amazing room with an amazing view everything was great. We were there for my friend's birthday and they had a great surprise for us ! It was Perfect  A special thanks To Nadia (reservations) Yassine (F&B) and Ahmed (r√©ception) they were really great !  We will definitely come back soon

Review_Date: Naoual K wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: very good hotel good service and nice people. Smells very nice and especially special thanks to room maid Fatima M'Hand ( if I have here name right) for the proper care she was very kind thank here for me.

Spent 3 days in this hotel and it was just fantastic. The staff was very polite and helpful . Thank you for the tea guy in the lobby  he is so sweet. The concierge is fantastic!!! Love the ambiance at this hotel.  See u sooooon
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Great location very close to the old tawon 10 min walk and also to all excellent restaurants. Great pool comfortable rooms. Some of the staff speak English  I am a funn of Marrakech but this is the first time I stay at the softies I do like it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Michel G wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: Sofitel Spa Hotel in Hervernage is a nice place to stay to visit Marrakech with a lot of staff very concerned by your confort especially Mrs Hyatt that had tacfull attention to transform our room in to a roses flowerbed suite.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mimi Z. wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: I viste Morocco this summer for 1 month. My first 3 nights and last 3 were in Marrakech. My first 3 nights I stayed in Sofitel Lounge & Spa and I LOVE it which made me come back and stay there for my last 2 nights!    Best service best staff very clean very organised and most importantly VERY professional!    Im definitely staying in Sofitel next time I visit marrakech <3 thank you for the best experience!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Hotel is beautiful but at every turn they aim to exploit the tourist by charging extortionate prices for food and drink. But you have a choice to eat and drink their. Our issue was we were charged ¬£10 for three warm 330ml bottles of water delivered to the room. This was not explained at checkin but only when checkin out not part of the mini bar and not even cold. We raised the issue but arrogant staff simply shrugged shoulders and say they would pass on the complaint. Simply a way to exploiting guests very disappointing. Also failed to explain the tourist tax at checkin so you will be billed for this also when checkin out.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Stefan M wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Title: Low quality standards compared with high price level and arogance
Review_Text: I am a very frequent traveller and have been in alot of different hotels throughout the years. I was very dissapointed from this hotel. We booked a suite and certainly had also high expectations. The size of the suite was very nice but there where things like big ugly stains on the carpet as well as broken washbasins. Things that are completely unacceptable. The general posture of the service staff like concierge etc. is rather snobby and arrogant and not really caring. The price/service-quality ratio was one of the worst I have encountered on my world wide travels. To be fair: I had the same impression of the whole country Morocco.    Good points: The hotel has an impressive and nice pool. So if you do not have overly high expectations and like to hang around the pool this might be a good spot for you. I would not return anyways.

Review_Date: Ash A wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: All I can say is Reda is extremely helpful and was great at telling us the best places to visit esp for food. He went above and beyond to ensure that we had all the information we needed and made all our reservations for us so that we could simply enjoy the experience! Thank you Reda!  From Naz
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Marrakech Lounge and spa is well located ten minutes drive from the airport and a twenty minute walk from the main square and entrances to the souks. The hotel offers top quality facilities and the rooms are what you would expect from a high end chain.

We had an relaxing time at the Sofitel Marrakech Lounge & Spa over 4 nights the week of July 4th.    The hotel itself is beautiful and we absolutely loved the pool. The pool is surrounded by beds no chairs so you can't help but sprawl out and get comfy as you relax. Also we would get the big bottle of Mojito every day and it was incredible so refreshing.    The service everywhere in the hotel is extremely friendly & helpful. Yes sometimes it takes a while to get someone's attention or for food/drink to get delivered. However that is just their pace and everything they do is done with a smile on their faces.    The trip was truly saved by Adil the concierge though. The hotel had set us up with a third party for VIP airport service that never showed up at our gate to meet us. He got us a cash refund immediately no excuses or questions asked. Then when my wife got sick he arranged to have someone go pick me up food from outside the hotel and went to a pharmacy to get her medicine. He bailed us out multiple times and made the trip run so much smoother when any issues came up. Thank you Adil!    My only complaint is about the food at the pool & room service. We were not very happy with it and they definitely need a better menu for eating in the heat outside. Stick with the fruit which is incredible. That being said their breakfast is amazing as well.    The Sofitel is a great place to relax at after the hustle & bustle of the Old City!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Luis M wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: Sofitel Lounge and Spa is well located few minutes from everywhere (however better by taxi). I found the hotel restaurants very pricey so I'd suggest eating elsewhere. There are loads of restaurants at walking distance and even more within a few minutes by taxi. There are also loads of Riads that you can eat for less than half of the cost with a better variety of local cuisine.  Our rooms were excellent clean renovated new robes with a 5 star quality of sleep.  The service is excellent with smiley and friendly staff.  The pool was good clean (and cold) and the beds and chairs by the pool were ok.  The service at the pool is slow.

Review_Date: salma amrane wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: I really recommand the orangerie restaurant the food is tasty. Nice view nice candle showI have spend a great moment. Outstanding experience. I really want to thank evry one Aya Hamza jawad atika Maria sara majda and special thanks to the manager Wiam . The best team ever
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My family stayed in Sofitel Marrakech during my traveling outside Morocco the hotel is tired and old newly renovated rooms were small and tasteless the pool area is nice but everything else is not 5 stars staff are not friendly and rigid I wouldn‚Äôt recommend the hotel specially for the price the only good thing about the hotel is location heart of the city and walking distance to papular restaurants.

Review_Date: David Lambrix wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Title: Excellent Service, Comfortable Rooms, So-so Food
Review_Text: The ambiance upon entering the lobby is relaxing and authentic. Upon arrival a cold towel and hot mint tea arrive before the check-in process. I had booked a Junior Suite via the Sofitel website which is a larger room one per floor. The room is immaculately clean and well kept. The large balcony and sitting area off the bedroom was an especially nice touch. The staff could not have been more polite nor well meaning certainly felt the Moroccan hospitality from nearly everyone.    My only negative feeling was the restaurants inside the resort. It's hard to find value in a 10 Euro glass of iced tea and dry 'spaghetti bolognese' served on penne pasta. These prices far exceed what you'd find in a five star hotel even in the capitals of Europe. Combined with the overall lackluster quality of the food it pushed me to eat outside as much as possible.

The hotel was beautiful but the service was poor. We ordered food by the pool after 20 minutes we had to continuously ask where it was after an hour we finally received. When we checked we were requested to provide a card which wasn't a problem. They took ¬£329 for a damage deposit which was fine as we were advised we would get the money back when we checked out. However when we checked out we were advised that we would get the money back within 24 hours. It has now been a week from checking out and I have still not received the amount back. When I called the hotel to find out what is happening I receive poor service and attitude. I am truly disgusted with how I have been treated by the persons I have spoken and I would not stay at this hotel again.

Review_Title: The hotel is in a fantastic location. A 10 minute walk to the Medina or a 5 minute taxi ride.
Review_Text: The checking in process was excellent. Upon arrival we were given cold towels and mint tea. Perfect.  The swimming pools are super and well maintained. The grounds are lush with lots of herbs and palm trees. Rooms are good and the beds comfortable. There are the facilities in the rooms to make tea/coffee.  The breakfast is good and a vast array of different foods are on offer. The "english" tea was not good for me as I prefer strong English breakfast tea. Managed with the mint tea everyday which was fine.  The hotel is undergoing renovations which caused some initial concern as our room was next door to the renovation however I spoke to the customer service manager and was offered a different room which was great but without the view of the pool area.  The staff at the hotel are OK. Their English is poor and I do not speak french.  The service at the pool is poor. We normally had to ask at least 3 times for something Again i think this is the down to the language problem. We did wait 2 hours for a drink by the pool which given the heat was not good.  On our last day a great waiter who is tall with a ponytail and glasses served us. He spoke OK English and delivered great service. I am sorry I cant remember his name.  We did speak to the customer relations lady and she and the hotel appear to be keen to address the poor service and the lack of spoken English.  The hotel offers a variety of resturants and the portions are good.  Was a bit concerned that a milk shake costs more than a G & T. Hey ho first time for everything I suppose.  Overall i enjoyed my stay and would return should I go back to Marrakesh.

After a chaotic and hectic souk experience the Sofitel Marrakech is the perfect nest to fall into.    We spent most of the time at the pool side lounge during our 2-weeks stay food was alright and a little slow sometimes but they have the most amazing and attentive staff here especially Mme Karima Adil Abddrehim and Adellilah.    Housekeeping lady - Mhand and the chambermaid who took care of us and made sure that our room is meticulously cleaned.    Concierge Adil whom assisted us with the desert tour booking and recommended a very trustworthy and flexible English speaking guide. The team also helped us to purchase train tickets sending postcards and other errands.    Thanks again for the stay and kudos to the Sofitel Team!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: I'd Give it a 6 if I Could
Review_Text: We had a wonderful experience at the Sofitel Marrakech. From checkin through checkout the service was impeccable. Rooms are decorated in a traditional style which makes it a pleasure to be in the room. The breakfast buffet is sumptuous and on a terrace so that we could enjoy the cool morning air. This is definitely my go-to place in Marrakech from here forward!

It‚Äôs been a pleasure to be here it‚Äôs very nice people are very kind. Most of all I recommend Mohamed Benalia who is a very good waiter of the so lounge. Thanks Sofitel for the good experience. I want to come back

We booked the hotel for our honeymoon and were not disappointed at all great services and a special thanks to the concierge Adil who took care of all our personal requirements for food and exploration of the city making our stay memorable!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Larissa A wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: We went here for our first wedding anniversary my husband mentioned it was our Anniversary over the phone to them and in an email and not one recollection whilst we were here but this is petty in comparison to everything else.    1. No building work was mentioned to us but on arrival they are refurbishing and our room was noisy during the day.  2. Only ONE lift working which we had to share with staff the lift was laughable it was tiny and not brand new for a refurbed part of the building short cuts were taken. EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTING especially when the lift finally arrives and there isn‚Äôt enough space to share with everybody else that have also been waiting.  3. New grey carpets and tread wasn‚Äôt even placed down correctly so tatty already and they told us only refurbed 3 months ago. Paintwork in communal parts is shoddy one coat literally on everything. Not smart.  4. Temporary breakfast area - again not mentioned and felt untidy with dirty seats and dirty tables.  5. As soon as I arrived I felt this is not a five star experience. Concierge are made to wear brown tatty cheap suits. Not their fault but come on! It‚Äôs meant to be a five star!  6. Service VERY slow heads down but quick enough to hand you the bill!  7. Towels reused by pool area left to dry and then folded back up like new!    If this was a 3* I would understand but Sofitel you need to up your game and cut the slack especially with the high prices you charge for food and wine maybe you should take a look at Es Saadi next door the hotel is of a much higher standard cheaper accommodation and food and drinks are of a much better standard and at a cheaper price too!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Very nice welcome and the rooms are ‚Äúfine‚Äù. Nothing to complain about. The breakfast is the largest choice I have ever seen in a hotel. There is no way that you could eat from every choice and still fit in your swimsuits  Great chill out bar next to the hotel too.

I am very satisfied with the quality of service and happy with the way the staff of SSofitel Marrakech welcomes her guests. I would especially thank Sanaa BENKHDER for the morning smile that we get every day during our breakfast letting uss feel welcomed in this beautiful red city. I also like to say that the meals we had where so delicious.  I lived my dream days  thankyou Hotel sofitel Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Halima A wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: I like Hotel Sofitel Lounge and Spa of Marrakech and I was very satisfied by their warm welcome and especially the follow-up of Ms. Sana on my satisfaction of the service and my comfort throughout my stay

Review_Date: Tali S wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Title: Beautiful hotel but terrible service if your not French
Review_Text: My boyfriend and I have just got back from the Sofitel Marrakech spa and lounge  When we arrived everything seems perfect we were sat down brought tea and hot towels which was lovely  We checked in which was simple enough and given out room key.  We went up to our room which was lovely clean modern everything I was hoping for really.  The first day we went to the pool someone showed us to a bed and gave us towels.  The pool is beautiful.  The next day by the pool we wanted to order a fruit plate and water.  As one of the waiters walked by my boyfriend asked and the guy pretty much ignored him but we thought ok maybe he‚Äôs just busy so 15 minutes later the guy has walked passed us a few times have a laugh with the French people and ignoring us I said excuse me we ordered a fruit plate and he said yeah yeah it‚Äôs coming  Another 5/10 later I went to where the food is coming from and said excuse we order a bottle of water and fruit plate nearly half and hour ago and nothing I would mind if someone came and spoke to us but it was like we were aliens after a very expensive but not existiant fruit plate came defiantly not worth the wait!!!!  At breakfast the next morning we went down for breakfast I‚Äôm vegan so of course there was not much for me to eat but I asked if I could get a morrocan salad but I just got looked at like I should speak French.  So I thought of I‚Äôll go and get vegetables and make my own salad but the tomatoes were old bit fresh so I asked if I could have some fresh tomatoes and of course I waited and waited while the waiter walks passed it‚Äôs like I didn‚Äôt ask him it was strange  I felt so angry as I was hungry and we were going out for the whole day so I wanted a good breakfast.  Overall I feel so staff need to make effort it seemed he French people got 100% more attention  As an international hotel the staff need to be able to communicate with everyone
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Myself and my husband (fianc√© at the time) stayed here for 2 nights and I can honestly not fault this hotel or staff at all. This was in November 2013 however didn‚Äôt get a chance to write a review back then. The staff take great care of you the hotel is exceptionally clean and the spa and pools are amazing. Not too far from the souks(market). 5* hotel 5* service !!!! Definitely will return
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ghizlane E wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Title: Nice place for a drink and dinner
Review_Text: What we can say about the lounge is the perfect place in marrakesh for a drink and dinner .what a lovey and professional manager wiyam even her staff are so kind SihamAya and the best chicha men Youness with a nice drink from the Barman tarek and atika

Poor service and poor quality of food. We also got charged for a bottle of water from the mini bar when we didn‚Äôt take it.    The ‚Äòperfume scent‚Äô in the hotel is sickening.    I expected a lot more out of this hotel and was really disappointed.    Hope this review is published as I truly feel there are better hotels in Marrakesh that are less expensive that offer a good quality of service.

We stayed here for only one night. The hotel stands bright and shiny on the Marrakech skyline - we were very excited to checkin there while we waited on our flight the next day. The checkin was very nice and the young lady very professional (she even noticed us around the corner and greeted us on her way home). The smell of this hotel was VERY BAD they have what seems to be several hundred scent diffusers throughout the hotel - if this isn't bad enough they are in the room. It was horrible - we had a few rooms and everybody complained. The hotel itself was dirty - the remote control the toilets the carpets the walls - just not enough attention to this kind of thing for a hotel at this level. The bed was also very bad - it's some sort of air mattress that had us all slanted and almost rolling into the floors. Again we had several rooms so it was not just one problem. The last straw for us they charge for in room coffee but sort of hide the menu - this is ridiculous - Best Western doesn't charge...why should they.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ghislaine D wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: First time at sofitel and I'm sure it will not be the last. Nice rooms and beautiful pool but the it's the people that work here that made our stay that much more enjoyable.  Fatima at the msammen station was amazing Zahira younes and Kaitam (I think that was his name) were so kind and attentive to our needs. They all could not do enough to make us comfortable.  Hassan the Gardner is a very knowledgeable guy: thank you for the plants and tips for growing lovely mint.  Chef Ahmed chef Momo Younes khadija Fatima Zahra Hakim Jamel  Oussama Ait lahcen Zohair Sara and everybody at the hotel patisserie department who couldn't do enough to give my husband tips on baking to help our new venture of opening a coffee shop back in London. Merci bezaaafff  I'm sure we will come back soon and we feel very sad to leave.

I loved my stay at the sofitel lounge and spa  my favourite sport was upstairs for shisha and tapas  the staff is always welcoming us with a big smile especially majda wiam and siham always working hard to satisfy us my favourite cocktail is the fresh mojito  great ambiance and lovely view  will defiantly recommend it to anyone .

Review_Date: Mlle L wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: Wonderful stay @ sofitel hotel Marrakech warm hostess with majda also it was really amazing day in the swimming pool however a lovely evening with nice people Younes and siham in the service they are really professional big thanks to Wiam and all sofitel team üòò

Review_Date: Rachel W wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: This hotel was phenomenal the bed was insanely comfortable the pillows lush and our room amazing. I am a fan of hotel rooms where the shower and toilet are separated. Our balcony was big as well.  The breakfast was one of the best breakfast buffets I have ever tasted and experienced. Value for money was well exceeded by this resort and I hope we can return. Concierge Raba was fantastic he arranged a very entertaining and enjoyable tour for us to the Atlas Mountains a must for anyone who likes to hike and a bit of nature.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We arrived at the amazing looking hotel and the checkin service was great and very fast. Our room was very nice with a typical Moroccan style. We then went to the pool which is amazing as it is such a big variety of couches/chairs/beds. Luckily when we went the hotel was not very packed and rather empty so we could chose and change during the day where we wanted to lie which was perfect. However the service at the pool is not the best. There is one person for the huge facilities which means you need to open you own umbrella and need to figure out how to use the umbrella and tie the knot. We then went to the Pool restaurant where we asked for a bottle of Rose where the waiter then said can I see your ID while pulling my ID out I asked what the drinking age in Morocco is and he answered "20 I think" and after looking at my age (19) he said "yeah 20" and then I googled the drinking age and it was 18 he just didn't want to serve us alcohol. And in general a lot of staff was very impolite However at the same time there are few staff which is extraordinarily polite and nice. The same staff that denied me the alcohol later stepped on my foot while I was sitting down and he didn't excuse himself. Also the concierge was a very nice man and recommend many stuff however some of the places he sent us to were closed without him knowing. Finally the Breakfast and dinner buffets are massive and very good food.    Overall the hotel itself is great with great rooms and pool facilities however some of the staff is not the best.

Review_Date: Ki-Ki Petite wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Title: Great Stay, Needs a Few Minor Improvements
Review_Text: This Hotel was Gorgeous Just like out of a Movie The majority of the staff were warm and welcoming upon arrival. Most were very gracious. The rooms were spacious and clean even though there was not much closet space and no iron (you had to request That). The food by the pool was pretty good but was cold by the time it got to me it was no big deal though I was on vacation mode. I was thinking of extending my stay and went to the front desk The gentleman there (not the one who checked us in) was kind of rude when I asked the price as if I couldnt afford it LOL. Rude. I did not catch his name but he was working at the front desk on the morning of- May 26th on the left side of the desk ( not the concierge) He didn't even make eye contact with me while he was talking he kept writing on a paper when I asked the rate. Very rude arrogant guy. Other than that the Pool was great as well but there was no Hot tub. There was something that looked like a hot tub  but it was filled with cold water. It would be really goof if there was a hot tub there's enough space for it. Also our housekeeping didn't show up until we called the front desk not sure why. Other than that everything was great!! If they could fix these minor issues it would be fantastic! Buffet Breakfast was also very AMAZING.

Review_Title: Nice to look at but not a good stay
Review_Text: We booked a suite there because we only had a 3 night stay in Marrakech. We arrived 10 mins after check in time and were told that our room is not ready and that we should wait at the pool. After 1 hour I went to the reception and asked for our room again and it was still not ready. We were given a different room with a twin instead of a large double but they said they were gonna change this don‚Äôt know how they thought they gonna change the bed?!?!?  Long story short. I spoke to the receptionists 5 Times in total with no help at all. This stay was a complete disaster when you take into account how much money you pay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sarah N wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: My husband and I came for a nice dining night to the restaurant at Sofitel. Actually I am a big fan of the sofitel in general because normaly it's always best quality and very friendly stuff but this time we had a very bad experience.  Around nine o'clock we came for dinner and the weighter offered us a buffet for 40‚Ç¨ each. We asked him how long the buffed will be open and he said until midnight twelve o'clock. We went to the buffet took a plate and sat down on the table outside just five minutes later I went inside again to take something else to eat and the whole buffet was gone just after five minutes!! I asked the weighter about the time as he said midnight and he said he is sorry but the buffet ends now but if we want something he can ask for it in the kitchen. We tried to explan that we took the buffet to enjoy dining and choose from different meals but he said that's all he can do. than he left and didn't come back again. He didn't offer us anything for compensation and we had to pay together 80‚Ç¨ for actually two small plates of food.  Besides that the food was completely cold very fatty and old. There were even flies sitting on some of the dished. I would never go there again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sajida B wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: starting from the professional  quick and efficient service with high standards amazing atmosphere with incredible smell that I admire fleur d oranger it blowes your mind in the lobby .  My first crash it's in the reception the receptionists without exceptions are smily prof and lovely the concierge it's my key in Sofitel the one who I really trust ask for whatever I want wich is he guide you up to your request and giving you many options but the best ones .  always delighted and glad to stay in this hotel always they touch my satisfaction apparently Sofitel reach a level wich is we always expect the best from the best .  Especial thx to Mme ikram rooms manager actually she is very powerful (professional way) super kind and very lovely .  I recommend this hotel for everyone want to come discover or whatever even for a busniss not only pleasure for any requirement and any occasions I guaranty they take care of you from A to Z .  From Dubai with love

We stayed here for 3 nights as a large touring group. We arrived at night and the hotel looked fantastic lit up. The negative is that the hotel sprawls over a large site so corridors go forever and it takes some time to get to your room. Our superior room was basic but did have a small balcony. The grounds including pool and breakfast area were beautiful and we were close to all sightseeing. A must is a trip from here to the Atlas Mountains. A big negative was dinner upstairs which then turned out to be outside and cold. It was the French restaurant but the food was definitely not French. Staff were rude food was average and we had to ask many times for the heaters to be turned on. Shame as the hotel itself was nice
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I booked the suite at the hotel. The room was extremely nice however the service throughout my stay was extremely disappointing. Toiletries were not refreshed laundry bags were not replaced on one of the days the do not disturb sign was removed and never came back. The most disappointment can when it was raining one of the nights I requested the hotel personnel standing with umbrellas to help me with an umbrella to my car and they refused and said I needed to go to concierge and take their permission which was ridiculous. I finally chose to sprint to my car. On my return that night I had a similar experience I had an elderly lady and a 8 month old kid in the car. The hotel staff refused to help with an umbrella to usher them into the hotel. After I went in and had to raise my voice I finally got some assistance. Even after this no one came to assist me with my luggage. After this incident I called for the hotel manager to visit my room and highlighted all the issues. He assured me that everything would be sorted out going forward. To my surprise absolutely nothing improved. Toiletries were still not refreshed the laundry bag still not replaced nor the do not disturb sign returned.  I doubt I will every stay at this resort again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I travel quite a bit and I have stayed in a least 10 marrakech propreties of the same caliber this is the best! location-wise amenities and service wise.  During checkin a lovely receptionist that I would like to recognize Chaimaa saw that my wife was pregnant so made sure we don't have to wait for room and gave us a close room to reception and pool to avoid long walks for my wife. She was very sweeet. Also as thoughtful is the reservation lady Hanane who checked the system and saw that I change room so she called me to make sure I am happy with the new choice That's what I call great service!  the rest is good rooms are with nice amenities. breakfast is top notch  What I always find dissapointing is food service by pool. it has been poor for few years now you have to walk to the waiters to get them to help you slow service and waiters look like they hate their jobs and are tired.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: After two weeks staying in more modest local accommodations it was a real treat to stay at this modern western-style hotel. Well laid out rooms. Large comfy beds comfy pillows.
