Outstanding blackout curtains. Bathroom has towel racks for both hand towels and bath towels. The hand towel rack runs along the bottom of the sink so it's very convenient. Large fluffy bath towels. Lighted magnifying shaving mirror.  Breakfast buffets are good buffet lunch is great. A bit difficult to get served water and coffee at breakfast.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Les D wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: Great location very close to the old town you can take a short taxi ride or walk. Good restaurants close by as well. Great pool outdoor activities and comfortable rooms. Only negative is that if you don't speak French you may feel that you are ignored by the staff.

Review_Date: Samir B wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: I stayed in Sofitel last weekend really enjoyed the service and hotel overall. close proximity to Marrakech landmarks (walking distance) and great restaurants make sure you take the breakfast with the room

Review_Date: Samantha H wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: We have recently returned from an 8 night stay and we couldn't have been happier with this hotel. Booking months in advance we got a really good deal on Expedia for a junior suite but after reading all the reviews regarding service I thought I had made a massive mistake but they must have just been unlucky. The hotel is spotless as was our room which was cleaned and restocked every day we even had housekeeping additionally knock every evening to ask if we needed anything. It is a big hotel but there were plenty of beds and seating around the pool to accommodate everyone. The staff at the Oasis poolside restaurant were incredibly attentive and courteous whether they were serving you at the restaurant or bringing drinks to your sunbed.  Please do not let previous reviews cloud your judgement. We had a fabulous time and would definitely recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Andy Z wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: We visited Marrakech in April/Mai and stayed at the Sofitel just the best Hotel!Checkin later in the evening was very slow but everything else is wonderful.The Hotel has a very nice Pool with Gardens.The Hotel is within walking distance to the main Markets.The Food here is very good the Hotel has a great Breakfast Buffet.All in all if you come to Marrakech it is a nice place to stay!

The rooms are big and spacious the pools are big and clear the food is just superbe and the staff was super nice mostly the Asian restaurant that has lots amazing stuff and Mrs.hanane served us and she was really nice highly recommended !

Review_Date: Rita T wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: For me this hotel remains amongst the best in Marrakech. The location is ideal  the new rooms are elegant  comfortable  clean and well Equipped. The service is the number one plus of this hotel . The staff is professional and kind. It‚Äôs always my primary choice whilst in Marrakech and i never regret it.

Review_Date: harold b wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: Maraksh is the playground of the likes of Francis Ford Copolla & Brad Pitt not together albeit." Vegas far East " yet wayyyyy classier and more chill.  No 3-day insomnia saturation maximum stsy here and if your pockets ARE deeper the Sofitel is exotically inviting & balmy warmy poolside AS well when Ole' man winter abounds North of here.    The property is well kept service and staff par excellence and the color scheme of the rooms classic all-time Maroc the jewel of N. Afrique.    No wonder Bogey couldnt get on that plane with Bacall Maroc was his true love Mistress!!    Come stay at the Sofitel and fall inive again HEIWAHH!!

The resort it is very convenient located near tocity center and Medina.The breakfast and the launch very good with a lot of choices and one of the best which I had in a hotel.The rooms a litlle updated but still spacious and having all facilities.Nice swimming pool.It is not so luxurious like Four Seasons or Royal Mansour but the food is better.

Review_Title: It was like coming to a paradise
Review_Text: From the first moment I met the first hotel employee I felt really welcome. And when I saw my room I did really like everything in it. The bed the night lights free in-room mineral water the shower the bathrobe the slippers everything. Everything was working and it was so clean and so quiet. After a long day it was like the dot above the letter i when the evening lady Fatima came to turn my room down leave me peaceful night tea and wish me good night.  The only thing missing in the room was facial tissues but it did cost me only 075 euros to buy them in the nearby grocery shop.    The buffet breakfast was excellent nothing was missing. I think there might have been even 20 different breads even dark ones which I prefer. All the cooking personnel were really friendly and helpful. Only the server personnel could be better. First I thought that it was only me to whom they were not so friendly but then I noticed that in the next table there were some business men and they had ordered some coffee. Later they tried to ask when the coffee will come but the waiter did not recognize them. They were in a hurry so they stood up and stood there a while waiting. At the end they left. The coffee came long after they had left and then the waiter just wondered where they had gone. The waiters were really slow. Can not imagine what the situation will be at rush hours as I was always in early morning when the breakfast room was not yet full.  There were many swimming pools I did use only the heated one in the garden. It was so nice to swim there whether it was sunny or rainy and even when the air was not so warm. To this hotel I will return.

Review_Date: Thomai M wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: It's my first time all people who work in the hotel are very kind and very helpful.  my room was big and clean. the breakfast had a lot of different kind of food & delicious. i'm very satisfy I would like to stay again . thank you!

Poorly managed staff. Would generally provide indifferent service at best. Very slow frequently ignored etc. Not as good as some 3 stars we've used. Had consistent experience with this chain throughout Morocco
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Gorgeous hotel, prime location, genuine service
Review_Text: This hotel was beyond our expectations. It‚Äôs beautiful and situated in a very luxurious area. The pics on the website don‚Äôt do it justice. The rooms were spacious and clean. Housekeeping did a great job of cleaning and organizing the room. We had a few issues with customer service but once the General Manager got wind of what was happening he was right there to pick up the slack and offer solutions. Mr. Soufian the GM and Ms. Nassera were amazing professional and genuinely friendly. They communicated with us throughout and we left the Hotel pleased!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed in a Deluxe Room with King Size bed on the first floor over looking one of the pools and above the restaurant.    Pros:  1-Excellent location. You can walk to many cafes & popular restaurants. Also Jema3 Fena is very close by as well as Koutoubia etc...  2- Gardens and Pool are spectacular.  3- Room is modern and new with all amenities  4- Pillows and comforter as well as bed are very comfortable    Cons  We were woken up at 7am the first day with loud knocking and the second morning we woke up again very early because we were located on the first floor above the restaurant. Loud continuous banging. It was not a relaxing stay we were there to celebrate my husband‚Äôs Birthday and sleep in instead we were up very early and not very happy with the room. Also when they grilled in the restaurant we smelled it in the room.  1-Room is very small with tiny closet space  2-Bathroom is very cramped with a shower and wash basin and W/C is in a separate tiny space with a door. Very difficult walking around & sharing the space.  3-A few Light fixtures were not working.  4- Floor tiles weren‚Äôt that clean.  5- Maids left our pillows on the floor after they cleaned the room  6- It doesn‚Äôt feel like a 5 star service as there was no chocolate on the pillow or roses as with other 5 star Hotels in Marrakech they cleaned the room once and that was it.  7-Water in the shower kept getting really hot. Not a good shower for a child  8-Tried the downstairs bar/cafe on the lobby terrace. Waiters were unavailable and we kept having to call them over. Finally got up and paid the bill but no one was around at the register.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I am not one for writing reviews and my husband and I are pretty easy going when it comes to these things. However we were really not impressed with this hotel and do not consider it to be deserving of it‚Äôs 5 stars. It looks beautiful and the breakfast was amazing. There was more choice of things to eat than you could expect each morning and everything was fresh. The pools were also quite inviting even though one was freezing cold. These are the main good points about the hotel. We could have put up with the fact that the food wasn‚Äôt that great at the restaurant in the evening or that the lift was broken or that our toilet leaked or that we found random toast on our balcony when we hadn‚Äôt eaten any toast but what we couldn‚Äôt put up with was the terrible service! The toast we found was never cleaned up. Sometimes our room wasn‚Äôt cleaned at all even if we were out all day and left the sign on the door to ask for it to be cleaned. Service was extremely slow whenever food or drinks were involved and staff were very rude to us and to each other. The first night one member of staff at the restaurant kept shouting at the other staff all of whom moved around a lot but never seemed to know what they were doing. During every meal or drink all we saw were staff arguing with each other or discussing things without actually doing very much because often people didn‚Äôt seem to know who was doing which job. By the third day we finally got good service at breakfast and there seemed to be some sort of organisation but it was never consistent in the 5 days we stayed at the hotel. People were rude perhaps because our French wasn‚Äôt very good but we did at least try and persevered rather than speaking only in English. I also asked for a hairdryer which was supposed to be included with our room and we were told I could have my hair dried at the Spa by one woman at the front desk. The following day I asked another employee and he said it‚Äôs in the draw. When we said it wasn‚Äôt there he said he would get one and it never arrived. These things made our stay very disappointing. It seems we were staying in the new side of the hotel which was only just finished so we understand it may have some problems like the leaky toilet and wall paint that was splattered places due to a quick finish and this would be acceptable. But it seems that this hotel can not cater for the amount of people that stay at the hotel and service was a great disappointment. I hope that once they get used to the new building being open the staff at this hotel will settle into what they doing. I would not stay here again or recommend it to anyone. I would recommend staying in Essouriara! Lovely people everywhere.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ron E wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: The hotel was very nicely laid out with pools and multiple restaurants. Saddek would come to refill our minibar he was always very friendly and asked if there was anything he could do for us. The concierge staff was always very helpful with all the questions that we had. It is always nice when the hotel staff goes above and beyond to make sure that our stay is enjoyable!

Review_Title: Nice, but could have been better...
Review_Text: Excellent hotel but could have been better. hotel was full due to the holidays and seem to have been under-staffed altho' staff was very accommodating. Reception was very easy and check-out fast. Was not able to have a late check-out due hotel being full. facilities were nice rooms clean and minor issues were resolved quickly.

Well I don‚Äôt know how shall I start  The hotel itself just great and located in a very good location in town. Right next to the most important thing to do during your stay in Marrakech it‚Äôs also a beautiful place but and it‚Äôs a big but. The service in  the hotel is No less then disgraceful  0 value for you money  I visited in many Sofitel hotels in my life it always was a big pleasure to stay with them until I tried Sofitel Marrakech  So bad service so bad attitude  And yet Morocco it a great place to visit with the most amazing nice people they all so nice and friendly as well as welcoming  Just stay away from Sofitel and all will be great in this magical wonderful country
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Sofitel is a very good place to spend a few days and enjoy nearby Marrakech attractions on foot. Major city hot spots are never more than 2km away and conveniantly and safely reachable. The outside pool area is designed attractively clean and well served. A very decent pool with lots of seating places around.  Breakfast is truly high class lot‚Äôs of fruits and local products assorted around different bars. Waiting lines are never too long. Service (all drinks as cafe tea water and juices are served to the table) is quick and friendly.  I specially liked the spa/gym area. There is a hammam where they offer different treatments for extra charge. The well equipped gym (with state of the art techno gym equipment) is free.  The restaurants are ok and offer beside local food a good selection of international stuff. There are also countless good eating places in the vicinity. They do serve alcohol everywhere in the hotel.  The rooms (I was in 66) however show that the place is quite old. Altough relatively spacy and very clean I missed some little things like hooks for cloth or something to put the suitcase on. There are only two small closets left and right of the TV (TV is big and good). In the bathroom is not one possibility to hangup a used towel or put on the soap in the showercabin. Taking a shower overfloods the whole bathroom because there is no showercabin door. Beds and linen are supergood quality.  Also good thing is the extra room for the toilette and the private balcony with a lounge.  Wifi is free and available troughout the whole place including outside area.  Overall absolutely worth the price next time I would choose a room upgrade.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Upon arrival we were sat down and were given wet towels to freshen up. We were then served mint tea and some local snacks. We were then checked in and promptly showed to our room.  Our room was very spacious and modern. I had taken a USB plug to charge my phone etc. but there was no need as there was USB charging points on either side of the bed. Our bathroom was spacious with a walk in shower. The shower was great with the right pressure and a huge rain shower head. Our room was serviced twice a day.  The breakfast was amazing with so much choice. Several types of eggs sausages potato wedges pancakes fruits and much more. The drinks where brought to our tables daily special mention goes to Abdul Raheem and Sauda I hope I‚Äôve spelled your name right. They remembered out drinks to brought them out every morning. Everybody was great at breakfast time. The chef who makes the Omelettes and the nice lady who makes the pancakes sorry I don‚Äôt remember your names were so happy and cheerful. It is pleasure to walk in for breakfast and be greeted by such happy and cheerful staff.  The pool area and sun loungers were great. Such relaxing beds near the poolside. The heated pool was also excellent as we were able to swim in March.  I would definitely return to this hotel. Thank you everyone as Sofitel for making our stay so memorable and pleasant. Thank you all so much.

Review_Title: Nice hotel, great pool area and ideal location
Review_Text: Excellent location within walking distance of the main square and souks. Nice rooms and very clean. The pool area is fantastic and perfect for relaxing after a busy day in the city. Took breakfast just across the street at a nice cafe (La Table du Marche) and dinners were in the town as no options available in the hotel at night. Staff very pleasant and welcoming. When booking excursions from the concierge clarify exactly what is included in the price as we found there were a number of extras in the day that hadn't been explained. For example we booked a day trip into the Atlas mountains and then once we arrived at our destination were told we had to book and pay extra for a guide if we wanted to see the main attraction which were the waterfalls.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Claude W wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Title: Classic Moroccan style combined with modern touches
Review_Text: If you want to get a glimpse of a more colonial marocain style hotel indulge in this chique hotel situated in one of the better quarters of Marrakech  le hivernage  away from the hussle and hassle of inner town Marrakech.  Everything is grand about this hotel lots of spaces three pools. A pity that the lounge pool is not free for hotel residents. Seems that even in a 5 star hotel not everything is included.

Review_Date: Sarah J wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: We stayed three nights in this lovely hotel. It is very clean with polite and friendly staff. We were greeted warmly and made comfortable while our room was prepared.  Our room was excellent with a huge bed and well equipped with seating area balcony fridge and safe.    Extra water was provided each night for free with the turn down service.    All of the staff we met were polite and helpful but not at all invasive.    The breakfast buffet was really good with a huge range of options from toast and cereal through to local delicacies.    The only reason that I wouldn't have offered 5 stars is due to the lack of dining opportunities in the evenings. The restaurants are all very formal and the buffet option was restricted to groups/events which left little choice if you were after anything other than a formal meal or room service. It would have been great to have been able to eat at the lovely poolside bar where we enjoyed drinks next to the fire pits.    Location is excellent close enough to walk to all the main attractions but quiet at night.    Worth a stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Chris J wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: Stayed here for 3 nights and had the most wonderful stay.  The hotel is beautiful in every way - the building the pools the room the restaurants. It's in top condition.  The staff are friendly and courteous but they don't pester you which is good.  Breakfast in Le Jardin is delicious with plenty of variety. Good coffee too!  Room was well equipped and seemed brand new. Very comfortable with a huge bed.    I would love to give it a 5 but I was slightly disappointed by the fact the Le Jardin is not open to guests in the evening but is open for what appeared to be private functions. Other restaurants were available in the evening but they didn't really appeal.    Overall we had the most wonderful stay. Would highly recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent 5 nights at this luxury hotel. The service is excellent. From the moment you put your feet in the hotel you feel taken care of by all staff. Attentive to details they are always looking for what you need. We asked for advice from concierge that was very useful. He organized a private car to bring us shopping to quality shops in the zouk and also a visit to a very nice hammam. Simply a great experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ivan H wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: This is a very good though expensive hotel. Our only criticism relates to breakfast where there was invariably some item missing from the table in the form of butter milk or spoons. These were somewhat grudgingly supplied on request. This level of service at breakfast compared very unfavourably with all other areas where it was exemplary.    Check-in was easy. Our room was beautiful. The shared areas internally and externally were stunning. Food and wine though expensive were very good.    Evening entertainment at dinner was of a very high standard. We particularly enjoyed Medhi and Hamza two guitarists/vocalists whose laid-back rhythms and intricatr guitar solos greatly enhanced the ambiance and the dining experience.    We would return to this hotel. Would be 5 star rating except for the breakfast experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sandra R wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: We had a very nice stay and the staff did a formidable job with us from start to finish. A special mention for the excellent doorman. The room was large and very clean. We had a great lunch in the restaurant.

Stayed here for 5 days. The hotel and facilities are fantastic but agree with previous reviews check in was unbelievably slow even though it was not busy. Our standard suite was huge and on the renovated side. All the staff were very friendly and helpful apart from some of the male receptionists. When checking out we were charged for mini bar items that we had not had. Also there is a tax to pay for each nights stay approx five pounds a day. When asking about the bill and taxes the male receptionist was very unhelpful in his explanation and made no apology for the extra items we were charged for. The days were very warm but the mornings and evenings right now are extremely cold so take jumpers and coats too. Definitely visit the Atlas Mountains a Hamman and we did an amazing evening food tour.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My wife and I spent a few days in the hotel early January. While we were not impressed by the bedroom in itself (junior suite that needed some refurbishments and some cleaning). We however had a very nice view on the pool and mountains. We were very satisfied of the welcome we had from staff and in particular we were mostly happy of the availability and good advices of the Concierge Hadil. Breakfast is more than enjoyable as well (lots of choices and quality of food). One particular mention as well is the quality of the massages performed at the SPA (and in particular we both appreciated the professionalism and kindness of Bouchra) and the set-up of the SPA in general. We understand that certain rooms and part of the hotel are currently refurbished which is a token of an even better appreciation for the future. Christine and G√©rald
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: What‚Äôs not to like ? It‚Äôs a Sofitel
Review_Text: We had a bookings for three nights for two rooms and were not disappointed with the check in process or the quality of the rooms.    Being a Platinum member I was told that I had been upgraded which was a nice touch although the upgrade was limited to the view from the room and not the size of the room itself    The housekeeping was a bit erratic and we needed to ask for refills for milk for the coffee additional water etc.    Wi-fi was fine in the rooms and restaurants and lobby.    And the location is close to the M√©dina as well as the new part of the city and the shopping malls.

The hotel is very well located. In january the common area are a little too cold. Reception desk are very good and the room service is perfect. I'm very glad to choice this place to spend two days in Marrakech.

Although located very centrally this hotel is very old and has rooms spread around inconveniently.  Lobby looks good on pictures but the furniture is old and needs replacement. At check in we were given wet towels but they were not very pleasant to smell.    Checking in was easy and staff was good but the room was not worth a 4 star rating. Toilet seat had scratches and rooms had dim lite and I understand that may have been intentional.    Restaurant was good and had good choices. But overall if you are looking for a grand experience in Morocco this is not the place.

Maybe the mistake was mine... I should have read before booking that the Hotel is huge I mean really big! And this is something I don't like in hotels. You fell like you are in a busy train station at rush hour all the time! The lobby is big noisy busy and with a lot of people smoking. When I say a lot I mean A LOT! We got there at 4:30 pm and the room wasn't ready. Strange as the check out when you have to leave is 12:00. Anyway it didn¬¥t take long to get into the room. And then the nightmare started... The room was old and outdated with a heavy decoration and dirty carpet but the worst of it was the smell!!! I thought I was inside an ashtray!!! Horrible cigarette smell! The following day I asked the reception if we could change the room due to the smell. They showed us another room but the smell was the same. In fact the whole place smelled like that. Maybe I am not used to people smoking everywhere anymore because where I live it is not allowed. But there it seems that not only it was allowed but it was incentivated.  My husband suffers from rhinitis and the whole experience was just awfull.  The pool area is nice but again always crowded with people. Staff is polite but not kind and service in general is very slow. Breakfast offers many choices of food. Definetly do not recommend this place!

Review_Date: Shamit P wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: 8 of us stayed here for my friends stag week back in March 2017. Wonderfully set in Marrakech's 'Hivernage' district. We were within walking distance of the opulent Four Seasons La Mamonia Palace Hotel Palais Jad Mahal (Restaurant) and the world famous Jemaa el-Fanaa Market Square.    Rooms were very nicely set and pleasant as was the reception area and poolside areas of the grounds.    Food & drink here is very expensive compared to other places I have been in the world but it's the Sofitel and I wasn't expecting it to be bargain basement. Service from reception staff and hotel ground staff was really pleasant and we were treated very well during our stay.    As we had many facilities available nearby we felt that we had picked the best location for our budget at the time.    We were there when the temperature was climbing to 25-29 degrees so missed the 30 plus mark by a week.

Review_Date: Shashi T wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: The staff is very attentive and helpful. Especially the breakfast restaurant staff Mr Abderrahim a steward. Very helpful.    However there should be more vegetarian options.    We had a tough time getting vegetarian food. Only pizzas and pastas. And salads.    Even something as simple as a vegetarian Curry and rice are not available. You do get tagine but very bland food. Basically boiled vegetables and rice or couscous.    But a lovely safe place for a holiday.

Review_Title: One of the worst hotels I've ever stayed in
Review_Text: Arrived on Friday 24th of Nov with two other couples (our friends); we checked in slightly later than them. We were allocated a horribly positioned room in an external building where the building work was ongoing and our view was the building work; meanwhile our friends were upgraded complimentary to pool side views. I asked to also be upgraded but was told no other rooms were available; the bed was nice but the shower was blocked the water was just 'Luke warm' there was no bidet in the toilet (toilet/bathroom were separate). I complained about the blocked shower and a plumber was sent to the room to report back to the reception staff; I waited for them to change my room but absolutely NOTHING was done about it! The staff were rude and unhelpful.  Whilst me and my friends were sitting in the restaurant area during breakfast service had finished but we were just chilling out. We asked for a bottle of water which we said we'd pay for but all the waiters could say was sorry service has finished and then they offered us an open bottle of water from when were serving!  We then thought lets go to the spa; to our surprise we were told even if we are staying at the hotel we must pay for the spa ie the sauna jacuzzi steam room. That in itself was shocking! I have never stayed at ANY spa hotel where these basic spa facilities have to be charged for!  Everything is a NO for the staff.. Appalled at how I was treated and will definitely never be going back to Sofitel or Morocco again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Beautiful hotel. The grounds are amazing too with fantastic beds everywhere. The heated pool was just the right temperature and spotlessly clean. Breakfast was fab and staff were really on point. I did not expect the hotel to be so outstanding but I could not fault anything other than drinks are expensive. The location is good. It‚Äôs a 10 min walk to the town and there are some good places to eat close by. Fabulous winter destination I am sure I will return.

Spent the afternoon with friends sitting on the terrace.  We all had non alcholic drinks  The glasses were so packed with ice hence after sipping three straw fulls the only think left was ice!  Lots of staff standing around chatting but not serving.  We were given minute portions of dried hard spiced croutons we could not eat.  The masses of birds on our tables enjoyed them.  100 dirhams each drink I don't know how they justify their prices...will not be going again.

Review_Title: Excellent facilities, but overpriced food and drink
Review_Text: A short surprise break here and a review of the comments made since makes for an interesting read in hindsight. The staff could not have been more welcoming throughout. Every member said hello in passing from the bellboys through to the reception staff (so I do not recognise some of the comments made) English was widely spoke and no issues noted.  The room (483) was well appointed with a large bowl of fruit on arrival and a vase of red roses brought in shortly after. The bed was enormous and very comfortable! Separate toilet and bath/shower were adequate with toiletries bathrobes & slippers.  The swimming pools are surrounded by cushioned loungers couches and hammocks (incl baby sized ones). All in all a very pleasant experience.  Food and drink-wise was less so in terms of pricing but one cannot fault the quality. Breakfast priced at ¬£25 each (basically unlimited buffet) failed to compete with other local outlets (eg Cafe ExtraBlatt 100m away) on price.It is highly unlikely that you could eat enough to justify the cost. Clearly convenience has a price. Similarly dinner had great food and ambience but was pricey. Overall a great stay nevertheless.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Service has really changed for the worse
Review_Text: I have been staying here for the last 4 years and have enjoyed the hotel. I recommend this place to friends. This last stay was not so good. The service is was terrible (in the restaurants pool and even check out) The issue is not the lack of staff members but the lack of them taking care of the clients. I see alot of them running around or just talking to themselves while you wait. We waited over an hour after we ordered drinks for anyone to come back and ask if we needed anything else. No one came so we needed to flag someone down. When you ordered bottles of Wine they would come back and continue to provide service - not just drop it off and never come back. At checkout - was not even asked how our staff was. I finally talked to the manager and she was very polite and I understand she would of taken care of it but it was our last day. I will update my review next time I go as I will give it one more chance - if not i will move my business to another hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Nice but not worth the price
Review_Text: Just finished a 3 night stay at the Sofitel. Rooms (beds amenities size beds bedding showers etc) all excellent (we stayed in a newly furnished room. You need to walk through the dining area to get to your room which is odd. The spa is gorgeous but we did not have time for a service. Shopping at boutiques (local designer max & Jan clothing very reasonably priced). Service needs a lot of help especially the front desk which is staffed by arrogant non-empathetic people ( even the concierge seemed indifferent to helping meet your needs). Notable people are Yousef (tall doorman with braces) Hamid in room service (who miraculously got us a 3pm checkout even when all front desk staff said 12) and Elayti at the pool restaurant. The breakfast is $25/person and generic/basic food (not really great but worth it for the convenience). One night we wanted to have a night cap at the bar near the lobby after dinner. We literally had to flag down a waiter after sitting for 10 minutes another 10 minutes to get our drinks and we had to go find the waiter to pay (we were 1 of only 3 other tables that evening). The pool area is lovely with plenty of seating (there is a private pool for an extra 400DAM per person) and service there is just as bad as everywhere else.  Location is 5 min drive from M√©dina. La Mommonia is in the M√©dina and the Les Orangiers are both better options than Sofitel.

Review_Title: Amazing breakfast! But some services need to improve...
Review_Text: The Sofitel in Marrakech turned out to be a good choice though it was a challenge to get the front desk to change our room. The deluxe room we had did not have a comfortable easy chair which I needed for my backache and so we upgraded to a mini-suite to have the benefit of a sofa chair. This upgrade was a challenge ‚Äì but it eventually was sorted out by the helpful and dedicated Ibitissam at the front desk. The hotel only had the much more expensive ‚Äúsophisticated‚Äù suites available for the next 2 days after which we could then get the mini-suite we wanted. The suite we moved to referred to as a sophisticated suite is simply not worth it. It is a lot of space and mostly wasted space offering minimal benefits. When we were eventually moved to the mini-suite we had a lovely room with a comfortable easy chair and well proportioned space. The front desk at the Sofitel can be a challenge ‚Äì it took numerous attempts to sort out the change in our room ‚Äì but the room we finally ended up with was worth the effort and hassles.    To illustrate the shortcomings of the Sofitel an urgent international package had been delivered for me at the Sofitel. The package had arrived on Saturday in the hotel the same day we checked in. No mention was made of a package arriving for me when I checked in. On Monday I asked the Front Desk of the Sofitel but they could not find any package for me. I then checked with the courier company and they confirmed that it has definitely been delivered to the Sofitel. Eventually on Tuesday when I checked with concierge he found the package in a cupboard. Amazingly this hotel has no way of recording received packages for guests and does not keep track to ensure they hand over packages timeously. As a result it takes the hotel 3 days to pass urgent courier packages to its guests.    However the kitchen at the Sofitel wins a prize for its amazing service! Breakfast was outstanding. I have never seen so many options in any buffer breakfast ‚Äì it even had about 5 different cakes numerous pastries and egg options. The chef a serious-looking large man eager to please did his rounds in the morning personally checking the various breakfast offerings. On day 2 I asked him if the kitchen could make a Moroccan flat bread with onions and chilli ‚Äì and within minutes he was giving the kitchen orders. A few minutes later 2 lovely Moroccan flatbreads arrive exactly as requested. As if that was not impressive enough the next morning these special mode-to-order flatbreads arrived on the table shortly after our arrival at breakfast even before we could submit a request! The Sofitel breakfast team are tops!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Large luxury hotel with at least 6 places to eat 4 pools of which 2 really large and one private have to pay extra all surrounded by lounge beds rather than chairs lots of parasols to keep you in the shade whirlpool tabletennis table jeu de boule chess and other stuff to keep you busy. Only annoying thing people reserve their lounge beds early morning and then leave for the most part of the day. Good thing thing it is so big you will always find a free spot though management should find solution for this behaviour.    We had a junior suite that has an immense terrace room with all you need unfotunately only a bath with shower inside separate bathroom huge bed and tv. Free tea and 6 free coffee...    Check in a bit interesting as they make you wait and come to you rather than at desk not sure why. Taxi stand in front of hotel ‚Ç¨5 to get you nearly anywhere in the city probably less if you really bargain. The main square is about 20 minute walk but you will only go there once too touristy.    One of the best breakfasts ever huge selection of food not cheap but defo worth it.    Live bands at night in at least 2 places.    Nothing else to wish for if you can afford this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jihane S wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Beautiful hotel very nice reception the smell is breathtakiny  the pool is amazing beautiful design with the touch of red all over the hotel  great special service from zakaria who really take care of us thank you so much

Review_Date: Alia H wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: My husband and I visited Morocco for our honeymoon and had such an amazing stay at the hotel! We spent 3 nights at the Sofitel in Marrakech and were treated to a warm welcome by the receptionist they brought us warm towels mint tea and French macaroons and Moroccan sweets as we say in the lobby while the receptionist checked us in.    The receptionist Chamime (not sure if that's the correct spelling) was such a delight. She went above and beyond her job description to make sure we had a memorable experience and were forever sold to the Sofitel chain of hotels. We were welcome to our room where we had a tray of fresh fruits and dried snacks and while we were gone for dinner she had our room decorated with the most beautiful arrangements of flowers and candles I could have ever imagined! She always made us feel welcome when she saw us entering and even on the last night had our room decorated with flowers for our last night. The concierge was helpful but a little aloof but Chamime more than made up for it with tips on the city!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Almar A wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Title: Luxurious 5-star hotel with great location in the center of the city
Review_Text: A very large and beautiful hotel with great location near the bazaar of Marrakech.    Stayed for one night and had breakfast the following morning.  Lobby was enormous with very high ceiling.  Staff was very friendly and professional.    Room was luxurious and spacious (also a big balcony with sofa).  Had a brief visit at the bar on the patio as well and didn't have to be disappointed.  Beers were served with great variety of snacks and the service was outstanding.    Breakfast choice was unbelievable and there were foods available that I haven't seen in any other hotels. Coffee was served with special pots brought to each table and omlets were done by request with a large variety of choice.    There was also a great restaurant nearby with local entertainment available.

Awful service throughout our week stay here. At the reception desk although they see you waiting to be seen to they ignore you. All staff speak french and if you can't speak it they mock you and aren't interested in helping you. For a 5* hotel wasn't expecting such disgusting service. We even got asked our room numbers a couple of times by a staff member who has seen us day in day out around the pool area acting like we had walked in from the street! The food at the poolside restaurant is awful. The other restaurant in the hotel never seemed to be open. We had similar treatment at nearby food places because we didn't speak french. I would advise all to Stay Away!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Allan S wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Title: Beautiful hotel with nice facilities but no shower doors
Review_Text: Lovely place with wonderful buffets nice breakfast attentive service but rooms with open showers. No Door. The rooms are modern and lovely in lush garden setting. Nice spa and restaurants as well. Our group liked staying here and concierge Services made stay even better
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Fantastic trip  Hotel fab! Breakfast beatiful! Service impeccable  Highly recommend.  So close to casino for the epicurien bar with music and outside for shisha  Went to comptoir darna for dinner and show... amazing! 4 min walk away

Review_Date: Andy D wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: As usual Sofitel deliver on high standards in terms of accommodation. There are many positives including the pool area which I could not fault it's a pleasure to be there.  The downside post Brexit is the exchange rate making the prices extortionate. To be honest it would have been expensive with a decent exchange rate for example 4 Gin and Tonics came to ¬£35.  The service at breakfast is also poor for a hotel of its class. It's generally slow especially at busy times and the staff were occasionally forgetful.  Overall I'd recommend the Sofitel its in a good location and although not the best Sofitel I've stayed in it was pretty good.

Review_Date: Dhruv P wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: What can I say. What a fantastic hotel. Well done to Accor hotels. Unfortunately I cannot rate my experience at this hotel as 5* as the service and attitude of 80% of the staff was absolutely disgraceful.    I've worked with 5* hotels top restaurants and bars around the MENA region and to date have never experienced such horrendous service by the staff. It seemed as though many of the staff either were not happy to work there or had an issue with our group. If you want good reliable hard working staff please do speak to me; I know hundreds of hospitality staff that would be willing to provide 5* services to their guests.    A couple of examples to set the tone would be making us wait at a table for 20-25mins just to take an order even though we had asked 2 people on 3 times we were ready to order even though there were more staff than customers at the poolside cafe/restaurant. Upon asking to speak to the manager of the outlet I was abruptly asked "why?" by a waiter!! I didn't realise I had to justify myself.    Food that we had ordered on a number of occasions was stone cold at the same poolside restaurant and also one evening when we ordered from room service.    Language here is definitely a barrier if you do not speak French as they really do act ignorant towards foreigners. It wasn't until we spoke a bit of French that the message was understood but even then the standards of service were far too relaxed and extremely moody.    Also the concierge in a hotel is supposed to be a responsible and respected position. Unfortunately the ones at Sofitel Marrakech have no idea as to what the guests are looking for and we were directed to some very quiet and romantic places even though we were 6 males. They have no idea of decent bars and restaurants in the area and we had to do most of the research ourselves.    All in all the GM Ahmed Benkirane really needs to up the game of his staff. This is why I will not be staying here again when I come for a longer 5 night stay in November.    When a complaint was made at the reception regarding the service standards and how the group was treated we were only offered a 30% discount on anything charged to one of the rooms. Between 6 people ¬£200 just doesn't really cut it especially when you've each spent close to ¬£850 for just flights and accommodation.    Service really has let down this hotel and being an international brand Accor need to take this seriously because you don't know who will walk in to your hotel and what type of service they are used to. Training needs to be given to all staff and a knowledgeable concierge team. I am also a strong believer that many of the staff at this hotel Base their level of service by judging looks of the guests. Something I'd expect at a 2 star hotel or bed and breakfast.

Review_Date: Sajid P wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: 3 nights stay at Sofitel  Hotels room looked amazing it was my birthday and they arranged for flowers and birthday cake which was very nice touch.  Must say this hotel is above the rest in terms of looks. The only downside is the earliest you can check in 15:30 which meant I had to sit around in lobby for some time. The food and drinks are expensive however I expected that with the rates and reputation of the hotel. The concierge are really good and very helpful.  Service could be better pool side as at time.  Overall stay was really good.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: parsa s wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: There was an errors like all the hotel in the world definitely but MRS. IMANE was really nice woman in front desk  helpful and always smiling ‚ò∫Ô∏è  Try all the restaurants specially the night club üëçüèª  Best location and close to jad mahal restaurant which is very interesting for tourists üëåüèª

Review_Date: Gary S wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Title: Don't stay there if hotel is busy
Review_Text: Been here for a conference and hotel simply has no infastructure to support high occupancy.  Waited 3 days for laundry  Housekeeping officially the dirtiest room I have ever stayed in.  Service is simply non existent.  Staff seem to just refuse to serve you if you English.  I am shocked that a hotel of this standard price and infrastructure can have such poor service.  It is a overpriced and simply can't move the guest experience.  The room have no glazing on the window so don't expect to sleep.

As usual Sofitel do not disappoint. This is a great hotel just 15 minutes from the airport but very quiet. The rooms are spacious and look out over the swimming pools of which there are several. Breakfast buffet is generous and there are several poolside bars. There are also plenty of excellent restaurants nearby. A great place to stay.

Review_Title: Nice but with too many wannabees
Review_Text: Booked a room at the Lounge part and they tried to move me to the old Imperial side by saying it is an upgrade.... NO WAY.... The old part is terrible. So after finally moving into the right room the one I booked it was fine and the room is great with beautiful furniture and nice balcony.    Overall a nice hotel with friendly staff and a good spa. BUT there are a lot of wannabees there either paying with dad's money or criminal money or other ways. It is sad because it makes it for me partly uncomfortable and I will probably not stay here again.

Review_Title: Amazing Vibe with Hit or Miss Rooms
Review_Text: Located in the Hivernage section the Sofitel Marrakech Lounge Hotel has an amazing vibe however make sure you don't get stuck on the much older and drab Palais side. They may try to stick you there even if you have your booking on the Lounge side! The rooms are not that great but the main restaurant (particularly for breakfast) and Lounge and pool areas are exceptionally amazing. The hotel is about a 15-minute historical walk to the city center    Positives  + the Sofitel lounge side had amazing exterior decor (outside of the rooms) and a very nice centralized area  + breakfast was huge with both Western French and Moroccan specialties  + great pool scene and pool parties however they start later in the afternoon around 4pm (kid friendly too)  + generally the staff and service personnel were helpful (with the exception of one pool server who was trying to pick fights with hotel guests)  + Sofitel concierge was quite helpful and we preferred the hotel to trying our luck with local operators  + comfortable beds with good sleeping material    Negatives  - despite making a booking for a lounge and specific room type the late night check-in staff tried on multiple occasions to put us in the wrong room location (palace side)  - late night check in staff seemed to create more problems than resolutions. For example we had booked a particular room but he kept selecting something else so I had to physically point out what we had booked on his screen  - people were smoking in rooms and even though we were not it was seeping into ours and smelling massively bad (and disgusting)  - interior decor was falling apart and needs to be refurbished  - room wasn't very clean and of the Sofitel standards  - there was a nasty stench that came into the room  - flies were everywhere in restaurant  - when we left the hotel various people would engineer situations where they pretended to be casually walking in a similar direction

Review_Date: The Popats wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Title: Trying to be a five star hotel
Review_Text: We booked this hotel for our one year wedding anniversary. Upon arrival the staff were very helpful and gave us what they called an 'upgrade' to our room as it was our anniversary. However the room was on the 'old' side of the hotel which was a fair walk away from the pool and amenities and had a balcony which you would struggle get 2 people on! so we requested to change which they dealt with ok but only the could manage it on the 2nd night.  The complete let down of this hotel is the service. It's by fair the worst we've experienced. Staff appear as if they don't want to be there by pushing each other to serve your table.    We had dinner at the SO lounge on the first night and there were only 3 tables eating that night but it still took absolutely ages to get served. Drinks kept being forgotten and all you could see were staff standing around not knowing what to do.    Each night it would take us almost 30min to get a drink at the bar (when there were only a handful of guests in there) and just as long to get the bill and be able to leave.    They couldn't even manage to get us currency exchange when we needed it because 'they didn't have the key to the drawer'    Our new room was on the refurbished side which they are still working on so is extremely nosey with the workmen.    The cleanliness of the hotel should be questioned. On several occasions we saw room service trays left in the corridor by the lifts and the staff wouldn't clear it for days making the leftover food go mouldy (see pictures).    As our flight back was in the evening they offered us a room to shower and change in later so we could use the pool etc for the day. We were reassured 3 times we would have access to a room. But when it came to it they couldn't find one for us and said we had to use the SPA facilities which would've been ok if they staff there weren't so rude either and if they showers there didn't have cockroaches!    It's not the service you expect from a 5 star worldwide chain.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was our first family trip to Marrakech and one that we hope to repeat!  We stayed at the Sofitel a beautiful hotel lit up in a beautiful pink shade at night.  The staff were really welcoming especially the door greeters who greeted us with good cheer every time we went past them!  The rooms were kept in neat condition by the room service. My husband and son fell sick during the visit and a doctor was called out on both occasions which we were grateful for!  The breakfast was a wonderful spread to cater for all pallets but what we won't forget is the wonderful service by the staff serving there! Fatima waited on our tables dutifully with a smile and had an impressive memory for what our requests were day to day and had them ready on our table without being asked. She was extremely friendly and attentive. Breakfast with a smile was dutifully served by Rida who made our eggs nicely to order a very happy Fatima who works hard at the Moroccan breakfast corner and Galitte who served our kids crepes made to order each day!  The kitchen staff worked tirelessly to make sure that we had a pleasant experience each day and I have to mention the two gentlemen who worked hard to provide smoothies of our choice each day no matter how busy it was I only regret not taking their names too!  All in all it was a wonderful welcoming experience staying there.  The rooms in the Imperial are somewhat a bit dated in areas but do have that essence of style that make up for it!  Would definitely stay there again!  Oooh and love the So Lounge the music is on point!üôåüèΩ    I would give the hotel 4 and a half stars but not sure how to note the extra half at the top of this page!

Review_Title: amazing resort hotel better than expected
Review_Text: This is a 5 star hotel with a 7 star service from the moment the taxi pulled up at reception the staff were great especially Ibtisam who looked after all our needs from start to finish she was the best she always had time for us.breakfast was on time and all the staff was great but Rachida made it special she would remember the things my wife would like and soon as we walk in she would take us to the table we like to sit on and bring all the stuff for us.last but not least the pool area is amazing all the staff are great but once again one individual made it special that was Moktar who treated me like his family and even organised a surprise celebration as it was my 25th wedding anniversary what a amazing guy thanks so much from Nazir & Memuna
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Nice resort hotel, very well-located, with some downsides
Review_Text: This is a wonderful resort hotel. The lobby and pool area are beautiful the rooms are nice and beds are comfortable. Breakfast was excellent as was lunch at the pool restaurant. The neighborhood around the hotel has a lot of nice restaurants and nightlife and it's a short walk to the medina and other historical sites in Marrakesh.    The only downsides were that the hotel is under renovation so there is some noise and some of the common areas are not as nice as they could be. It also took us over an hour to check in as some of our rooms were not ready even though it was past the 3 pm check-in time.

Review_Date: Ilias E wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: Very pleasant stay at The Sofitel Marrakech  The place to be  And to be very Well traited  the professional staf at The front Desk  The Well knoning of The conci√´rge Adil And The greatest receptionist Abderrahim And Saad  very kind And very helpful "The opened I hairdresser For me at midnight" like waaw!!!  Sofitelmarrakech have The best staf in The world! And I'm sure once you Will try This experience you Will schare The same opinion. üëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèº

Attractive hotel from the outside that features a wonderful pool area spa gym and attentive staff in the lobby who don't hesitate with assisting you with your bags etc. However - we arrived at the hotel around 11pm after travelling all day we were greeted by a pleasant lady who informed us she couldn't find our booking on their systems immediately this slightly concerned us as the thought of not having a hotel for the night in the centre of Marrakech wasn't what we had anticipated. After about 20 minutes and a few grunts and sighs later she informed us that she had found it and asked for the relevant documents passports etc. Then to our surprise she asked that we hand over 7000MAD incase we use any of the facilities within the hotel and then the cost would be deducted from the total - I handed over my card and she assured me the cost wouldn't be taken until departure if we had used any extras that the hotel had to offer which made complete sense. However she then went ahead and created a payment of 7000MAD which came off my debit card instead of having it as a deposit she reassured me she would refund it at the end of our stay if appropriate. After about another 20 minutes this was resolved and we were then told about the tax per person per night that we had to pay upfront. All I would say is make sure you read the small print for this hotel as they charge for absolutely everything and anything. Finally we were taken to our room (about a 10-15 minute walk from the lobby/pool area a slight inconvenience) it was pleasant well presented and tidy however slightly dated and definitely didn't reflect any of the rooms advertised on their website. The room was clearly a part of the old not yet refurbished area of the hotel. Sunrise came and a couple of hours later we made our way down for breakfast a pleasant varied selection of pastries fruit cooked breakfast options and pancakes which we were certainly pleased with. After breakfast we returned to our room and sat on the balcony to admire the views of the Atlas Mountains and suddenly we noticed a man appear from the bushes below who then began to pleasure himself in front of us whilst making direct eye contact. Surprised and slightly concerned we headed back into our room and drew the curtains. We then headed to the pool area a large attractive area with big beds and bright red towels and cushions. Again everything is extremely overpriced you will be paying ¬£5 for a can and for alcoholic beverages you're looking at ¬£10-¬£20 a drink. All in all ok hotel not up to Sofitel standards. If you're planning on staying here advise a member of staff on arrival that you would prefer a newly refurbished room (to avoid the slightly dated side of the hotel and getting wanked at from below your balcony)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Diva W wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: Absolutely stunning hotel! The entrance of this hotel is beautiful with welcoming staff it felt like you were stepping into a dream. The pools and restaurants were perfect and only a stone throw away from the hustle and bustle of the city. In particular the staff Souad Hicham and Karim made the stay feel perfect. They were so welcoming and inviting and went beyond and above to make us feel special. I would come back very soon!!!

Review_Date: SIMO H wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: The entrance of this hotel is impressive. It's also perfectly located in the heart of Marrakech.  However the first room I was given was small old and noisy. It looked like a cheap 3 stars hotel room. After I complained I was given a room in the supposedly renovated part of the hotel. The room was newer but far from the standards of a 5 stars hotel.  To summarise it's not worth the price they are charging. Stay there if you get a good deal and you want a perfect location. If you want to experience a true 5 stars hotel there are plenty of other options....
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Yvonne B wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: I cannot recommend the Sofitel Marrakech highly enough. By the time we landed and arrived at the hotel we had water or drinks on arrival and upgrades we did not expect. A fabulous place with lovely staff in the various bars restaurants and heated pool onsite and excellent entertainment at night (Various lounges and brilliant live musicians). We did visit the main Medina and it was nice to see but not comfortable for us . You are best picking a Riad restaurant in a back street outside the walls for fantastic food and service. Amazing place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Amar Zaidi wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: As a frequent traveller I spend 150+ nights in hotel during a recent business trip to Morocco got a chance to visit Marrakech and I decided to stay at Sofitel Marrakech. From the moment I arrived to the second I left it was an amazing experience. Concierge Check In Staff Bell Boys every one was nice and courteous and went out of the way to help. Little things make big difference and this place certainly knows that.

Review_Title: Great all round stay - definitely recommend it.
Review_Text: Perfect welcome to the hotel... cool towels mint tea and a general chat with the lovely Reda. Reda (the concierge) could not have done more to make our stay as great as it was. His advice on where to go what to see how much we should pay etc. was perfect for our needs. He looked after us everyday including arranging a private driver for the day. We would suggest anyone staying at the hotel to pop down for a chat with Reda!    We had a beautiful room (free upgrade) with amazing views across the olive groves. Breakfasts were delicious and varied although the staff were inconsistent in attentiveness.    The pool area was fantastic although allowing guests to blast their own music from portable speakers was not relaxing and detracted from the otherwise lovely morrocan music piped through the trees.    The 'so lounge' food and service was 'just ok' as was the pool food but the Lawrence bar was much better.    Marrakesh in general was a super place - the people were so welcoming and friendly. We felt safe and well looked after everywhere we went. We will certainly be back one day!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Zara K wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Title: Nice hotel just not amazing for toddler's
Review_Text: The hotel is close to the airport 30 min drive.  On arrival we had nice cuppa tea and check in was simple. We was then taken to our room.  Room 87 nice size for two adults and one toddler ground floor nice decor. The bed is a bit too soft but hay each to their own.  To get to pool there is a back way from the back door of our room however you then leave your room open. So the longer way was back past reception. Pool was nice and big bit chilli but fine once u got in. We didn't know until our last day that there was a baby pool which was heated. Staff could have been more helpful in showing us around. Breakfast was simple but nice and fresh. However the restaurants didn't open until 7.30pm and having a toddler who needed dinner around 5.30/6pm was an issue as we then had to have room service all 4 days racking up a bill of ¬£240.    Another down was using the hotel concierge services there was no booklet to have a look so prices where not fixed. We booked a tour to the mountain which was 1400mad around ¬£140. The drive was 1hr and a half. We was told food and water was including which wasn't the driver got water on the way but made out it was on him. And food we got dropped at restaurant then had to pay the bill being on holiday fine you pay but it's the principle of what we were sold. The tour guide / driver dropped use to another guide who took us up the mountain he was really good BUT the walk / climb was not for children or anyone who can't do a big mountain hike. The guide was good and we didn't make it to the main point as it was way busy and a Sunday even he said it would be hard for him. So all in all I didn't think it was perfect trip my cousin had a driver for 100 pound and seem to have had a much different trip. We also stopped at some point of interest. All in all we spent another 100 pound on the day.    We got a taxi to the market one day which is 25mad only 15min drive so good. On the way back we got a horse which we haggled down to 75mad  The staff at the hotel are all really nice I would just say around the pool it's hard to call someone from the bar to get drinks.    I think all in all good hotel but restaurant opening and concierge advice service was a big let down. The hotel did have buggies and high chairs and car seats to hand at the door which was nice however no one knows how to fit the car seat.

Review_Date: Ahmed E wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: Best location in Marrakech once you are there you are close to everything that matters the hotel is a bit old and prices are on the high side especially those of the spa Staff is extremely helpful; my daughter got a food intoxication (not from Hotel) but the hotel was very fast to get a good Doctor who did the necessary for her and gave her the right medication...

This hotel is such a nice place to stay. If your there on holiday and you can relax by the pool and enjoy the sun. It's right in the centre so everything is close by.    In the reception Saad is the guy to ask any questions you have. He is a top bloke!!!    Thank you for a enjoyable stay.

I was expecting a good standard of hotel from sofitel and got exactly that. I have have read some not so good reviews but whilst i'm sure the reviews are honest I can only say that I had a good 2 nights here. I must say that the other people I know staying here at the same time (more than 5) all shared the same view. I booked a suite and it was enormous with everything you need and plenty that you don't but is still nice to have. The two main pools are fantastic. You have a choice of temperatures depending on how you like it and a large spa pool as well. There is a very nice but pricey poolside restaurant and several bars. If I had one suggestion it would be to get the waiters to ask people by the pool if they want drinks. You'll sell a shedload of them in 40 degree heat. Generally service was good and the only downside if there was one is that the Medina is still a mile away. Cheap taxi ride but not to walk in that heat. Close to the airport though so that was a bonus. Very nice restaurant around the corner with entertainment (Jad Mahal) I would stay here again if I'm in Marrakech.

Review_Date: Sarah B wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Title: Stunning but shame very poor service
Review_Text: We decided to have a pool day as we were staying in a Riad in the centre. It cost 400 Dirhams per person around ¬£32 each which I was happy to pay. The pool area was beautiful loads of sunbeds & daybeds two big pools one heated. On arrival we paid and then were shown the pools and our towels placed out which was great.    We really enjoyed our day but the service element was so poor. I had read this on the reviews and decided that maybe this is due to the Ramadan season and the staff may be slightly under pressure but I don't believe this to be so now.    To start with I was questioned quite rudely had I paid when I offered to show the receipt the guy in a brown suit he said it's okay I trust you! Clearly you hadn't? No one came to ask for drinks there was just no one around trying to get some bottles of water was difficult. Later that day a lady came and had a basket to put used towels in she tipped the ashtray into the basket ( I don't know why?) and it started smoking I noticed and say to her it was on fire and we gave her our bottled water to put it out! She left and the man in the suit came by I explained to him what happened and said he could replace my water if he liked but no one came! I paid ¬£2 for that small bottle of water!    This is just so sad as this hotel looks really beautiful inside and out. All other Sofitel hotels are normally brilliant. We also went to Le Jardins de Koutoubia which was 200 dirhams the hotel is older and smaller but beautiful and has 2 pools one on the roof and the service was exceptional they even came round with fresh cut fruit for guests which is what you would expect from the Sofitel great big sunbeds too!    I am and Accor member and shame on you Sofitel you really need to up your game especially after all previous reviews too!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Clement A wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: Spent a week at this hotel with some family and friends for an extended birthday celebration and had a wonderful time. The hotel has amazing facilities and all the rooms I saw were excellent. Breakfast was extensive and the staff at breakfast were super friendly and helpful. Special mention to Fatima Souad and Oumaima who made us feel at home. Thank you!  Also visited So Lounge for drinks a few times and found it amazing. Service in Marrakesh is generally slow compared to Europe so do bear this in mind when you go out to eat or make orders.

Review_Title: LOVED IT! Great lounge and vibe....
Review_Text: Went to smoke the hookah there and have a few drinks... Cool vibe. VERY friendly staff made you feel welcomed. Strong drinks and reasonably priced. Went two nights we enjoyed it so much... I would recommend going after dinner.

Review_Date: Samir P wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Title: terrible service - mis sold - price increased on arrival
Review_Text: when we entered the hotel we where offered welcome drinks. which we where charged for!    we booked a luxury suite. we where offered a from for 4 which was very different to the photos online and was in a part of the hotel that had building work going on - so we had scaffolding as view.    we asked to cancel the booking as we found a nearby suitable villa. however we where told that we would only get the cash payment back. where 3 of 4 of us paid by card!    so we settles for 2 junior suits. which where basically 2 beds put into a room. we had to top up the already extortionate payment further.    moreover the booking system failef to mention the "local tac" which was about 10% of the total.    the in house night club "So"  is quite good - however very pricey drinks    swimming pool is ok  but th pool staff wheer4 terrible.

Review_Date: Alexia T wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: We stayed at the Sofitel Lounge & Spa for two nights while in Marrakech. One thing to note is that the Lounge & Spa is the same hotel as the Palais Imperial (just different towers). While the grounds were very nice the service was absolutely TERRIBLE. My husband and I had a horrible experience at the pool the second afternoon. We arrived around 2pm and after laying on our chairs for 45 minutes finally tracked down a waiter to get a food & drink menu. He came back 20 minutes later to take our order and we asked for a bottle of wine and scoop of ice cream. Another 45 minutes later he was nowhere to be found and we had not received our very simple order. I tracked down the pool manager and explained the situation and my frustration. He had another waiting come take care of us and he brought us an upgraded bottle of wine and some additional snacks which I assumed were on the hotel. As we were getting ready to leave we are hit with a bill charging us for a more expensive bottle of wine than we had originally ordered. At this point I was too annoyed to track down the manager again so just paid the bill and got out of there. The whole time we were there the service was awful but this specific instance was the worst. Long story short I would not suggest staying at the Sofitel. There are many other nice hotels around the area that I'm sure have much better service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I just came here for some food and shisha but had to share mt experience. My initial impression of the hotel was great! Upon arrival the staff were very helpful and pointed me in the right direction. Once we got to the pool lounge my opinion of the staff changed completely. Disinterested and bored they took our order forgetting it twice! Once the food came it was super bland and definitely not worth the money. Shisha was nothing special either and no one tended to it. We were super hungry so we are it anyway which in hindsight I probably shouldn't have done! Upon returning to our hotel I started feeling a little unwell only to experience full-blown violent sickness for a solid 15 hours after! Completely ruined my last night in Marrakech. I'm still not exactly sure whether it was the cheese or salmon that made me feel this way. In any case will not be returning there and will definitely not recommend bar food there!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kirtana K wrote a review May 2017
Review_Title: Beautiful hotel but less than stellar service from staff
Review_Text: The hotel was very beautiful and the grounds were well-kept including the pool. However the service from the front desk and housekeeping staff was less than stellar. First we were assigned a room that was right next to an empty wing which at first seemed nice since we were so exhausted from our flight and train ride from Casablanca. However that feeling was short-lived because the next morning we heard power drill noises starting at 8 AM in the room next to ours. It was a bit frustrating since we were hoping to sleep in a little bit after our long day of travel. When we asked the front desk staff about switching rooms we were told that we could only upgrade to a more expensive room rather than a similar room to ours. They were very inflexible with our request and for the rest of our stay we were woken up to loud noises at 8 AM. Second our hotel room was situated right next to one of the indoor/outdoor restaurants which played loud music until 1 AM in the morning every night. We asked the front desk staff whether they could ask the restaurant staff to turn down the music and they responded that they would take care of our request. However after multiple phone calls the restaurant never lowered down the volume of the music which meant that the front desk staff never actually "took care" of our request. This was VERY disappointing since we couldn't get a full night's rest during our entire stay due to the loud music until 1 AM and loud construction noises starting at 8 AM. Third the housekeeping staff never bothered to refill our complimentary tea/coffee selections in the room despite repeated requests. Finally during check-out the front desk charged us for additional mini-bar items that we did not use during our stay. The front desk staff had a hard time believing us and made a huge deal about removing the additional charges despite our repeated statements that we were being honest about not using the additional mini-bar items. I would not recommend staying at this Sofitel in Marrakech since the front desk and housekeeping staff do not make any attempt to resolve issues raised by their guests or care about improving the quality of guests' stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ed I wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: My wife and I arrived at this hotel with high hopes. We had saved for ages having promised ourselves a premium five star break following a difficult couple of years in our personal circumstances. We booked a five star establishment believing that they would uphold the traditions of quality and service that one expects from a premier hotel however in so many ways we were both deeply disappointed and shocked at how inconsequential our needs were to the management and staff at The Sofitel Hotel in Marrakesh.    Arrival was ok indeed we were sat down for a short while our credit card details were taken and our keys given to us. We were then escorted to our rooms with our bags. We had booked a suite and this was available. Before we were able (or allowed) to go to the room a very effusive concierge started to tell us about excursions however it was most unwelcome as we had been travelling all day but he would not relent until he was finished.    On arrival into the room we immediately noticed how dimly lit it was in fact it was actually quite difficult to see anything in the main bedroom but the loo and bathroom were satisfactory despite many of the light bulbs being blown.    That evening we went to the first of several restaurants and had a pleasant enough meal although this cost over 100 GBP and we only had soft drinks! So to bed and to be fair we had a good nights sleep until people above started moving furniture at 5.00 am which was a rude awakening. It should be noted that the hotel has poor sound proofing and you can hear the televisions and conversations in adjacent rooms. Take ear plugs! We went down to breakfast quite late and were shown to a filthy table. It looked as if they had hosted a kids party. Because we had the temerity to arrive shortly before they closed we were told in no uncertain terms to be quick not much fun when breakfast for two as an eye watering ¬£40 +. I felt humiliated and insulted.    We elected to book a trip with the concierge but the price was now quoted in euros and he would accept only a cash payment as he was clearly on some kind of commission but what really got me was that the price had suddenly gone up by about ¬£20 too. I paid without too much fuss believing that we all have to make a living but feeling slightly that the Sofitel had sanctioned a little stealing alongside their usual business.    That day we took lunch in the main restaurant which was about ¬£50 per head plus drinks. The food whilst ok did no warrant the price although the oysters were a nice touch. In this restaurant the service was reasonable and almost up to a five star standard but not quite.    Next day we took our trip but finding our host was quite difficult as the concierge who was so eager to take our cash was no where to be seen. We contracted very serious food poisoning on this trip so I would advise against eating lunch in the mountains particularly at the venue chosen by the driver. On the positive side our 200 euros bought us a well informed driver a decent car and some interesting if 'contrived for tourists' excursions. Sadly he food poisoning laid us up for 3 days afterwards.    Whilst we had food poisoning we used room service. Of course this is always expensive but the Sofitel really know how to to provide the least possible quality and service for the most amount of money. A burger and chips at over ¬£20 and a waiting time of over an hour and a half. On top of the cost they charge an extra ¬£12 tray charge making a burger over ¬£30.    The next day I begged for some attention from house keeping but it was only after 36 hours and a threat to vacate the room that anyone arrived. We had rotting flowers no water stinking towels no toilet paper an empty mini bar and no replacement coffee tea or milk. Frankly the house keeping service was laughable I would expect better attention in Wormwood Scrubs prison.    I am writing this just before we leave. Today finally someone turned up to clean the room. The rotting flowers have been removed and we have clean towels.    I should comment on reception too really. We were unable to use our phone so I had to make my way down to the lobby to report the fault which was a good five minute walk. The male receptionist was disinterested and ignorant. Firstly he just ignored me when I arrived preferring to complete counting money and doing paper work. When I informed him of the fault it took a little while for him to even recognise what I was going on about the conversation went like this-    Me- 'Hello I need to report a fault on my telephone I cannot contact room service.  Receptionist- 'you dial 24'  Me- ' Yes I have tried that but it doesn't connect  Receptionist- 'Its dial 24'  Me- I am sorry you don‚Äôt understand I can't get any kind of line  Receptionist- 'You try 9?'
