Me- (now a little peeved) Yes I try everything- nothing works also there are no instructions either.  Receptionist- 'This in your room?'  me- (Lost patience now)- 'No in next doors room'  Receptionist- No words just blank look  Me- 'Please I am not an idiot- of course it's in my room and yes its actually not working  receptionist - (now deeply offended) 'I not call you idiot sir'  me- 'No but you are treating me like one now kindly send someone up....' turns on heals exit stage left in dramatic huff‚Ä¶..    This episode was pretty indicative of the typical two star service at what purports to be a five star hotel.    The week got little better. We felt generally ignored poorly serviced and highly ripped off.    This hotel has a serous management problem. Clearly morale is low amongst staff and there is no consistent or quality training at all.    We would never book this or any other Sofitel or Accor hotel again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I would not recommend this hotel. For one on check in they gave me a room that had someone already in their after their mistake they said they would upgrade me to a suite only to find out when I got back home that they had charged me $600.00 on my credit card for no reason which the credit card company is now investigating also the hotel is for French speaking people even though government language is Arabic everything is in french even your hotel receipt which leaves you at the mercy of the hotel staff to translate for you no where are you safe from people smoking except in your none smoking room while checking in or out the hotel lobby is full of people smoking which should be for everyone and not for people who smoke but for everyone. THIS IS WHY I CAN NOT RECOMMENDED THIS HOTEL FOR ITS DISHONESTY AND LACK OF RESPECT FOR ALL GUESTS.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Lovely location; great pool/garden area. Amazing lunch and breakfast buffets. Rooms can be very far from reception/lobby/restaurants. Pay close attention to your bill when checking out. I had mysterious mini-bar charges on mine. Once contested they were removed. Don't try to check out in a hurry.

Review_Title: High End Hotel Right in the Middle of Marrakech
Review_Text: This hotel true to the Sofitel brand was an outstanding stay and very relaxing. The hotel is a bit big so if you have trouble walking ask to get a room closer to the reception area. Check in was fast and they prepared tea for me while I waited.    Rooms are clean and spacious with nice Moroccan decor. Food was delicious too!    Id recommend staying here as its very central to everything and easy to get around. Only issue is the night club attached to the hotel as it can get quite busy at night but the noise shouldn't bother you.

It was absolutely fantastic to spent my last day in Marrakech there and be treated like a princess.  I stopped there without an appointment .  Everybody was taking great care and interest to make me comfortable.  Really 5‚ú®  Bahja did the best massage I ever had.  Great team most kind and friendly

Review_Title: Terrible staff: beware of a woman named Aziza:(
Review_Text: We wanted to relax and we were prepared for the high price but we read good things. We asked to get a day pass for the pool and this woman named Aziza helped us. She never smiled once only when we asked if drinks were included in the price. She actually laughed in our face. She made up a price for us when we said we wanted to include lunch. Without lunch but was 500 and with lunch 700 per person. I guess she decides and if she likes you the price goes down. She never explained where to go where and what time lunch would be served etc etc. The pools were ok lunch buffet amazing but nevertheless that didn't make up for the rudeness of this woman. Suggestion for Sofitel: replace her as soon as you get the opportunity. Still pisses me off.

Review_Date: T P wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: Highly recommend. The service is impeccable. The food was wonderful. The rooms very comfortable the bed mattress was great. Breakfast was included in our rate. The breakfast buffets was amazing. We had a great lunch as well.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Sofitel Marrakech lounge and spa is one of the best hotels I've stayed in anywhere in the world. It has the perfect mixture of great facilities large suites various relaxation options around the pools and caring staff who really make you feel welcome.

Review_Title: Great place for a relaxing Easter brak
Review_Text: The hotel is a very good and pleasant retreat from all the 'hustle and bustle' in and around Marrakech. Good facilities and easy to get into town and as a base for day-trips around Marrakech. Qality of rooms vary and requested to change room from the one given to us upon arrival; smoking room no view (as promised when booking) and pretty run down compared to ehat was expected form prevous stays at Sofitel / price of the hotel. The staff handled this very well and we were given a new room the folloing day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Nice hotel that needs an upgrade
Review_Text: Nice hotel in a good location in Marrakech with large nice pool area. But the water was so cold I could hardly swim. The hottelet has a very nice public area but the rooms need an upgrade The rooms are nice but worn out and you can hear what the neighbor is talking about and doing in bed....  I noticed that they have started to upgrade a part of the hotel there was some noise but noting that was disturbing. Maybe next time I visit Marrakech its finished.  I could see that the room we had vas not an non smoking room but there was no smell of smoke there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Resh T wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Title: Nice hotel but wouldn't rate it a 5*
Review_Text: Nice hotel in ref to the location - not far from the main market.  Rooms are old dusty.  Breakfast is good.  Restaurant within the hotel is expensive limited food options. The hallways are old. Hotel needs updating!  Would stay here again if i wanted a budget trip - but if you want a 5* this isn't your hotel!

I selected this hotel as it was reasonably close to the  Medina but still accessible and had lots of outdoor space. The communal areas were beautiful as you would expect from  Sofitel. The rooms were a little tired but perfectly good. The outdoor areas were lovely with lots of shaded lounge areas to get out of the searing heat. The price of drinks and food are quite high but again this is a high end hotel group so to be expected and there are plenty of other options for food and drink nearby just a short cab ride away. I would definitely stay here again if I came back to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Deborah M wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: The hotel reception feels luxurious on entering we were made to feel welcome checking in being offered mint tea and chairs to complete our paperwork our room wasn't ready for a couple of hours so we left our bags and decided to have a walk into marrakech center if you like to be constantly mithered to buy poor quality copies of stuff or have a picture with animals dressed in clothes and made to have henna tattoos then you will enjoy it but we only visited the once.  Our room was nice but strange choice of furniture didn't feel 5 star balcony area was nice with a good view. The breakfast was good and plenty of choice hot things not so good. The pool area was very stylish in the evening we found the so lounge which I found to be fantastic with a live band a dj and 2 bars there were also other lounges and one outside with great lighting and views were u could eat and drink. The downside was the cost of the drinks cheapest being small bottle of lager approx ¬£9. There are a few bar restaurants in walking distance and the hivernage area feels relatively safe.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Haphazard - aims to please, but disorganized
Review_Text: We're Platinum members and arrived to be given the worst Jr Suite in the hotel (in a construction site no view ground floor phone not working....). When asked about upgrade or why they'd treat Platinum members worse than others the next day they changed us to another suite which was excellent with great views etc. Mgmt should plan for their Platinum members and not just assign the "only room left". We used the valet for the car and one day drove off and parked the car near Jmaa El Fna turned it off only to realize the valet forgot to put the key in our keyless car. We had to wait until the hotel sent someone with our key to lock up the car and continue our tourism! Again disorganization even though they do everything with a smile and aim to please.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: On April 12th we spent the whole day at Sofitel Marrakech to enjoying sun swimming pool and lunch at the pool.    From the Medina it takes less than 5 minutes to reach the hotel.    The price is around 30 ‚Ç¨/person just to access the swimming pool anytime you want.    All around the 2 swimming pools you can find very large and very comfortable sofa. The hotel provides towels included in the entrance fee.    It is quite busy so do not expect to get a quiet area. Nevertheless sofa together with sun and high temperature invites you to sleep. Deeply...    One swimming pool is heated: it is where you will find all the kids (around 20). The other one colder is quiet.    When it is time for lunch in addition to your 30 ‚Ç¨ entrance fee you just move from your sofa to the terrace where you can enjoy pizzas hamburger salads club sandwiches... You need to consider a minimum budget of 30/40 ‚Ç¨ per person. The food is really nice.    Based on our expenses our swimming pool break at Sofitel Marrakech cost around 60 ‚Ç¨/person. It was really relaxing even if is noisy crowded.    The service is not what we could expect from a Sofitel: team has a cold attitude and seems to provide the service respectfully but like a machine (opening door good afternoon providing towels answering question.

Review_Date: David L wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: I have been here twice now and each time I was overwhelmed by the luxury and the quality of service. My first impression as I walked into the reception hall was the wonderful fragrance that wafts on the air from their fragrance diffusers.    The quality of the rooms was exceptional on both occasions I stayed here and the room service is truly superb.    The breakfast buffet is incredible with a massive range of international food in both hot and cold options. I never ate lunch or dinner at the hotal as it is a little expensive but not more than any similar hotel.    The staff are all very friendly and extremely helpful. I will go back again and again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: karina r wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Title: Need to improve in order to be called 5 stars
Review_Text: The place is beautiful! Great reception hall and welcome with tea and pastries.. the rooms make sure you stay at the new ones.. the old ones do not deserve to be called 5 stars. I've stayed in an old suite .. numer 332 it was dusty the drawers didn't work properly the phone didn't work neither the iron.. I was to tired to complain and to be honest shouldn't all be perfect for you to just relax? The terrace had sunbeds dirty full of paint and one covered with a towel. The place is so pretty that you forget about the bad stuff.. but the reception staff are arrogant (except two ladys in the white reception by the shops) I've politely asked if I could change rooms whenever possible and was given a confusing and rude answer of "come back later" the same at the swimming pool asking for a towel could take up to an hour if you are lucky! Sometimes The group I came with will just decide not to order drinks/food just to avoid trying to get attention from the waiter.. if they had more waiters they would sell sooo much more..and please put towels where people can fetch them if you won't habe enough staff to provide them. They lack a good guest experience Manager or someone that is really controlling the staff. However the shops were amazing and the staff were educated polite and top notch! Also in the SPA my massage was AMAZING.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Especially WAFA!!!    She just gives the extra Miles to arrange an excellent stay!    Excellent breakfast  Excellent service  Excellent ambiance  Excellent pool  Excellent For familly  Excellent  Excellent  Excellent  Excellent  Excellent  Excellent  Excellent  Excellent  Excellent  Excellent  Excellent  Excellent    Mo

Review_Title: Beautiful hotel, friendly staff, service needs looking at
Review_Text: Arrival/welcome    Arrived to a beautiful lobby pleasant staff we were greeted with some cold towels and some morrocan mint tea which was a lovely touch..staff were all friendly.. and check in was fast and efficient    Room    Whilst we stayed here we had 2 room changes. We initially booked to stay at the sofitel spa and lounge.. however due to some very loud banging we asked to change rooms which was done after a few complaints.. we were moved to the old side and given a room.. we were not happy with this and spoke to nafisa who sorted this for us and the day after we swapped rooms. Nafisa was very friendly and listened to our complaints and handled well.. as a sorry for the troubles we had lovely candles set out with a warm running bath and petals.    The rooms at the sofitel spa side were very spacious beautiful french vintage modern look.. the bathrooms are slightly dated all amenities are provided..    No iron was provided the first time we asked for it an hour later still no iron was delivered so we called again and one was delivered while we went out for dinner.    One day we had a wake up call at 7am even though we had not requested one.    Pool side    Absolutely beautiful large loungers 2 pools plus jacuzzi the service for pool side food and beverages were good. We were greeted most days by mohsin who seemed to be very busy however always friendly and at your service.. However the service for the pool attendants really needs looking at. There appeared to be 2 pool attendants who were so busy. We had to go and get the towels ourself after waiting approx 15 minutes to grab his attention. The poolside was extremely busy not a spare seat spare most days.    Location    Great location extremely friendly place really nice cafes around    Check out/ departure    We requested a late check out however our room was booked we therefore were advised that we can stay poolside and they would provide us with a courtesy room to shower and change. We requested the room 2 hours before our departure and were advised that room service were cleaning it. Approx 15 minutes later we were provided the key we walked into the room which had a really horrible smell the window was opened but the smell remained.. the shower had not been cleaned from the last user there were towels everywhere and shower gel and shampoo (used bottles) in the bathroom. Not a good end to the trip.  However the bell boy/porter who helped us with our luggage and to locate a taxi was very pleasant and friendly.    Overall    Satisfied with the trip it was our first time in Marrakech and we were here for our 2 year anniversary. Even though i have highlighted some negative points it was a lovely trip beautiful hotel perfect weather.. once they iron out a few service issues this will be true to the Sofitel brand! Not to forget the staff were always pleasant and friendly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Very nice hotel with a friendly staff.
Review_Text: Beautiful lobby and a great big pool area. All the free Moroccan tea you want at the lobby.  One of two Sofitels in the city but my favourite one. The concierge area tends to get busy at times with a bit of disorganization.

Im sure this was an amazing hotel 15 years ago. It now comes off as quite old although the pool area is large and nice;    + staff is generally nice and welcoming  + breakfast was good excellent choice  + nice pool area  + fairly large rooms    - we had not been informed of the construction works which lasted 830am - 6pm  - the place is quite old and tired  - only one restaurant option for lunch with junk food quality (pizza burgers etc)  - very understaffed at the pool (and at the same time plenty of staff just walking around in the lobby)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Confusion at the start but eventually fine
Review_Text: First of all - Sofitel advertises that they have two hotels in Marrakesh and you can book rooms at both of these hotels. However the reality is that they have merged two adjacent properties and now have ONE reception areawith rooms in different wings of what is now the main building. But this is not the confusion i refer to in my heading!! We arrived at 2.00 pm and were offered a seat and a drink. Lovely - we thought. But we did not expect the next thing which was the Concierge coming over to us and giving us a hard sell on all the things he could organise for us - all before we had even checked in. We felt 'sold to' and under pressure and were somewhat annoyed. Things didn't get any better when we eventually pushed past him and fronted up to the Reception desk -there are far too many people working at the desks and they are all getting in each other's way. We eventually caught someone's eye (really) and were given an upgrade - great! Looked at the room on the same level as the open air terrace restaurant with direct access via an open staircase from our balcony to the restaurant - not great. Refused this room and insisted on another on a higher floor where we would feel safer. To cut a long story short - it took us three hours of persistence to get checked in and get a room. This is not the sofitel service we have come to love and they also recognised that our start had not been good by leaving us a small gift and a written apology in our room later that evening. However after this rocky start things did improve. Our room was very usable good lighting and a great view. There is the old French arrangement of a separate toilet - somewhat outdated now and the bathroom could do with a total overhaul. The shower is particularly weak. We ate breakfast each morning - a great fresh selection of Moroccan and international food. And the coffee was great. One dinner in the 'international' restaurant - great steak and good service. The hotel is well located just outside the Medina. The front door staff are very good at getting cabs off the street - although they do try to push you towards the hotel limo -which will cost three times as much. This is a very busy hotel there were always loads of suitcases lining the entrance hall reception needs a serious rethink and sofitel need to sort out their website - but apart from all this it is a lovely place to stay.

Review_Date: Jude D wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: Stayed in the medina but after a couple of nights of calm you need a bit of fun and So lounge fora the bill. Beautiful decor and when you enter you get the feeling this could be a pretentious place but staff and customers did not reflect this at all. Meant to stay for 1 drink but ended up meeting visitors from many parts and had a ball. Not the cheapest place in the world (10E beer) but worth the extra few euro!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Guido L wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Title: Superb Hotel to chill and relax
Review_Text: Together with my wife we spent 4 days here and had a great time the staff was extremely friendly and helpful and the pool area is simply amazing.  WiFi was superb both in speed and easy of connection.  We did experience some drawbacks... being attended during breakfast was a challeng as the staff could not cope with the amount of guests more than once we had to leave without having received our cappuccinos. also the furniture in the rooms plays against the comfort of the guests the chairs they have make such a loud noise when being moved that the first night we were woken up @ 05:30 by our neighbors from upstairs. Quite unpleasant disturbing and easily avoided by replacing such furniture.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Love this hotel for it's location as it is located in a very nice area  easy to get taxis from the hotel. The breakfast is very good with loads of choice  lovely pools if a little cold - could do to be a bit warmer - rooms are nice and have good balconies. The only downside was my mini bar was not restocked each day and I had to call up reception to ensure I had what I needed- apart from that will definitely stay here again.

This hotel is not only one of the best but also very well situated. The rooms are nice and the staff is friendly. Breakfast is a real treat. It's not cheap but you get real luxery in return. A nice place to enjoy your time off.

Review_Date: lea t wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Title: We spent amazing days at Sofitel Marrakech
Review_Text: I've come with my husband to sofitel marrakech for our one year anniversary together and we really enjoyed the days we spent in the hotel.    I would like to thank Mr Ali Diagne for his kindness and attention.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mohamed C wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: We've passed a couple of days together at this property it's was really amazing all the staff were very kind and friendly the hotel is well decorated great vue from our room three swimming pools are located one of them is vip i want to thank some of h√¥tel's staff because of their kindness and help Abderrahimmehdi LImane K Mehdi B hanane R Nassira Sanae and Farah.

Review_Date: Ludovic L wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: 1st time in Marrakech and Morocco was only staying for 1 night but what an incredible experience. Between the excellent Sofitel service and Moroccan hospitality this was by far one of my best short stay.  I wanted to experience a little bit to see if I wanted to go back for longer stay and I can‚Äôt wait to book next flight to Marrakech.  Everyone was so welcoming friendly and professional. Nothing was too much and every request fulfilled. I had one of the best meal in the restaurant in the evening with delicious food and tasty Moroccan wine.  The pools are fantastic and one is heated which is great as it was a bit nippy being early February.  The room was great spacious with Moroccan style and I really appreciated all the lovely chocolate and dates and water ready in my room. The turn down service was also great and on my pillow was chamomile and mint tea to wish me a good night. It was all the little touches that made me smile and happy.  Thank you for a lovely short stay one I will truly remember because it was the people there who made it happen.

Review_Date: Saba H wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Text: I visited the Sofitel for the first time and it was Amazing what a beautyful hotel the staff are very friendly and kind and so helpful especially the room service the lady called Sihum was so professional and so kind friendly lady thank you Sihum xx

Review_Date: Larry M wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Title: Relaxing day for two by the pool
Review_Text: Despite staying in a riad in the old town for 300DHR each we were able to spend day by the pool and make the most of the lovely weather. We managed to find a lounger in the sun despite getting there about midday and although there were noisy building works we felt quite comfortable. The setting is rather lovely with tasteful and decadent designs and palm trees a plenty. Going in February meant the main pool was a bit too fresh for us but the side pool was nice enough. Assuming our ticket didn't allow re-entry we had to eat in the hotel for lunch which was rather disappointing as the food was very overpriced for what it was. But we made do. Despite us not being guests staying at the hotel the staff were friendly and very accommodating - I lost my shoes at one point and the staff were super helpful in reuniting them with me. So it was a nice day but if you're on a budget I really wouldn't recommend it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Shireen S wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Text: The hotel itself is beautiful and our room was the traditional Moroccan theme with a pool view. We were greeted with traditional moroccan tea and the receptionist was lovely. Rooms were very clean and we were left beautiful gifts with the room turn down service in the evening. The range of food at the hotel in the morning was amazing. All the breakfast staff were very helpful and polite. In general 5* stay. Made our honeymoon very special for a week. Would go back there anytime.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Best place for chilling in Marrakesh
Review_Text: One of a best place in Marrakesh. Just come for lunch and enjoy the swimming pool. We  Good service  good food and would definitely recommend. Anyway I plan to go in Marrakesh soon and I will come back for sure!

Review_Date: Nono M wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Text: My experience in the hotel was just magic we did really appreciate the service from the beginning until our departure. I would like to say a big big & special thanks to Aida all the support she gave me before coming on the organization of the arrival and the preparation of the room. Everything was absolutely fabulous and perfect. She is very customer oriented with all suggestion proposed and her pro-activity to make my stay with my fianc√©e unique and beautiful. Bravo Aida and keep going.  I would like to thanks the florist (Brahim Soumaya and Malika) for the decoration of the room. My fianc√©e were absolutely in love even with the letter writing by Aida. Thanks a lot for the cake made Ibtissam Fatema and chef Lagouil. Thanks a lot to Hayat and Redouane for their work the room was always clean and we didn‚Äôt miss anything. Thanks to the drivers who take care of my care in very professional way and to all employees who make our stay very special. Thanks for the amazing and relaxing time at the spa as well. Everything was perfect.    I used to travel all around the world in 5 stars hotels and I was just impressed by the level of service at Sofitel. Honestly I didn't expect to have such service in Morocco. My stay was amazing and my fianc√©e was impressed and in love with the level of service.    I will definitely come back at Sofitel anytime I will come to Marrakesh and I will advise and recommend the hotel to my network.  Thanks to have made our stay memorable in such beautiful hotel. My fianc√©e and I were in love with the decoration of the hotel mix of oriental and occidental style the perfume we could smell everywhere in the hotel the friendliness and the kindness of all staff at any level of hierarchy.  Thank you very much    Oumaima & Nouredine
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Me and my boyfriend landed in Marrakech yesterday to celebrate our anniversary after missing our first flight in London! When we finally got to the hotel in the evening we were given a room with a view of the restaurant which we were not happy about as last time we visited we were given a room with the most beautiful view which drew as back to this hotel! As I explained this to the receptionist she gave us another room which she claimed had the pool view when we moved to this room it was exactly as the one we were first given just a floor beneath but in fact worse as our balcony had stairs leading to the restaurant which has no privacy whatsoever! Everyone can see through the room so we need to have our curtains closed at all times which defeats the purpose of what I had asked for! (The view)    When I called to complain again we were told that we had to wait until the next day to be given another room! This made us feel quite unsettled on our first night of the holiday.    We Would have never faulted this hotel the last time We visited hence why we came to visit again and neither am I faulting it this time but the service we were given yesterday doesn't come as near enough as close as the 5* service we were given last year.    However I would like to mention the service of the one man that made us feel very comfortable and welcome as soon as we entered the hotel. I've sadly forgotten his name but I'm sure we will see him around again to catch his name for our next review after our week stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A last minute decision to spend the weekend in Marrakech brought us to the Sofitel for the second time and the experience was exceptional. Attentive service excellent food and a great evening lounge atmosphere all made for a lovely time. The spa was extremely beautiful and the pool area made for a wonderful getaway from the chaotic city outside of the walls.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Very nice staff who are all great and helpful.  Hotel is also nice.    Few things that detracted from 5* were:  1) finding a pool which needed a supplement. That was strange  2). Manager not following up to a question during 4 days  3) Concierge sending us to a tourist trap versus family friendly restaurant. (Should have relied on trip advisor).    But a great location and well maintained hotel so apart from my minor comments a nice place in walking distance of most places to visit in Marrakech

Just a quickie but I wanted to show my appreciation for the fantastic staff who serve us all around the pool. Two members of staff stand out as going above and beyond and I am ashamed that I am only able to mention by name one of those staff. Mohammed and his colleague (so so sorry that I can't recall his name as it was not a name I have heard before - many apologies). Anyway they were both amazing and were so attentive to our needs. I cannot wait to visit again on 15th February when I know they will be there and determined to make my next visit as memorable as the last one.    Thank you.

This Hotel was wonderful charming Staff great Manager( who is always present) I think the man must work 15hours a day.. The Hotel is very clean.. The breakfast room is beautiful... staff so very welcoming a young dynamic staff that work hard to please you.. the Cooking staff made all your culinary wishes come true. I had a absolutely fantastic time at the hotel.. a upgrade to a Junior Suite with a breathtaking view of the high atlas mountains...the grounds of the hotel are spotless and in good repair... and a top security staff as well.. all in all one of my favorite hotels.. Thank you Sofitel Marrakech..

We're currently at the Sofitel for a week of combined work and pleasure. It is absolutely elegant and delightful Try a Manhattan at the Lawerence Lounge!    However we were given room 349 which was comfortable but very tired. The carpet and chairs were stained the desk top had a gouge and the bathroom tub had a loose fixture. This room was not in keeping with this caliber hotel. My wife complained to customer relations they explained renovations were on-going but had't been done yet in 349. We were upgraded and moved to a delightful suite with a balcony overlooking the snow capped Atlas mountains in the distance. I'd highly recommend the Sofitel BUT be sure to insist on a recently renovated room

Review_Date: Thomas K wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: Big rooms beautiful pool area excellent Sunday brunch and friendly service. A spacious palace in the middle of Hivernage next to the best restaurants shops and clubs. You feel welcomed by the friendly staff. All is decorated in luxury Moroccan style.

Review_Date: Ahmed K wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: Sofitel Marrakech is one of the best hotel or resort in Morroco  Quite big big rooms fully with all required tools inside  Nice swimming pools and GYM  Very super food  Service is great  WiFi everywhere and free  Good meeting rooms  Hotel located in middle of town  10 min walk to the mall

Overall the hotel was ok. There were some really good things about the hotel but some which made it disappointing and hence the three star rating.  We stayed 3 nights at the hotel. I had requested for a room facing the pool as wanted some quiet. The room we got was at the end of the corridor and next the the room they were constructing further rooms/ fixing walls etc. So there was a lot of noise whole day. We had spent some time in the room but were mainly out so it was bearable but it is not expected from a big hotel like this. The construction workers were always around the room. Further as it was end of corrider it didnt really have a view as i was hoping.    Further the bathroom had a leakage in terms of the bathtub glass shower curtain was not fit in properly so everytime you would shower the whole bathroom would be wet as the alignment of the shower curtain was not proper.    The service from the hotel staff was decent they have a nice property and proximity to some of the restaurants etc is good. We had a meal near the swimming pool and food was decent being a vegetarian. Lots of activities for kids so good place to spend a few days if you want to have a resort break.    One more thing that I was upset about was i had forgotten my scarf in the restaurant on the day of checkout and I realised it within 15 min and called them but they could not track it. It was hard to explain to them as few people understood english esp on phone and there was a point wherein I was just speaking to staff all over the place but no one was understanding. Unfortunately I didnt find it which was disappointing as I was very sure of the exact spot I forgot it and being 7:30 in the morning I didnt think there were lots of people either at the breakfast restaurant. Anyways that was my bad luck but hoped for better service.

Review_Date: Walker V wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Text: Thank you Thank you Thank you!!!!! Many thanks to Hicham at the concierge desk for assisting me communicating with the airport baggage services when my bags didn‚Äôt arrive on time. Thank you Nassira for assisting me with contacting a tour operator when it was apparent they were running late. Let me note that Nassira had only been working for Sofitel ten days and her services were outstanding! Thank you Abdelhakim for showing and making me the best Moroccan tea!!!! The rooms were clean and the view of the magnificent Atlas mountains was an added bonus. The breakfast buffet was wonderful offering an array of pastries fruits and items from the grill.    Since returning to the US I‚Äôve become Sofitel‚Äôs unofficial ambassador! Everyone wanted to know how Marrakech was and the accommodations. I‚Äôve showed pictures and told them of the wonderful people who showed grace and charm during my short hotel stay.    Thanks Sofitel Lounge and Spa staff for making my first trip to Morocco memorable.

What a nice hotel !!!  Lobby nicely decorated and room also nice with enough space  Great breakfast with large choices  Service score is below zero One of the worst one that I experienced in my life  SPA and swimming room nice and well maintained

This hotel tops the list.  Breakfast Has it all and more. Second day room service perfect  Evening meal. First evening delicious Harira Soup then Tagine  Second evening the soup again then a delicious Filet Steak cooked to perfection  Rooms Total comfort Beds are so comfyyou are sleeping on cloud 9 and Lanvin Toiletries  Staff All very helpful and head waiter was fabulous  Hotel Exquisite and Beautiful A hotel not to be missed

Had a great time a very good and comfortable place to be in\  clean rooms and baths mice view and clean areasthe staff weas very freindly.  i ve felt so welcomed and at ease  thank you all for your service and hospitality  i strongly recommended

Spread out over a large area the Sofitel is a very beautiful place. Rooms have everything you need. Clean  comfortable and well equipped. Our balcony overlooked the Atlas Mountains. 3 pools and a spa. The breakfast and lunch buffets were superb perhaps the best I've ever been to. Good coffee which seems to be unusual for Moroccan hotels. I have never had a better chocolate mousse anywhere.

Review_Title: Nice 5 star hotel w good food
Review_Text: Really beautiful hotel with a Nice swimmingpool and dining area.    Staff is friendly and ready to help where possible. Would recommend the hotel for holidays or business.    Even with bad weather still enough to do.

Review_Date: Lauren K wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: This is a beautiful luxury hotel. I'm giving it a 4 out of 5 more for the location than the hotel as it is in a part of Marrakech that quite honestly reminded me of Las Vegas or Beverly Hills more than anything else and there isn't much to do within walking distance. A taxi or car is required to get almost anywhere. With that said the hotel is stunning and the staff was lovely. It's also very well staffed with people to greet you at the entrance to open doors get taxis help with bags etc... I found that they were able to anticipate our next move or step into assist before we even asked without being overbearing. The concierge was also very helpful. He assisted me in making a reservation at a hamman and making a dinner reservation for a large party.  There's a lot of restaurant/bar/patio spaces to sit and get a drink or something to eat although the prices are relatively high and comparable to what we'd spend in the US on food or drink. The breakfast is fantastic. It's a large buffet and everything was really good- from the made to order omelettes crepes/waffles charcuterie fruit and yogurt pastries etc...  The rooms themselves are very nice and the beds super comfortable. We had a small private outdoor space which was pleasant and despite the hotel being quite busy it was generally very quiet and peaceful. Overall a really wonderful stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here 10-OCT-2016 to 15-OCT-2016. We were scheduled to stay only 5 nights but we added another night because we really enjoyed it. Ahmed Defaa the Executive Chef was phenomenal and very helpful. We enjoyed talking to him. They really cater to all of your wishes.  The pool area was great and we loved the layout. NO little plastic chairs and everywhere was comfortable.  We went to the weekly dinner that provided different types of music and belly dancers. The show was great and the food well there was soooo much food that I could not move! Really good staff there as well.  We highly recommend staying there and would like to go back.  Also room service was great too. Very friendly and attentive. Thank You H.Singhat and Brahim!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed 2 nights in October 2016. We arrived tired We had already checked in online supposedly to save time and have our room keys with the Concierge. However we were told to sit and wait. Not a good start. We eventually got our room Dropped our bags and made for the main restaurant Orangerie. The service was poor seemed to be lots of staff but badly organised. Our meal was very average and disappointing particularly for a culinary destination. Our room was large bed very comfortable breakfasts were superb. We made sure we eat our for dinner on our second night.. Overall very disappointing in a Sofitel
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I had always wanted to visit Marrakech but did want to stay in a 5 star hotel which mean staying outside of the medina and we couldnt have made a better decision. Just arriving at the hotel all staff very friendly no hanging around reception waiting to check in. It was all very prompt as it was late when we arrived. The scent in the hotel was to die for. The decor was beautiful without been ornate. Although it was a 5 star hotel and the service was 5 star you still felt comfortable. Our room was lovely overlooking the restaurant and was greeted with petals on our bed. The lounge areas and pool areas were amazing. So many options of where to sit and lounge. I could'nt recommend this hotel highly enough. All the staff were very pleasant and accommodating to us.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Worse place I've stayed in years.
Review_Text: The only redeemable aspect of this hotel is the location and the doormen.    The spa is overpriced and services are not very good. The hotel wants to charge you for every service. For example if you want to use the spa pool you have to pay.    The room was not well maintained with stained carpets non-functioning lights and many items broken or scratched.    Do not stay here if you are looking to relax as there is a horrible wedding reception style band that cranks out the hits well past midnight every night.    Marrakesh is wonderful this hotel needs to be avoided.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Bad Live music (like a cheesy karaoke) till way past 10pm keeping us awake every night
Review_Text: This hotel is one of the most expensive I have stayed at - not expected for Morocco.    Our stay is being completely ruined by the nightly live music from the terrace bar outsider window )so loud it is clearly audible from our 4th floor room even with the windows shut).    Made worse by the poor standard (it's like karaoke).    Will not risk booking here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I visited the hotel for the 6th time in as many years always a pleasure to visit this exceptional hotel with great staff.    Made to feel more than welcome by all staff and truly the place to go and relax.

Overall the hotel was nice. Lovely reception and a fabulous pool area.  We upgraded to a junior suite which was nice. The room wasn't that clean a few hairs were left in the bathroom and a funny smell coming from the wardrobe.  The location is great a great selection of bars and restaurants near by which is ideal as the hotel is very expensive. I was warned about this but wasn't expecting to pay ¬£5 for a coffee ¬£20 a cocktail and ¬£25 for a burger and chips! I also didn't rate the customer service for the price you're paying and agree with a few of the previous reviews - lot's of staff hanging but not eager to take your order. I had to go to the bar myself on many occasions.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Natalie Y wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: Arrived at the Sofitel Lounge and Spa. Beautiful hotel reception and views onto a lovely pool area. We are a party of four women celebrating my sister's 40th birthday. The Lounge and Spa section of the hotel should be closed as the noise from the building works is awful. I moved rooms yesterday due to the loud drilling noise and overnight my sister' room had a group of rowdy men trying to get through the interconnecting door that wouldn't lock properly. They were moved to the only room available that is down a corridor that has no lighting so you can't even see to open your door. They were woken by all the drilling and building works.  You can also hear the building work noise from the swimming pool area. Loads of pool side staff stood around but not interested in taking your drinks order. Had to walk over to the bar twice before we were able to order a drink.  So far the only positive has been the excellent breakfast.  Such a shame as we are only here for 3 nights and could be a fantastic hotel.

If there is one hotel I recommend to stay at in Marrakesh then it is Sofitel!    The team on hand were fabulous catering to all of our needs no request was too small and service was second to none.    Farrah Fatima Zahra Hicham and Anas the breakfast team I can't speak highly enough of them. Thank you for looking after me and my family and for your warm and friendly manner.    Looking forward to staying with you again üòÄ

A fabulous hotel professional courteous and most of all friendly staff willing to go the extra mile for the smallest of tasks.    Can't praise the breakfast team enough look out for Zine Dine Hicham Ibrahim Yousaf and Fatima. Thank you all for making my stay fabulous and for your hospitality it has been a pleasure

Review_Date: Devika P wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Title: Lovely stay but some easy improvements to be made..
Review_Text: Overall we had a lovely 5 night stay at the Sofitel lounge and spa. The swimming pools lobby lounge areas etc. were clean and inviting and in line with what we have come to expect of the Sofitel chain. The rooms are in need of a refurb particularly the carpets which were stained. Service was generally good. There are a few things that could be improved which would have made our stay much better:    1. Taxis. There are a line of taxis just outside the hotel gates. The hotel have agreed a fixed rate of 50 diharams each way up to a fixed distance so they do not run on the meter. This is more expensive than metered taxis (which you can hail down on the street) but you pay extra as these taxis are always there and they regularly service the hotel. They can also pick you up for the return journey (again they charge 50 diharams). A taxi from the hotel to the airport should be 70 diharams during the day and 100 diharams at night. None of this was explained to us by the hotel staff which caused a lot of unnecessary confusion.    2. Shower. Our room shower water changed from burning hot to freezing cold regularly. We complained about this daily but nothing was done. I appreciate these things are not easy to fix particularly as the rooms are a bit dated but we would have appreciated some acknowledgement of our complaint from the hotel manager which we never received.    3. Spa discount. Our room rate had a % discount on the spa treatments. Whilst we were pleasantly surprised that our treatment cost less than we expected when we came to pay we were not told of this when we checked in (also not on our booking confirmation). If we had known we may have booked more treatments.    4. Check out. Whilst check in was a very relaxed and pleasant process check out was not as pleasant. The person serving us was quite rude and left us feeling low at the end of our holiday. This is an area that could be improved.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: One of the best in Marrakesh.
Review_Text: The Sofitel was one of the best in Marrakesh you can feel the difference once you enter and start your check in.    The swimming pool area is amazing you can enjoy a full day there and since it's more as a garden then only a pool that made it more relaxing.    Everyone starting from the management reception and waitress was helpful and very friendly.    The main points we didn't like was the continues sound of the work going on starting early in the morning and in the 3rd floor there is this big wooden hanger which is used only for hanging two Chandeliers those two hanger made the walk way ugly and unsafe.    Hope then next time I'm make the can fix those two problems.

Review_Date: Faisal F wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: We are wrapping up our four day stay at this hotel and I had no choice but to jump onto the Palais wifi to put this place on blast before we jump on the plane back home. What a remarkable hotel. The service is rock-solid too. Ask for Reda B. (Head Concierge) for the hook up. Tell him I sent you.    We came with our 6 month old baby and the Sofitel experience helped turn this adventure into something that I have no words for.    Directeur Benkirane: You do an exceptional job directing this establishment. Thank you and your wonderful staff for your hospitality. You made us feel at home.

An excellent luxury hotel in a great location.staff are superb and the whole outdoor area and gardens are so relaxing.an oasis in the middle of the madness that is marraketch. You could easily stay for a week and not leave the hotel at all.it is soon relaxing.pure luxury.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lovely for a short break, could do with a refurb!
Review_Text: I have stayed at a Sofitel in Bali so was expecting a similar standard. All communal areas of this hotel are immaculate and smell great the grounds are kept to a high standard and the pool area was fantastic in fact their loungers or should I say day beds were the best I'd ever seen around a pool and perfect for private bathing and chilling out.    The rooms however let this hotel down and could do with a refurb. Our carpets were stained the plug socket at the dressing table was hanging off the wall and didn't work and the toilet door didn't close all the way. The patio door also didn't have a lock we were on the 3rd floor so not majorly bothered but if you have a small child you wouldn't want a door that doesn't have a lock! On the plus side the bed was very comfortable the sheets were changed daily the shower had a decent pressure and they provide robes slippers and offered a turndown service daily.    The staff were all very friendly a little less so in the So Lounge but we only went there once so it didn't bother us. They struggled to understand us at times due to the language barrier but again that was nothing major.    The pool was a great chill out area and the day beds are a great idea. The actual pool was very clean and inviting a little cold but refreshing once you swam around. The staff will serve you while you sunbath but the service at times was slow. It;s a shame they allow the 3rd pool (up on the 1st floor) to go to waste we were told it would be 400MAD per person to sit around that pool we didn't see a single person in there the whole 4 days we stayed.    Breakfast was a little limited but if you're only there for a short time you'll survive. The chef's are very friendly and helpful. They do have a bit of a bird problem though sometimes there were bird droppings on the table so opt to eat inside if this would put you off.    I guess I would return again but those rooms could definitely do with some new carpets and having the fixtures and fittings replaced/upgraded.

Review_Date: Sophie A wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: First time here and will definately come back. Rooms are really nice and staff are superb.  Would recommend having a massage.  Hotel was in the right area and security was very good.  Facilities were in excellent order and the 2 pools were just right.

Review_Date: Fadoua B wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: It's always amazing felling to stay in sofitel Marrakech .the rooms the view and the staff are amazing the swimming pool and the view on the palm. The staff always make u feel welcome and valued each one that I deal with is professional and so attentive to all my request .soukaina. aida hajar ibtisam abderahim mehdi mustapha the concierge staff .the gentlemen on the pool the amazing staff in the restaurant for the breakfast . I will definitely recommend this hotel to all the people .it's just so magnifique

Staying here for 4 nights on our baby moon and my birthday treat. Spending lots of time in the hotel as heavily pregnant. Disappointed and surprised at the lack of service not only for a 5* hotel but a hotel in general. On two occasions have asked for snacks and beverages by the pool and not received service but can see others being served. F&B staff seem unenthusiastic to offer any information of what's available so you need to ask the right questions to know what is available menu wise they are not forthcoming and helpful as if you are expected to know everything the hotel restaurants offer. Have yet to have the breakfast or lunch buffet and now unsure if we should take the risk given other reviews.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Nice hotel but could be renovated...
Review_Text: I enjoy staying at this hotel because of its high level of service and it's central location. The staff is very friendly and accommodating as expected at any Sofitel hotel.    The lobby and pool area are both very pleasant. However I found the rooms while comfortable to still be a bit disappointing. It is clear that the bedrooms needed renovation as the furniture and the bathrooms do come across as a little outdated. The little separate room for the toilet was also quite old-feeling and not very well ventilated. On the plus side the bed was comfortable we had a nice view of the pool area and the room was very quiet and nice to sleep in.    The iconic Sofitel weekend breakfasts are fantastic. So many choices that you end up overeating but it's still a great experience. However I found the poolside restaurant to be a bit boring. It would be nice to see a more varied menu.    The spa has a nice heated indoor pool as well as a large fitness center. The reception area of the spa is beautiful with a Moroccan fountain in the center. We had massages at the spa which were also very relaxing although the private massage rooms would be nicer.    Overall a nice central hotel to stay at if you are not willing to splurge.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lynn P wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: My 7th trip back to Sofitel Lounge and Spa in the same amount of years.  Love this hotel and i am always greeted with a warm welcome back by all the staff that remember me..My friend and i had a fantastic treatment in the spa on the first afternoon and we had a nice room over looking the pool area.  Only had two nights this time but was a welcome break and did't want to leave.  See you again next year!

Review_Date: Travel Matti wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Title: Great hotel in a intriguing city
Review_Text: We chose this hotel for our anniversary trip to Marrakesh and we were not disappointed.  We ordered the airport transfer through the hotel and were welcomed with a hotel sign at the airport and chaufeured with a Mercedes back to the hotel. Whilst the hotel transfer option costs about 3 times what it would cost with one of the local taxi guys the level of comfort is simply unsurpassed.    We were welcomed into hotel by many helping hands however despite having completed the online checkin the day before it seemed that this did not add any value as our room keys were not simply ready as expected and we rather had to wait for the local team to complete the check-in again.    With the Loung and Spa being the renovated wing of the Sofitel in Marrakesh we were escorted to a wonderfully fitted room on the fourth floor facing the pool and if you travel in winter / spring when their is better visibility you would be able to get a great view of the High Atlas mountains as well.    The hotel surprised on the evening of the arrival when staff arrived at 22:40 to complete the complimentary "anniversary room decoration" which included a delicious cake. Apart from the unexpected timing the guesture was fantastic.    In the evening we were further surprised to find out that at the back of the hotel wing in which we stayed the hotels own Lounge was one of the cities more popular Lounge locations with the adjoining night cllub. Whilst the open walkways on this side of the building had glass doors fitted retrospectively to reduce the noise impact of the Lounge they did not prevent the bass travelling into the building structure. Despite initially being concerned about it we noticed that it was only mildly noticable in the room but if you expect full silence in your room you should rater request to be located in other hotel room wings.    The swimming pool area is huge and the hotel goes to great extend to organise events from pool parties with style and other things which was nice. The hotels food options vary. Whilst breakfast and the pool food options are as to be expected the hotels own restaurant food is way to "touristy" and lacking flavour. We found many better dining options throughout nearby Medina.    Overall we had a great couples get away and really enjoyed our stay as I wrote above some of the noticed items are simply down to personal preference and expectation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Benjamin K wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Title: Visiting the red city is a fairytail
Review_Text: Dear team.    It has been an amazing experience of visiting a city of our childhood memories from a stories we have been told as children before going to bed.    Thank you for a very clean room amazing breakfast experience every day.    We can not say only in few words how the staff of hotel is so kind and polite. Kind and friendly and helpful. I had problems with my eye and a staff from breakfast Sara and Anas brought me a medicine to help my with my eye. Most grateful for that.    We are living home with the best first experience of visiting Marakech.    Ben and Luka

Very good location staff are very friendly. Rooms are very nice beds are too soft to my liking but not a major issue. Breakfast is amazing!!!!  Very clean but if you eat or drink in the hotel it is quite expensive. Pool area is very nice with comfortable beds and pillows to sunbathe in. Would definitely recommend.

i stayed 3 night in the sofitel marrakech what i like about the hotel is the service at the back office starting from the booking department. Our trip start with a lady called Halima in the booking department who provide us all the best information about the city and got us the best rooms tks to her.  all the people where nice and friendly especially the old lady at the breakfast who make the moroccan pan cacke (rghayef) she is just amazing.  the only problem we had is that at 5am the room service had only morocan beer or very expensive beer.  very nice location from casino night club & restaurant.

We had a really good stay at Sofitel Marrakesh. Good food and great service. The pool area was perfect for our son. Although it was hot in the summer there were nice areas with shades. They also have a special room for kids. Great. Special thanks to:  Fatima Rachida Ilham Hicham Mustapha Berd Azly and Farah.  And concierge Adil for great help during the stay.

Review_Title: amazing staff make this a truly wonderful experience
Review_Text: I spent 7 nights at this hotel and found the experience amazing thanks to the very competent and diligent staff members who stopped at nothing to make my stay as delightful as possible. The restaurant/breakfast staff which impressed me most include Farah Hicham Fatima Rachida Zidane Nouihi and Azli. The head Chef Ahmed gave me a warm welcome and made every effort to accomadate my every requirement.    The front desk staff were very welcoming and had a permanet smile fixed to their face. Saad Noura and Jihane showed exemplary customer service and Adil & Reda ( concierge) were also very helpful and pleasant.    The hotel amenities such as the pool and food are of a very high standard but what sets this hotel apart from others in Marrakech is the staff.

Very great hotel with nice location many bars and restaurants close by.  Hotel staff very polites  Rooms very clean and hotel Resturants very delicious  Strongly recommend to visit the hotel  Rate are reasonable

Review_Date: Mary Westre wrote a review Aug 2016
Review_Text: The service was on point. Everyone was extremely kind and attentive. The room was more spacious than I thought which was great. Location was ideal literally really close to everything. Totally coming back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Younes R wrote a review Aug 2016
Review_Text: I spent 10 days to attend my best friend's weeding. The service was 5* vip all day long special thanks to Mr Ghali who made everything possible for us to feel at ease. I will never forget the hospitality of Ms Sakina Agorram who was very friendly and good listener. Also Mr Youssef the best waiter at the swiming pool... Without forgetting the teaman with his best smile always there to greet customers at the lobby. Mustafa and Khawla assisted us 24/7 seeking perfection. I will definetely stay again for my next visit in Marrakech.

Review_Date: El√≠n I wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Text: Loved every minute of my stay at Sofitel.  The hotel staff was fantastic incredibly welcoming kind and helpful.  The room was spacious with good amenities and well furnished very comfortable and clean.  The hotel is beautiful with great lounges pool and bar areas and restaurants.

The hotel is situated in a beautiful tropical park offering wonderful√∂ relaxing facilities. Close to thecentre of marrakech. The only bad experinece was the attentiuon at the reception and upon our arrival it took too long before we could get aour room. this is a poor standard as compared to the written and announced standards. ther is a lot to improve the service at the reception!

Review_Title: Best Place to Stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: The service is spectacular. Staff are very friendly and speak good English.  Rooms are spacious and the breakfast is rich and delicious.  The restaurants and clubs they have are great! Location is perfect ( with LV store opposite the hotel).

This hotel is great for multiple reasons. First of all the location is ideal. You're able to quickly and easily walk into the Medina while stopping along the way at multiple locations for photos or a drink. You can also pick up taxi's easily from the hotel as they sit on the main street; their prices are competitive and you can haggle for a deal. Secondly the hotel itself is nice. It's very spacious in the lobby with a great pool/lounge area. It seems to fit multiple ideas of what a great vacation is; you can either come here by yourself with a spouse or even make it a family trip. The hotel's public areas seem to offer a great time for all types of trips. Lastly the rooms are great. We had a very spacious bed excellent patio on the first floor to sit out and relax while also enjoying the nice sized bathroom. Additional amenities in the hotel were great to include the food (room service and breakfast); the spa was nice albeit overpriced compared to other areas but you're in a large chain hotel that is high-end so it's expected; and lastly the ability to sit somewhere whether it be the lobby pool side area or in a chair throughout the endless hallways and just relax/read a book. Parking is available albeit limited. Call ahead for this type of request. We will be back to this hotel for sure.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My wife and me spent one week there Me wife is pregnant so all of hotel staff was pending of she needed and the care of of details with her. we felt as at home and the care all of details with her. They moved ours to Imperial Hotel just My wife could rest better whit less noise...Special mention to Soufiane Mazzouj ( Guest relations manager ) for ours he was in the top execution manage wit us. High level staff.

The Lounge was so good...and the service was so good too. Had a great time and enjoyed the bright lights and the food and drinks. Also the club had an awesome atmosphere and a great selection of music. We received perfect service from the Waiter Mehdi and he answered all our questions and was so polite and nice. Massive thank you to him for being so kind and making our Sofitel experience one of a kind. Definately going to come back again.

Review_Date: Tareq M wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Text: Hi  I was very blessed and lucky to visit your hotel especially that you've got a very good and kind staff " Ibtisam &Aida " who really did very good job and she assisted me in professional way  Such kind of people have to be promoted and well highlighted by the management  I hope to visit you soon again  My regards

Review_Title: Wonderful experience all the way around!
Review_Text: This was my second time to stay at the Sofitel Marrakech and as always it was a great time. I particulary want to mention the special treatment I recieved from Aida Rharmili in guest relation. She was the most wonderful host who did everything she could to make sure that we have the a mognificant stay. We will always come back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ajay M wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Text: Upon arriving at the Sofitel Spa and Lounge we were immediately greeted by very friendly and welcoming reception staff. We were amazed at the beauty of the hotel and were really impressed with the excellent service we recieved from the hotel reception team in particular Ibdissam who went out of her way to make our stay the best possible she even upgraded us to a suite defintely deserves a promotion.  The facilities which we used included the swimming pools gym spa restaurants and bar all of which are of high quality and the services are impeccable. The location of the hotel is great and everything is within walking distance!    Would highly recommend the sofitel lounge and spa! For the amount you pay in this hotel you defintely get the highest quality of customer service. However if you are looking for more affordable services then you can easily get that within marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Shane G wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Text: Spent a week here to attend a conference but did lots of visiting. The room was spacious and luxurious. Staff was helpful and very friendly. The pool was a great place to relax with a couple of beers and should you require more then a visit to the spa will certainly complete your relaxing routine after walking the souk from end to end.

Review_Title: Nice hotel, shame about the service levels.....
Review_Text: Admittedly we stayed during Ramadan but that doesn't excuse the quality of service we received. This had nothing to do with the number of staff on duty but their collective ability to busy themselves doing nothing. I suspect that this will not be an isolated experience as it takes a lot of practice to be able to maintain your eyeline 2 feet over everyones heads. That is of course unless you are a "VIP" guest when the staff make no pretence about service your needs above the other guests. Shame that a short break in a lovely city at a hotel with good facilities was spoilt by the service level.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Elnur S wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: The resort is excellent. It is clear large with many types of swimming pools. Food/restaurants are good.    The service is overall good but I think the management should formally introduce a benefit for Platinum Accor member as currently there is no extra benefit for Platinum in comparison with Gold. To me they offered a free access to internal Spa/swimming area but I recommend this to be a standard for Platinum members.    I should highlight one special member of staff - Zeyneb. She was excellent. I had an issue with my card being stuck in a bank machine. and in spite of late hours and the weekend - she was able to get a technician from the bank to come and get my card out . saved my trip. Many thanks to Zeyneb.    Regards

Review_Date: Nikki J wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: Sunday to Sunday at the Sofitel Marrakesh far exceeded our expectations. We arrived tired and slightly stressed after a strangely confrontational taxi transfer from the airport (Which should cost you 100 dirhams- i think a fixed rate to the region that Sofitel is located)    The moment we pulled up the bell boy opened the taxi door and we felt like we'd arrived at a 5 star hotel...finally. The security staff at the entrance to the hotel were so kind and gracious. We were led up into reception where Ibtissama the receptionist greeted us by seating us in the lobby which had one of those 'corporate' scents being pumped in..non offensive in fact a very calming and pleasing scent. She called for us to be handed some refresher towels and 2 Moroccan teas along with some Moroccan sweets Ok so no big deal you may say but the way Ibtissama seated us and took us through the the check in process was stellar and really showed how a check in is supposed to be done. She came over and listened to our gripes about the delayed flight we had and the journey from the airport (15mins) we literally felt like our holiday had began the moment she started to speak. She gave us tips on how to handle ourselves in town and gave us all the info we needed. I privately mentioned it was my girlfriends birthday and she and the room service team decorated the room and prepared a cake i cannot thank them enough. Atoul Singhat Brahim Sanae Balkani made the day so special. Especially Ibtissama the receptionist she made what was already going to be a lovely stay more than perfect. Because of her we would definitely return and recommend.    We visited in the month of Ramadan maybe avoid that as some of the local shops and restaurants were closed during the day.    Hotel pool facilities were great location was great breakfast was really good from crepes to omelettes to fresh patisserie! Breakfast staff got to know what we wanted and had our teas and coffees and freshly squeezed orange juice ready each morning. The hotel restaurants are pricey and food in Marrakesh is all quite similar. I would say to venture out if you can tear yourselves away at least in the evenings.    Weather was amazing although got a little chilly in the evenings. Cabs were between 30-50 dirhams each way to the main square from the hotel negotiate this prior to getting in.    Sofitel looks pretty amazing really impressive you have to look really closely to find faults. I'm quite fussy and i was happy. Porches and Range Rovers parked up outside very posh.    Its not a brand new hotel and there are bits that could do with an update but the experience we had due to the staff more than made up for this.    I wish more of them spoke English but thats not a complaint just an observation. We brits need to be multi lingual. Everybody all over the world seems to be. Most staff speak a little English if not fluent but practically speak French.    You will not be disappointed we had a great holiday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Such a beautiful hotel amazing standard and lovely staff.    The rooms are great and the pool is beautiful on a hot day! The breakfast was lovely and the hotel is in a good location. There was a supermarket within walking distance and also the old town a busy street with some restaurants (can't remember the name but the hotel directed us) within walking distance.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel is in a great location easy to get a cab into the medina. Locally there are some good restaurants/ bars or you can travel further in. The hotel is two hotels the imperial is older and the spa hotel very modern. Both are good- not cheap and the restaurant is expensive for drinks/ lunch. Will be back though  as there are so many places to see whilst here!

Beautiful surroundings and pool area however rooms a little dated - don't trust a receptionist called Anas - promises the earth and deliver zilch - kept us waiting at Reception for 2 hours! Breakfast brilliant but VFM.

Review_Date: Mark J wrote a review May 2016
Review_Text: This is a very lovely hotel near the town but secluded. Key for us we stayed for the day and used the restaurant and pool. We are staying in a Riad and it was great to chill by a pool. A bit pricey as should have paid 450 Dh as a non resident but we never asked.  Lunch was 400Dh for two salads and a drink each
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: James W wrote a review May 2016
Review_Text: Large luxury hotel with spacious pool/cabana complex set near the old city and medina. Beautiful Moroccan theme throughout. Seems to be one of the favorites of well-heeled Moroccans and others. Our room had a very large ( by hotel standards ) deck with table and lounge chairs overlooking the pool area. First class service throughout. Don't be surprised to see Bentleys and other high line cars in the driveway.

Good news:  * the very helpful and forthcoming staff at all levels  * congrats to the chef as the food the buffets are simply outstanding  * surroundings garden pool are enchanting and poolbeds and more than comfortable  *good AC  * very comfy beds    BAD NEWS:  * paper thin walls - a nightmare!  * water flow in shower: goes from ice cold to steaming hot and back within seconds  * pool turns into public pool on weekends  * expensive restaurants  * buffet not available at dinner when large groups present
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tse Kwong L wrote a review May 2016
Review_Text: It is a nice hotel and the food is fine. It is quite and comfortable. I was feeing really at home as the personnel was caring and ensuing that I am enjoying the best time.    I like the always smiling staff you come across who make you feel safe and relax.    I enjoyed the restaurant "So Good" as the food is really good with a nice live show. I had an excellent service and was impressed by the young Whalid who gave me an excellent service making my evening really special.

Review_Date: Mr. R wrote a review May 2016
Review_Text: Had an amazing stay at the Sofitel thanks to Mr Soufiane the general manager of the hotel who made everything possible for us to feel at ease. We'll never forget his understanding and hospitality. The hotel itself is great (room staff food) definitely will stay there again for our next visit to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Aislinn D wrote a review May 2016
Review_Title: Best Place Going! Avail of Pool pass!
Review_Text: If you are travelling in Marrakesh and staying in a Riad be sure and visit this hotel for a pool day and drinks.It will not disappoint! I have been to hotels of this calibre before in the UAE but this has to have been the nicest and most magnificent hotel I have been to. For 300 Dirhams you can have a day pool pass. It's excellent value considering the beds you get to lounge on and the table service. We went at 11 a.m and had solace in the sun and shade. We had a waiter checking up on us regularly. We enjoyed drinks and laughs at the pool for the whole day. Food is served and the setting is nothing like I have ever seen before. Well worth a visit.

There's not a lot to say: Friendly staff spacious rooms very clean amazing pool area good location apart from the medina but still in a walking distance to Djemaa el Fnaa (approx. 15min). In short we couldn't have spent the week better than here!    Only negative points - and they were not really disturbing: Expensive pool restaurant (imagine Swiss prices) and bars close early (1am).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Christopher M wrote a review May 2016
Review_Title: Mixed experience in the back-to-back twin Sofitel Marrakech hotels
Review_Text: The first night at Sofitel Lounge & Spa (SLS) was in a suite said to have Atlas mountain view. This is nonsense as the mountains are 20-plus miles away and visiblility in Morocco is rarely 20 miles. The SLS suites are also quite old with a 1990s shower over the bath and on the end of a wing with two balconies per suite are adversely affected by road noise. Very quiet a/c and comfotable bed. Massive breakfast spread served inside or out. Dinner at So Good restaurant was OK but we had to be outside in the wind (with heater) as the inner space only provided microscopic tables in a night club setting.  We then spent two fabulous nights in a "tent" at Kasbah Tamadot.  Our return to SLS for two nights apparently clashed with an African Convention which took over most of the SLS end. We were therefore 'upgraded' to the Sofitel Imperial Palais (SIP) along the building but wished we had not been!!  SIP looks to be an all suite hotel with nice recently renovated rooms over looking the pools and set back from the main road with little road noise. The suite was huge with one WC a bath with shower over but also a proper separate shower. A spacious lounge with 4-seater dining table and so many wardrobes/cupboards we had to remember what was where. Two nice balconies one with a love-seat style daybed and resident pair of pigeons. All well and good but in SIP room 409 neither the a/c unit in the lounge nor the one in the bedroom/bath complex provided any useful cooling during a minor May Marrakech heatwave. Truly awful experience with barely any sleep for either of us. We were booked on a late flight out so happily avoided a second intolerable night in SIP.  L'Oranderie restaurant is billed as the gourmet sofitel Restaurant but we found it unsatisfactory. Eating outside we were subject to cigarette and cigar smoke from other diners and a very badly behaved endlessly screaming child that the staff did nothing to control at 9.30pm. There was no exterior non-smoking zone and should not admit small children late a night. The bulk of the outside tables are in a open air pavilion and subject to intrusive high volume muzak that the staff refused to soften.  An early repeat breakfast in the same breakfast room as before was very disappointing with half the previous staff missing and half the previous food offerings missing at 0730.  In all a very mixed and inconsistent experience in the twin Yin and Yang of SLS & SIP but very well located. Walking distance to the Medina and 10 minutes by taxi from the Airport but no aircraft noise.  Would stay elsewhere next time rather than play room and restaurant roulette.  The SIP suite came with a "token" Butler who was big on introductng herself but then vanished without trace. Claimed to be available 24/7 but appeared to work only 10am-6pm.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: s k wrote a review May 2016
Review_Text: Just to give you a little context I'm a platinum at Sofitel stayed at other Sofitels countless times. When I was checking out my rental car had a flat tire. The valet manager offered to fix it so we gave him money. He asked for more so we gave it to him thinking that was tip. When we came back few hours later the valet manager was nowhere. This time the valet asked for another tip. The bellman who initially brought my bags out refused to load my bags into the car (since he already got his tip) and sent another bellman who now asked for another tip. I don't mind tipping for good service but this situation was out of control. Now that I'm back in US I see that my Sofitel account is not credited with my stay. I've emailed 3 times for the bill so I can forward to the point program. No response. This is a totally routine request Marriott Courtyards respond in an hour. Skip the Sofitel there are plenty of very nice riads much better experience.

I stayed few days at the Sofitel Lounge and Spa and it was AMAZING! the amenities are great and the level of service is incredible! a speical thanks to Adil and Rida who are fantastic concierges! you guys rock! thanks again!

We travel a lot and usually stay in better places so we can trully enjoy those few days when we can rest unwind and relax. When you pay the higher price for the hotel you expect better hospitality- well Sofitel at Marrakesh may disappoint you.
