Yes the hotel is clean the service is ok (although we had an unpleasent experience at the main reception- when asked for a previosuly offered a lowered price for the breakfast we were told that they didn't have a note of that?! We found that extremely rude as they simply meant we were lying (!)  The other thing is we wanted to lie down next to the infinity pool which we couldn't understand why was completely empty so we sat down on the chairs next to it. A member of staff approached us and said that we had to pay 400 MAD (28 GBP!) each to stay there! Was that a joke?!!! It was a snobish and unpleasant place.

The hotel is absolutely stunning in its playfully modern style. The Palais Imperial entrance is grand and opulent whereas the lounge and spa had a more modern minimalistic feel to it. The pool area is huge with ample space and lounging options and the spa is gorgeous. If you find yourself having dinner at l'orangerie try the tenderloin it's cooked to perfection.    Some things could be improved though:  1) the 400 MAD charge(yes even for guests) to use the infinity pool on the terrace is a bit unnecessary and high given that it's higher than the admission to most beach clubs where you also get more for your fee than one little infinity pool  2) some minor details are a bit annoying as they disrupt the ambience of the otherwise beautiful lounging ares for example - the chandeliers in the section with the umbrellas in the lounge & spa area are for some reason hung from 2 massive steel beams which have been placed across the balustrade of the third floor and taped with yellow/black striped warning duct tape. oOf course parts of the beams are sticking out onto the corridors leading to the rooms meaning that the residents of those rooms have to watch out for the beams en route to/from their rooms. Other (not less heavy) chandeliers and umbrellas are hung from thin barely visible wires why not these?  3) Our first room on the third floor overlooking the beautiful majorelle style fountain & pond was beautiful during the day but made it impossible to sleep at night due to what seemed to be hundreds of croaking frogs that sounded just as if they were right in our room. We gave them a chance for 2 nights (the reception staff did send security to get rid of them on the second night but failed as it was pitch black and they are.. frogs ie quite hard to locate and move can't blame them there) and asked to be moved on the third night which the staff arranged swiftly and efficiently requiring minimum effort on our behalf.    Having said that I'm very pleased with my stay and very grateful to the staff who went out of their way to accomodate all our requests in a professional and hospitable manner. Thank you so much for my birthday cake and the vip treatment guys :)  A special thanks to Aida Wafaa and Ayoub at the reception Mohcine and Mokhtar by the pool and of course Reda at the concierge desk for their dedication and professionalism.

Review_Date: Carol F wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: The Sofitel is a wonderful combination of traditional and modern. The service was terrific (with the exception of a somewhat Byzantine check-in). The room was large and bright.    At first we thought the breakfast was too pricey. However there was no where else to get breakfast that we could find so we decided to have it at the hotel. It was amazing. A sumptuous buffet good coffee and the most beautiful patio and poolside setting. It was so hard to pull ourselves away.    Overall a wonderful place at which to explore beautiful Marrakech.

This hotel is really fantastic the rooms although not to everyone's taste were maybe a little dated but the beds were to die for the best sleep so comfortable we didn't want to get up and they do bring free water each day. The outside area is super again you cannot fault the sunbeds or the staff who walk you to your beds and lay out your towels. The staff are so polite and always open doors for you the spa was rather expensive but we found a Yves Roche sop which did massages very cheaply. The hotel is very well located and it is so easy to get around on foot you can easily walk to the souls a and to the new town where they have opened a new shopping centre. Food is very reasonable around the hotel but we didn't actually eat in the Sofitel. We would highly recommend this beautiful hotel this was our second stay there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anesia F wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Title: Amazing hotel , next time will stay here.
Review_Text: zing and gorgeous hotel.  I went for drinks with my boyfriend and to get to know this hotel and felt in love.  Had a beautiful smell beautiful interior and amazing staff.    I girl called Sofia gave us a tour and let me say she was so lovely by explaining everything and showing us everything.    Next time I will stay here.    Stayed April 2016
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Gitana D wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Title: A true sample of excellent hospitality!
Review_Text: Without doubt is one of my favorite hotel I have ever stayed at. We stayed here for 3 nights and we didn't want to leave. It feels like at home even thought that hotel is quite big but you do not feel that. The reception stuff is very helpful and friendly. The stuff by swimming pool is very efficient they always finds you the best "spot" to relax brings the towels in few seconds. The room we stayed was simple amazing (the suite) overlooking the Atlas mountains and the pool. Room service is very great. Special thanks to Mimouni from room service (i hope I remember his name correctly) He was serving us Sunday nigh: very friendly super professional has answer to all your questions very good adviser in the wine selections!!! The breakfast is just amazing: sooo big variety and the choice. Everything is served fresh and tasty. At breakfast there is lady Fatima who make an amazing Marcian pancakes with very warm and nice smile she always puts in your plate the hot pancake from the pan :) The terrace of breakfast area is fabulous!!!  This hotel has an amazing restaurent L'orangeria! Highly recommended to try.  We truly enjoyed our stay at this hotel and for sure if will travel again to Marrakech without any doubts we will stay again in this marvelous hotel!!!    Thanks for Aziza in the reception for very prompt and clear communication via emails!!!

I travelled to Marrakech with my daughter for a long weekend. I have to say that there wasn't one day when something went wrong due to bad service. Day one: on arrival we were met my rude reception staff. It took at least 30 mins to check in and get a room key (even though there was hardly any other people checking in at that time). We were given a room worth a double bed having already paid for a twin room. We tried to call the reception from the room but the phone just rang and rang. We therefore had to go back downstairs wait again for the rude reception staff and finally get a key to a room with twin beds. Day two: our room phones didn't work so couldn't order room service. We asked for them to mend the phones and they didn't. We arrive back from an early dinner and my daughter wanted some ice cream and they said they had run out! We also realised on our return that our twin beds had been made into a double bed whilst we were out! We had to wait until 11.30pm for someone to change the bed back. Day three: still didn't mend our phones despite asking twice again. Again no ice cream (although in the hotel brochure they prided themselves on their "butler" service where they can arrange "anything for you discreetly" to ensure your stay is amazing etc). They finally mended the phones and we ordered room service for dinner to be bought to our room. They failed to collect the empty table with left over food and we had to call them three times to collect the table before we could go to sleep. Day four: started off with having to find one of the ladies that clean the room to get more Rolet roll shower gel and cotton wall before we left the room . Lunch around the pool - my daughters chicken kebab was raw and they refused to take it off the bill initially (had to speak to two different managers before they agreed to remove it from the bill). Day five: ran out of sun tan cream and they refused to open the in hotel shop. Suggested I walk to the supermarket 10 minutes away to buy some.    Please don't stay here. It really is absolutely dreadful. Not worth the money. The service around the pool is slow the rooms need an overhaul and the drinks and food are ridiculously expensive.

Review_Date: shafiq M wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: Loved this hotel. Beds are the best in the world.  Near all the resources and markets. spas. My wife and I enjoyed this trip.  There was no problem in any part of the jurnery there.  I would recommend this place

Review_Title: Terrible service! NOT A FIVE STAR HOTEL
Review_Text: Since we arrive Ananita at reception was ineficient finding our reservation and after 30 minutes she cleared the situation she start taking care of other guest that had just arrived! INCREDIBLE ATTITUDE not even an excuse! We went out for dinner and when we arrive at 11 pm the room lights didn't work soooo after 15 minutes in the room phone and nobody answer I decided to go down to reception and found that it was time of changing the turn and they were just chatting between each other and doesn't take care of the phone less for the guests! As I claimed the guy that was lwaving just took his note book and left and told me that he was not working anymore!!! And Mohammed that was now in charge just told me "calm down I have just arrived and it's not my problem" VERY GOOD ANSWER FOR A SUPPOSED FIVE STAR HOTEL". After arguing they sent me a maintenance worker to my room number 340 that he just told me what I knew: thenlights are not working I will try to fix them! After 30 minutes this is 12 am he hasn't come back again maybe with this kind of service tomorrow I'll be lucky and receive that is supossed I paid for: GOOD ATENTION!! In few words: The hotel is nice in the building but personal has no idea how they have to treat the guests in a five star hotel! And by the way: no manager in duty available at 2 pm and either and less at 11 pm!! SOFITEL COUNTRY MANAGER WHERE ARE YOU.??

Review_Date: Amr M wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: It was a very nice luxurious hotel room was spacious & great the staff is very nice  The food was amazing in the hotel restaurant (the local food was great  the sushi cuisine & the Italian cuisine) actually the restaurant serves different tastes with different cultures & the so lounge at night was amazing for those who enjoy night life I strongly recommend this lounge.  room needs some facilities like kettle complimentary tea & coffee  If I will visit marrakech again definitely I'll stay in Sofitel again

We have enjoyed the swimming pool during half a day.  The medium size pool is heated perfect to enjoy a swim during winter.  The service is good. We have been placed at a perfect location.  On the other side we have tried the food and it has been served cold... That doesn't worth the price.  Last but not least if you want to find a quiet place It's not the one. There is too many noisy people. It seems that this Sofitel is now the place to be seen by French people. By consequence you will know all about their life in a short period...  Hope that's not the case every week.  In conclusion our experience was good but not at the level expected.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Deema K wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: This hotel is just amazing i loved the pool area  the rooms were very nice with amazing balcony  bed was so comfortable and most importantly the breakfast was very good .also this hotel is great for shisha lovers as they have an amazing shisha place in the lobby.

Stay at this five star hotel for my four day vacation day 1 had my room changed because no heating leaking water and telephones weren't working took 5 hours to get me to a new room another 3 hours to sort out the bed in new room. Day two pool guys were only interested in serving a certain type of gender food was cold and staff lacking manners and an understanding of English. Day 3 went to breakfast came back to a pungent chemical smell in my room which kept me out for the whole day due to them laying new carpet in the room next and using adhesive to stick it down! Day 4 resting from the ordeal and couldn't wait to fly home.

We enjoyed our stay at the Sofitel as we were looking for a larger hotel which a larger pool. The rooms were comfortable as were the sun loungers. The Concierge was extremely helpful and generally found the staff extremely friendly. Our only gripe was the cost of the food. We used to sit at the pool side restaurant were the food was adequate but very highly priced. I ordered a simple piece of grilled chicken and white rice and was charged gourmet prices. The evening bars were fun however and we enjoyed the Moroccan evening in lovely surroundings.

Review_Title: Central, nice beds and breakfast...and great heated pool!
Review_Text: I stayed 3 nights in this hotel during the Marrakech Biennale in February 2016 after having discovered this hotel in December 2015.  The situation in l'Hivernage outside the Medina is very central just 5minutes from the Mamounia for instance. It has a car access.  There are 2 parts: The Sofitel Lounge & Spa (more modern) and The Sofitel Imp√©rial (with Moroccan decoration). Both are confortable not "waouh" but ok.  The So beds are very bery confortable as in all Sofitels the wifi works perfectly and the breakfast is really nice and with a huge choice of fruits breads eggs etc.  The best part is obviously the garden and the heated pool (on the Imp√©rial side). The other pool is not heated! Around them you'll find confortable sunbeds and hamacs perfect to relax.  The hammam + Moroccan scrub (500 Dhs/30min) is nicely done but for a better more charming and cheaper treatment the Sultana (in the Medina) is a better option if you have time.

Review_Title: One of the bet in Marrakech
Review_Text: I like the facade of this hotel. Quite interesting with some red sculptures of animals. The hotel is also nice at night. The breakfast was very sumptuous. Its quite accessible to some other hotel sites. Everyone was so polite. The room was quite comfortable. The linens were as what I expected. Good comfy feeling.

Review_Date: Laura A wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Text: visit the sofitel 2 or 3 times a year usually with my own guests. in leaves everyone i bring feeling like they have experienced a mini slice of heaven food is sublimed. d√©cor is excellent staff are okay. would highly recommend. The interior of some rooms don't always stand up to the rest of the hotel.    I sign up to the membership club every-time I come which is literally twice a year i never receive an email or anything. I usually always come with at least 2 other people on one occasion 5 if there is a travel club it would be nice to know I dont fully understand why I sign the same thing over and over    Other then that I highly recommend this hotel.

Review_Date: Dan D wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Title: Nice hotel but check prices before you buy
Review_Text: We have a lovely 5 days here but were shocked when they had added mini bar items to our bill which we hadn't had. I stayed once before and the same thing happened. Also check the prices if ordering anything from the pool bar. We were charged ¬£8.50 for a fruit juice!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: So sad to leave this wonderful City had the pleasure of staying at the Sofitel for the second time and my was everything just as fabulous as I remembered.  8 of my girlfriends were welcomed into the hotel by the wonderful staff with smiley faces and extremely helpful in assisting with all our baggage.    When I approached the concierge desk I was so pleased to be welcomed by the wonderful Mr Reda Benjaroud he is the Head Concierge. I remembered him from my visit in 2012 how Reda was impeccable with his great organisational skills and recommending all the best nightspots and attractions to visit.    This trip was a special one as we were celebrating my best friends 50th! The hotel made our stay so comfortable and Reda organised everyday for us adding touches to make it even more special for us all.    We were all very sad to leave and cannot wait to go back to the Sofitel soon.    Well done to all the staff and Adil  Azbik who helped us out when Reda was on leave.    See you all very soon . üòÉ

Just got back from our 5days stay here was sad to leave :(    Was around 6.30 after travelling just 2miles took 5mins from the airport the sun had set the hotel was at its best lit up  like a pretty pink castle we were greeted at the entrance by  the welcoming staff.    Check in was fast and efficient looking around the hotel it was stunning pristine and the citrus oil smell in the air as you walked through was so uplifting.    Are room was large decor was lovely had a nice size balcony we  quickly freshened up and went down to the So Lounge for dinner and shisha perfect place to chill and relax on a evening.    Breakfast was a slight disappointment which was included in  our stay but for people paying daily it is quite pricey for what you get so many pastries deserts freshly made crepes which i love but the cooked breakfast area was a let down only serving fresh eggs nothing to accompany with it no bacon (or halal version) tomatoes  mushrooms hash browns beans the  little things you miss eating while away other that that the staff  were efficient and you were never left waiting to be seated.    Pools were large plenty of day beds to sunbathe was quiet in  the week but as the weekend approached got very busy around  the heated pool area as the other larger pools were cold.  Service was slow most of the time and asking for something brought to you took several requests and telling different pool  staff which got annoying.    Checked out the So Spa very beautiful the facilities were good has gorgeous pool good steam hamman room and sauna never had any treatments there so cant comment i struggled to find the time but can imagine they would have been first class.    The hotel is very well situated in the Hivernage District you  have the casino round the corner the Menara Mall nearby  great restaurants & nightlife close to the Koutoubia Mosque Souks and Medina.    Thoroughly enjoyed my stay here at this hotel the the only  regret i have was not bringing my children with me i would definitely stay here again wouldn't stay anywhere else.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: tracy c wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Text: Hotel is so lovely. Breafast was amazing . staff very helpful welcoming. Out rooms was really nice . everything was perfect . we have booked to go back to Marrakech again . but this time we needed a room for 3 girl adults . and unfortunately sofitel spa and lounge doesn't have rooms for 3 . so we have booked the Savoy le grand .and hoping it's as nice as the sofitel .

One of the best hotels in Africa that I have been to.  The location service environment and price is just unbeatable.  I would recommend this hotel to everyone as it's just Wow.  They have shisha and two pools.  One thing I enjoyed but maybe not everyone will is that you can smoke in the lobby as most hotels in Morocco

This hotel is not up to the level of the Sofitel brand. The room I had was dirty: stained carpet hairs... at least the bed was pristine. The furniture is old and it shows and my room had badly fixed fixtures (lamps and hairdryer). On top of it my balcony gave onto an ugly side street with the wonderful noise of a big aircon unit... Finally the service was patchy. Some people were very nice but other not at all. Upon leaving the night clerk tried to rob me on the change "forgetting" to hand over some dirhams after I had paid cash in euros... This hotel needs a makeover.

Review_Date: natalia a wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Text: this is a magical place in morocco  we had a reat moments in this hotel  and it was magical and so amazing  the pool was fantastic the activities was amazig  serice and food was excellent  best place

After a rough start and several problems guest relation manager mr soufiane mazzouj took personal care about our issues! I nightmare become a dream out of 1001 Arabic nights! He and his team show us true Moroccoian hospitality! Thanks to him we keep our stay as a memorable one! One time more communication is the key for everything! His understanding of being guest relationship manager should be the base to recruit new ones ! Great stay great staff wonderful country and city! Cheers from Sven and Amro

Beautiful hotel and scenery we went for my husbands birthday and got Very bad service. Reception Made us feel very uncomfortable and unwelcome the hotel restaurant kept on forgetting our order and we couldn't wait to go back home üëéüèª wouldn't recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: hashim o wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Title: Not quite So Sofitel - just to visit and not to stay?
Review_Text: The Sofitel Marrakech is an opulent property and the look and feel was awesome. However for such a pricey hotel the overall ‚Äúsoftware‚Äù was rather disappointing due to inconsistencies in service levels and attention to details. My so-called quiet privilege suite (273) was overlooking the workers quarters and face directly the roadside. The suite looks old and jaded. After a flurry of activities I was transferred to a better junior suite (427) which was a lot more comfortable albeit a smaller one. The standard of housekeeping needs improvement. There were many signs in both rooms that the rooms had not been properly cleaned. For example in both rooms used coffee capsules were still stuck in the coffee machines. Perhaps they didn‚Äôt know how? At times there was only one service staff at the front desk for a long stretch of time. A phone call to reception asking for help was abruptly interrupted without any ‚Äúun instant svp".  However the staff were generally very friendly. I felt that the standard of service during my stay was not because of lack of trying. It was obvious to me that they seemed to be doing so much of fire-fighting to get things done. One staff Monsieur Ouessman stood above the rest in trying to make things work for me - but there was so much a person can do if the system was not in place. I also appreciated the group of porters and doormen who were all smiles helpful and full of charm all day long.

Review_Title: It is a good option but it is not a 5 stars
Review_Text: Check-in took a lot of time and it seems that the staff is not well coordinated. Rooms are four stars and the four star is about to fall. The hotel could have been a very nice hotel some 5-10 years ago but now it is aging with no visible renovations. Breakfast is poor for the price they charge. Pool facilities are nice and comfortable with lots of place to rest and it is very calm.  In general It is overpriced for what for the net quality that it is offered.

Review_Title: Be aware of poor service and an arrogant attitude plus out of date. Not 5 star.
Review_Text: Sofitel need to abandon this property if it wishes to maintain any thought of running reasonable hotels. The property built in 202 is so out of date it is beyond a joke. we had 2 rooms on the 3rd floor. Views were not good as they over looked the street. The balcony was ok but as with the rest of the room about 10 to 15% too small. The lighting in the room is terrible. Probably one of the worst we have experienced. Who ever designed these rooms should be shot!  Furniture in the room is appalling. The quality and design is horrible. All needs to be thrown out and replaced with a better quality and design. All the cushions on the furniture in the room and balcony needs replacing as they have stains all over. A lot of space wasted. No coffee or tea making facilities and this is supposed to be 5 star. What rubbish. Lack of sockets. There is just 1 in front of the desk and 1 by the side of the bed. This of course is too few. Why are they not International sockets instead of European only. Any decent hotel would use such sockets. Not up to date at all.  Bathroom is also too small and only a shower within the bath. This is so dangerous and only should be in a 2 star hotel if at all. The plumbing has some issues as the water goes from scalding to cold and back again. This shows an issue with the construction. The bathroom is dirty with damaged fittings which could easily be replaced if the managers here cared at all.  The breakfast at MAD 250 (Euro 23) is to be avoided as it is rubbish.  As others have commented the staff are arrogant and totally inefficient - Colonial influence? who knows but this place is over staffed and reflects on a very weak management who cannot train them.  The hotel doesn't really know what it wants to be very strange layout in lobby which makes no sense and there is no main focal point as there are 2 reception desks.  Even in the lobby I have seen more than 12/14 staff just walking around doing nothing over staffed with poor training.  Potentially this could be an enjoyable hotel but with lack of service and low quality of fittings and equipment 3 stars is what it should be. Management have said that renovation will happen in 2016. If it does it is 5 years too late.

Review_Date: hassan h wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Text: My wife and I booked this hotel for a 5 days stay everything is lovely but someone forget to inform the gate keeper that not all African people are either the hotel singers or else we were constantly asked this question which completely ruined our enjoyment couldn't wait to get out at the end. Good hotel but rather short sighting hotel staff if you are other than caucasian.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: nash d wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Text: Loved this hotel. Wish we stayed here more. We had to go to sahara so couldn't stay longer but worth the price and ambiance was great. Excellent service. Very helpful people. We had to park our car for 2 nights beyond our stay at hotel they were ready to let us park our car. Pool area and bar was excellent.

Review_Date: Zola L wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Text: 4 stars  1 star quality of service  I actually lost my sport t-shirt while swimming in the warmed pool in the spa  The staff denied that they found it  I called the reception she answers me that some guests some times stool things looool that was the best jock to close 2015 lool  In the 2nd time there while check in the reception guy tried to stool 200 drhm extra money from me but I was already aware about it so    The African guy in the pool lounge called OMAR is the best in the hotel staff  I'm not going back there smelly toilets n garden  Horrible experience

Review_Date: Tarek D wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: We were staying at a local riad and decided to spend a day by the pool. We tried Sofitel and four seasons. We found Sofitel more suited to our family (3 young kids) as it was a little more relaxed a little busier and the heated pool was more suited to children. Entrance and food prices were also much less at the Sofitel - we were quoted 300 per adult for entrance and half price for kids. Poolside bar prices were reasonable and quality was very good. Would definitely return.

Review_Date: Debbie P wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Title: Great pools but not 5 star service
Review_Text: We stayed for 4 nights in October 2015. The hotel itself is in a great location as is only a 10 minute walk from the Medina and the pools were fantastic. The food was also great and we enjoyed the variety of food at breakfast. Unfortunately the reception service let the hotel down. The reception desk was frequently unmanned and on our final day we waited 30 minutes for towels to be taken to the temporary room we were given to change in and after chasing twice we had to give up waiting. Overall we enjoyed our stay but it let itself down in a few areas.

Review_Date: NAMAN S wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: We were travelling in a group of 20 people. Everything was horrible right from the check in experience. The staff at the reception were showing a lot of attitude. The bell boys asked us to take our own luggage. However the person who took the cake was the guy staffing the concierge. He only seemed interested in selling certain restaurants and organising a day tour out of which he could earn commission. His writing was completely illegible and he had attitude which never seemed to end. The guy was extremely rude. The manager gave us an excuse that they are running quite busy. They certainly did not charge less. What a terrible excuse! That too coming from the manager of the hotel. Carpets in the corridors were stinky and shabby. Bathrooms date back to generations and one has to step into the tub to take a shower! Would definitely suggest avoiding.

Review_Title: More of a 4* than a 5* hotel
Review_Text: The gardens the caf√© and the pool area were nice but the rooms could have been way better - they definitely need renovation. Service was ok except for when we had to ask a couple of times for toiletries in the room.

I just adored it. Everything is extremely perfect. The staff is great. The so lounge is epic. I spent such a wonderful time in it. It was worth it. I can't wait to be back. Everything is so nice from the garden to the swimming pool to the rooms. Loved it loved it loved it.

Review_Date: Zara H wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: We did not stay in this hotel but went here for shisha. The set up was insanely pretty and it is the perfect place to come to with your friends after a long day and wind down. Relaxed atmosphere and amazing views of the hotel. It was better than a lot of the other lounges we visited!!

With a spacious lobby and special group reception area the Sofitel looks every bit a modern 5-star hotel sleek and brightly lit from floor to ceiling windows. Upon arrival our tour group was greeted with the customary hot mint tea. For our included breakfast we had a buffet assortment that was delicious as well as beautifully presented. The pastries were the flakiest I have ever tasted and there is a good selection of meats and cheeses dried and fresh fruits cereals yogurt eggs cooked to order and assorted breads. Getting coffee seemed to be tricky as we waited for what seemed to be an eternity for a waiter to come by to offer coffee. When none came by we then had to go searching for one and request coffee. The first day it actually took about half an hour before we got a pot brought to our table. The second and third days saw us more proactive and we asked a waiter straight away for coffee so our wait was only about 5 minutes since they make each carafe French-press and fresh. Lunch buffets were quite spectacular with dishes representing just about every cuisine. There were selections for sushi tagines pizzas sandwiches pastas desserts and cheeses. While our tour group provided one lunch with our package we balked at the 450 dirham price (about $45 US at 10 MAD=1USD exchange) on our own the next day.    Our room 355 was spacious with a king bed and sitting area. The roomy balcony furnished with banquette seating a small bistro table and 2 chairs overlooked the pool. The bathroom with large tub/shower was well-lit and supplied with high quality toiletries. Despite these first class amenities the hotel room wall was paper thin. I could hear the French couple next door enjoying a very amorous afternoon rendezvous. Nevertheless the hotel is beautiful and not only did we get bottled water gratis we could get sparkling water gratis. The air conditioning worked well so that our room was cool despite the 107 F (41 C) outside.

Review_Date: Emmy H wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: We stayed for 3 nights and we had a lovely time. They have everything you need even an arm machine. They have bars restaurants spa and many swimming pools. Someone play instrument every evening in the lobby. They have an art area like a gallery which is my favourite. The hotel is in a nice quiet area and it is about 20 mins (30mins according to google) walk to the local market square.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tiare A wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: After staying in elegant ryads and hotels in the Moroccan countryside the Sofitel in Marrakech was a shock to the senses. The decor was over the top with no apparent rhyme or reason. The black bull statue with the bright red unmentionables at the entrance is a good indicator of what you're in for at least on the interior design front. However my travel companion and I grew to love our comfortable room; the hundreds of chirping birds that roosted in the colorful bougainvillieas; the gorgeous pools; the mesmerizing fire pit and the sweet staff at the restaurant. One disturbing note: in the nicely appointed outdoor children's area a lone monkey was tied to a cage. The poor fellow looked quite sad and seemed to yearn for freedom.

Review_Date: Dagoff Koda wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Title: Loved this hotel. Great rooms and really really friendly staff
Review_Text: Such beautiful rooms and lobby and gardens the hotel is surely the other imperial palace in Marrakech. Everything was so easy and nothing was a bother. But the real treat were the wonderful pool guys. They're soo sooo friendly and ever so eager to come to meet for special party to make special friends. We had a great time and they even showed me some special places outside the hotel to smoke cultural things and they showed me big party too.  I love this hotel so much.

Review_Date: Traveling S wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: I have been staying at the sofitel for 3 days now. So far I have changed room three times the first because myself and my husband were given separate beds the second because we were placed in an 'upgrade' located directly above the niteclub and now in the third which is in the older part of the hotel overlooking the pool it's absolutly lovely. All of this is fine except when I tried to change rooms I was left on hold for what could have been forever because the guy on the phone had no intention of helping. Met a differerent staff member at the desk who was very helpful. Next day we went to the gym I wanted to use the pool and my husband the gym that was lovely when we went to leave we were met by an employee who very rudely let us know that the pool is not free to use strange as it is located directly beside the gym and I was led into it by another member of staff. Again that would be fine a simple mistake but the attitude of the staff member was terrible his behavier made us both feel very uncomfortable just not what you'd expect from a five star. I have been to Marrakech many times and am used to the 'you take you pay extra' attitude that has come from an abundant tourist trade but I have also stayed in much nicer hotels such as la Mamunia where the staff will bend over backwards to ensure you enjoy your stay. Considering that is a 5 star hotel based on nothing but it's hospitality I would give this hotel 2 stars. You'll know what I mean if you do end up staying here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tim C wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: Spent 5 nights and what a fantastic hotel. Great location great staff (expect the reception) pool area is fantastic. Food and drink very good especially the breakfast would highly recommend to anybody if you are going to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Percy Potter wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: A lovely hotel with helpful and attentive staff. The upgrade to the junior suite was well worth the extra cost.  The only downside so far seems to be the extortionate cost of the spa and drinks approx ¬£9 for a glass of wine and a bottle of fizzy water so we dare not eat here.  The Menara Mall is only a 10 minute walk as are a few local restaurants.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Olivier P wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: the hotel in an overall aspect is very nice and clean. the service for the most part is helpful and friendly. however be careful there is no flexibility to switch bookings. we are on a paragliding trip in marocco and as you can imagine very dependent on the weather. we had booked two suites for Saturday through Wednesday with the intention to move to the coast towards the end of the week. due to adverse weather in marrakech region and favorable ones on the coast early in the week we asked to move two nights back toward the end of the week in order to fly by the coast on monday to Thursday. the staff showed no flexibility at all despite the hotel confirming there were free rooms. in fact as per the staff at reception the only reason we could not shift the dates was due to the fact that we had already paid for our stay and that their computer would not allow then to move the dates. in a way this is the result of lack of humanity in these bigger chains and at the time really made us wish we had been staying in a more local/hands on riad.

Review_Date: Amal D wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: We stayed here for 4 days great service from all the staff .boys around the heated pool were great all smiles and very helpful . Atol from room service was great helped with were to go and what too do he would be a great tour guide will definitely be going back. Thank you for great time.

Review_Title: Good hotel however customer service is very bad
Review_Text: Its a nice hotel but customer services are really bad....main reception staff is very rude and not helpful at all... we had guests making complain about it aswell..  I have been standing at reception and all the staff were busy chatting with each other and ignoring me completely...they just dont want to deal with their clients...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tanya P wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: Just returned from our 4 nite honeymoon at this hotel. It was our first experience of 5* and what a wonderful experience it was from start to finish. If you looking for a 5* hotel that is in a very good location and provides luxury and pleasure this is it. Don‚Äôt always rely on others reviews; go with your gut instinct which is what I did. Yes things do go wrong from time to time when you trying to cater for and accommodate so many guests with different expectations.    What sets this hotel aside from any other I have ever been to is the way they deal with errors and misfortunes. If you have the misfortune of something going wrong then I know the man for the job. The ‚Äúguest relations manager‚Äù SOUFIANE MAZZOUJK is a true asset to this hotel. Don‚Äôt rely on the receptionists‚Äô to fix the problems don‚Äôt be too quick to pick up a phone and complain. Go into reception and request to see Soufiane he is the most dedicated; friendliest; helpful gentleman and he just couldn‚Äôt do enough for us. We unfortunately had a room problem on day one which was dealt with and rectified in the most professional manner. I‚Äôm so glad we did or we would never have had the pleasure of meeting him. We would definitely recommend this hotel to any age group with or without families. It was truly a magical experience and we will defiantly stay here again.    ‚ÄúSh‚Ä¶t happens‚Ä¶ its how you deal with it that matters‚Äù!!    Well done Soufiane we loved you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at Sofitel for 5 nights. The rooms are spacious but a bit old. Bathroom was especially worn and need renovation. The staff is very polite and super serviceminded. The breakfast is very nice. We are very satsified with our stay and hope the rooms are renovated next time we come here!

We were able to get a reservation last minute as we changed our original itinerary. This luxury hotel is beautiful but: the toilet did not work well the shower did not drain well (we stood in 3 inches of water while showering) the hair dryer barely had a breeze and another in the closet did not fit any plug there was trash outside our balcony a cabinet did not close all the way the luggage rack was worn and worst there was loud music outside our window from an event at the hotel. I called the desk at about 8 pm and was told it would be taken care of and the woman would call me back. She did not. An hour later I called again and was told it would end at 10 pm. It did not. They finally ended the party at 11 pm. Considering the prices and the Sofitel reputation this was really inexusable. (We had checked in and undressed and showered and were there for only one night which is why we did not request another room.) When we came down to breakfast I gave a list of the problems to someone at reception and said that I think they should give some consideration to reduce the bill. Didn‚Äôt happen. The breakfast was great though. I would not recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: kulsuma f wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: Unexpected things happy but the service and how staff responds to such occurancr is what defines a 5 star hotel from the rest. After a long day of travelling all i wanted was to freshen but alas No water in hotel and worse yet no toilet facilities. No alternative arrangements and staff who don't communicate or worse don't know what to do. Asked for bottled water so I could at least wash my hands but slow or rather no response. Eventually found a helpful member of staff but really service geberally wasnt up to scratch. Dissapointing start to what was meant to be a birthday treat. Had to go along to a local restaurant to freshen up. Unacceptable and really a big let down.

The hotel is in a good location and has a really good atmosphere. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The pool area is large with plenty of room to relax. The only let down is breakfast service which is slow and inattentive and because you have to find your own table can be frustrating at busy times

I spent 2 nights in this hotel. I had booked on internet directly on the Accor website. This hotel is made of 2 hotels the more traditional one and the more modern one. I was upgraded to a suite in the traditional side of the hotel (platinum card) and my room was really nice overlooking one of the 3 swimming pools (Room 202). I was also introduced to my butler Zacharia a very kind able and knowledgeable man. He gave me his mobile number and I was asked to call him for assistance from transportation to restaurant bookings. It worked very well. I really loved the swimming pool. One can enjoy a Chicha (pipe) on the terrace. There are shops and a great disco open at weekends with a great atmosphere. I highly recommend this place for business travelers families etc...    Special Thanks to Zacharia who really worked hard to make my stay a great success.

Review_Date: christine l wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: I booked this hotel for my Hen Do and we were not disappointed. Not your usual hen Do location but the hotel was pure luxury the staff could not do enough for us. The Spa was excellent and accommodated our group of 10 women so well the traditional Turkish Scrub was fabulous. The Breakfast was simply the best quality and variety I have ever seen and beautifully presented. The Pool area was 5 star I would recommend to anyone and will definitely return

The pool and breakfast are great as is the location and ambience. If you require something done in your room don't expect it to happen. We asked for 2 extra towels and they have yet to arrive despite calling housekeeping and stopping at the desk twice. Turn down service is not regular and they do not provide washcloths. Finally we reported the volume on the TV was not working. One might assume this was something that could easily be attended to....not so. We asked to speak to the manager and left after waiting almost 10 minutes when told he would be right with us. I am guessing there are better hotels in the area that really deliver 5 star service. We are here for 4 days and 3 nights and are disappointed.

I stayed at the Sofitel lounge & spa for 2 weeks. Average to be fair the only good points are the pools & sky lounge bar. Not five star!! I found some of the clientele a bit odd you need to experience it to understand. The staff are ok but needs refining I appreciate the assistance from Atoul Marie-Helen. Don't get view to the streets the noise is a nightmare. The place is great if you want to party (club next door) hence the attraction from a more dodgy clientele. The area is good I would stay again in the same area but not the Sofitel. Sorry! Lovely boutique called Max & Jan (spent a fortune!) nice staff! Strange vibe overall I think the owner needs some work!

Everything about the hotel just oozes class and glamour without being over pretentious. Rooms are spacious beds very comfortable and the sunbeds around the pool just lovely. And the spa treatments and area very relaxing.    Service was a somewhat slow and staff at the reception desk were actually quite dismissive and rude at times. However aside from this (which I hope would be looked at) the hotel was faultless.

Review_Date: Quintus S wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: I had a cocktail with a friend on the terrace after my friend left I odered a glass of white wine after 20 min I did not received a thing could not even get the attention of the waiters I had to get up and ask for my bill. It is such a beautiful detting just a pitty the service does not match

Review_Title: A very nice hotel in walking distance to the city centre
Review_Text: A very nice luxury hotel with great indoor swimming-pools and lovely greenery & flowers as well as very helpful & friendly staff. This was our first time in Marrakesh and did enjoy the hotel facilities. It is great that you can reach the city center just on foot or you can take a horse-drawn carriage.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I was one of my best travels ever the weather was fantastic with a hot shiny sun even if i couldn't go out sometimes beacause of it. But basicly i enjoyed very much bein there. My hotel was really good too.

Review_Title: Lovely hotel and excellent customer service
Review_Text: We really enjoyed our visit to this hotel . It looked as good as all the pictures we had seen . The staff were really friendly and went out of our way to accommodate our needs. The hotel is in a good location for sight seeing as well . I would definitely go back to this hotel !!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We came to So Lounge at the Sofitel for our last night in Marrakech. We chose to sit outside on a comfy sofa near to one of the bars. The DJ played really good songs RnB and the drinks are reasonably priced I never got to spend long here as I had to catch my flight home but it is somewhere I would visit again.

Review_Date: Glenn Stuart L wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: I would advise people not to stay at this hotel or any Accor branded hotels. We planned a Easter getaway and made a reserve payment when we arrived. We then settled up when we finished our stay and it transpired that they charged us twice (c.‚Ç¨1000). We thought they could refund this easily but this has not been the case and after 5 months of correspondence they have been unable to refund us the money despite saying they would do so. I have stayed at a number of Accor hotels in Mauritius and Paris and this is the last time I am going to use them.    The lack of customer service and attention to detail indicates they are behind the curve and there are many other hotels that would love to have my business and those of others. I did not want to have to make as post but it appears the only action and so that I can warn others. Hopefully they will learn from this experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing service lovely hotel thank you Sofitel
Review_Text: We stayed here in August 2015 we are a family of 4.  The hotel is lovely with lots of very helpful attentive staff.  The pool areas are beautiful and well managed. Our rooms clean and as expected from a hotel of this calibre.  The beds and pillows are so so comfortable!  However a couple of things could have made our experience even better!  A map of the hotel in the room would have been useful as its large and has hidden areas! Sample menus of each restaurant would also have made choosing easier especially as we have one fussy child!....and the hairdryer was pretty useless!  We were looked after very well and on the last day were able to use a courtesy room to shower and change as our flight was in the evening.  Thank you to the staff at Sofitel our holiday was amazing!

Review_Date: Mohammed P wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Text: I stayed at the sofitel between 11th and 18th of august with a group of friends. We had an amazing time after the first night. The holiday started of bad where we was given alternative rooms to the ones we had booked. However due to this mistake me and my friends were offered a complementry dinner at the hotel for free. The next day we was given our deluxe pool view rooms which was absolutely brilliant. The holiday then actually started and we felt part of the hotel. I would like to take this opportunity to say thanks to jehane she is the reason why hotel is doing so well and she makes guest feel welcome. She is the best person to speak to if you have any problems. The location is perfection for the hotel as we allowed to roast only few meters from the hotel at the casino and at the club theatro. The hotel pool area has a great atmosphere and its such a good place to chill and relax. I could go on and say so much more but the hotel is brilliant and after staying here i would not want stay anywhere else. The location is perfect close to everything.    Thanks jehane and all staff for everything ill be back soon to dry roast.

My husband and I spent 10 days in this beautiful hotel. This was our second visit over 2 years. We really enjoyed our stay however the hotel was a lot noisier this year than 2 year ago with loud music being played by the pool every Fri/Sat/Sun. We chose to go back to this hotel because the pool area and loungers were the best we had seen so we're disappointed when they had introduced a "party atmosphere".    We did receive fantastic service the whole time we were there. Nothing was too much trouble. A special mention to our man at the pool Omar. He was very attentive and made sure we wanted for nothing. We would go back to see him for sure!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I‚Äôve just returned from a 4 night stay at the Sofitel Lounge & Spa in Marrakech and already clicking my heels to return. What a fantastic experience! I travelled with 8 other girls who were all equally impressed with the hotel. From the very moment we touched down at the airport we were greeted by the hotel chauffeurs (you have to book this service) who took us to the hotel in executive Mercedes vehicles the check in was painless and the concierge was thorough but quick in explaining the local area.  The rooms were big and decorated and furnished to a high standard. We were on a hen party and our hen and her sister were upgraded to a Junior Suite which had the added benefit of a HUGE terrace and seating area although being completely honest I‚Äôm not sure I would bother paying extra for a suite. The beds were to die for and I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôve ever slept so well! My only comment would be that there‚Äôs very little lighting. A couple of extra lamps would have made all the difference!  The pool area is amazing! The pool is large clean and well maintained the beds are huge and very comfy and you have the added privilege of pre-requesting where you‚Äôd like to sit if you so wish. The pool area is similar to what you would expect to find at a beach club like Nikki beach just without a DJ. The pool food and drinks were fantastic we developed a taste for the cosmopolitan cocktails and ordered several magnums during our stay and they were delicious! And they were very generous with their measures of alcohol.  The food on a whole was to a very good standard with one exception when we dined at Le Jardin restaurant on the first night however we expressed our disappointment and this was dealt with immediately a very lovely and apologetic lady remedied the situation so we still left the restaurant as happy customers. However throughout the rest of our stay the food was great!  Do wonder down to the Spa if you get a chance it really is a beautiful place! We all had a treatment and it was a very relaxing experience. My only criticism would be that I paid for an hour long massage which only lasted 40 minutes.  I have to say the most attractive thing about this hotel is the level of service we experienced. I‚Äôve stayed in many 5 star hotels across the world and I have never known anything like it. Nothing was too much trouble we felt especially looked after by the guest relations manager Soufiane Mazzouj the concierge and our lady who helped us with the restaurant who I believe is called Aida. These people went out of their way to provide us with everything we could possibly want for and made our stay an unforgettable one. They are a credit to the Sofitel brand and I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

I'll start by saying this is the most comfortable hotel I've stayed in the beds are hard to leave behind the loungers at the pool are fab plenty of shade if you want and the staff at the pool are brilliant. It's easier to communicate if you have some french but I found this to be the case all over Marrakesh.    On arrival we went through the usual check in process my friend was asked for a card and handed over her visa debit card. She was then handed the keypad and told to enter her pin. It was only after noticing a guy beside us questioning in the amount that we checked. The staff had preblocked 10000 dirham on her card (roughly 1000 euro) I questioned this amount I was told it was standard and we were staying for such a long time 10 days I don't think is so long. I argued the case and was told if i wanted to run a cash account i could so we agreed and they reversed the charge on my friends card. 5 days later she checked her account and noticed the money hadn't come back onto her account. Se called her bank who said that as Morocco isn't set up for visa debit the money had been refunded to mastercard and it would take 30 days for her funds to be freed. Luckily her bank are helpful and said if we send an email to the bank from the hotel they will clear the block immediately. Simple enough request. It took 24hrs and 5 requests we wasted nearly a full day sitting in reception asking for this to be done only for it to be done wrong 3/4 times. Eventually it was done correctly the next day.    On checking out we made use of the courtesy room which is a great facility but there was 2 of us and 1 towel. we requested towels 4 times and still ended up with none.    The hotel itself is lovely. It's expensive but most hotels are. ‚Ç¨5 for a can of coke and ‚Ç¨20 burgers. The staff let it down and didn't handle what should have been minor problems very well at all.

Although I did not stay in the hotel I have visted the So Good and So Lounge areas of the hotel on a couple of occasions. The hotel grounds are stunning the service is great and food and cocktails are of a high standard. If I return to Marrakesh I would stay here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have been here for 3 days and 2 left keeping thinking it cannot get worse... Well it can! We spent 3 days at essaouira's Sofitel and the difference in services is disconcerting.    Welcome was impersonal and cold - no welcome drink or quick tour of the hotel which we had in essaouira.    Room is ok but on small side. Bed however is very comfortable.    Breakfast buffet is nice and varied however waitresses are unorganised and clearly not trained. You can have 3/4 dealing with the same table and it s simply a waste of time. It seems there is a lot of "supervisors" doing nothing but blowing hot hair.    Food is good and pricey but not more than any other 5 stars; however it is a bit much for the drinks. The hotel being in central Marrakech there are plenty of restaurants around.    Swimming pools are good sized but the area looks stuffy as there are too many beds/ lounges for the area size. However it is always full so they are indeed needed. People not renting a room can use the pool for a fees (700dhr I think) however you can frequently see one of the pool team letting pp stay for a much smaller fees (handshake with a note is NOT discreet). This is an issue for the management however letting pp using the pool when there are not enough beds for the clients seems not well thought. Again staff is not organised/trained and have had to ask to signed the receipt more the once when food/drinks was served a while before. This is again an issue for the management as they cannot charge the client without the signed receipt.    Noise the hotel has a club and hotel is quite noisy when it closed down at around 4/5 in the morning. It took at least 45 mm for security to come and deal with a naked woman yelling for the police while trying to jump over her balcony. When I called the reception I was told security had been sent and was hung up on. Apparently politeness and excuses were too much too expect.    On the good side one of the door man was really helpful when we had an issue with a taxi. Some taxis will try to charge you more because you are a tourist and even more so when staying in a 5 stars hotel. My husband being Moroccan we have not had much issue like this as he knows the tricks and speaks the language but please be sure that the taxi use his meter. The door man came to help and informed the driver that he has his licence number and police will be called if he keep asking for 150dhr for a 20dhr drive. Reminding him that by law he must use his meter.    This will be my first and last stay in this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tom M wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Text: We stayed for 4 nights at the end of July. We were worried about it being crazy busy with it being the school holidays but fortunately found it exceptionally quiet. We arrived very early and our room was not quite ready however we were given a courtesy and we were also told at check in that we had been upgraded.  When we got to our room we found it large bright and airy with a big balcony over looking the pool. The beds were the most comfortable beds we have ever slept in- seriously good sleeping!  We did have an issue with a light which broke and fell in the middle of the night from the ceiling but this was fixed an hour after we mentioned it to reception although the paint cover up was not the same colour as the rest of the ceiling when it was fixed back in.  The pool area and the sunbeds were the best thing about the hotel. Huge double mattresses with plenty or parasols if needed. Towels there ready for you to use so no lugging lots of bags around. The large pool was the perfect temperature and although the hotel is huge there were only a few other people using it. Service was usually quick around the pool however I did order a drink and waited over 45 minutes for it before I got up and cancelled the order as I was leaving.  Drinks in the lobby also took an exceptionally long time to arrive and not the best service.  Breakfast was great. Our waitress remembered us each day by name and came ready with what she remembered to be our favourite juice and choice of tea/coffee. The breakfast was great although it was lacking in the cooked breakfast area (no sausages or bacon on offer).  The location is great because it is outside of the Medina but you can walk there easily within 15 minutes. We preferred this as the Medina can be pretty hectic and not necessarily what you want each time you step out the front of the hotel.  We got a great deal on the hotel through travelbag website. Things in the hotel are fairly expensive but no more than you'd expect from any other 4/5 star hotel.  Tip: brush up on your French as some people don't speak English well at all.  Thanks Sofitel for a lovely stay. We'd definitely go back for a relaxing stay
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fine but still things that shouldn't be in a 5 stars hotel...
Review_Text: - Stains on the floor of the rest room near the seat...    - TV Channels local channels are ok but no international channels I can see the label of the channels but no feed (Black Screen).    - Smells of cigarette on the Spa side...    - Accord highest grade platinum card is useless holders have to queue with others even if they've a dedicated desk the dedicated platinum desk is empty and no special care so don't bother even saying that you have one since you'll be considered as a non holder guy anyway...    - Taxi cab rip off for a dinner outside near by the counter was not activated and I was asked 100DH (~10USD) which is actually 3 to 4 times the regular price he asked us 150DH for a return trip which I declined...  I was expecting that asking for a cab trough the hotel staffwe'll be somehow protected from this since the hotel would have a filtered list of drivers...    All the rest was good the staff was nice which made me set the rating to average after all...  Generic copy and paste apology email right below:  ---Start here----
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful hotel, great location however terrible service...
Review_Text: My friends and I visited the Sofitel Lounge and Spa in Marrakech during the month of June. The hotel itself is beautiful I was very impressed by the look of the hotel the d√©cor the pool and the outdoor furniture. I have to note however that in the rooms the furniture is old and the carpet is dirty you get the feel that you are staying in an old room which needs cleaning and refurnishing.  The location of the hotel is great the surrounding area is clean and pretty and there are a number of famous restaurants/cafes and shops close by.  There are three pools at the hotel which I think is one of the strong points of this hotel the pools are lovely and the surrounding area is great very spacious and relaxing.  The level of service that we witnessed is what made me and my friends decide that we wouldn't come back it became very tiring when you have to ask for something a few times and wait for a long time.  It may be ok and we stay patient when it is one or two days however this happened every day of our 7 days stay at the hotel. another thing is hygiene there were a few times that I found my cutlery and water glasses dirty at breakfast and in my room.  There are a number of incidents which happened that I do not want to mention.  As mentioned above the hotel is beautiful however due to our experience I do no think I would stay there again.

Review_Date: Stewart B wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Title: Great service, comfort and decent prices
Review_Text: This was a surprise birthday trip from my lovely wife so it was all out of the blue. The old adage - you learn about the service of place when they are dealing with problems was so true of Sofitel. We were initially given a room which rather cramped and with twin beds rather than the double requested. Within 30 minutes we'd been moved to a really nice 4th floor balcony room with a huge bed. Food was great - the buffet at 350DH was terrific value and service close by without being obsequious. The concierge sorted out putting two extra holes in my belt (am losing weight) in an instant. Our night out in town to eat was such a disappointment in contrast - two attempts and leaving both early after crap service and poor food - that we stayed home the rest of the short trip. Our trip was during Ramadan so a little unusual but we liked the low numbers in the hotel and relaxed approach around the pool and restaurant.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: William B wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Title: Great hotel, very peaceful and relaxing.
Review_Text: This hotel was very clean and the room was of high standard. The pool area was just great with a choice of pools and it was very relaxing and peaceful. Although the breakfast was very good with plenty of choice the rest of the food was ok but expensive and lacking in choice. Drinks were very expensive. Overall we enjoyed our stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Could have just stayed in the hotel
Review_Text: The grounds and pool areas are gorgeous. Very peaceful and relaxing and beautifully clean. There is a choice of pools the lunch menu is not cheap but be warned the portion sizes are large and alcohol is very expensive. The breakfast is fabulous with a huge selection. We were in a party of ten people and we were all very happy with the breakfast. The hotel itself is delightful and uniquely decorated the hotel photos do not do it justice. I would consider going back here for a winter break.

This is the first negative review I've written. I won't even due to space and interest include all the issues we ran into during this trip.  Like most hotels they take a swipe of your credit card upon arrival. Here it is a hefty 3000mad (¬£208). On checkout day I was advised that this  fee was un-required and would therefore be refunded. One week later I checked my account and there was no refund. I telephoned the hotel and was  advised that the refund had been made and it was the credit card companies fault and to wait at least ten days for the credit to appear. Ten days later still  no refund so I telephone once again. I am told that the refund has once again been made and that they will email me the receipt as some kind of proof. I have never received any emails. This is now in the hands of my credit card company raised as a dispute claim.    We had numerous issues with the hotel during our stay. firstly the TV and hairdryer did not work. I reported the TV as a fault four times over two days  and at each time was informed it would be dealt with asap. Funny thing is on two of those occasions the reception clerk didn't even ask for my room number. I had  to suggest to them that said room number would prove useful to the engineer. On the fifth occasion I asked to speak to a manager which I did. Thereafter the TV was fixed. There was also a faulty light in the room due to the above I couldn't be fussed about reporting.    If your looking for speedy service as regards to drinks whilst hanging out in any of the lobby/reception/bar areas. forget it. it'll be quicker to go to the bar directly. Service in the bars is poor v's their excessively high prices.    Elements of the hotel are fine it's just so let down by extremely poor service & we had other issues to just can't be fussed to re live them here. I'm done over to  the credit card company to get my funds back and they say this is a five star hotel. I can assure you having stayed in many it is not.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fantastic Pool Area, Great Scene, Must Go!
Review_Text: Just spent a day by the pool at Sofitel last week and wow this is paradise. The layout is awesome with plenty of places to lay out enjoy some cold drinks and take company with beautiful people.    The food is decent the drinks are pricey ($12 each) and depending on when you go you may have to pay to enter the pool area of you're not staying there. But it is most certainly worth it!    Considering most of Marrakech is an alcohol-free community enjoying a day at this pool is one of the top things to do if you're looking to let loose a bit.

Review_Date: Paula G wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Title: Great hotel in my favorite city in Morocco!
Review_Text: Having stayed in the Sofitel in Rabat I was expecting a quality experience. The Sofitel in Marrakech exceeded my expectations. Not only elegantly appointed but well positioned in the city to walk to quality restaurants to the Mellah. Having caleches parked down the street made it very convenient when My tired feet screamed out for a reprieve.

Excellent hotel in the city center few minutes walk from all major city attractions.  Very clean  Great service  Great amenities  Pool is lovely  Shisha bar and club are amazing  But very expensive to eat or to drink count 10 Euros for a Corona 25 Euros for a Shisha and 50 Euros for a breakfast for 2 people! I guess the price of luxury!    Recommended hotel but expect a high bill if you buy anything from the hotel!    Overall excellent hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Desiree D wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Text: This hotel is located close to all good bars/restaurants/clubs. It's easy for the taxis at night. Especially if traveling only girls I wouldn't recommend to stay in Medina at a Riad. At night it gets complicated to get home since certain streets get closed. The Sofitel Palais Imperial is in the same building. I've stayed in both and there wasn't much of a difference. Compared to other 5* prestige hotels I'd say this is the best located one and the crowd mixed. Where in other hotels there are rather 60+ aged guests.

Fab hotel  i visit yearly & it just gets better & better!  Big big thanks to Mr Abderrahmane Benmansour for ensuring me a swift check in on my arrival.  Thanks to Yassine & all the team at the pool area for making every day perfect & relaxing.  Well done to Mohammad the pool massuer for our daily massages...fantastic!    Big thanks to all the team at the Sofitel Marrakech  you make this hotel perfect for me in every way & i always love my stay & look forward to returning.    All the best  Michelle

From the minute you drive up this hotel is magical - the lobby area is just spectacular and leads into a great bar followed by the poolside area and restaurant which is a dream - amazing atmosphere and colours    The food at the hotel is first class and is among the best I have had across the world    The spa is dreamlike - beautifully adorned and puts you in a relaxed frame of mind - the gym is functional with good equipment    The hotel is well located and is highly recommended    If there is any negative it is the slow service during meals but the outstanding food and spread makes up for it

A very well located hotel in the center of Marrakech. Great surroundings and some great restaurants and shops nearby. The hotel itself was nice albeit somewhat dated. We were upgraded to a Junior Suite which was great in size but not enough lighting so coupled with the dated furniture made it quite dark. If your room is at the front of the hotel (where you also get some of the nicest views) it can be quite noisy outside particularly with the horses passing by and taxi drivers parking up and talking quite loud into the early hours. The spa was also quite dated and overpriced for the quality of service delivered and products used.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel is remarkably good value; the staff  so polite& humble. The food excellent if you're palette is looking for a straightforward nourishing feed. A bit on the pricey side especially the on site restaurant that features live music in the evening. Seriously overpriced food with ridiculously minature portions that leave even the little ones asking for more! Do not go there. The waiting staff were pushy& incessantly offering alcohol!!!! The staff generally at the hotel were very welcoming& helpful. It's a big busy hotel though you will not be disappointed! Our kids loved it which made for an easy holiday !!!!!üòäüòä the spa& massage areas are lovely but pricey but worth a treat. It's in a great location & the wonderful smell of the orange blossom will evoke fond memories!

Review_Title: Nice hotel shame about the building work
Review_Text: Reception initially couldn't find reservation - confusion between Palais hotel and Lounge hotel reservation systems aren't linked and the tour operator Thompson didn't even know which hotel either or even that the hotels although one building and sharing facilities are split. Check-in is at 3 - so if you are on an earlier flight eg Thomson's you will NOT get your room before then - be prepared.    The room which was then allocated 164 was directly above some building works - and I mean building works - total gutting - so even though we complained on arrival we weren't moved until 4 days later. The room switch took 6 hours - during which our bags were left unattended in the lobby (despite me having been told they would be moved straight from room to room). Obviously then they couldn't find the bags once we eventually got the new room. Which although a bigger room 219 - a suite- had no balcony and was overlooking a busy roundabout. The Thomson rep was noticeable by his absence and missed several meetings and didn't even bother to complete a complaint form.    On the plus side - the pool area was lovely and one pool was heated.    Good wifi everywhere even poolside.    Food - expensive eg about ¬£10 for a plate of plain pasta by the pool Breakfast was fabulous though.    Probably wouldn't come back.

Review_Date: Leon V wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Title: Mixed bag, but generally very good
Review_Text: We stayed here twice in a week as we were trekking in the Atlas Mountains. On first arrival after 30 hours of planes airports and taxis we got to the hotel at 20:00. Imagine our surprise when our rooms were not ready! We had a 45 minute wait before we could go up to our rooms.  On the second check in though things went smoothly which was a blessing given that we desperately needed showers after four days in the mountains.  The hotel itself is beautiful and the decor celebrates Morrocan style in a very elegant manner. Rooms were spacious and quiet. And the hotel is relatively close to the Medina.  Breakfast is extensive with a wide selection of fruit bread cheese and cooked alternatives.  The only problem we found with the hotel was that service was very slow. Be it on the pool deck or the upstairs restaurant which has a beautiful setting the wait is guaranteed to be long. My pet hate: the wine I ordered from the wine list was unavailable! The alternative I was offered was unfamiliar to me and tasted truly terrible.

Review_Date: Axel B wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Title: Great hotel / breakfast is fantastic / Wifi is poor in bedroom
Review_Text: and internet speed is really bad even around lobby area...    Otherwise a very nice place to stay.    The swimming pool area is really great with plenty of large sofa bed type area to relax with good privacy.  Service is quite efficient as well.    Ask for a ground floor bedroom a bit away from the restaurant as they come with a small private garden with a sofa bed. Perfect for an afternoon nap or a nice drink in the evening. Upstairs bedrooms have a view but a small balcony so ...    Anyway if you get a good deal vs the stiff base price jump on the occasion.    Ps : a bit too much of a place if you plan to just use the hotel for sleeping/breakfast though.

You have to wait an hour just to complete check-in transactions. The receptionist told us to make ourselves comfortable and they will come to check us in however we waited 50 minutes just to be noticed. Very very bad service overall I do not recommend this hotel at all...

I had the pleasure of staying at this property on a recent trip to Marrakech. The location within a short walk of the medina is perfect. The rooms are a good size and tastefully decorated. The breakfast and lunch buffets are incredible. If you want to relax by a beautiful pool in a beautiful garden setting you have found your spot. Definitely recommended.

No suprises either good or bad  as a traditional luxury chain hotel you have all what you can expect in such a property  the outside areas are very nice with huge pools...  Service is not fantastic which is a surprise in Marrakech...    A good alternative to a riad or other luxury hotels if you can't afford La Mamounia Aman or Four Seasons...    Location is good just outside the historical centre 100m from La Mamounia and 200m from la Koutoubia
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here over Easter for a week and had an amazing time. The hotel is just outside the old city and has great gardens and pools. The service was generally excellent and the staff were very welcoming. The rooms were spacious and comfortable with balconies and Lanvin amenities. For children there is a kids' club which wasn't always supervises table football and pool tables. There's also a go kart track at the front of the hotel. The food was excellent and the concierge services were also good. The most amazing thing is the breakfast buffet. Probably the best one I have ever experienced anywhere in the world.

Review_Date: Clayton H wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: We stayed in a spacious double room clean and well serviced. Staff we're attentative friendly and professional. Unfortunately I was unwell for most of our stay but was well attended to by the Hotel Doctor. The facilities are amazing check it out.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: anita d wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: This hotel is huge but very pretty! Stayed here hosting a group as part of an incentive trip and it is very luxurious. Grounds are beautiful- plenty of outdoor space to soak up the sun and huge restaurant although I only had breakfast in there. Benefits from having So lounge onsite which is a lively bar/club which does fantastic cocktails. I've stayed here twice in both the 'traditional' side and the 'modern' side (this place is two hotels linked together hence why it's big so ensure you decide which style you prefer before booking!) and I preferred the traditional more Moroccan feel personally. The only downside to this is its a fair walk to your room so if you stay this side make sure you don't mind a 3 minute walk from lobby to lift!

One of the nicest cleanest and beautiful hotels I have ever stayed in.  Staff were incredibly friendly and could not do enough for you.  Soho bar was fantastic the staff in here were truly helpful and genuinelly enjoyed looking after you!  Would definitely return.

Review_Date: VX W wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Title: Great family hotel with good outdoor swimming pool
Review_Text: We arrived late at night and were warmly welcomed as you would expect from a 5* hotel. Having read that the rooms were hit and miss we decided to play it safe and book a suite. The room did not disappoint and was immaculate. The furniture was new and the both balconies were spotless. Our 5 year old daughter slept on the sofa which they made up into a comfy bed for her. The view was of the Atlas mountains and was spectacular.    The breakfast on the first day was not too good with poor service and untidy tables.
