The second day we arrived for breakfast much earlier and had a totally different experience with excellent service - attentive to our every need. The food was good with provisions for children such as chocolate spread for pancakes and chocolate cornflakes etc.    There is a Children's suite which we visited but did not use as there were no other children there and it was staffed by a man wearing a rather formal suit! It looked well equipped with an outdoor play area too. They have an interesting activities timetable too.    There is another outdoor play area which isn't signposted and we weren't told about but stumbled across - it has pedal go-karts and a little race track which all the children seemed to enjoy. (It's situated at the front right of the hotel and can be reached if you exit from the So Lounge part of the hotel where the pool table and table football are).    The pool area offers a tranquil escape from the medina and one of the pools is heated although still a little chilly. It's worth mentioning that they have a small monkey kept in a cage adjacent to the pool bar which seems like a strange thing for a hotel to have. It seemed like a very cruel thing to do as the monkey was alone with no activities in the cage and had a chain around it's neck. The monkey is quite tucked away so we didn't even notice it at first but this makes it even more pointless.    The concierge was not very helpful with our transfer to the Sofitel in Essaouira and when he's not on the desk it appears there's no-one on site doing his job. This is a problem for a large luxury hotel like this.    I have still rated this as an excellent hotel as the good things far outweighed the bad and it was very good overall.

Review_Title: Beautiful hotel, not so great concierge
Review_Text: The hotel is located just outside the medina walls. It has beautiful gardens and swimming pool. The lounge smells orange flowers and is full of comfortable sofas. The restaurants are good but very overpriced. The disco seems to be very popular with locals.  The rooms are comfortable as you would expect of a Sofitel.  The only let down is really the concierge. In a city that you are constantly trying not to be cheated you at least hope the concierge would give good advise but not here. Our day excursion to the city centre was full of traps of buying carpets and argan oils and left out Ben Youssef Madresa which is simply stunning. The concierge sold us a trip to Atlas mountain and told us it was an easy hiking even if he knew we had a 70 year old lady with us. It is simply not possible for a person with mobility issues to climb the waterfalls. Very disappointing.  The taxis at the hotel all try to charge you 100 Dirham instead of the normal 40- 50 for a ride and nobody does nothing about it.

We stayed at the sofitel for one week after reading numerous positive reviews on trip advisor.    The hotel it's self is a nice hotel the lobby area is very big and spacious and the smell is just divine! We had asked for luxury room. The room itself was nice although I do think it is in need of a revamp.    The rooms were very clean along with the bathroom however the bathroom is not one I would classify as a 5star. The tiles and the decor definitely needs updating. This also applies to the terrace the floor tiles and furniture could do with an update.    We had breakfast on the first morning and it was lovely however as it was not included with the room the price for 4 of us amounted to approx ¬£25 a head which we felt was over the dodai. We managed to find a local cafe that served equally nice breakfast for a fraction of the price about 200 yards from the hotel.    Given the time of year we visited the weather wasn't really on our side so we couldn't really utilise the pool area to it's full potential however there were a few occasions where we sat by the pool and the service was extremely slow which is surprising given that this was an off peak season. It took the pool staff almost 30 mins to bring us drinks menu and area wasn't not even that busy. There appeared to be quite a few waiters just standing around however when we were finally served the waiters were helpful therefore no real complaints on that point just the slow service.    On another occasion we were in the bar area and it wasn't particularly busy and we noticed 6 waiters just stood around. No one actually came to give us a menu we had to go and ask for one which in honesty is not something you would expect from a 5* hotel.    We also visited the So lounge on our second night and it was lovely the service was good and the drink we ordered were also of good quality however it was a little pricey! The overall atmosphere of the place was nice. On another night my husband and brother in law went to the lounge again however this time the experience wasn't so pleasant. The door man tried to charge them for entry and when they advised they were guests at the hotel they were quick to change their tune. When they entered there did not appear to be any available seats so a waiter showed them to another seating area which was available however the doorman who originally tried to charge them came over and said the tables were reserved. There was no reserved sign on the tables and I'd just like to add why a doorman would know which tables were reserved or not surely that's down to the waiters. This experience was completely off putting and as a result the guys left.    We did use the spa facilities where we had a facial however one of the ladies that carried out the treatment seemed disinterested left the room twice and appeared to be on the phone. For a five star spa experience this was unacceptable however we did not want to make a fuss however do feel this should be addressed.    The location of the hotel was perfect in the sense that just 200 yards from the the hotel there were plenty of bars/restaurants of great quality. And a further 15 minute walk into the city where we had access to the new town which boasted a cosmopolitan environment.    On our last night we did have a technical hitch with the safe. The hotel staff advised it was due to the battery being low on the safe the matter was dealt with in an efficient manner however in a hotel brand which classifies itself as 5 star these things should be checked prior to check in.    Overall our experience in the hotel was pleasant a perfectly located hotel with easy access to amenities. However given that we paid off peak prices it was suitable however had this been in peak season we would have been disappointed as We have stayed in many 5* hotels and i would class this as a 4* at best. You cannot charge 5* prices and have blocked sinks broken chairs and almost zero water pressure.    Just a to note as well there is a lot of development going on in that area the pavements are dug up and not up to UK health and safety standards haha!

Review_Date: Sibtain R wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: We stayed here for 5 nights in March 15. From the website (and the price) we were expecting great things. On arriving at the hotel the lobby was beautiful. However our room (which apparently had been upgraded) was not as expected. The balcony was dirty and the furniture old. It was not bad but for the price would expect more. The service the hotel provide is also sub par and they charge for every little thing eg to drink the coffee in the room or to use the pool table. Again not what you would expect from a 5* hotel.    Overall our stay was average but for the rating and price of the hotel I would expect more.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Overall we were impressed by our stay but there were a few points that prevent me from giving this Hotel the highest rating.  On arrival we learnt that we were too early to check in which we understood but unfortunately were given impression that our rooms were just not quite ready.After about an hour we were taken to the pool area by a member of the reception team Subsequently we learnt that check in did not commence until 3pm. The pool area is beautiful but it is harder to enjoy when you are in clothes you left a colder UK in. Had it been made clear at reception when check in was we could have used the toilets to change into more appropriate clothes. Our bags had already been taken away. Apparently check in time is on the website but clearly we overlooked it. It would have been simple for reception to say immediately when check in was and could have made ourselves comfortable. Given the time of incoming flights from London this situation must often occur. This is something to be wary of.  As I have said the Pool area is beautiful but sadly staff in that area were quite disinterested and it took a considerable time and effort to obtain a bottle of water.  Two of my party found the beds uncomfortable as they ultimately sagged in the middle. I heard that this problem is known to management.  The Breakfast Buffet is without a doubt impressive and it would be hard to imagine anyone who would not be well cated for but again the disinterest of some of staff was clear Perhaps the 2 managers would have been better employed on the floor rather than sitting on sofas .  We felt the hotel manager was aloof and very selective who he spoke to. His welcome was not universal to all guests. To be clear we were not expecting him to fawn over us but simple acknowledgement or pleasantries when passing by would have been appreciated. Clearly we were not as valued as others.  .  The outstanding member of staff was the Head Concierge Reda booking trips restaurants and offering advice. He has a wealth of knowledge and was so happy to help us. I would recommend anyone staying here to seek him out as I doubt if there is anything he doesn't know or can't arrange. He is the real star there. Our stay in Marrakech would have not been anywhere near as enjoyable without his unfailing assistance.    It was only through the service we received from Reda that I have rated this hotel as very good as otherwise it was average. It is by no means a bad hotel despite length of my review. This is a hotel that is failing to quite reach its potential . It is clear there are those who are aware of the shortcomings I have highlighted. I hope consequently these can be addressed and lift the hotel to the level I believe it could be and where owners would like it to be.  Admittedly I suspect I may have left a better rating if I had been one of the guests who seemed to get more personal attention.

Review_Date: Miray Muge Adal wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: Absolutely perfect. Rooms are clean and designed tastefully. Stuffs are very friendly. Especially Farah Jardin. She helped us a lot. The breakfast was unbelievable. If you choose this hotel you won't regret it.

Review_Date: Bob L wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: Just back from weeks holiday in Sofitel Hotel Marrakech. Great hotel clean wonderfull food espessially at Breakfast..."what a spread"  Staff friendly & helpfull nothing too much trouble. Although mainly French influance plenty of English speaking staff.  Swimming pools fantastic. Overall a great holiday & great hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Our first holiday to Morocco and we will definitely be back to this lovely welcoming country.the hotel is absolutely top notch from the second you leave your transport and step in the door.the staff are extremely welcomingfriendly and hard working.the location of the hotel is great only a short taxi ride from the airport and a short walk to the city walls and into the medina.the hotel decor is amazing.the pool is a great size and just the right temperature.breakfast is totally amazing the range of food to choose from is vast!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I went to Marrakech for the week -end last month and I was very happy about the service level I received from Wiam El Mansouri. She is an excellent employee very pleasant person and her beautify smile was the bomb. I will be back soon in June with my family and I will MOST definitely return to Sofitel and go back to see my smile face and new friend Wiam. Go Wiam!  Houda

Review_Date: Kapl D wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: Visit: 18/02/2015 to 24/02/2015  We did write a review on the Sofitel on the 26/01/2015 but due to overwhelming sincere support and attention which was rather refreshing from the staff at the Sofitel as we had to hastily depart from England to Marrakech due to a severe illness of my father in law who actually passed away on the 18th. It came to the attention to the staff of the occurrence and everyone offered their condolences to us and the subsequent service was wonderful to behold. It must be noted that regardless of this situation the service of the staff and thoughts are impeccable at all times. We would just like to pay a special mention to a few people namely who were exceptional Moustaf Abdeerazzak (Barman) Oussama Youner and Laila Siham and Allall on the service section of the hotel. Wiam (Manager) always welcomed us anywhere in the hotel we happen to meet and made sure that nothing was too much trouble. Finally the amenities that the hotel offers we find truly relaxing enjoyable and puts us in a great frame of mind to come back to England.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Had drinks at the Sofitel superb service very welcoming staff Assia Azziza Nezha Hind Jamal  Super surroundings beautiful pool. Complimentary snacks overall recommended. Thanks  For every Body see You soon

Review_Date: Richard B wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: I would like to testify about the excellent service that I received in the lawrence bar from the lovely Wiam and her team. I very rarely received similar outstanding attention that makes me feel a privileged client. I also had the pleasure to be served by the other members of the team like Siham Leila  abderrazak  Youness Kebir wafaa azdine not to forget Youssef And rabii

Review_Date: Cheryl M wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: I went to Marrakech for a week long holiday with my mother and we decided on this hotel after lots of research - we definitely made the right choice! On arrival we were greeted promptly and told we had a room upgrade which we appreciated! We then went to have dinner and cocktails in the SO Lounge - a bar/restaurant in the hotel which was great. It was my Mums birthday and the staff went out of their way to help us with our celebrations!    We had breakfast everyday which was great - lots of choice and even some gluten free products which were good. A special mention to the staff who worked at breakfast - Abderrahim Mohamed Youssef Hassan Jamaal to name but a few who really went out of their way to be helpful accommodating and provide great service. This service was replicated throughout the hotel and especially Rachid (worked on the Sofitel Imperial reception) who helped us plan some day trips.    As well as the fantastic staff the hotel itself is amazing - beautiful grounds wonderfully comfortable bedroom and a superb spa which was so tranquil and relaxing. Location is great too - not far from the airport and also only a 10-15 minute walk into the old town.    I really cannot fault anything - again I would highlight the staff are a real asset to this hotel. Polite helpful and friendly - even when they had to deal with a few difficult and frankly rude guests at times. They really helped make out holiday special.    I was so sad to leave and am already planning my return visit to the wonderful city of Marrakech and do plan to stay at the Sofitel Lounge & Spa again in early May - I'm hoping to book my stay very soon!

Review_Date: Barry W wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: First time in Morocco and Marrakech. I really loved the property and the country and would like to bring my first of many groups to this hotel very soon for sure.  I want to thank Ms. Intifada for her time showing me the whole property and for the delicious lunch. We are really looking forward to an enjoyable and long relationship.

We travelled to Marrakesh for a couple of days break and we were not disappointed! The service at The Sofitel is excellent with nothing ever being too much trouble and have plenty of staff ready to cater for any of your wishes. Knowing the problems we had with flights and getting there they had kindly upgraded our room etc. We were looked after a lot by a lovely waiter called Karim whose English is brilliant and even followed me around with coffee when moving to sit outside. The breakfast is excellent with a good selection of pastries eggs cheese ham and fruit.    We did venture outside the hotel for a few hours for a camel ride see the tanneries herbalists etc but really we were happy to stay within the hotel with their heavenly gardens pools spa and excellent customer service.    Thank you to all the staff who have made our trip so enjoyable....we will definitely be returning! Xxx
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: John P wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Title: A beautifu Resort in Hivernage Marrakech
Review_Text: Stayed in Sofitel Spa & Lounge beg March with my wife as well as my daughter & her husband.  Check in was extremely cozy since they get everything done for you while you are begin served some special tea. The Reception has this beautiful Moroccan style which already puts you in the right mood.  The Deluxe room we booked was very comfortable with a wonderful view over the piscine area.The bathroom was all the necessary amenities as well as a big bath tub which I always appreciate.    Plenty of trees surround the pool which give you this sense of being in the country side. Although the hotel was fully booked it was pretty quiet since the standard of the clients is quite elevated here.    We dined at the So Lounge where we had very good salmon sashimi for starter which was a pleasant surprise for us all. My daughter Micheline had a stir fried chicken which was delicious & we ended up all sharing it while her husband went for the shrimp pasta which was also very tasty.  My wife had the monk fish which was the best of all orders while I had the trio of lobster / shrimps & calamari which was recommended by the waiter. Very good quality food while the service was also of a high standard & very friendly.  To top it all off the singer was superb while the band was very lively contributing to a very lively & entertaining atmosphere over all.  What was extremely good was the breakfast which included most types of French cheeses along with a big selection of cold cuts which we highly appreciated.  Juices were prepared for you on the spot while there was a wide selection of fresh fruits to choose from. Marmelades / waffles / croissants Danish pastries were all there in a very orderly manner while am sure I forget so many other items I cannot recall. Had some amazing fried eggs with bacon & the staff was always smiling & present in spite of the fact the place was buzzing.    In the afternoon we spent some nice time in the elevated heated private pool which had a superb view of the hotel. We were not happy with the fact they asked us to pay 40 Euro / person just to sit there ( apart from the orders we would place ) but were pleasantly surprised to be told they would waive it! Ended up having some good wine glasses & fresh juices there & full enjoyed our time & the tranquility of this beautiful spot.    Booked at the Spa for the 4 of us today where everything was well organized & the responsible lady very helpful.    Overall this is a very nice Resort that I would definitely recommend to anyone who wants 5 Stars Luxury in Marrakech without being overpriced. The fact it is so close to the airport as well as to other top notch resorts like Mamounia or Four Seasons is a plus.

Abdelilah restaurant oasis was great to us and very attentive every day at lunch.  The staff were all helpful the atmosphere was perfect around the pool and the rooms were just the right amount of luxury and practical.    We stayed in a riad in the medina for the first few days and then came to relax here.  Mission accomplished

This is a wonderful hotel with great amenities lovely grounds and super helpful staff. Everyone was really friendly. The selection of food at breakfast was excellent and included freshly made smoothies and vegetable juices.

I stayed here during the end of February JUST before the temperatures went above 23 degrees.  Upon arrival we were greeted immediately by the frontal staff with such a friendly welcome our bags taken to the concierge then being welcomed by the door staff with warm delighted smiles and cutesy. We were led to a sofa to wait on our check in which only took a few minutes and the minutes were so we could be welcomed in style. We were attended to by the best host ever 'adelakeem' he made sure we knew his name 'akeem' meant Docter loves him! he poured us tea in style and offered us sweet confectioneries. He was beaming with life and friendliness he had made our welcome perfect.    We booked bed and breakfast and the choice was amazing and the food was delicious!  Even though the service was buffet self service once sat down we were offered extras to our breakfast like tea juice staff are everywhere and willing to cater to you. I cannot stress friendly service enough. And in such a classy hotel.    The decor is to die for! Such elegance and vitality.    We tend to go out every day and evening especially for dinner but we did have a few cocktails at the hotel and lunch by the pool side. We had chips and a margarita and olive pizza which was lovely I even ordered more chips they were so succulent. My favourite cocktail was 'lady' could not get enough.    Service at the pool was superb there are staff around everywhere that are there for your every need just catch their eye and they cater to you bringing you your orders etc.    Note: the courtyard around the pool is basked in the sounds of peaceful birds chirping very refreshing in the mornings soothing in the evenings and serene during the days! It dreams PARADISE.    I had also noticed they are very polite and good with kids from observation 'chilling in the sun'    The room we stayed at was comfortable clean and beautiful we had the view of the atlas mountain in the far beyond and a pond with fish and turtles below.    One bad note was on the day after the first night we came back from at out to find out room had not been cleaned we left again to chill at the pool until we got tired from the sun came back to rest and our door locked at about 4:30 for cleaning.. We had to send them away that was way too late and I wanted to sleep. They passed by again to ensure we had clean towels and water. They then cleaned the next morning without fail.    The sofitel seemed to be the most luxurious hotel in the area from going on various tours around the area. When we were picked up and dropped off by out your operators other holiday makers never failed to ask us about how the hotel is they were always looking on from the vehicle.    I commend and praise these staff for making our time extra special... Adelakeem taoigif charafeddine and oh I've forget in two others the tall guy that is always by the pool helping others always there making us feel catered for if we needed anything and this sweetest dear at breakfast who normally situates himself near to the entrance door offering tea/ coffe/juice. As I often dined at breakfast alone and he was there to make me feel confident. He had a lovely sweet fave and smile.

Excellent service and staff special in bar area and polite girls  Nezha  Assia  Aziza  Hind  Maryam  Gamal  Thank you for every body in this nice hotel  And sure I wi come back again  Good location and smell staff

Review_Date: Thomas B wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: Hotel is good. Great location. Bit outdated room wise.    The pool service however is excellent. Ask for Mokthtar. His English is super. He understands what it means to give the guest a great experience. Very friendly and doesn't scare away from going the extra mile.

Fabulous stay at the hotel - really good service and a luxurious stay. Special mention to Jamal Youssef Nezha Aziza Mohamed Hind in the Palais Darkum who really went out of their way to be accommodating and provide amazing service :-)

The best spot on the hotel is the terrace the decorations are fantastic drinking morrocoan tea there was quiet an experience.  Yet food was not as expected. One more advantage was that the hotel was very close to the old city where the bazaars and traditional caf√©s were.  In general I was glad to stay in that hotel.

Review_Date: Hamad A wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: It's very nice hotel on a very nice sitting. Highly recommend.  The palais dark um aziza assia nezha hind jamal are very nice hosts pleasent chearful and very friendly. They made the evening setting far better.

Review_Date: Rohit S wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: There was absolutely nothing negative about this hotel. From the moment we checked in until we checked out the service we received from all the staff was top notch. Everyone was always friendly and with warm greetings always being at hand to help with anything. A special mention goes out to Aida one of the hotel's senior reception staff who was always at hand and went out of her way to make sure our stay was a pleasant one thank you very much. The pool staff were also very helpful with local recommendations and always up for a game of table tennis or pool.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Miranda L wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: I recently stayed at this hotel for my birthday and can safely say that the quality of service and guest attention is 200%. I have travelled the world over and was really impressed with how far staff go to look after you. I am gluten and dairy free and the kitchen staff made me a special birthday cake. Kudos and thanks to the room service team including Ghali Atoul Brahim Mimouni Soufiane Aziz Badr and Amine plus Aadili Aabsi Anhich and Lagudail. Sofia one of the managers was a delight as was Yassine Lacheb. I would definitely return.

Review_Date: Lynda akosua A wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: Very welcome in Sofitel by Waitress who were extremely nice and always smiling and ready to assist when you needed help. I would like to especially thank; Abdelflah of the Oasis Restaurant who was extremely helpful and friendly and a credit to the hotel and the entire staff for their hospitality during our stay in the hotel.    Lynda

Very welcome in Sofitel by Waitress Hind and Aziza and Nezha are very helpful and disbonible i like to take my appero in the terrasse of Palais datum it is very Nice and the staff is always smailing in the last i think jamal

Hotel has excellent location bar at the garden is a real Moroccan experience and excellent service . Turkey recommended . This is first choice after 3 vista to Marrakech !thanks for Aziza Assia hind and nezha

Respectful hotel clean nice stuff... Very adorable Sofitel Marrakech is the best hotel in all Marakech it is very special experience I will not forget it is my first place in Marrakech I want to thanks Aziza assia hind Nezha without forget Jamal and zohra

Thanks so much for being so nice Assia Aziza nezha hind  The hotel is beautiful and people lovely makes a difference for the customers thanks for the great service I ll come again for sure  Signed happy customer

Review_Title: An oasis of calm in a bustling city
Review_Text: Stayed for four nights in this thoroughly luxurious hotel in a great location only 15 mins from the main square. It is in a very upmarket and safe area.  The building looks and feels special - the maintenance of the public spaces grounds and rooms was very high.  Beds - very comfortable as usual for Sofitels guranteeeing a fine sleep. The shower was powerful with plentiful hot water: the toiletries were of a particularly high standard  As mentioned elsewhere the quality and quantity of the breakfast is very high. The pastries cannot be bettered!  All staff were very attentive and caring which is a testament to their recruitment and high levels of training.  Overall a great hotel - yes it is on the expensive side (rooms drinks etc.) but for a base in Marakech we feel it cannot be beaten. Go and treat yourseves!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Robert G wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Title: An amazing experience in an amazing city
Review_Text: Brilliant in every single aspect. The breakfast alone was worth the price - you won't believe the quality & wuantity of food on offer and the service is amazing (particular mention to Farah Aziza Hind Nexha Meriam & Mohamed for the bar service & lovely tea on our departure!)

Review_Title: Very enjoyable hotel, excellent quality and service
Review_Text: We came to stay for 3 nights/4 days and chose the Sofitel as we usually stay in a Sofitel when on holiday. The service and quality was excellent as anticipated and the staff were fantastic particularly in the Palais Darkum which was one of favourite place to sit and enjoy a drink. We particularly want to mention Assia Aziza Hind Mohamed and Nezha who were extermely helpful and friendly and are a credit to the hotel.    The only negatives to our trip was that the evening restaurants/bar were not wheelchair accessible. Therefore we had to utilise room service for our evening meals and whilst the food was lovely it would have been nice to be able to eat in the restaurant. We also found the wet room in our room was extremely slippery and both of us ended up slipping when getting out of the shower. We have mentioned both of these things to the hotel.    Even in light of the above we would still return to the Sofitel Lounge and Spa as its in a great location and the staff are very friendly.

I Was in your hotel i was √† very satisfied the staff is very professionnel i want to thank wiam the manager for doing her job correctely laila siham mohamed mokhtar kebir and finally th√© maistro of all That amazing staff the classy lady wiam the right person in the right place .

Review_Date: Rukan D wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: I come to Marrakech often  this is first time here  Had a wonderful time  A charming place to come back  Staff Asia Azziza nehza and hind made my day fun and to remember  Rooms are clean and fresh wonderful  Restaurants
At the bar you find the sweetest staff Aziza  Hind Assia Nezha and Mohammad . Good service excellent quality  nice sitting and atmosphere . Soft music for a relaxing time with great coffe and sweets.

Review_Date: Christina H wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: You get really great service here they want you to be happy wheter you are at your room eating inside or at the pool.. The room has a big fabolous bed. It takes 15 minutes to walk in to the city center(Medina Jmaa el Fna) and there is a supermarket close. Transport costs 70 dh to the airport but 100 dh from the airport. Sofitel has a lovely big breakfast and a great pool/lounge area with sunbeds. The water is cold in the wintertime so don't get your hopes to high for a relaxing swim here.

I stayed at this hotel for a couple of days.  I met a member of staff called Adil and Yasine- they were very courteous and very genuine people.  I was looked after like a king and they made sure nothing was wrong with my stay.  I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel and definitely other travellers to sample the hospitality on offer here.    5 stars for EVERYTHING.  Well done guys and keep up the good work!!

Review_Date: Helen A wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: My husband and I came here during our stay in Morocco and used the spa facilities it was a real treat and we came out feeling pampered and relaxed staff were wonderful and the spa itself was perfec.

Review_Date: David D wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: Probably the best hotel I have stayed in. Beautiful pool area great breakfast and friendly staff particularly the staff at breakfast who make you feel really welcome. Good bar and charming staff there too reception staff were ok one reception manager had real attitude but apart from that everything was great. Food is expensive if not included and indoor pool costs ¬£ 20 per day but you won't need this if the weather is good as outdoor pools are amazing plenty of sun loungers and hammocks. Other guests local business men and visitors so good mix.

Review_Date: Chen W wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: Never stayed at Sofitel before so we weren't sure what to expect. First impression was excellent very tastefully decorated throughout and reception staff are all polite and attentive. We had an upgrade to a junior suite which is a nice surprise. The suite is quite spacious with double balcony and south facing. It is at the end of the building therefore quiet. Breakfast is in the main buffet restaurant plentiful and all the waiting staff are very attentive. We had dinner one night in the lounge where there was live show and three other nights at the A-la-carte restaurant. The former has a quite lively atmosphere with good food (and huge portion); the latter is a classy proper restaurant with very high standard of food and service and we were very pleased dining there. There are French and Moroccan choices but we found ourselves keep going for French dishes which were so nicely made. We did spend some time on pool side every afternoon which was nice and quite because of the off-season we reckon.    What made the stay special is all the staff members working at the hotel. Everyone of them is genuinely willing to help and very pleasant to talk to. Fatima at the breakfast Omar at the pool side Youssouf at the dinner restaurant just to name a few. One thing we were very impressed with is that in one evening we were making our way to the old town and one of the hotel staff working in the lounge the night before recognised us on his way home after finishing work at the hotel he walked us to the old town and said goodbye afterwards. It wasn't his job at all to accompany us but he was willing to spend some private time to help hotel customers and we really appreciate his effort.    Overall a very very pleasant stay and such a beautiful welcoming and well-managed hotel. Would definitely come back. Thanks for everything!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tom F wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: Stayed her for 6days in February 2015 had great service from all the staff .boys around the heated pool were great all smiles and very helpfull . Atol from room service was great helped with were to go and what too do he would be a great tour guide will deffinatly be going back only downside when I paid my bill I asked if they had taken all the tax which you pay every day of your stay .the staff on Thursday evening told us Yes all done just leave in morning .as we were getting in our taxi to the airport the bellboy said I had go back to the front desk only to be told I had to pay the tax which should have been done when I paid the bill this was my only criticism T Flint

This was the first visit to Morocco and the first time we had stayed in a Sofitel and we were a bit apprehensive having visited many parts of Africa and the Middle East.  From the moment we arrived at the hotel we were made welcome by Yussef who looked after the luggage. The bedroom and bathrooms were clean with lots of good quality toiletries towels and bathrobes. The beds comfortable and large.  Our room was at the back of the hotel and there was some noise from the air conditioning units serving the meeting rooms located below but when the doors are closed this is minimal although if you want to sit on the balcony it can be annoying.  Breakfast offers a great choice and if anyone is not satisfied then they must be miserable having a bad day or just plain awful to be around.  We liked the fires lit in the garden at night so that you could enjoy a drink and chat and Nawfal and his staff looked after admirably and even remembered what we had been drinking the previous night. Drinks are not cheap a 300ml bottle of beer is ¬£7 and the cheapest bottle of wine over ¬£20.But alcohol appears to be expensive in this country. Not the place for those that like to get drunk every night!!  We were staying as part of a golf package and our clubs were stored safely in a locked room and brought to the car when we required them by enthusiastic staff.  We met Sofia a Junior Manager during the managers reception on Monday night and what a star she turned out to be. Full of life and a real love for her job and making sure that the customers are happy and trying to eliminate the problems of they aren't. If every company had a Sofia they would benefit.  Fatima one of the waitresses gave excellent advise for the back problem and the ginger shots in the morning really do work and make your digestive system function.  The gardens and swimming pools are impressive and the outdoor heated pool was warm and ideal for swimming in even when the temperature drops.  The only downside was the check out and getting Nehdi to understand that we wanted to pay in Dirhams and not ¬£. Perhaps some training her on the card machine as it clearly stated ¬£ and he insisted that we would be charged in local currency as the hotel dealt in Dirhams. The 3% service charge was not significant but it all adds up to the cost of the holiday.  Overall impression: Great hotel wonderful friendly staff and we look forward to a return visit. Would certainly recommend and we will now look at staying in Sofitel's in the future.

Review_Date: Heather B wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: We had a lovely stay faultless hotel very friendly and obliging staff especially atol room service he went out of his way to help. The pool area was fantastic and very comfortable and food very good. We will defiantly be returning.

Just returned from staying at this hotel on a golfing holiday to Marrakech and can say this is one of the best hotels we've stayed in for service and personal attention - nothing was too much trouble for the kind happy and attentive staff.    Special mention to Sofia for looking after us all week especially on my birthday also to the night housekeeping team who made such a good job of decorating our room and preparing a fabulous birthday cake (Atoul Ghali Brahim Mamouri Abdelfabar Aziz Badr Lagouail Absi Aadili Ahnich and Issam).    Also thanks to Anas for preparing the invigorating ginger shots at breakfast.    For a stay in Marrakesh I would recommend this oasis of tranquillity every time. We expect to return soon.

This has been another return trip to the magnificent Sofitel in Marrakech. I cannot speak highly enough of the staff especially the restaurant team. Naming -Farah Hicham Anas Azli Fatima Rachida Nouihi Querfi Haj Aziz Elghade Nezha Achraf and many others.    I would also like to make special mention of Youness Chafiq in the So restaurant and Brahim. They have exemplary customer service and never fail in making me and my colleagues fully welcomed.

As a regular visitor and client of the lawrance bar and l'orangerie i would like to thank Wiam and her team for the excellent service and brilliant customers relations that shows this team complete devotion to fully satisfy the clients with a permanent smile. I would like to name the lovely persons that become more friends than simple servers starting with Wiamlaila Siham mustapha youness aminemohamedrabiimokhtar and kebir. A very big thank uou to all of you.

Review_Title: Will never go back here again after the service we received
Review_Text: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and from the moment 'go' it was trouble! Took 1 hour and 10 minute to check in. We were offered no food whilst waiting even though we told the woman at reception that we are very hungry and fed up! We were told to wait or have a look around the resort while they try and trace the booking! By the time we got the room we were shattered infact they ruined our plans because we were so tired hungry & put off!  Got into the room and bathtub was filthy and iron wasn't working. Asked for a new iron and housekeeping came to drop it to us.. knocked and within 2 seconds of knocking walks straight into the room!  Another time we had house keeping walk into our room after a single knock again walking in after literally 2 seconds! We had the sign on 'do not disturb!'.  Towels had lipstick stains on it.  Our balcony door was left TWICE open by housekeeping. Sink was blocked housekeeping fixed it. Next day it was blocked again!  We asked for a wake up call on night 2 and no one called we almost missed breakfast. We had 30 mins to get ready and go down and eat!! We ignored it. Day 3 we asked for a wake up call and explained that 'we didn't get it the night before so please make sure we get it today'.  Day 3 and no wake up call. We ended up missing the breakfast completely!  We were offered free breakfast by manager but it's not the same as the buffet we paid for? It was our last day at the hotel and the day's plans were ruined and wasted because we woke up late due to no wake up call!  We were offered a lunch & shisha by manager which is fine but it doesn't compensate for the amount of money we spent on the hotel and within the hotel during our stay we had the suite and spent extra for this as it was a special occasion. The staff service was slow. A lot of the times they were just talking among themselves or on their phones. Once we stood at reception which was empty with only 3 staff members. We stood waiting for them to finish talking and laughing around. It took them 4 minutes to acknowledge that we were even stood there!!!    Overall the hotel has potential lovely location all facilities are available. Beds are comfortable and there is a good choice of breakfast and food overall throughout the hotel restaurants. Its a shame that the service was sooo poor that we would never recommend the hotel or go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have stayed at this hotel and it has every facilty. From a kids club to a luxurious spa of world class standards. The staff go out of their way and it is eastern hospitality at its finest.  I would like to thanks Fatima esszahra Elrhadi Touial and Soumia for their excellent care and attention and helping us with the little extras for our three year old. Fabulous hotel.

Review_Date: Yuni M wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: our holiday in Marrakech were very well chosen. the hotel is very well located and offers access to many restaurants and bars it is a complete and beautiful place. the staff takes care of you and advise you. We want to thank Mr. Zakaria the manager in the big reception. And we want to thank miss Sofia for her hospitality she takes care of a new pool called ULTIMATE but she is always there when needed (as she says with her smile) this young woman really loves her profession and we see it. we also thank miss Jihan for her help and all the breakfast staff especially Fatima and azly youssouf at the Orangery restaurant and the the Moroccan Tea gentleman at the reception. soon we hope
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nessreen D wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: I stayed at Sofitel Marrakech Lounge and Spa 4 days and it was really remarkable. The hospitality I have seen there and the service was really amazing they have the most qualified staff. Also the location of the hotel is great as it‚Äôs nearby the shopping souq and malls. I do recommend this hotel to anyone seeks luxury and peace.  I would like to thank you all for this great experience.

I stayed at sofitel Marrakech 4 days and it was a very good trip . Everything is excellent in the hotel and I would like to thank Sofitel for the great hospitality and kind of services I had found there !

I organized a trip to Sofitel Marrakesh for 140 people. Our stay was a delight thanks to Ismail Front Office Manager Zanty Zehra Benayel Quorfi the chef of So Lounge & buffet restaurant and all the other staff. We appreciated their hospitality and will be there with other groups too.

Review_Date: Michelle R wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: my parents stayed at the Sofitel Marrakesh Lounge and Spa for two weeks I am very moved they showed me the pictures and told me every little detail I want to thank you for the welcome you have given to my father and to my ailing mother (in wheelchair) I know it was not that easy but you have impressed me thank you "Sophia" for taking care of my parents they told me how much you care. thank you "Omar" from the pool restaurant for being so kind thank you Chief "Hamid" for the delicious sandwish club thank you "Tarik" for the wonderful strawberry cocktail thank you to the doormen they have always helped to take their taxi ... I will certainly thank you in person.

Review_Date: Ryan S wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: I did not stay at the hotel but I went for drinks with friends. The place is amazing and well kept. We were tired of walking in the old Medina and decided to have a drink at Sofitel. We loved it so much. The scenery is breath taking and the service is top. it was a little bit cold during January they had a fire in the middle of the terrace by the pool: fantastic. The price is fine for the quality of drinks and service.    Will stay there next time I m in Marrakech.

Super hotel very friendly staff and great accommodation. Two outside swimming pools one of which was heated and wonder ammenities. We ate in the hotel restaurant twice and the staff were very attentive and the food excellent

Stayed at the Sofitel Marrakech Loung and Spa for a week commencing 5th October 2014 and had a wonderful and memorable time at the hotel and in Marrakech itself.  The weather was perfect comfortable warm and sunny. Have always stayed in 5 star hotels and this was equally impressive though individual. Especially as we enjoyed the benefits of two hotels in one Palais Imperial and Lounge and Spa both of which are connected by the very welcoming and spacious reception area. After the long wait at Immigration the welcome and efficiency of the staff made us forget out irritation and tiredness.  At time of booking no rooms were available in the Palais Imperial however on arrival we found that we were upgraded to the Palace rooms which have a modern yet traditional feel to them. Only disadvantage is that they are located a distance from the hub of the hotel.  Next day we requested customer relations staff Loubna at the front reception desk if we could see the rooms at the Lounge and Spa which were more modern and the decor light and airy and more importantly closer to the main entrance to the hotel.  These were more favorable to us therefore on request Loubna very kindly arranged for us to be relocated and all our luggage was effectively transferred to our new rooms which were equally comfortable as the first with all the expected facilities.What would have been a nice touch was a tea/coffee tray in the room as room service was a little long in coming though when it did arrive it was presented as would be expected from a 5 star hotel.  As regards to the hotel it is very very well maintained and the decor is pleasing to the eye and kept spotless. All around the hotel there were plenty of well proportioned comfortable seating areas to relax in and the scent was heavenly. There are four swimming pools one at the Spa for the exclusive use of those having treatment and the smallest pool is usable at extra cost. Of the further two pools one is heated. What is wonderful is that there are plenty of sunbeds around all the pools which are located in the well maintained gardens.  As for the restaurants we ate at the L'Orangerie Le Jardin and the Oasis where the food was cooked to perfection and of highest standard. However as the days went the service got considerably slower which was disappointing. The other thing our group felt was that a smoking area so near to the eating area at the L'Orangerie was a little offputting. The staff at all the restaurants were impeccable and the surroundings were excellent. A special mention to Hind at breakfast time who greeted us with a smile and ensured our teas coffees fresh orange juice arrived promptly. A special mention to Rida the concierge who was very helpful in organising trips transport and respective guides which made all our outings very special and enjoyable.  Our thanks to the guides who were very respectful informative and attentive to our wishes and to our safety.  We the family of six are very pleased with our choice of hotel. The staff have been very pleasant and professional. Particularly Loubna who works at the reception desk was so very cheerful helpful and nothing absolutely nothing was too much trouble. It is Loubna who made the stay even more memorable and is a credit to the hotel.  A very heartfelt thanks and regards to her from all the family and best wishes that she succeeds in everything she does.

Review_Date: Sunshine J wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Title: Ultimate relaxation... at the Ultimate Pool Lounge at the Sofitel!
Review_Text: I have been lucky enough to stay at the Sofitel Hotel in Marrakech a number of times now and I have always had the most amazing time there. But this year I was really excited to see they have added a brand new private pool and Lounge to the property called the Ultimate Pool Lounge what can I say‚Ä¶ it was FABULOUS!! A very intimate warm relaxing setting with the most beautiful and breathtaking views of the Atlas mountain. Now you have to pay extra to enter this section but I genuinely think it‚Äôs worth the money. I was treated like a VIP guest as the staff never seemed to be far away when I needed another drink or food. I have to commend Sofia the manager at the Pool lounge; you can tell she runs a tight ship with her team! I am always impressed by her professional approach to customers and her staff. And finally I absolutely love the music they played at the background.    I highly recommend you spending an afternoon here purely for the sublime atmosphere excellent customer service food and also a brilliant place to people watch!!

Review_Date: Najima D wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: everytime in marakkesh i stay at the sofitel. the service the rooms the staff the breakfast buffet and the nightclub - everything is over the top quality! it is situated only a 10min walk to the world famous jama' elfna.

After a good night out we decided to check out Sofitel for their Shisha (Hookah)    I have to admit it was slightly more pricey than others (roughly 250 dirhams) which works out to be ¬£18 (Slightly more than a decent UK shisha cafe would charge - more close to Edgware road prices)    We got our shishas served with an ice base which was nice since not all places server it like that and I think a pineapple head so it was good in that sense    Also we got lucky since the staff noticed we were all english speaking and knew little french so a local friend (or regular) did some translating for us to help us make a choice from the menu and fed that back to the staff    We also got soft drinks and mocktails which I didnt bother working out but it would likely be ¬£2 and ¬£5 each    The staff there mainly speak french so unless you know some french dont expect to interact much    We got coal changes often which was fine and the music was actually urban and decent  Lighting was nice and relaxed and they had nice sofas to fit a group of friends    Id say average but only because UK serves it better (or im used to it more) and we have a bland experience    Would I go again?.. Yeah..Why not

Review_Date: Jamila A wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Title: Nice but overpriced, step up the service!
Review_Text: Sofitel Marrakech is a beautiful place the suites are nice the pool is nice the club SO Lounge is nice. BUT it is a bit overpriced! I mean drinks for instance are more expensive than the best European/ US hotel. Unless you can promise more than an outstanding service then it's ok ... But that's not the case. Special thanks to some of the People that made our trip very nice number 1 is Abderrazak everything we needed we got Shokran. Thank you Hakim and Mostafa voor the many glasses of thea. Thank you Fatima Zohra and Yahya at SO Lounge and the security guys.

Review_Date: tiniko k wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: I hope my title begins to do justice to the amazingly complete level of satisfaction at this marvelous venue. There was not one aspect of the experience that was anything but outstanding. Starting with the genuine people who make this destination a fulfilling journey to an already recognized world-leading destination Marrakech. Absolutely every single person on staff is friendly outgoing and has the pleasure of the guest as their only concern. And this is not just through corporate mantra or proper training but comes genuinely from the heart. As an experienced traveler to many of the leading facilities throughout the world I can honestly say this place ranks among the finest if not the finest all-around experience I have had. The location is prime but as interesting as Marrakech is one finds themselves just as pleased to remain on-site in order to enjoy this place as much as any destination in the area one would care to visit.    The accommodations the lounge the dining the spa and common areas are all first-rate. I would defy anyone to find the beds anything but among the finest they've experienced no matter the property. The food is outstanding in every aspect from quality to creative preparation to abundance. Chef Ahmed Eddefaa warrants particular mention. In addition to his outstanding culinary skills his attentiveness to the guest is extraordinary. Every possible need is met and complete satisfaction is assured.    One other individual who should be specially noted is Mr. Mazzouj our PR Director. No request is beyond his abilities. He was terrific.    On your visit please seek these gentlemen out for they are sure to enhance your stay. And I may even meet you there as I will most definitely return soon.

Review_Date: Tim B wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: Nice place to stay for a winter stay in Marrakech.  Rooms clean and nice with the fine Mybed concept  Just be careful with the taxis outside ask the concierge if he knows a private company.  The ones outside are terrible dishonest  it's not really the responsibility of Sofitel but this could stop me next time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Imad K wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: Marrakech in this time of the year have the best Weather conditions.  Sofitel night life is so nice with the So Night Lounge .  The breakfast restaurant and the service is the best with : Jamal A. Zidane and Karima and BenMabrouk.

I am really glad to meet some wonderful staff in your hotel  the following people i highly recommend to reword them as part of their service during my staying in this hotel  Nouihi  Taha  Hicham  Fatima  Kind regards  Mohammed Alruqaishi  Room no 359

Review_Date: frederic r wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Title: nice hotel in a nice city
Review_Text: great pleasure of staying at Sofitel Marrakech a magical setting full of good things large pool .the people are friendly in marrakech . the hotel is beautiful with nices views of atlas  superbly served by Atoul room service and omar at the pool  mehdi at the reception was also really welcoming.  thank you to you all and see you soon

A very good hotel located near to the Medina. Split into two "themes" the Palais Imperial and the Lounge & Spa which is more modern. Both sides are very well decorated with a feeling of luxury / quality all around. The rooms are well equipped and comfortable - probably just about what you would expect from a hotel of this quality. We stayed including breakfast (didn't eat lunch / dinner at hotel so cannot comment) and the choice of food was incredible far beyond anything we have experienced elsewhere. What really set this place apart for us was the quality of service from the staff with each and every person going out of their way to help. Jihane (guest relations) ensured that the TV was set up to show English football matches Amina at the front desk gave us great tips and suggestions of where to go / eat whilst Fatima / Karim (as well as Rachida / Benayad / Nouihi / Hicham / Chahira / Azly at breakfast) all went out of their way to make sure that we were enjoying ourselves and had everything we needed. Would highly recommend this hotel purely on the quality of staff service itself and we will definitely be coming back.

Review_Date: Rahul V wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Title: Great pool and Spa, descent rooms.
Review_Text: Stayed here for a couple of nights in June 2014. The pool area is lovely rooms not western 5* but somewhere between 3 and 4 star in my opinion. More than sufficient nice and clean big rooms.    SO nightclub is good live music and great ambience. There is also an outdoor area which does food and shisha which is nice.    SPA is nice but pricey in Marrakech terms.    The pool area is one of the best in Marrakech.

Review_Title: Not a 5 star luxury hotel.. So not worth it.. But
Review_Text: Ok.. So for what I paid and a supposed 5 star luxury hotel. THIS IS NOT. Here's the thing the quality of the rooms would be fine for best western prices. The beds are comfortable and the sheets and towels are clean.. But that's standard! And the prices are luxury. You have to wait forever for room service and the first room I was in had no wifi. The signal couldn't be picked up anywhere so I had to change rooms. Also the carpet floors are not that clean and the lighting in the room is very poor.. I think it's so you don't notice the not so clean rooms. The finishings in the bathroom are poor and there is an opening between the glass door for the shower and the tub that makes water go everywhere on the floor.    Positive:    The staff is very friendly and they do go out of their way to help. The breakfasts are DIVINE! You have never seen a continental breakfast like the one here. It's far from continental! There is a juice bar pastry eggs Moroccan dishes.. And a man outside frying Moroccan fresh donuts! The food was definitely 5 star.    If this hotel was cheaper it would be ok. But for the expensive prices... Nah. there are other 5 star hotels in Marrakech.

Check in and welcome: When we arrived we were brought to the reception desk of the Lounge and Spa hotel part; A receptionist took our passports and credit card and left; We had to wait for more than half an hour until my husband asked for somebody to take care of us until the staff brought us our documents and handed over the room keys.  Room: Mattresses pillows and linens were nice but the carpet furniture and bathroom has to be refurbished and changed urgently: The carpet was dirty the furniture shabby and the bathroom old; The Lanvin toiletries were nice; The glass door and windows towards the balcony were not cleaned properly and were really dirty; Free wifi everywhere.  Pool area: The pool area is exceptional and the best we have ever seen: Very stylish lots of daybeds for a lot of people; Good food in the restaurant with attentive staff.  Outside bar area: Nice ambience towards the fire places; Very friendly and attentive staff.  Breakfast: Lots of variety and choices also between Moroccan and continental breakfast; relatively attentive staff (except one lady did not understand that we needed a large spoon).  Check out: Went smooth and fast.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Faheem P wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Text: Well this was my first time to this hotel and certainly will not be the last.  It was excellent service from all staff  But most regards go to Adil from the pool side  Zakiria from the hotels disco tech  Omar from the pool side  And Mustafa who makes the best Shisha in the hotel if not just the best Shisha maker .  These 4 staff look after me and my friend very well  And treated us like we're family  Thanks guys for everything will be back in March 4th  To see you lot .  If you ever stay at this hotel  You won't regret it  Amazing hotel  Amazing staff  Excellent service  Nothing I could say bad about it  Most recommends  Price might be Abit high  But wroth every penny

Review_Date: J A wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Text: We travelled as a family of 3 with a young baby 16 months from the moment we step out on the red carpet of the hotel we felt like we were royalty. The first impressions of the hotel reception was that is was amazing stunning d√©cor and and a real feel of luxury complimented with exotic relaxing aromas and we were offered mint tea while we waited to check in.    We received a complimentary upgrade to one of the imperial suites with a balcony overlooking the pool and the room was like an apartment separate lounge separate bedroom 2 bathrooms - 1 bath and 1 showeroom our son zakariya just kept running around in this huge space and exploring. The rooms were of very high standard and our housekeeper Wafa was brilliant on a daily basis would deal with our small requests and needs for our child Wafa saw that we kept heating up the baby milk using kettle water and a pot so brought us a electric baby bottle warmer which made our life simpler and easier Wafa was really friendly helpful and really thoughtful if we went back we would love for Wafa to look after us.    The pool area is nice and relaxing the pictures speak for themselves a real sense of luxury.    Breakfast at the hotel was always a lovely experience with a huge variety to choose from freshly made omelette and pancakes and more! the restaurant staff were brilliant sofia one of the managers each morning personally came and greet us and welcomed us. restaurant staff like  farah Hakim were really helpful. The service was really good and we took extra long to eat and finish with a child and were really good with our crying baby.    The hotel gives a very personal service by day 3 everyone knew our son zakariya by name and always took time to play and joke around with him one of our butlers was called Zakariya too who was really helpful as was Mohammed the porter would help when we came and went from the hotel.    Overall we would recommend this hotel service was excellent and you get a real feel of luxury at this hotel very child friendly and accommodating even provided us with a travel cot.

Review_Date: Shabnam S wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Text: I stayed at the Sofitel with my Mum for 4 nights. The service was very personal from the moment we checked in. The staff were very helpful and always took time to speak to us.  We enjoyed the breakfast there was a good selection of pastries and fruits as well as a choice of cooked breakfast.  The staff were very friendly in the restaurant particularly Rachida Hicham Noooihi Fatima Azli Soumia Taha and Aziz. I was surprised to see so many staff looking after the guests.  I would recommend the Spa the staff were very professional and we really enjoyed the treatments.  Overall a very pleasant experience.

Review_Date: Soukaina J wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Text: Very big thank you to Wiam the manager for bringing me my glasses that I forgot. She even came down to the parking to give me them which are very sentimental for me.    Suberb service and very attentative staff such as Leila (waiter) kitchen staff Rashid Zaizi Moukhtar Mohammed Rabi and Yossef who explained to us our Moroccan dish Tanjiya and the history of it meat slowly cooked in a clay pot.    Then we spent time in the bar with manager Samira to complete a perfect night.

Review_Title: The best spot to relax and kickback with quality service.
Review_Text: It's as if time froze and you step in to the lovely old times of Morocco. The atmosphere of the hotel takes you back in time from the Moroccan tea at the door to the atmosphere of the hotel in general.    But what stood out was the lovely and serene Lawrence Bar. The service and mood was relaxing with very professional and helpful staff which made our visit very enjoyable and part of our daily routine.    I would personally like to thank the following staff:    Wiam Manager    Mohammed Mokhtar Rabi & Amine Assitant waiters at the restaurant    Leila at the Bar    Mostafa Bartender    Highly recommend a visit to Lawrence bar for a great and fun experience.

Review_Date: Biren S wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Text: The wonderful people working at this gorgeous luxurious hotel made our stay totally unforgettable. We arrived at the hotel around 12 pm noon time on Sunday and there were a couple of people checking in. We were politely requested to sit on a comfortable sofa and offered an aromatic towel to freshen up and delicious mint tea while waiting to check in. I approached the desk but the lady at the desk (Noura) politely said she would come to us with everything done. She also completed forms for us to sign up with Accor hotels to get offers and free upgrades. To my pleasant surprise she upgraded us to junior suit with Atlas mountain view. Thank you Noura! The suite was gorgeous with modern furniture (a complete sofa set dining table two televisions marble flooring and two spacious terraces). From our bedroom we could view the majestic Atlas mountains.    The hotel is just outside the Medina (old city) so it was a gentle stroll (about 500 metres) to visit the famous Jemma El Fna square and Koutubia mosque. Location is about perfect as one can avoid the very hectic and lively pace of life inside the Medina and still be part of the charming mayhem at will. Also taxis horse carts etc. are easily available from the hotel.    The hotel has more than 300 rooms so one would expect more business-like and less personal approach towards customers. However we were pleasantly surprised that almost every staff member was very personal and warm towards us. Most of the time we didn‚Äôt need to approach them as they themselves figured out what we wanted and did their best to exceed our expectations. I am sorry I don‚Äôt remember everyone‚Äôs name (my memory is terrible !)‚Ä¶the lady with the specs (who has visited Delhi Mumbai and Goa) and came all the way to show the spa and So restaurant / lounge and explained in detail about food and drinks available at different restaurants (also chatted animatedly about Moroccan people and culture)‚Ä¶the shaved head gentleman with a hat who served with smiling face during morning breakfast and also at pool side‚Ä¶the cleaning lady who meticulously cleaned our room and every evening visited us to ask if everything was alright in our room (and also once presented beautiful rose bud)‚Ä¶ We have visited more than 25 countries so far (including most of Europe and America) and this was first ever hotel where nearly every staff member took great pride in offering their best service. Well done you all‚Ä¶pls keep it up ! Speaks volume of the warmth of Moroccan people and Sofitel culture. The breakfast was sumptuous and we were spoilt for choices ‚Äì Continental Moroccan (Harira soup was awesome) Fruits fresh juices (freshly squeezed pomegranate juice was my favourite) dry fruits selection of cheese and so on. We were served at table fresh juice tea etc. when requested. Every now and then every person (including manager) at reception lounge pool asked us how our stay was at the hotel and if they could do anything to make it better‚Ä¶ Not expected at hotel of this size.    The only areas where I would suggest a little improvement is cashier and concierge service ‚Äì as there was a little absence of attention when dealing with the cashier (some sympathy with people dealing with money as having done cashiering myself in early stages of career I know dealing with money is a bit stressful). Pre-authorisation on our credit card was taken but we were not given any proof when leaving the hotel that the pre-authorisation will be cancelled. Only orally confirmed so I would say this could be made more professional by presenting valid proof of cancellation of pre-authorisation when checking out. Also the concierge gentleman was keen on selling us Atlas mountain holiday on a definitely cold and rainy day (Monday 24 November 2014) ‚Äì we politely refused and didn‚Äôt visit the service again (partly also because we wanted to make the most of Medina part of the city during our first visit of Marrakech).    This was first hotel where we stayed more in the hotel than visiting tourist places just to enjoy the facilities of the hotel (our lovely suit heated swimming pool and garden spa). And still we couldn‚Äôt visit its lovely restaurants (four of them if I remember correctly) as we tucked in lots of street food at the famous Jemma El Fna square; also I couldn‚Äôt find time to visit the gym of the hotel. Maybe next time ‚Äì Marrakech is beautiful and lively place and Sofitel made it even better experience.    In summary I would say Sofitel Marrakech is a jewel in the crown of Accor hotels. We would love to visit Marrakech again to enjoy the hospitality of your hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A lovely hotel allowing you to escape from the mayhem of central Marrakesh. Great facilities superb outdoor pools and lovely service. Breakfast is expensive if not included but the choice is wonderful and beautifully presented. Restaurant is good and waiters made a big thing of our wedding anniversary.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Marilyn G wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: I stayed at this hotel for several days early this month. My first complaint is that it is full of perfume everywhere and I spent all my time indoors there coughing and sneezing. My second complaint is that it took them all afternoon to find rooms for our group which had been prebooked by the tour company.    My room was spacious and nicely furnished but poorly lit. And the service esp. the lobby crew was not what it should have been.    I found this hotel very pretentious and hope it is not representative of all Sofitels. This was my first one.)

Although this place was busy my room was so comfortable and calm. Top of the range bedding pillows bathroom toiletries bath robe meant you could really relax and have some peace. Lovely view from my room with balcony of Atlas mountains. Breakfast was excellent with a varied selection. Weather unusually cool and rainy prevented us from sitting outside by the pool which looked lovely and inviting. Tried dinner upstairs in the lounge with live entertainment (two guitars) which was pleasant. Service at the front desk was prompt and courteous. My request for extra water in the room was somehow never met; and one day they forgot to provide hand towels - so just some little things that still need attention given the rating of this hotel. But overall a very positive experience and I would return!

Review_Date: Tony K wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: We enjoyed a 7 night stay in this lovely hotel in November 2014. Apart from the time taken to check in we found everything more than satisfactory. The staff were unfailingly helpful courteous and clearly intended to make our stay memorable. We would particularly like to mention Atoul from the room service staff who could not have provided any better service than he did. He was attentive had a great sense of humour and met our every request in a timely charming and efficient manner

Review_Date: J T wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Title: Hotel is great, service is mixed
Review_Text: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights at the end of September. As it was our first trip to the country we didn't feel adventurous enough to experience a Riad.    The hotel itself is very good. Lovely building decent spread for breakfast great lounge area by the pool good restaurants lively bar and the spa is lovely it was so tranquil and nice we went there two days in a row.    However for a hotel of this level I expected a little more with the service. Reception appears to be understaffed and check-in took about 20 minutes even though no other customers were visibly present. There were problems with the mini-bar fridge and bathroom sinks when we arrived and had to ask 4 times before someone attended. The concierge leaves a bit to be desired - ahead of arrival we arranged transport for several days throughout our trip - the emails were abrupt at best.    Having said that although slow most of the staff we met at the hotel were courteous especially one of the doormen who mysteriously appeared to be working 24 hour shifts throughout our stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: They have a great and excellent service with the people. Very accommodating and respectful people specially Farah Bentaleb Nouihi Hicham Azly Rachida Fatima Berd TahaSomiya Sarra Zahra Rashid and P.D.J . This is our second stay in Sofitel marrakesh because we feel like we are home and comfortable with the people's service. Staying 8 days with them is a very satisfactory that we could surely repeat all over again and again in this hotel. I made a membership with the le club because of the people. Staying in their opera suite is amazing service that I could recommend. I'm planning also my next trip to London to stay in Sofitel London to see the difference of the service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I travelled here on the 6th Nov 2014 for 4 nights for my birthday. I travelled with 3 other ladies. We received great service from day 1. I arrived to roses in my room and a tray of fruit and macaroons. I was sent a cake to my room in the evening by room service which was a pleasant surprise. The room was spacious with a lovely view of the beautiful pool. Bathroom was a good size and was supplied with Lanv√≠n toiletries.    The hotel is huge with a nice decor staff were very friendly and there was also a nice scent in the lobby/reception area. Whilst we checked in we were offered some lovely Moroccan tea.    We visited So good restaurant in the evening they have live music which was very entertaining and they kindly sang 'Happy Birthday' to me....again pleasant surprise. The restaurant/lounge bar turns into a club later on. We visited this twice and was a good night out.    The hotel is located near a Casino and clubs. We visited the Theatro club on a Saturday which was amazing and was a 3-5 minute walk (in heels).    There is an ATM at this hotel and currency exchange.    The hotel is nicely located and perfect for a short trip. Thank you to the team that looked after us throughout the 4 days we all had an enjoyable and memorable trip.    Definitely recommend this hotel!

Review_Date: Antje D wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Title: Amazing Hotel in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: After a one week trip through Morocco we enjoyed the Sofitel in Marrakech. The Sofitel Hotels were by far the most pleasant accommodations we experienced. The Sofitel has very good facilities with a wonderful Spa restaurants & in- as well as outdoor area.  The friendliness and the service is outstanding. The entire staff did everything possible to make this stay special. Starting with the Manager Univers - Yassine- and his team Aicha in the Spa area; the Pool staff with Aziz and El Mokhtar as well as the Bar Crew -just to thank a few!

Review_Date: Ed T wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: This is really a first class hotel and very well run EXCEPT they seem to have a problem with their reservation data and the key system. I was traveling with friends and all of us arrive back at our rooms only to find our keys didn't work. This happened to me 4 times in a 3 day stay. And one day our group had been checked out and rooms locked a day early. These issues detracted from what was otherwise and wonderful hotel in a very exciting city.

Review_Date: Experienced Traveler 2012 wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: #1 if you go bring Immodium - you will most likely need it and if you need it in the middle of the hotel - the hotel will not get it for you. Nice customer care.    This hotel is a little old and tired. Lighting in the room was poor. First room I had to refuse outside was an extremely noisy ac.    This place made it a bit to apparent the only thing they wanted was your money.    But I am sure you can also do much worse than the Sofitel!!!

Review_Title: A one night stop at the end of a 10 day stay in Morocco
Review_Text: We had a fantastic welcome at this hotel and the room was extremely good. Arriving at lunchtime we made our way to the buffet which was good but a little expensive especially if you only wanted a light snack. By the far the most disappointing aspect of this hotel which marred our stay was the checkout. We were slightly pushed for time and in front of us was a lady complaining about her bill. with only one person attending to this and the other member of staff doing nothing it was a complete shambles. I had to interrupt to say that I was in a hurry to catch a flight (as it turned out I need not have bothered as Marrakech airport was a complete joke - a total lack of security and lots of queuing!!) and asked if there were any other staff available - there wasn't! The price quoted on booking was less than we were charged but we did not have the time to query it. We also had to arrange our own bags to be collected from the rooms - the porters were however excellent.

Review_Date: Larry C wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: Of the 23 hotels we stayed in on our last trip the soffitel was by far the best. The hotel is lavish while very affordablethe service is so good that it almost over the topthe staff are very helpful and friendlythe rooms are comfortable with mini bars and air con that works and the most comfortable bed you will ever sleep in.Everything was spotless.The breakfast buffet was fantastic and so too were the breakfast staff.A special mention to the concierge has to be made for his untiring and succesful efforts to assist whenever requested. We had a superb 6 course lebanese dinner in the upstairs restaurant provided by the hotel after a minor misunderstanding and i would like to thank the training mgr from HR. Two large clean swimming pools made for good sunbaking. Go there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Best part of Sofitel for view of garden and pools
Review_Text: We booked this part of the hotel for the reason the rooms are nearer everything then the rooms in the Imperial Palace part. We stayed in the Imperial Palace in the beginning of our trip and changed it over to the Lounge and Spa for the end of the trip and it was a good choice. Room has al you need and a comfy bed. Very good views of the gardens an pools and near the restaurants. the hotel is situated in the Hivernage quarter next to de Es Saadi The Novotel Suite Hotel Hivernage and the Pearl. We we're very glad with our choice and being out of the medina. Choosing a hotel in Marrakech can be tricky but you just have to make up your mind if you want to stay in the middle of the hustle and bustle (medina) or just out of it. just out of it it also means that a car can pick you up and drop you off at the hotel door. In the medina some places are remote from the road and it means that you have to find your way through the alleys to your hotel or riad. The rooms in riads in the medina are mostly smaller too.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple
