Review_Date: Houss√†m C wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: ..  The Hotel Sofitel Marrakech is a magical and special place because of its structure location and especially the "unparalleled" service teams ranging from the welcome at reception with Housam and Hesham Mostafa rachida thank you tou teams  and staff through the room or restaurant staff pleasant and makes your custom break. We would like to thank Fatima. housam

Have just returned from a weeks holiday in Morocco and my family and I stayed for 3 nights in Sofitel Marrakech Lounge and Spa. I am not usually one to write reviews however this hotel deserves recognition for amazing service staff food and setting.    Upon arrival we were offered beautiful mint tea and reception staff were very attentive. Although we had a mix up with our rooms they changed us with no fuss and were very pleasant. Even had macaroons in our room with a gorgeous view overlooking the pool area and the city. On our first evening we stumbled across The So Good restaurant/bar in the hotel. Amazing mojitos in the most gorgeous setting (lanterns and cushions and candles everywhere) and the waiters were of an excellent standard. I had the lamb with prunes in the most gorgeous tagine. To die for!    Breakfast in les jardins is amazing. Beautiful fresh pastries and fruit (especially the pomegranates) along with a wide array of traditional Moroccan delicacies and hot food. The staff are a joy and couldn't have done enough for us they seemed very genuine in their approach.    We ate lunch around the pool skewers prawns... Delicious! And again the wait staff were excellent and couldn't have done enough for us.    We will definitely return to Sofitel Lounge & Spa again. Not only is it a beautiful hotel with excellent food but the staff made it a wonderful and relaxing break for us. Cannot wait to return for some winter sun again!

Review_Date: Cathy F wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: Loved the smell of "les fleurs d'oranger" from the diffuser in the lobby!! Will forever remind me of Marrekech! Room was quite spacious and the beds were the most comfortable I have ever slept in! That said the decor was a bit tired and the lighting very dim. The balcony with a nice view of the pool was totally unusable due to the multitude of pigeons who decided to visit and do their business on the furniture all day long! The hotel should really look into nets or something that will deter them.  The staff was really helpful - especially the doorman who went out of his way to help us with taxis etc. As noted by previous clients the check-in was slow and inefficient but  in the end who cares? We had a wonderful long weekend in a beautiful hotel!

Review_Date: Sam T wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: Overall not bad. Make sure you know the difference between the Imperial and Lounge and Spa. When we stayed there they initially made a mistake with our rooms and tried to place us in the Imperial. The lounge and Spa is newer. I would say its worth it provided you get a decent discount through a hotels search engine for a cheap deal.

In the past 25 years due to my travel I have covered more than 80 cities in 6 different continents (cities such as San Fran LA London Paris Saint Petersburg Dubai Hong kong Tokyo Egypt more cities that you care me to mention) with over 180 hotels (such as Four Seasons Burj Al Arab Hilton Dorchester George V Marriott Holiday Inn etc) yes Sofitel Marrakech made us feel special from the word go.    Upon Entering the premisses an Orange Blossom scents encapsulates you then comes the staff with the most simple yet wonderful effective and very original welcome I had ever experianced after a long travel there is nothing better than a nice drink (in this case was a simple cool Moroccan tea) and a desperately needed Hot towel (how good is that after a long travel) This is while processing the Hotel registration. Yes this is the ingenuity of the manager's hospitality Mr Soufiane Mazzouj. As for the other members staff Such as the amazing Khoula (I believe a customer relationship coordinator) and the waiters such as Mustafa and Fatima at the breakfast area and Lubna in the Child group area.    To all the whom that made my family and I feel very special and welcome during our 10 day stay at the Sofitel Marrakech. We don't know how to thank you all for your kind help and support during our stay.    The Mousawi Family

Review_Title: A home far away from home. The best hotel
Review_Text: I have been in many hotels in Marrakech but Sofitel is one special hotel. First the location is perfect and the hotel is magnigificent everything is perfect the rooms with the vie and the food and the pool arias. But this is something you can find everywhere almost in marrakech. But there is one thing that makes us come back and that is the employees and there are 4 persons that really stands out. First its samira samira is this lovely beautiful girl working as the manager in the bar near to the pool. She welcomes you and helps you as you where really close to her. Nouafal works there to and he is sutch a gentleman and always a smile on his face that shines your day . And then we have abderrahman he is the boss when it comes to rooms and helps you with everything you need to make your stay as good as possible and at his side there is Ismail who helps you with the rooms to. They together are excellent how would our stay be without them. For us as you can read its not just an hotel they makes us feel like home but in a more warmer and exotic country. So if you visit marrakech this is the place to go. You will not regret it. And I wanna thank the director of F and B M.Benouby for his wellcoming
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fantastic hotel if you are travelling with children
Review_Text: We stayed for 3 nights with our two children (aged 7 & 2) at the end of October. It has to be said it really is the staff that make this hotel. There are elements of the decor which are a little tired in the interior of the hotel but the pool facilities are fantastic with one of the pools heated (much needed during our stay) and really comfortable sunloungers which were plentiful. The team at the poolside were fantastic and the waiter who served us each day couldn't do enough for us he was incredible.  The children were fussed over and really made to feel welcome. There are small touches for the younger guests like the pedal karts and track at the front of the hotel and the giant chess set and wooden table games in the gardens which make for a more interesting stay.  Breakfast provided an excellent choice and variety of options which were all beautifully presented. Again it was the small touches like having a buffet for kids with mini croissants and small packets of  Kellogg's cereal which sets the hotel apart. Farah served us each day at breakfast and a special mention must be made of her exceptional service guests care and patience! Her smile is constant and she is unflustered even when very busy. An absolute star.  The location of the hotel is very good. We walked into the main square and labyrinth of souks in less than 15 minutes. There are a number of very nice restaurants within very close proximity which we used rather than eat in the hotel. (The main restaurant in the hotel is lovely but the menu was just too formal for my kids). Access from the airport is also very quick-we used the hotel car for pick up which cost more than a taxi but for the convenience and comfort very worthwhile.  Finally my husband arranged a cake for my birthday which I celebrated whilst staying at the hotel-it was left at turn down service came personalised and tasted delicious! We are very grateful to Hamid Atoul Rachid Ritam hassan Meriem and Amine who arranged this for my husband with less than 24 hours notice-they did a super job and made me cry! Happy tears thankfully!  In a nutshell I'd happily return. The staff are fantastic the location is great and the pool is superb-sad to be home!

Overall a good hotel with friendly and helpful staff .one major drawback is the showers. Cant get steady warm water it changes suddenly very hot or very cold. Swimming pools are clean and well maintained abd restaurants too.  Palais Darkum staff is the best specially the smile in their faces  Nezha AzizaHindGhizlanNassima and Samira are really my favorites.

We stayed for a week at Sofitel hotel and that was a joyful one!as you enter the lobby area is so nicely decorated that takes you back in time!staff very polite and helpful .the pool is huge and the garden around perfect.our room was pool facingvery nice and clean with all the amenities someone would need.

Review_Date: Barry W wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: Stayed at the Sofitel for a week in mid October. Perfect location close to the airport and old town. Wonderful ambience and aroma on entering. Upgraded to a junior suite with views across the swimming pools to the mountains.Beds a little lumpy. Not seen a hotel with so many restful sitting areas both indoors and out always quiet places available. I cannot compliment the staff too highly. Nothing was too much trouble. Lovely breakfasts. I would particularly praise Farah the waitress Atoul for room service Safa in the Spa and all the reception staff. A perfect place to return to after a long day out. A less formal and earlier dining option in the evenings would be a bonus.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Surprisingly Terrible service and communication marred good facilities and location
Review_Text: Oh dear where to start.    I'll be specific with multiple examples of poor service unexpected for a Sofitel that really ruined our stay. The smaller boutique riads offer better value/service. Given the multiple issues experienced by myself and friends - am surprised at this score.    1) Upon arrival despite booking and checking-in (!!) the newer lounge and spa we were moved through the building into the older Imperial WITHOUT our consent. The hotels adjoin each other so we didn't realise we had been moved until next day our friends described their rooms. Having unpacked and settled we chose not to move but were unhappy.    2) Despite confirming bookings for spa they did not have our appts - only after complaining did they then accommodate our original timings.    3) Despite email explicitly asking for a ladies hair appt (wash/dry/pin-up) for my partner (we had a wedding to attend) the hairdresser didn't know how to pin-up hair!! They found another hairdresser who then proceeded to do a poor job (pins fell out on way back to room). Despite listing a hairdresser on the website the hotel is clearly unable to offer a quality full service.    4) When requesting shirt pressing was told someone is coming 20m later.. called again.. they said coming nothing. 15m later I left the room. When eventually next day shirt was picked up was meant to be ready by 2pm shirt only returned when chased at 4pm... seriously? Am i meant to be chasing staff.    5) Breakfast very overpriced. Go to the cafe literally across the road - great food on third of the price.    There is a general 'lack-of-responsibility' culture and poor communication with the staff. Upon problems occurring no one takes responsibility or tries to fix.    Only when pressured or complaining or with escalation do things get fixed.  Poor communication is also to blame.. if there is a delay/problem - then why?    Its a large hotel and maybe it was a busy period but we had around 10 rooms and others also had problems ranging from pungent and/or unmade rooms being offered to malfunctioning AC with consensus around generally lack of responsiveness    I complained extensively and so got some resolution needless to say having to complain about basic simple things ruined our stay.. Those without the inclination or demeanor to complain as I did would probably suffer here in silence.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We (myself wife and son) had a few nights here in late October and really enjoyed our stay.    It is about 10 mins from Airport the cab driver charged us 200 Dhs which may have been steep. I should have seen if the hotel provided a transfer.    Our room was magnificent very spacious and a lovely comfy bed.  The pool and surrounding area were excellent very relaxing and friendly service.  The front desk were professional and couldn't do more to help. In particular a lady whose name may have been Safaa who was lovely.  The breakfast was delicious and quite good value.  The one thing that stops me from giving 5 stars was the rest of the dining options. Many dinners did not start until 7:30 which is quite late for my 2 year old. There was the choice of the room service menu in the outside bar area which we opted for. I would have preferred a poolside or separate bar food menu available during the early evening hours for those who want another option as ordering from room service menu could take 40 mins and on one occasion my pizza was not hot.    Overall - a definate recommendation!

In summary a very good hotel with the best breakfast I have ever eaten combined with the excellent helpful staff.However my only gripes are largely of my own making!Arriving in the early hours with a very kind taxi driver I was adamant that this was a different hotel from the illustration of the one I had booked-wrong !the two hotels old and new share the same imposing entrance and at night the same reception(the illustration I had seen was of the interior of the new part !After that during our stay I was confused by the number of different eating opportunities at various times of day combined with different pricing structures .On checking out I agreed with reception that the overall total for food and drink was OK but was not at all certain that it was my bill!(of course it was I had only stayed three nights and had not spent time mugging up on the various restaurant/eatery profiles)In short a very helpful and in my case tolerant staff with a resident whom I am sure fitted the definition of a mad englishman!If you are not teetotal it is worth remembering that this is a country where alcohol in hotels can be very expensive (but of course you can bring your own -supermarkets or duty free)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Younes A wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: Good hotel with wonderful staff specially room service team for their high quality of service. Special Thanks to Kamal and Zakaria for their professionalism and effeciency. The hotel is Very close to jamaa el fna which is amazing place to be visited.

Review_Title: Staying at Sofitel - Ok, but not great
Review_Text: On our 10 year anniversary and booked the Sofitel because it came across as quite plush and the place to have a bit of an indulgent week. The surroundings are admittedly luxurious but it ends there. We were put in a junior suite but the bathroom was badly designed - anytime the shower was used there ended up being a great deal of water on the floor and we had to use half of our towels to keep it from going into the main room. The separate toilet was a bit dated and small. We were ok with these anomalies but not with the staff service which was actually quite appalling. A couple of times my wife asked questions at reception about facilities how to get to a restaurant etc. The staff were dismissive of her to the point to rudeness. In fact one of the night clerks went so far as not even to say anything but just gestured for her to speak to the concierge turned his back on her and pointedly played with his mobile. What made it even worse was that a few seconds a European couple walked up and he was all light and sweetness. It is quite apparent that he thought that since she was Asian and a female he did not need to show the respect she deserved as a guest. This happened to a lesser extent several times - when she ordered tea on the terrace and it took ages to come and when it did it was done grudgingly; when we were waiting in line to speak to the concierge and a random Middle Eastern guest jumped in front and he started to engage with her despite seeing us in line until I seriously lost it and told both of them this was unacceptable and that she needed to wait her turn. I am logging a complaint with the general manager over these issues but it is quite clear that the staff have a superiority complex as well as giving a strong impression of racially-segmented behaviours. This is unacceptable. I have stayed in many great hotels across the world this is the one where I have felt the most uncomfortable and I would not choose to stay here again any time soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Miriam H wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Title: Better but there's still room for improvement
Review_Text: This was our second stay in Marrakech‚Äôs Sofitel Lounge and Spa and after the first stay we had no intention to ever come back. Well here we are and we must say we expected less than we got.    The room we had two years ago was worn down and small. Now we got a beautifully renovated room with a large terrace. The beds were too soft for our convenience but others might like it that way. Reception staff was nice and efficient and even the concierge tried to be friendly and helpful this time. Big improvement!    The best experience we had was dinner in the Lounge‚Äôs outside area called ¬´ So Nice ¬ª: This is a stunning garden bar/restaurant: Lights and candles cushions fountains... marvellous surroundings! One of the most beautiful garden restaurants we have ever been to! The food was delicious and the young lady who served it was charming and professional. We‚Äôll be back for more!    Unfortunately there are still quite a few downsides and some of them leave you speechless:  We asked for a quiet room and got one in the first place but found the loud life music from the Bar/Restaurant in the Courtyard most annoying. You can hardly avoid it as virtually all rooms face the Courtyard. I don‚Äôt really understand why a Hotel that has a Bar/Restaurant area where they can play life music and no one is bothered (the ‚ÄûSo Lounge/So Nice‚Äú) chooses to play music in the Courtyard as well: There was a handful of guests in the Bar but about 100 rooms that were affected by the noise ‚Äì probably not a good choice.    The spa/gym area is nice and well equipped. But if you‚Äôre looking for those refreshing 5 minutes in the indoor pool after a workout: Be careful! You‚Äôre not allowed to use it ‚Äì or you are but you pay extra if you haven‚Äôt got a spa treatment. The same goes for towels in the changing room: You don‚Äôt get one unless you have a spa treatment. Imagine: Your workout is over you‚Äôve just had a shower ‚Äì but no towels! Sorry. And yes we claim to be a five star-hotel.    BE CAREFUL WHEN HAVING YOUR LUGGAGE STORED !! Only when we picked it up did we realise that it was stored OUTSIDE the storage room in the Hotel entrance area out in the open space and 30 m from the street! Anyone could have walked up to it and just take what they want. ABSOLUTELY UNBELIEVABLE and a no-go for a hotel of this category.    All in all this was a nice but still mixed experience. We still feel that not enough effort is put into figuring out what makes a guest happy - unfortunately a nice location is not enough. Do we come back for a third stay? We don‚Äôt know yet.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tim Y wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Title: Second best hotel in Marrakesh, probably
Review_Text: We arrived on a late flight but the reception staff were unprepared and unprofessional. The atmosphere in the lobby was louche and heavy with cigarette smoke the upshot of some event at the main hotel bar which we didn't fancy paying to get into. The room we were given for the first night was next to a bank of AC fans and noisy.    The atmosphere the following day was different for the better. The breakfast was excellent in terms of food quality and choice and service. Afterwards we were able to move room and the reception staff were professional particularly Amina. The rooms themselves are well appointed comfortable and evidently normally peaceful. It was my birthday during the stay and the hotel surprised me with some cake in the room.    All areas of the hotel were pleasant and broadly 5* level. The spa isn't the best I've been in but is perfectly reasonable and there was an attractive deal available during our stay. The outside areas with two pools was well kept and had enough sun beds for everyone. Getting hold of a towel was a protracted process however and the pool guys weren't very helpful.    In the evenings the piano bar was lovely - often with local music playing in the background.    Location-wise we could walk into the centre of the old town in 15-20 minutes.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Wonderful professional team at the Lawrence bar. Art of details!!!  The simple task of lighting candles is made into a local folkloric show. Reminding you that you that you're in Marrakech sofitel and not any sofitel. Don't usually take pictures but felt like taking videos of this show.    Had to congratulate the team so asked to speak to the manager Wiam.    The service as usual is unquestionable!! Special thanks to The team made of  Siham mohamed Rabi Leila Aziz youssef Youness chicha guy  Ali & oussama.

Review_Date: Sharon H wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Title: Great Hotel, Great Service and Wonderful Staff!
Review_Text: We have just come back from a three night break at this hotel and can only say we had an amazing time. Our check in was relatively smooth although a little slow but after reading reviews of this problem lowered my expectations and just went with the flow. We allocated a lovely twin room on the fourth floor. The room was lovely and clean with everything you wanted with the Lanvin Toiletries Bathrobes Slippers etc and a fab balcony with table chairs and Day Bed the afternoon sun was just lovely there. The maid service in the day was spot on and we also got the turn down service every evening with clean towels and topped up toiletries. The Mini Bar didn't get replenished but we just asked the reception desk on the way out to dinner and when we got back it had been stocked :-)  The Breakfast buffet was incredible they even had a Smoothie Chef to make up whatever you want :-)  The Pool was amazing and the service staff were very attentive.    We visited the Spa for a Facial and it was so relaxing and the products used were beautiful.    The concierge was wonderful arranging our taxis for dinner and calling ahead to the restaurant so that they could send a staff member to meet and greet us :-)    We will definitely be going back to this wonderful hotel well done and Thank you to The Sofitel Marrakesh :-)

Charming building good food comfy beds friendly staff nicely landscaped. Wi-Fi didn‚Äôt work in our room had to stand in the hallway to get any sort of signal after calling the reception on 3 different occasions right from day 1 on arrival the Wi-Fi started working on the 3rd and last day of our stay in the hotel. The other thing that I found extremely odd and rather inconvenient about our room was that fact that the toilet was on its own right when you entered the room in a fairly small space but no sink in sight!!! The bathroom sink and the shower were in a separate area of the room on their own. All that aside my major concern about this resort  given the price range and the fact that they claim to be a ‚ÄúLuxury‚Äù resort is that they forgot to mention a ‚Äù little‚Äù detail about the pool tile removal and replacement project right under our window that was in full effect every day. And the grand finally we were awaken on our last night at 2:30 AM by lovely sound of the pressure washer compressor under our window being used by the hotel staff to clean the common area and around the pool when I phone the front desk to complain about the noise I was told ‚Äúsir we do all of our maintenance and cleaning during the night‚Äù they did eventually stop. Bottom line lower your expectations if you‚Äôre used to the quality of the other Sofitel resorts.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: This beautiful hotel needs better employees
Review_Text: Concierge : not to trust. Wrong info about tours. Lack of explanations. Mostly not present at the desk cause busy chatting elsewhere.    Check in and out :  Not very helpful . Language barrier?  Demanding to wait till their computer system was up and running again even though our transportation was waiting outside.

Having nice Time with amazing people. One of the best places To visit in marrakech and have some cool drinks surrounded by careful and devoted guys. Live band playing cool tunes from the past.everyone living or visiting marrakech Must experience warm evenings in this cosy lounge and wonderful place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We booked this holiday not knowing that it would be during Ramadan so most resturants and all bars were closed. The hotel staff were extremely tired and level of service was low.    The hotel was also under construction and this should have been mentioned in the booking advertisement.    The hotel is extremely over priced e.g ¬£8 for a conflict coke.....I'm not sure even the Ritz charge such ridiculous prices. The hotel food was absolutely horrific and again ridiculously expensive for what is was worth.    If your looking for staff who can speak English then your better off going to the local Square Souq as the market traders actually speak English.    If you don't speak French or Arabic expect bad service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Very nice hotel in the centre of Marrakech
Review_Text: Very nice spacious room decent size swimming pool and amazing breakfast. WiFi is pretty fast and the service is outstanding. Some cockroaches in the room.    Highly recommended to stay here the garden is also pretty cool.

I love the Sofitel brand and frequently stay at Sofitel across the world. We stayed at this hotel 2 years ago and gave the benefit of the doubt for the initial bad service because we liked the hotel and visited again. This is not a CHEAP hotel it is expensive to stay eat and drink. Returned in September for 15 nights after staying at a Sofitel airport hotel (subject to an excellent separate review).    Pros  Has a beautiful majestic setting  In a good location near the medina shops and high quality restaurants  Spectacular gardens reception area and terrace  Great pool area    Cons  Booked hotel transfer at 250 mad they weren't there when we arrived  Booked a non smoking room given one with an adjoining door where the smoke seeped under the door  Check in took 45 minutes to be told room wouldn't be ready until 3pm and they would call me when ready  Didn't receive a call and returned at 4pm room wasn't ready told to return in 30 minutes as the hotel was full  Ordered refreshments at the pool waiters ignored the request on several days  For 6 days of the holiday housekeeping had to be contacted daily for towels which hadn't been replaced  Rooms often not tidied until after 5pm  Couldn't use the balcony because of bird poo on the day bed which was only cleaned on the last few days  Carpet was never hovered  Bathroom floor never cleaned  Sink was cracked  Carpets throughout the accommodation areas were worn  Accommodation area was tardy dirty and weary  No Tea or coffee facilities in the rooms  Sockets hanging out the wall  Bulbs removed from the lift one out of six in place  Lift alarm activated no one responded to confirm if this was an emergency  Person injured at the pool and asked for a first aid kit no one appeared  Building work on-going putting pools in and ripping a new one out  Too many people in suits looking important but not being responsible or accountable for anything  When complaints were made to a manager they didn't resolve anything  Waited 20 minutes at check out to allow 5 staff to finish bickering in front of two customers    To summarise lacks customer focus and service lacks management structure responsibility and accountability obvious deterioration with minimum maintenance in the accommodation areas. If thinking about visiting look at other better hotels in the vicinity. We will not be returning to this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A good quality hotel but high human traffic (large coach groups and corporate events) does not leave you with the feeling of a calm oasis that the marketing department would like you to believe! The reality was a chaotic breakfast room that looked as though it had been attacked by a plague of locusts and a level of service and attention that does not always reflect the star rating of the hotel. Restaurant and drinks were over priced but there's plenty of choice outside the hotel. Building works at the pool did not help us to relax. All in all a good quality stay just not the oasis of calm and quality of service that we were hoping for.

Review_Date: Will M wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Text: My stay in the Sofitel Hotel Marrakech was excellent. The breakfast buffet was superb and the help and friendliness of the staff was exceptional especially Farah Said and Layla who always went out of their way to make my stay even more enjoyable and relaxing.  Would definitely stay again - 5 stars!

Review_Title: Farrah and Hicham - Waitress and Waiter of the YEAR Award!
Review_Text: Farrah and Hicham and a lot of the staff are amazing. Farrah and Hicham work in the restaurant as a servers. They are kind hard working and have the brightest smiles and purest hearts. But what really stood out for me. Is the morning breakfast is a buffett. Farrah made sure I ate my morning breakfast. She cared for me in the most nurturing of ways. My face buried in a computer she would come and gently tell me not to lose my focus and ask me what I would like and go to the buffett to get me breakfast allowing me to sit and focus on my work. So my best description of Farrah is‚Ä¶.Thoughtful and kind. The ability to observe a stranger and anticipate there needs. A rare and beautiful quality in the hospitality business. Now Hicham was my IT guru at breakfast. He would sit and fix all my problems and did so with generosity and kindness. Imagine a waiter willing to help a stranger fix all her gadgets‚Ä¶.Now that's service!    If not for Farrah and Hicham I may not have given Sofitel Marrakech another thought (other than wifi frustration). But I will remember them in my heart forever and will probably return based on them working at Sofitel.

My experience of the Sofitel hotel is that it is genuinely the best hotel I have ever stayed in!  It's truly beautiful surroundings but what has made it are the people! I cannot thank all at the Oasis pool bar enough! Especially Omar always smiling Reda friendly and professional Imad nothing is too much trouble Laila a joy to be around Youssef for the amazing cocktails Wafa for always a welcoming greeting Mostpha & Mouhemed a pleasure! Also both Tariq & Tarik for teaching me to write my name in Arabic! Al Mokhtar for being so lovely. Also Said Hamzd & Zokanie in the night so lounge for keeping us well hydrated & topped up with double apple shisha!  I will be coming back to Matrakech it will forever have a place in my heart!  Thank you all so much Marahaba!!! Xxxx

My visit of sofitel Marrakshe was fantastic service at a high level where Rafat me the sit which made me 2 day getaway restaurant staff very excellent thank all of  -Azly  -Abderahim  -Rachida  -Fatim  -Benayad  -Nezha  ** Thanks for all and see you soon**

I went here with my best friend and sister. We had an amazing time the staff are really friendly and the hotel is absolutely beautiful. Could not find a fault to the place. Highly recommended to anyone going to Marrakech

Review_Date: Sarah M wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Text: I love Sofitel as magnificent place where i spent my wholly Time With friends in my holidays  either sejourning or eating in their fantastic restaurant  it reminds a special destination where i feel welcoming With their smiling and very greatful clerks  i cant make a comment Without talking about the way we get served in Lawrence bar owing to his manager Wiam the one that give us feeling as we are in home  Also the other staff beginning With leila  kebir  Mohamed youssef and the last one rabi3 . Well  I entirely happy being customer of Sofitel hotel thanks a lot to its management .

Review_Date: Ed W wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Text: We almost decided to stay at a more authentic riad. Glad we decided we wanted a pool and a more luxurious hotel. The SOFITEL Marrakech provided all of that and more. We stayed in a junior suite thanks to the front office manager.    The pools were amazing and the service was exceptional. Word of warning... The drinks are expensive. But indulge a few times. Otherwise go hit a store to buy some wine for your room. Also the breakfast buffet is one of the best around if you can get included in your room price. Otherwise

Review_Title: I have been robbed by the hotel staff
Review_Text: When in my way to the Marrakech airport after a medium week in Sofitel I was reached by a hotel car asking back my receipt (payed in cash) because a bill of about 10 Euro was missing asking me to go back to the hotel. I paid the 10 Euro in order to avoid to miss my plane directly to hotel staff. They took my receipt promising to mail it to me with the correction. After a month I was charger the full amount of the stay (around 1000 Euro) on my credit card. I had left a slip from my card at arrival time. The hotel contacted by me refused to answer. So if you want to stay in this average level but expensive hotel be very wise: your stay could cost you twice as supposed !!!

It waz amazing stay  and great staff  while I'm in LE JARDIN resturant I face 5 star services and so helpful from staff like : Abderahim Mohammed  hicham hajaziz shahira Hassan  Fatima  benayad. They are so expert and so friendly . :)

I was for the first time in this hotel two years ago in Ramadan period and the hotel was not crowded at all therefore the service was great we were all the time asked by the staff if we were ok and if we needed anything and we really great time. We came back this summer with this opinion but nothing was the same starting from the check in that we needed two hour to get in our room and more than one hour for check out.so difficult finding a free sunbed and if you go after noon to swiming pool you will be provided with towells just dried from prior users not washed.  Above all due to have problem with my bank bcs of the credit card used in this hotel I send more than three emails to the hotel to clarify the situation and no answer was send to me. These features don't fit to an exellent hotel as this is pretended to be!!!

i'stay here with a groupe busness associates. Class room was very Good excellent dinner in orangerievery Good breakfast choice.  All staff is friendly And willing served. Lot  of thank's for awa and siham.

Stayed here three times. Great location. Helpful staff. Lovely food in the restaurants at night time. Pool area fantastic. Would recommend for a very relaxing break. The hotel is expensive for food drink massages compared with the local area. There's an inexpensive cafe/restaurant called Extra Blatt about 3/4 minutes walk away which is perfect for lunch and a Carrefour about 10/12 minutes away for water/snacks    The hotel offers a limousine service from the airport which is the same price as a local taxi. A great place to stay if you want an enjoyable and relaxing holiday.

What to say  I had a great stay at sofitel and specially with wiam and her staff  Lokking for all details feeling in good hands  Leila and siham wonderfull girls very profesionnal offering the Moroccan hospitality  and special thanks to mustapha barman with his wonderful cocktails and I dont want to forget chicha man younes    At the restaurant rabie youssef mohammed kebir are happy to serve you with amaizing smile  Wish them all the best and hope to come back very soon

Review_Date: Paulien M wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Text: We stayed here for 10 nights excellent hotel. We were treated very friendly by the staff. Special thanks to Hicham and his collegues at breakfast which was fantastic. Service here is impeccable though the food and drinks were very expensive. Better go to the Medina for authentic Moroccan specialities. Will definitely return to Morocco and Sofitel someday inshallah :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: S R wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Title: Very helpfull staff and supreme location
Review_Text: I frequently visit Sofitel Marrakech and I am very content with their facilities and its supreme location. This time I want to make a special note and thank the staff since they have been so helpful after I got nailed by a food poisioning at Djemaa el Fna. A doctor was at my service within half an hour. The days after Nafissa senior manager checked in with me frequently to see how I was doing. Also all other staff (Mustafa Mokhtar Omar and all others) were very helpfull and exeptions were made to make my stay as good as possible. Hope to see you all soon again in good health Insha'Allah! Best SR

Review_Date: Sophie S wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Text: We had an amazing time in Marrakech staying at the Sofitel. The hotel is absolutely beautiful and far surpasses any photographs. It's a buzzing place with a great vibe. The decor spa and restaurants were all top quality and we are speaking as seasoned travellers. Breakfast was a highlight of the day and the staff were extremely hospitable and kind. We cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

Great hotel beautiful room well suite I'd call it. Love the beds and hammacks around the pool; staff were attentive and helpful. Would definatley go back. Very luxurious hotel. Would definately recommend and can't wait to go back
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We visited at the end of June 2014. We have been here before and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. On this trip our room was upgraded on request as it was my partners' birthday. We got engaged while here (what a surprise!) and Atoul from room service really made our holiday special. He did everything possible to provide with an excellent service and served dinner for us on several occasions. THANK YOU! The hotel is extremely beautiful the d√©cor having a strong Moroccan influence the staff are helpful and although this place is not cheap it is fabulous as a base for seeing Marrakech. We shall return..
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Too many people and dirty pool. We stayed 2 days and couldn't sit along the pool. In the morning before breakfast we finally could and it was dirty :/ the staff was totally jammed. The breakfast is over rated (25‚Ç¨) and the wifi was very slow. (basically when 95% of capacity is booked it's not very luxurious anymore)

Review_Date: amar h wrote a review Aug 2014
Review_Text: We have visited this hotel in August/2014. We have enjoyed our stay the staff were friendly and helpful the rooms were spacious and clean. Breakfast was amazingly good with excellent variety. We have specially enjoyed Harira (the Moroccan soup) and the staff were kind enough to show us how to make it and they even wrote the ingredients for us (thanks to chef Amal chef Afra and all the staff at the kitchen).  We highly recommend this hotel to families; it is very close the city centre and main attractions. We would like to send or special thanks to the staff who served us during breakfast at the pool and at reception to make our holiday worthwhile including Amina (reception) Muhammad Amal Benchakda(Chef) Rachid Rachida Fatima Zehra Laila (at the swimming pool) Quarfi Salahaldene (Chef) Ahmed Edafeaa Fatima Azeural (Chef) Afra Benchakda (Chef) Meriam (Chef) Farah Abderahim Hisham and Berd.

Review_Date: David D wrote a review Aug 2014
Review_Title: The sun shone, sadly the hotel didn't!
Review_Text: We booked a family hotel for a short break in Marrakech and thought we couldn't go wrong with the Sofitel 5* hotel. On arrival the Ferrari and the Lamborghini dazzled in the sun outside the entrance and the reception area was full of people. When we tried to check in we were told we had to wait 2 hours to as we could only check in @ 15:00. So we sat outside in the bar and cooled down with a drink. At 15:00 we were told the room would be ready shortly as "someone" would not move out of their room till late so house keeping were preparing the room - 15mins and things will be ok. 30 mins no room an hour past no room! Surely we could just check into one room and wait for the 2nd. After 90mins we were allowed into one and then another hour later the second room! After lots of complaining and a total wait 4.5 hours they offered to pay for dinner as it was my wife's Birthday. Every day reception was full of guest waiting on their rooms well after the 15:00 check in time! Through till 18:00. Surely not more guest who don't want to leave!  Pool over crowded and full of posers who constantly took selfies and changed their bikinis at lunch time. Food was great cocktails great service great! Clean and comfortable rooms however poorly sound proofed so very noisy neighbours on their return from clubbing early in the morning. We wouldn't be returning!

Review_Title: Stunning hotel. Ideally located. Poor service.
Review_Text: I have always loved a Sofitel and will usually always opt to stay in one if given the choice however this one lets the brand name down a little:    The good : The hotel is stunning. It is a gorgeous mix of moroccan culture and modern decor. It is also huge with massive lobbies and walkways meaning you never feel cramped or on top of other holiday makers ( although be warned the pool area gets very busy and we found it near impossible most days to find a sunbathing spot.)  It is also ideally located. You are no more than a 15 minute walk away from all the local amenities such as the Medina cafes shops and restaurants. ( do not feel guilty about ordering a cab though in the Moroccan heat 15 mins can feel like hours) so in terms of aesthetics and location top marks.    The bad: On more than one occasion we were left waiting well over an hour for menus to arrive at our table when trying to order a poolside snack hollering down staff seemed near impossible and many holidaymakers were actually leaving the complex to get refreshments elsewhere as they were tired of waiting. When we were finally served our menusfood coming out was again very slow and the wait for the bill and change was painstaking. We found this to be the case when relaxing in the bar in the evening also. Getting served is like finding a lake of water deep in the Moroccan desert - a real rarity nearing on impossible!  Although our rooms were cleaned and tidied daily quiet often they would forget to replenish towels meaning we had to head down to reception and request clean towels be sent to the room. An hour later no towels. 2 hours later no towels. The towels never appeared. Our complimentary dressing gowns also went walk about after day 1! I know this isn't the end of the world but there is no better feeling than getting out of a nice warm shower after a hot day and into a white fluffy robe. We had this privilege once. We hAd the privilege of clean towels being left without nagging twice! Poor.    The ugly: They advertise high speed wifi. The only thing high speed about the wifi was my temper trying to access anything online! It was slower than slow and rarely worked. Incredibly frustrating to say the least. I know when abroad internet access shouldn't be all that important but lets be honest it is 2014 and we all want to access our emails and check social media when on holiday. If you have any plans to do so at this hotel change them!    In summary the hotel itself if large spacious beautifully decorated and ideally located and don't get me wrong the staff are very friendly and polite but the service is diabolical. Looking at other reviews many people have had the same experiences as me and nothing appears to have changed. How can this hotel warrant 5*s?!?

Review_Title: Horrific, shocking and disappointing - don't stay here!
Review_Text: I stayed at this hotel for my mum‚Äôs 60th birthday and a friend‚Äôs wedding (luckily the wedding was not at this hotel).    Prior to arrival I was liasing with the hotel to confirm my reservation and room bookings. I had to book 2 rooms as they could not accommodate 3 people in one room. Despite numerous calls from London where the call would be disconnected put on answermachine for more than 40minutes or being passed from one person to the next I managed to confirm my booking and in particular an early checkin (due to our flight arrival) luxury room with pool view and balcony (which was upgraded as there was availability and due to the inconvenience with the calls) and non-smoking room (I had numerous discussions with Hanene from Guest Reservations who actually didn‚Äôt action anything what was agreed so wasted my time and incurred my telephone costs).    Upon arrival I was told both rooms were not available. I was told I would be contacted within an hour having given them more than 2 hours I went to the checkin desk and told to wait. The reason the room was not ready was the mini-bar ‚Äì I don‚Äôt think it takes 3 hours to check the mini-bar even at the slow pace they work. Normal checkin time is 3pm ‚Äì it was agreed prior to my arrival to have both rooms that I booked ready for 12pm (with Hanene who disappointinly failed us). I did not get my room until 4pm ‚Äì to my shock was given a disabled room with an awful shocking smoking smell. One of my family members is an asthamatic and cannot stay in a smoking room. Also there was no balcony as I was offered a ground floor room (not as per my room booking). I dealt with a staff member called Fatima who was rude and unhelpful. Having expressed my concerns and after another hour (5pm) I was then offered a ‚Äòdecent‚Äô room for the 1st night and then moved on the 2nd night to a room which was originally agreed (Marouane ‚Äì Front Office Supervisor managed to sort out after all the inconveniece I was caused) ‚Äì not a great start to our holiday!    The shocking bits:  Firstly although the pool is nice what we saw was horrific. When guests leave the pool their towels remained on the sun loungers/beds. The towels are left to dry for a period of time with the pool attendees coming to check if dry if not they are kept out. The pool attendees then come to check if dry (by patting each towel) then folded for the next guest as they remained on the sun lounger/bed. Not only disgusting and unhygienic but not what is expected from a Sofitel chain. I even had to tell some of the guests to ask for clean towels as this is what they had done and were about to use the ‚Äòused‚Äô towels. When questioned a pool attendee the response I got was ‚Äòthis is what we are told to do!‚Äô My advise if you do stay at this hotel ‚Äì bring your towel from the room!    At breakfast as lovely as the display of foods. One day they served melon and pineapple that was gone off and I got severely ill. When I told the chef they tried it admitted it had a ‚Äòfunny taste and must be bad‚Äô and removed it from the breakfast. This resulted in 3 days of me having diarrhoea and severe vomiting.  The staff would handle the pastries with their hands despite servering cutlery being available ‚Äì no wander I found facial hair (eyelash) in both crossiants and pastries ‚Äì basic hygiene requirements need attention. Breakfast is simple fruit and pastries ‚Äì no cooked breakfast.    I was on a half board basis ‚Äì warning: you need 3-4hours for dinner. It takes 30minutes to just bring a menu another 45minutes to bring drinks. The pace at which they work is alarming and they have no sense of time when serving ‚Äì whether they want the restaurants to look busy or genuinly are sluggish I do not know. You might as well eat out as the food standard is not of a typical Sofitel expectation.    Housekeeping ‚Äì be prepared to ask for toiletries and towels as they often ‚Äòforgot‚Äô to replace when towels were clearly on the bathroom floor for replacing and the toilet roll had finished! A lot of chasing and had to look for them as they didn‚Äôt come within an hour to replace.    Check your bill on checkout ‚Äì despite half board basis I was charged for meals. I requested the staff to check the bill and correct. I was told to come back in 2 hours. Again after painful 2 hours nothing had been done by the reception desk staff at Lounge and Spa. At this time the reception desk was closed and I had to go to the other Sofitel desk to sort out. They charged me for minibar use and restarant bills which was inaccurate ‚Äì corrected after checking restaurants bills that I supposed ate when I was on a day trip and when all minibar items were accounted for ‚Äì becareful they don‚Äôt cheat you and take a copy of all signed bills. The hassle to sort this out was painful and the checkout staff were extremely rude (Aberrahim) and again sluggish they clearly have time but don‚Äôt realise you don‚Äôt! At least the duty manager (Mohammed) tried to sort it out after 2 hours.    I was so surprised at the standard of this hotel ‚Äì definitely not a typical 5 star hotel. It is cosmetically nice but when it comes to service and hygiene it wouldn‚Äôt even meet a 3 star. It was such a disappointing holiday and a hotel from hell‚Äì I would never go back or recommend anyone to stay here ‚Äì you are better staying at the Hivernage Spa and Hotel which is round the corner!

Good place with excellent service and pleasent view from the room.    Luxurious big rooms with nice balcony.  I really enjoyed the tasty breakfast open boufait with variety of delicious moroccan food.....

Lovely pool area and quite spacious rooms some with lovely balconies overlooking the pool - worth the extra cash.  The buffet breakfast is outstanding and served on the outdoor terrace it's a lovely way to start the day.

I wish to express my gratitude for the pleasant night I have spent here.It was really specialThe gorgeous placethe shiny lightsand not to forget the delicious drinks.The service was impeccable. That was perfectly what I needed to have fun and to enjoy my summer nights.From the bottom of my heart I would like to thank MahmoudFati and Hamza from the So reception for their great job.

This is not my first time at the Sofitel and l must say that the few things that l complained about 2 years ago have improved which is a good thing.  The restaurant's food is excellent the swimming pool is pretty chill out and the personnel is super friendly. Samira and her team were particularly helpful and sympathic.. Thank you for the nice stay!

Review_Date: Hannah K wrote a review Aug 2014
Review_Text: I have visited this hotel twice now and both times have received excellent service in the SO Lounge from Hostess Rajaa and Manager Zakaria. They made the night very easy and ensured we had the best spot to sit in night after night. As soon as everyone is settled in the music gets livelier and the nightclub gets packed out to with an amazing DJ. Definitely a must!

Review_Title: A world of luxury away from the old town of marrakech
Review_Text: Thorougly enjoyed our stay here; a beautiful hotel oozing 1920s luxe with a modern twist!    My lovely boyfriend left our passports at our previous hotel and the sofitel couriered them over for us at their cost! They then upgraded our room as they felt so sorry for us after the stress of it all!    Staff at swimming pool are so polite and friendly and really make you feel better when you feel a little sore after a night partying at the hotel's nightclub So Lounge - a great indoor/outdoor nightclub to dance until 5am in!    Room was wonderfully decorated and the beds were so soft it felt like laying on a bed of clouds.    We will definitely return!x

Review_Date: Sarju P wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Title: Not what I would expect for a 5 star Hotel
Review_Text: We stayed here between 23-26th July for our 9th Anniversary. We arrived a little earlier then the check in time. We were asked to leave our mobile number and told they would us when our room was ready. 1 hour later I went to ask for an update as by now we had gone past the check I'm time. I was told that the room is nearly ready and that they would call in 45 mins. Another hour later I went back to the reception and was given our room cards. We were first given room 169. Upon entering the room we saw that it was nice clean and welcoming. The wet room was nice too. We decided to have a short nap however we noticed there was an error message on the ac controller so it would not work. I called reception and housekeeping both to inform them of this and I was told they would send someone. An hour later still no sign on of anyone so again I called reception and housekeeping and was told someone was on their way. Another hour passed and still nobody came. We decided to go out so on our way out we informed reception that the ac still hadn't been fixed we were told it would be sorted by the time we got back. We came back after a couple of hours and surprise surprise ac still not working. I rang reception and insisted in having our room changed. I was told they have another room for us however it is on the other side if the hotel. I said as long as the ac works I don't mind where it is. A little while later we were still waiting so I made enquiries with reception about our new room.mminwas told there had been a shift change and the new manager did not know about this. Upon hearing our problem he immediately arranged a new room for us. This room was less luxurious then our previous room but we were happy as we had ac. However pigeons constantly sat on the balcony light and their waste was constantly dripping into the outdoor sofa so we could not use it. All in all the staff were friendly however I would expect a lot more for the price we paid. The bed and pillows were fantastic. The wifi was good.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Attiya A wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Text: Good hotel fun and enjoyable. Staff friendly and relaxing definitely worth the money. Would definitely recommend going here and relaxing. Food is nice and a variety available to eat. Rooms are clean and spacious.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent a very long weekend in Marrakech and wanted a hotel close to the Souk. This hotel is located within walking distance to good restaurants the main Mosque and the Souk. The hotel is up to date nice pool area clean comfortable room. Staff was very helpful with good recommendations and even the hotel restaurant was excellent.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alicia A wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Title: So bad, we didn't even stay...
Review_Text: Having stayed elsewhere earlier in our stay we booked Sofitel as a last night luxury end to our trip to Marrakech based on the brand & reputation plus the fabulous images on the website.    The check in process that then took over 3 hours meant we completed wasted our last day in Marrakech (and at 45 degrees heat very uncomfortable) and left completely disappointed & extremely upset - plus out of pocket. We ended up booking somewhere else locally and leaving as soon as we could.    On arrival the porters were impolite no greetings and suitcase disappeared and a bag tag just shoved to us with no explanation.    Check in after being handled by 3 or 4 different people took close to 3 hours - first told the room would be ready in 20 minutes then offered another room in the Palace side of the hotel (which we declined as was not what we wanted or had booked - the receptionist even agreed it was not nice); we left the hotel for lunch and still no room. No apology or service when we finally got a key.    The room unfortunately looked nothing like the website - rips in furniture a broken glass smell of paint and overlooking a maintainance site. We were kindly moved - but back to the same palace side we had declined hours before. Maintainance work in the hotel & corridors made it feel very unluxurious - understandably work has to be done at some point but there was no reference to this on the website or at the time of booking.    We were also told by a member of staff that they were only just over half full anyway and with the size of the hotel I am sure this service issues could have all been avoided.    I would never recommend this hotel - it looks tired and the service was no where near 5 star. On a positive note the receptionists despite looking on the whole quite embarrassed did want to help as much as they could.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anna A wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Text: We stayed here for our Easter break and it was a lovely hotel in a great part of Marrakech. I also sampled the traditional Hammam treatment at the spa which was a great experience. The pool is a welcome break from the heat and there are lots of sun beds. If you are looking for a luxurious hotel this is a great option in a cosmopolitan area however if you want to be in the heart of the city (Medina) it is probably better to look into a Riad. I would definitely come back to this hotel it is spacious and in close proximity to some of the best restaurants and bars the city has to offer.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Friendly and helpful staff. Great pool area with restaurant. Children welcome in the pool area. The hotel was at the time going through a renovation with some noise during daytime.  Great breakfast buffe (Intercont/French-Local inspired).  Good locan one block away from the old city wall. Child trolleys at reception Pretty expensive on food and wine.

I was impressed with this Hotel. Reading previous comments some people have left unjustified remarks leveled at the Hotel in my opinion!....that is to say `Arabic culture and climate differences CAN lead too misunderstanding!` However there are standards that must be kept under the Sofitel brand. The Hotel is well located near the Medina just 10 minutes walk. It is very safe at Night and Day but if you prefer you can get a Taxi very cheaply. The Sofitel is not well sign posted but most people know where it is.    The Bar/Waiting Staff stood out for me. They were all very friendly and excellent at their Jobs; more than willing to give advice too. I wrote down some of their names....SoufieneSumine Nassima Hind Wassif Mehdi and Ponof (apologies if i have spelt any names incorrectly!)    I also had my first Hamman scrub and massage. I would without doubt recommend it! The Masseurs and all the `So Spa` Staff excelled themselves. It was clean friendly professional and above all `so` relaxing!    I had one complaint during my stay.. The room I stayed in was very noisy due too many frogs croaking in the Pond below. I agree that its part of nature and not the Hotels fault but I needed a good nights sleep. However the Hotel promptly moved me to another room the next day and I had a beautiful sleep. (to rectify this problem perhaps the Hotel could seal the sliding Patio doors a lot better.    The breakfast was faultless. It catered for most international tastes! I would recommend the freshly cooked omelette with Olives served with Moroccan Tea.

Review_Date: Frans S wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Title: Excellent luxury hotel near city center
Review_Text: We had an excellent stay at the Sofitel in Marrakech. It is located in a nice and quiet area on walking distance from the city center which is great after a day in the medina.  Excellent breakfast great swimming pool and nice bars to have a drink before or after enjoying the many possibilities one can enjoy in this city.  We had a good and spacious room with nice balcony.  Hotel has a nice restaurant itself but there are many good opportunities in the very near area.  We will surely return here when coming back to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nicole D wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Text: well trained staff  the alpha to omega of a great stay. At the front door Karam and Yousssef make sure that your luggage finds it way to your room that your taxi is in time and knows whrere to go. In my case a wheelchair was needed - this had been organised by the concierge who also introduced us to Larbi Benis who proved to be a fine driver/guide for our trips to Ourika Valleyn Imlil and Essaouira. Small attentions make a difference : a fresh rose on the bed in our impeccably made up room was just an added bonus. At breakfast ( I have never seen such choice nor such quality) we had our daily chat with Rabil about the birds in the garden  while enjoying our excellent coffee. In the Orangerie the daily double menu (french or moroccan) was great with a good choice of wine and the professional but extremely friendly attentions of TalalAtika and Mohamed... The pools are just what we wanted : lots of space to sit around comfortably - great service from the pool bar and big enough for a brisk swim . The in-house hamam is a real bonus with great staff and such a lovely place to relax in. Try the inside pool!.We stayed for 2 weeks and enjoyed evey minute - will recommend it to all our friends !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: During my different stays with my family and friends at the beautiful sofitel Marrakech  I had the chance to be treated like a king in the kingdoom of hospitality  The restaurant lorangerie quality of service is classified as excellent AAA +  The polite staff are very friendly helpfull and recognize the client by their name  the food was very tasty  Special thanks to Wiam the Manager of the restaurant yousssef adil mohamed and the oussama the smiley face.    I would highly recommend that restaurant for your special stays or events at The Magical Marrakech

Review_Date: Ed M wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Title: Beautiful but rough round the edges
Review_Text: (1/6/14 - 6/6/14) This was our second stay in the Sofitel Spa & Lounge in 2 years and again was ideal for our 5 day get away. We had toyed with staying in a Riad but having a pool was a necessity which a Riad couldn't supply. The pools at the Sofitel are amazing we tended to stay around the smaller pool which had ample shade during the peak heat of the day. The staff are happy & friendly so the service I can not fault however there were a couple of niggles.    The food in my opinion is over priced for the quantity you get although don't get me wrong it is good. I do however begrudge paying ¬£10 for a bar snack pizza by the pool.    Personally the rooms were the biggest let down. We eventually moved rooms after we found it difficult to sleep due to the frogs yes frogs that were singing until the early hours our mini bar fridge sprang a leak which caused a huge stain on the carpet and we had a balcony facing the road which had locals shouting at all hours. Please note the beds may look appealing at first glance and may even feel like laying on a cloud but be warned they offer absolutely no support! I'm in my late twenties with no normal back problems one night in that bed & I was walking around like a 90 year old I digress.    The room move was swift and pain free we were even upgraded to a suite but I couldn't help feel the rooms were beginning to look a bit rough around the edges. I might sound picky but a 5* hotel should not have cracked sealant around the bath or a shower in the bath which is near on impossible to use due to being behind the taps without an extendable head.    Overall we had a great break which was enhanced by the hotel however I hope they do not rest on their laurels and past successes and strive further for pure 5* luxury.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Karen B wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Title: Everything you could want and more.
Review_Text: This was my first visit to the Sofitel in Marrakech and I was not disappointed by the experience.  The hotel is excellent and of a very very high standard. It is also in an ideal location and within easy reach of most local amenities and night life.  The rooms are excellent. They are immaculate spacious and very comfortable. The pool area and gardens are also fantastic. I really enjoyed the choice of restaurants and the excellent range of quality food offered. I also highly recommend the cocktail bar.  One thing I must comment on is the first class service from the staff. Nothing is too much trouble whether you need a restaurant booking a taxi or just some directions. Everyone is incredibly hard working and I felt very comfortable venturing out on their recommendations and guidance. I would like to give a special thank you to Sara in guest relations. She is helpful pleasant and happy to help whatever the situation. Whenever I saw her she was always smiling and would always say hello and ask if everything was okay. It really shows that she is caring and committed to delivering excellent service to guests and is an asset to Sofitel.  Overall I would highly recommend a visit to this hotel as Marrakech is an amazing city and staying here will greatly enhance any visit. I will definitely return for a longer stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lovely Hotel: But Avoid the Second Floor!
Review_Text: This is a lovely hotel with a great pool area for lounging. It is walking distance to the Koutoubia Mosque and the Souks. We had a very nice and spacious suite overlooking the pool area with an incredible view of the Atlas mountains at sunset. The balcony was enclosed by flowering bougainvillea vines with birds flitting through them; but don't leave the balcony door open or the birds will hop right into the room. The breakfast food was good and extensive but getting decent service depended on how busy they were at the moment. The big problem was that our room was on the second floor right over the lobby--obviously there are speakers in the lobby ceiling which means the second floor rooms have loud music playing in them from 7:00 am to 10:00 pm! We asked them to turn the music off or adjust the volume way down and they acted like they'd never heard the complaint before which would be impossible given the volume; even though they promised to do so they never did.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Great hotel nice pool and location was perfect. Just minutes walk from the medina Walls and with loads of very nice resturants around and about.  We felt very safe walking around the area and the staff in the hotel were great. Room was lovely so would tetally recomend !!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: For such an expensive hotel we expected perfection.  Upon entering the place does look great. The rooms are large and comfortable all the amenities are in place could be a great place.But...  Checkin- We were greeted by the reception and seated at the lounge a very nice lady took our passports and went to register us we were offered tea and biscuits  and then went on waiting for almost half an hour to get our room.  Service- Lovely poolside with nice cabanas  asked for the towels ... the guy said "yes right away" and we never saw him or the towels . waited for someone to take an order for the bar... no one came for 1 hour until I went to the bar myself only to be told they can't serve me and I have to wait for a waiter to come to me...  Wi-fi- saw many comments before about how poor it was. The previous posters were generous!!  AC did not work in one of the rooms.First night we sweated it out and in the morning asked for the AC to be fixed. Front desk said "sure no problem" returned in the afternoon and saw nothing was done. Went down and asked again... "sure  no problem" returned at night and sure enough... nothing was done. second night sweating.. on the third day in the elevator the cleaning girl greeted me and asked if all was fine. I said "yes but the AC does not work" It took her 10 minutes to get the repair man and fix it!!!  The kettle did not work I asked to replace it... won't bore you.. just like getting the AC fixed.  Front desk are useless!!!  Saved the best for last.... Checked out at 5:55 AM came back 5:59 to retrieve a jacket I forgot.  The front desk clerk was in the room saying he was there to prepare the room for the next guest.....  After such an inefficient front desk experience I should have guessed something is wrong and since when do the front desk prepare rooms and since when do hotels prepare rooms at 6:00 AM???  When we arrived at the Casablanca airport we realized we left a wallet in the room as well.  We sent our guid to the hotel and they told him no wallet was found....  I just hope the cleaning girl that came in later still found the tip waiting for her....

I have never felt the need to review a hotel before -as long as the good points out-way the bad points then I figure 'lets move on'  On arrival we had to wait 4 hours for our room -we were told they had a large group arriving and they had to take priority.  Allocated a 'quiet' room overlooking a noisy construction site within the hotel -next day I invited the manager to visit our room to share our experience -he was unavailable so we had a visit by the room allocations manager.(see photo) When asked why rooms overlooking a construction site were not closed down to paying customers and the time used to clean the carpets and curtains and repair the broken items in the bathroom he replied (with some embarrassment) that it was not Sofitel policy to close rooms during construction.  He re-allocated us another 'quiet 'room overlooking a main road into the city!!(see photo)  Pool area was very nice and staff very pleasant and helpful -again pool furniture was very badly stained and dirty.  Breakfast was adequate and service OK as long as there was not a large delegation in the hotel --then service was poor.  Overall the week we spent there was not a good experience and the manager could not be bothered to find us to offer an explanation or apology.  This hotel charges for 5*goods and services and offers some customers 3* experience  Beware ---you have been warned!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great hotel, staff need better service skills though! Worst Wifi ever
Review_Text: For a bit of luxury this is a top hotel compared with the chaos and bustle in the Medina - it's nice to get away to at the end of a busy sightseeing day.  The check-in was unusually long and overly done - you are asked to sit down and wait in reception and then someone goes through paperwork and familiarises you with the hotel. I guess they think it's a personal touch but is actually a bit laboured and annoying! A quick and easy check-in is all that's needed.  The rooms are are OK although could do with more lighting - was always pretty dark! Beds are very large and comfortable. There are no tea / coffee making facilities or iron / ironing boards in the rooms. You can get one from housekeeping but the irons have seen their day and don't work very well!  Wifi at the entire hotel is totally useless - worst I have ever experienced and is so bad they may as well not have it - not sure if it is just a Moroccan problem or the service is inadequate for the number of guests they have - at least it's free.  The pool is amazing and service pretty good from the staff there. The breakfast service was not particularly good - a lot of staff milling around ignoring customers. You had to almost beg to get coffee / juice and the same for refills.  Meals at the restaurant are good but are around twice the price of going into the Medina. Drinks are prohibitively expensive and DO NOT go for the waiter's recommendation of a glass of champagne or mojito before your meal - unbelievably expensive!!  All in all would recommend but would be great if the hotel could sort out its breakfast time staff and the awful wifi!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Disappointing stay in what should be a very good hotel
Review_Text: First off it should be noted that the pool area of the hotel is great. I would actually go back just to enjoy lounging there all the sun beds are modern and the gardens are very well kept. There is sufficient pool staff to assist you.    However despite the good facilities of this hotel we still had a disappointing stay. There were numerous issues:  - the bed: was surprisingly uncomfortable. My husband and I both lay down and then sat back up and looked at each other thinking something must be wrong with our bed. We look it over entirely and couldn't understand the sheets and mattresses layout (very odd) and didn't have a comfortable sleep.  - the check-in: the check-in process was quite long  - the housekeeping staff: it took three phone calls to housekeeping to get an ironing board  - the room service: our order came and was incorrect  So these issues and several other small ones led to a disappointing stay.

Review_Title: A really fancy hotel, for such a place
Review_Text: I was there for two nights for an important business event. The hotel is very upscale well kept and has all the "ingredients" of old Morrocan charm in addition to the modern infrastructure for a relaxing stay: pool gardens entertainment etc....    It is a 20 minute walk from the old town souks etc... I felt safe in the area walking late at night.    Speed of service and responsiveness of staff could be improved ... they could be faster and quicker to react but overall no problems.    I stayed in a ground floor suite  which was very convenient for accessing the gardens and pool area.. so cannot comment on the regular rooms.    Marrakesh is a place to see ... some people fall in love or become addicted others look at it as one of the places you ought to visit once in your life. I would personally not consider it a vacation destination.

Review_Date: Uzi R wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: For our first visit to Morocco we were recommended to go to the Sofitel in Marrakech. I found out that it was an excellent advice. The front desk staff and the concierge were very helpful and pleasant. We enjoyed the Spa treatments and the hammam very much. At the breakfast restaurant we especialy enjoyed the great and friendly service by the waitresses and waiters Fatima Rachida Chaffira Mourad and Hicham. All of them provide outstanding service allways available and allways with a great smile.  Thank you  Sofitel Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was my 5th visit to the Sofitel Marrakech  each trip gets better & better !  The hotel has a high standard of consistent excellence throughout all service areas.  The pool lounging area is superbly well maintained & run .  The pool team are exceptionally helpful to make your stay enjoyable . Zakaria stood out to be very accommodating & extremely helpful at all times making every day at the pool a pleasurable experience .  Would highly recommend this hotel & the all round fantastic team

We stayed at this hotel for two nights. When we walked through the doors we were greeted straight away taken to the reception and checked in. A lovely fellow kindly walked us to our room and on the way said that we had been upgraded from the room we booked which was the Junior Suite with view of the Atlas Mountains to the Suite overlooking that Atlas Mountains and the Pool. All I can say is WOW. As you walk in to the hotel you have SO much space and cupboard space. You have a dining room a living room a double balcony with sun bed and table and chairs an extra large bedroom with massive king sized bed and more drawers then you have the Bathroom with more cupboards a bath shower over the bath plus your sink you then walk through to the second bathroom which has a separate shower toilet and sink. There were 4 towels HERMES shampoo conditioner body lotion and body wash exfoliator scales (if you want to weigh yourself on holidays....) and two amazing robes and slippers. There is a Nespresso Machine in the room and you get the first 6 pods free plus you get 3 bottles of water and 1 sparkling water per day for free. There were also a dozen red roses in the room. The bed is one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in!    The view overlooking the pool was amazing so relaxing. The hotel itself is massive there are several restaurants and the breakfast range is like I have never seen before. They have everything you can think of and I think it is worth every cent (although it seems expensive).    We ordered room service for the first night (and second night) and when it arrived it came with a handwritten note and a birthday cake wishing my husband a happy birthday - I didn't order this! We had a note on the booking but didn't remind them or ask for it. It was amazing and so generous of them.    The pool area is awesome. There are two outdoor pools and many many poolside beds. You do need to get in early if you want one by the pool or in the sun! They fill up so quickly. We had ordered a fruit platter and some drinks by the pool - very good service and the fruit is delicious fresh and nice and cold.    We also had spa treatments in the hotel. We got the traditional Hamman a body wrap and a massage. The spa area is beautiful you get a robe and slippers and you can also use the facilities such as the steam room and indoor heated pool. The staff are very helpful and the services were really great as well.    I couldn't fault the hotel or the staff I found everything to be of excellent service and quality. I know you pay a lot of money to stay there but you do get value for money and I would recommend it even if it is for just two nights of your stay in Marrakech - just perfect.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Carol W wrote a review Apr 2014
Review_Text: This was my third stay at the Sofitel. It's a luxury hotel beautiful surroundings but sadly a couple of things were not up to standard. Firstly during the day when we were relaxing poolside there were building works (including a tractor) not very relaxing we couldn't go back to our room as the building works were happening directly outside! We were not informed of this nor offered an apology of any kind. The service around the pool was poor this time around (there were 2 men that were doing everything) we burnt whilst waiting for an umbrella - it took 20 minutes in the heat of the day! We also waited over an hour to be served coffee around the pool and at the time the pool area was not busy. There was a very important group of people at the hotel - they were seated next to us for lunch at the restaurant near the pool during this time the focus was on them entirely so much so that I was given raw seabass luckily I spotted this before I ate it or else I imagine I would've been very unwell. Sadly a disappointing trip this time around.

Review_Title: OK Hotel with beautiful pool garden
Review_Text: This was the third time that we stayed at this Hotel.
