The location is very convenient in walking distance to most local attractions and surrounded by the best restaurants and night clubs in Marrakech. The pool area is in a park like setting with beautiful flowers and comfortable Lounge chairs and cabanas. The rooms are just OK outdated and would need some urgent updates. The wifi internet service most of the time does not work which is really In today's times not acceptable anymore. The drink service in the pool are is about the slowest and inattentive service we have experienced the waiters pay no attention and frequently forgot to bring placed orders.  All in all the Hotel is a food place to stay but needs some attention in the various ares.

I had a weekend away with a friend and we were both very happy with our choice of hotel. The hotel has a grand feel to it when you arrive. The 2 sofitels are actually joined and share the facilities. We stayed in the "lounge and spa" and found the room to be very comfortable. The bathroom was on the smaller size and a little dated but still decent and clean. The front desk service was fantastic in terms of helping us with a tour guide booking restaurants and our 2 night/3 day stay seemed too short! The pool area was lovely but as we were busy sightseeing we didn't actually go swimming. We did relax on afternoon by the pool area and saw lots of kids and families enjoying the pool. Breakfast was great with lots of local food available. We also had lunch there on our last day and again enjoyed the local foods on offer. It was a shot taxi ride to the souks and there are a few restaurants walking distance from the hotel as well - its locoed in a very nice part of town and was very clean.

Review_Title: Great hotel.... better than the service!!
Review_Text: We stayed in in Sofitel lounge SPA for four days in April 2014. I really appreciate the quality of the hotel in a great location just outside the wall of the historical centre of Marrakech (15 minutes walking from Jemaa El Fna square).  A marvellous pool area one heated pool and one not.  Fantastic breakfast.  Good gym I didn't tested the SPA.  Special mention for the Concierge: he suggested us always the best possible in relation with our requests. Thanks!!  Said that I have to underline the absolute inadequacy of all the restoration services: the delay in receiving the food ordered has been incredible both for dinner at the restaurant and for the light lunch at the pool. Many other customers were unsatisfied....I really don't understand why...apparently there was plenty of workers for every needs of the customers.....

First stay at Sofitel and first time in Marrakesh we spent 10 days here. The hotel was of a very high standard the food was excellent and the staff were too. Only problem we had was the air conditioning in the room which took some addressing we eventually were offered another room which was better than the original one. The manager and customer service representative were extremely helpfull.All in all a very enjoyable holiday would definetley recomend it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great hotel amazing pools fantastic staff
Review_Text: Have stayed here more than 10 times and still here when writing this review. This hotel is a joy to stay in. The building is lovely there are two huge pools one heated. There is work going on to to build a pool but at this time there is no real disruption the noisy stuff is finished.the excellent staff really make this hotel stand out they are all delightfully and seem pleased to give great service. There are neat touches around the pools when staff bring round free plates of chilled fruit and even a man who cleans sun or reading glasses beautifully. There are several restaurants with good mixed menus on offer. The full breakfast is fabulous if a little expensive. The medina and souk is a five minute walk away  or a ¬£3 cab ride. The hotel is frequently used by film companies whilst in Morocco to house the stars and the cocktail bar is full of their portraits. We have stayed in Riads in the centre but whilst understanding their appeal love the pool options and the tranquility. We love the rush of the souk be really enjoy the pampering and tranquility of the Sofitel especially the wonderful Spa

Review_Date: Andrew P wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: We stayed a week in the Sofitel we were told by Thomsons a week before we were due to fly out that there was work going on and we tried to find somewhere else with no luck.  The hotel is in a good position as you can walk to the medina & souks. We had a great week with a couple of good trips. The hotel was busy and very french bonjour The first room we were in was on the ground floor dark and directly in front of scaffold poles etc they started banging etc early till late. We complained to our rep and got moved which was better but still the noise especially around the pool got really annoying. Downstairs by our first room there was always a conference going on.  Around the pool was cool as they have these big loungers and hammocks with waiter service. The drinks are not cheap lots of smoking staff nice most spoke english the food was very good really enjoyed the food I would say its better to book half board as the prices looked expensive I didn't manage to get an English paper while I was there which was ok they have the New York times not much english TV the club (sol lounge) which you can go in as a guest had a great house band and good entertainment. The rooms weren't bad I dont think they vacuumed very often. the room shelf with the safe on collapsed i just bruised my hand could have been worse.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The best hotel you can get in Marrakech friendly staff and nice resturants full of koskos & Tajeen.  The pool area and garden is very nice & relaxing.  Central position to every place in the city.  Nice spaceous rooms.  Recommended for any one going to Marrakech

Except for two things this is a very nice hotel which enjoys a truly ideal location near the center of Marrakech. I have stayed there at least 3-4 times in the past but will not return because of the two things mentioned in the title of this review...    First the corridors and bedrooms almost always smell like open sewers and the hotel seems unable to remedy this problem. Second there is a trick they pull when they run an American credit card pretending to give guests the option to pay in US dollars or in Moroccan dirhams but actually obliging guests to pay in dollars at a bad exchange rate and a commission of 3%. Although the staff swore to me on check-out that I would be charged in dirhams this once again proved to be a lie (or perhaps they are just mis-informed) and my credit card company (kudos to Chase Sapphire Preferred) gave me a credit for the 11-dollar difference.    This may seem like a small amount and it is certainly not worth losing a customer's goodwill over but this customer does not like being lied to by hotel personnel. And Sofitel does not have a Customer Relations phone number -- only a clumsy e-mail procedure -- so there is no way to give them feedback directly.

Despite being slightly apprehensive about staying in such a modern hotel in marrakech I was pleasantly surprised by the Sofitel. The staff were all very helpful and were on hand to offer advice about finding our way around the city this was a nice addition to our stay as we didn't spend our limited time getting hopelessly lost. The Medina and Souks are within walking distance and the hotel are happy to arrange any form of transport you want (Petit/Grand taxi horse and carriage etc even a limo if you have the funds!) The hotel can also arrange a guide for most trips if you want local information and to be taken to where you actually want to go! Other trips that can be arranged include those outside the city into the desert. The pool area provides a great opportunity to relax from a days sightseeing/Moroccan heat. All in all a beautiful hotel (albeit a modern one) in a city known for its character. The hotel does have some traditional Moroccan touches and when you walk into the Sofitel for the first time you are instantly provided with a lovely scent of (what I think) was orange flower and jasmine. I would recommend the hotel to anyone who is visiting Marrakech for the first time who wants a slightly more luxurious stay and is happy to sacrifice staying in the old town for something more modern.

My family and I got back from Marrakech last week we had a good time. However I am glad I read the reviews  and stress that is is very important to read these as it thoroughly prepares you. Please go with an open mind ready to embrace the Morrocan culture please leave English mentality at home. If you can't then please don't go! I was really nervous by the mixed reviews so I had no expectations however I can say we had a wonderful time and would love to go again. For further details...continue reading!    SOFITEL LOUNGE AND SPA  This is very beautiful hotel I was taken away by the interior design and prestigious location Hivernage that it is located within. The actual hotel building/facilities is definitely 5 star accreditation the staff very lovely and really fussed over my little one. But the hotel service was slightly hit and miss and slightly lacking in attention to detail. But I realised that it is part of the Moroccan culture they are very laid back people however when you do ask for something they are keen to provide. The Hotel receptionist Housna was always readily available to our needs Nafissa and Hadija kept on checking on our room comfort and made sure they corrected any mistakes I.e. Non replaced towels etc. It appears all the reviews concerning the air condition in the rooms are correct they DONT work properly. Thank God it wasn't really hot otherwise we would have suffered :( !!!  Oh and their appears to be construction work near the poolside which no review has mentioned quite surprised. This can be slightly noisy but not overbearing.    The Main assistants Omaihema (and Lamye) were so pleasant and my daughter loved them  and really worked on building a rapport with us. as well as the infamous Fatima working in the breakfast hall....amazing Woman!    PLACES TO EAT/LOCATION    Hotel is reeaaallly expensive so worthwhile eating at Hivernage Hotel and Spa (fraction of price) we did twice. For a nice (expensive treat) highly recommend So Good restaurant and Bar at the Sofitel with amazing entertainment (by Seven Senses my lil' one actually performed with them) or Pomiroeu @ The Pearl Hotel and Spa(Italian).  The hotel is located in a classy residential area with a few hotels round it...Es Saadi The Pearl etc. The medina is not to far 10min so we walked it however you also have a choice of horse and carriage ride or taxi. You can get round yourself don't mind the self-imposed tour guides who keep pestering you.  The Medina was such a wonderful experience however we went early 9ish and left before it got very busy cos of our lil' one...As they say be prepared to barter with the stall/shop keepers.    There are a few executions so ask the concierge and other hotels cafe you can go to further out.    LANGUAGE  They speak mainly French and it is worthwhile learning a few words it goes a long way.

We went for a short break to celebrate our wedding anniversary.  As expected from 5 star chain hotel the first impression was very good. We were upgraded to deluxe room tired from our journey we checked in but found the following day to our disappointment the view from our balcony to be a horror as the room was directly in front the junk storage etc. and lacked natural light.  On bringing this to the attention of the reception desk the staff immediately called the front office manager Mr Abderrahmane Benmansour who apologised profusely and moved us to another room immediately and kindly offered us free dinner and spa treatment for my wife as gesture of goodwill. He was very helpful and dealt with the matter quickly and professionally which made our stay in Sofitel very very pleasant and would most definitely revisit the hotel in the future and recommend to our friend and family.  We also found the guest relation Sarra Mouj to be very friendly and helpful in this matter and she kindly invited us to a cocktail evening in the hotel that evening. We throughly enjoyed ourselves as the atmosphere was very pleasant.  The breakfast was very good and there were lots of selection and the staff was very friendly and helpful in particular FATIMA who is definitely an asset for any organisation. Her colleagues Hichom Rochida Ab Rehim iBrahim and iLham were also helpful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From the moment we arrived at the hotel we were made to feel like royalty.. We were welcomed with warm smiles and the custom morrocan mint tea followed by complimentary macaroons. To me first impressions are lasting impressions and this was certainly the case with our short stay at the Sofitel lounge & spa. For myself the highlight of our stay in Marrakech was most definately the hotel and the exceptional service of one staff member in particular Fatima. Fatima served us for breakfast on two occasions and I cannot commend her enough! She was just brilliant so kind hearted and warm natured she made us feel as if we were a member of her own family. My sister was ill on the very first morning of our stay so was unable to make it for breakfast. Knowing this Fatima kindly packed a selection of pastries and cakes in a box for us to take to her. Not only that she made a soothing milk drink with a blend of special herbs and spices to help aid her upset stomach. Fatima is definately an asset to the hotel and she made our stay very pleasant.  With regards to the pool area it had a very relaxing ambiance. Would highly recommend this hotel to friends and family!

Review_Title: Very stylish. Great service from professional staff.
Review_Text: We were overnight prior to the end of our tour. A lovely hotel oozes quality from the first moment. We had a lovely room overlooking the pool/lounging area. Pity about the building work which would have marred a longer stay because the sound echoed in the room. We had breakfast and lunch both very goodalthough lunch portions were far too large. This seems to be the way in Morocco where food just keeps on coming! Would definitely recommend for a longer stay as a base to see Marakkech but see also my review of La Maison Arabe as a more traditional alternative. It's all a matter of taste.

Review_Title: Five star? I don't think so!
Review_Text: I had read mixed reviews on this hotel and decided to book a week I think I was blinded by the brand!  It is a lovely hotel on first impression but is let down on many levels.  We were transferred from the airport and the representative organised the check in which went smoothly as we drank the customary Moroccan tea.  Disappointed in the room expected more. The beds were so comfortable that was the best bit.  Seperate toilet was so small shower average. Carpet was rather grubby.  The service was mixed concierge was poor lots of staff but they didn't seem to be doing very much. Breakfast was nice enough a bit chaotic the staff are very quick to clear tables but not so hot on customer service. Water for tea is lukewarm and the coffee was average.  The restaurant was extortionateDinner for two two courses a half bottle of wine and a bottle of water ¬£100!!!  During our stay there was building works going on which was noisy most of the day. No explanation or apology for the inconvenience.  I did not use the spa charge for the pool and steam room was 2500 dirhams ridiculous considering this is almost always complimentary in any other hotel I have stayed.  If you are visiting the Sofitel brush up on your French and prepare to spend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: thirawit l wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: we arrived at 2:30pm and were asked to wait until 3pm. Fair enough we went to the pool side restaurant service was horribly slow. We got our room at 3:30 it was not worth the wait small and overlooking the highway. Lots of cars buzzing by late or rather early into the morning.  The complimentary internet was bad breaking up and loosing connection all the time. I could only get wifi connection in the toilet!  We ordered room service for 6:30am it came close to 7am.  Guess what I am definitely not going to stay there again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Great restaurant. Salah and Abdessadeq where are waiters and they are some of the nicest staff that you could ask for. Very good as we didn't have a booking and they helped us straight away and they attended to everything that we asked for. Great food had starters mains and a bottle of wine for around ¬£80. will definitely go back again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed for four nights at the Sofitel Marrakech we pre-booked the chaffer driver from the airport who takes you to the hotel which is 10 minute drive from the airport.    At the hotel you are greeted by friendly staff and the hotels grand reception area.  The rooms are spacious and modern (Brits as this is a French hotel do not expect tea making facilities in the room). Rooms are checked and cleaned atleast twice daily.    The breakfast buffet is fantastic with great choice of foods the hotel is located close to the clubs and bars for night life and a 10 minute walk from the market and old Marrakech making in an ideal location.    The hotel has a heated pool which is handy as the weather in feb is around 20 degrees and the heated pool is still warm.    Would definatley stay again and all the hotel staff were friendly and helpful and nothing was to much trouble for the concierge.

We resided in this specific hotel towards the latter end of February . fa√ßade very imposing. Arrival overall conducted in a rather hurried fashion. The front reception staff were not exactly the epitome of embracement .Even although there appeared to be no other guests checking in at that particular time . .We were allocated a room in the lounge and spa area of the establishment .Although the room was rather exhausted in appearance .They were well appointed with the latest mod cons and the usual extravagance of toiletries    Breakfast was a sheer delight .With an array of fresh produce of the highest standard and quality. Staff in the dining area were generally all very helpful and friendly .    Recreational area ; Gardens nice with a multitude of sun bathing option. Staff were always on hand if you required towels  drinks etc .    Generically this is a lovely hotel .Situated in the affluent Hivernage area of Marrakech. Classified as a 5 star establishment coupled with excruciatingly high food and beverage prices . We took the liberty of not dining in the hotel as we calculated that a meal for 2 and a few drinks in one of the Sofitel restaurant's would set you back at least ¬£100.00 . The dining experience outside the hotel was phenomenal . A few minutes walk to the right of the hotel sees a number of top class eateries ( The Pearl hotel and Table De Marche ) which were at least half the price .    Marrakech is an overwhelming experience not to be missed .A bustling vibrant city that offers an assemblage of accommodation and dining options .Would we return to the Sofitel Marrakech . . Yes  but certainly not in a hurry . We have travelled extensively and stayed in some of the leading hotels of the world which in hindsight were less expensive compared to the Sofitel. Sadly its soaring prices may have a somewhat tarnishing effect on the individual .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was a well earned 2 night whistle stop tour to Marrakech with my husband. We are both SO glad we chose this hotel. ( with British Airways Holidays ) From the moment we arrived we were treated incredibly. I had previously read every review and was prepared for the long check in etc but we were in our sumptious room within 10 minutes of arrival. We were also given a complimentary upgrade to a junior suite which was immaculate.  We booked the half board plan and every meal was delicious and very generous.  We were particularly looked after by Amine on our first night and Salah on our second night. That said EVERY member of staff were exemplary and wonderful.  ( A wonderful woman checked us in and I am ashamed I lost the card with her name on). ( I was also made pancakes by the now infamous Fatima who truly lived up to all her reviews!!!)  Also the house band Seven Senses were brilliant. Both my husband and I are professional musicians and we really appteciated their amazing talent.  We spent a very relaxed afternoon on the terrace drinking Mint tea and drinking in the heady romantic atmosphere.    Thank you Sofitel lounge and spa for an unforgettable stay.  We have discussed it and would find it very hard indeed to find a single fault.  Here's to the next visit. I cannot wait.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Frank K wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: I stayed at this hotel just 2 nights. The hotelroom was absolutely no value for money ( room 60). The room is equipped for invalids but I would not even recommend it for them. The curtain was partially torn the fridge did not work the toilet reservoir was leaking so it refills every 10 minutes. Every morning there was a bad smell in the bathroom. The door to the terras could not be locked ( was fixed). The connecting door made it unfortunately possible to overhear the voices in the other room. Within these 2 days 3 times a employee of the hotel entered my room without any knocking even with the do not disturb sign outside the door. I had the feeling that this room was used by the staff not expecting that a guest was using it. The staff at the reception was not very friendly and not very open to my complaints. Not a nice experience and will certainly choose another hotel next time despite the Spa that was a wonderful experience

I would NOT recommend this hotel at all. I generally do alot of research before booking hotels as I am very particular; though this hotel received mixed reviews I liked the fact that this was a well known brand (therefore certain level of expectation would be adhered to) seemed close the souks restaurants etc...    The hotel is there to rip people off down to the hotel porters restaurant staff and concierge etc..    Our "suite" was located on the ground floor and had an awful stink to it (I am guessing it was located near pipes and the kitchen (possbily). Upon checking in straightaway we had issues our air conditioning wasn't working and had to call twice to get this fixed (wasting 1.5hrs!) our windows which led to the garden area and the balcony door were left open - they could not be locked. After calling maintenance they fixed this. However every day housekeeping would leave our balcony door (ground floor) open - bearing in mind that people could walk past our room and just enter in was appalling.    Out front door would not lock and even the device that locks it from the inside (door guard) did not work on three occasions the hotel staff (cleaners maintenance you name it!) just walked in whilst we were in the room with the DO NOT DISTURB sign on.    This is the most unprofessional hotel I have ever had the misfortune to stay at. In addition to this (and please be careful) the "Concierge" was a complete joke they would only recommend what would seem like places where they probably get a cut (money!) from. When I tried to ask them about other places that came recommended they would not enterain talking about them; they had their own agenda which made us feel very uncomfortable. They recommended the worst places to eat; in addition when we booked a hammam from a place that they recommended we had to cancel on the day (giving 2 hours notice) he went ballistic (very unprofessional) stating that I should have told him yesterday I had to explain that I cannot predict when I get ill and therefore had to cancel. I had to raise my voice and be very rude back for him to back down.    There is one particular hotel porter (I didn't get his name!) that insisted on carrying everything we had even though we would keep saying no just to get a tip. Even on our last day we walked out of the hotel and he insisted on stopping my husband to find out his room number so he could check if we checked out - UMM are you not a Hotel porter? Who the hell are you to check if we have checked out. That is our responsibility and the hotel take your card details if people just leave a hotel without checking out. ABSOLUTELY RIDICULOUS.    Breakfast is just full of pastries and unhealthy items (apart from yoghurt and some pasty looking fruit!). I would recommend going to the cafe (called ExtraBlatt) that is on the road in front of the hotel (past Novotel). Breakfast cost if overpriced too.    The taxis outside of the hotel are way overpriced - just walk down the road and grab a cab from there (you will cut the price by half!).    Do not get a hotel taxi from the airport; they charge 25 Euros when you can get a cab for 50 Dinars.    TO SUMMARISE - Stay at Novotel Stay in a Riad - I wouldn't bother wasting ANY money at this hotel. The only saving grace is "So Lounge" which has a lovely ambience and had a great band entertaining guests (Seven Senses!)    I thought Softel was 5* luxury - I would rather stay at Travellodge! I would never stay at Sofitel again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fabulous place and staff but felt food and drink expensive.
Review_Text: The hotel itself was absolutely gorgeous. Everything expected and much more. The pool and outside area was stunning and very comfortable. The staff could not do enough for you. Rachida our waitress at breakfast time made us feel very welcome and always looked after us every morning. She made our stay so much easier explaining how best to explore the area and what to expect from Moroccan culture. The only downside was how expensive it was to eat and drink.

Review_Title: Columbidae welcome; guests wait your turn!
Review_Text: Marrakech is a wonderful place and Sofitel are generally not bad however after the initial impressions of the interesting interior in the public areas of this hotel had worn off we began to feel a great sense of disappointment and then finally anger!    I'm not sure if it was the two-hour wait for the room to be ready (at 16:00!) on arrival or the fact that we were then charged for our "welcome" drinks in the bar or maybe it was the smell of sewage when we finally entered the room and the grubby carpets ramshackle chest of drawers or the fact that the doors to the minibar would not close and hung permanently at ‚Äúhalf cock‚Äù.    Was it the fact that the air conditioning would neither cool nor heat? In February you need both.    Could it have been the pigeons living on the balcony that had clearly taken up residence a long time ago? I really should have photographed them nesting in between the cushions on the balcony sofa. Their ‚Äúdoings‚Äù were all over: on the table and chairs on the sofa and cushions on the balcony rail floor need I go on? Our first three days involved early start excursions so we only had a chance to complain about this on the fourth day. The mess was sort of cleaned but as I predicted said pigeons came straight back and continued where they had left off. This rendered the balcony unusable.    As others have also commented here the shower was a trickle variously hot and then cold with no way of regulating the temperature because of the low flow rate. Tip to other guests I managed to fix this. Simply unscrew the shower attachment then turn on the shower. This will expel the rubber ‚Äúfilter‚Äù which in our case was blocked by some more rubber. Screw the showerhead back and hey presto! you have a perfectly working shower.    Was it the ritual humiliation of waiting at the front of the breakfast queue whilst "well kent" locals were taken from behind and seated first? This happened on the two mornings when we were able to have a late breakfast (10:00 am-ish). At 07:30 it was just about possible to get a table with no waiting; at 08:00 it is already too late. On one occasion even when assigned a table and told to ‚Äúgo to the buffet whilst we clean it‚Äù we came back to find one such local had plonked her handbag there and claimed it had been there all along. It had not and the waiter told us so however paying guests seem to come last when it comes to service here.    Maybe we were disappointed by the waiting and waiting and waiting for service in any of the bars or the very limited menu in the restaurant or the lack of eating choices anywhere?    Perhaps it was the fact that having called for ‚Äúhelp with the bags‚Äù on release day nobody came so we hauled them down ourselves?    So overall impressions? Well it‚Äôs a ‚Äúno‚Äù from me I‚Äôm afraid. Not so much *****; more like **!    By the way some of the staff here are running a scheme in order to have a mention on this site handing out slips of paper with their names and the Trip Advisor URL. I did wonder why so many reviews seem to mention staff by name.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have stayed 5 nights at this hotel.    On arrival the first impression was very good tastefully decorated lobby lounge & initially felt we arrived at decent 5 star hotel.    Regrettably our room allocation was poorly maintainedwas given as "City View" when in fact overlooked rear trades /and staff access to Es Saadi Hotel which was noisy both day and night akin to busy rubbish clearing facility!    The room proportions were adequate with balcony (unused for reasons above) the wiring to electrical sockets left hanging loose by bedsideroom lighting very poorinoperative ceiling light above wardrobe shower gets cold/boiling hot suddenly very loud extractor fan noise above toilet soiled carpet in some areas and the lists go on ! Although staff were informed of these room faults nothing was done for the duration of our stay indicating a "couldn't careless" attitude. Thorough room inspection by supervising staff is obviously necessary. That said the bed was very comfortable.    The front desk staff seemed too engrossed in operating their computers than responding to queriesseldom acknowledged our presence in front of themseemed totally stressed out even an occasional smile would have helpedalas no!    The exterior facilities were the Hotels best assetslovely pools comfortable double sun loungers helpful staff and well managed gardens with abundant birds and residing ginger cat.    The breakfast buffet was superbfaultless in every respect with helpful cheerful staff and chefs the best meal of the day.    Coffees /drinks /snacks at the terrace (Palais Darkum) was it seemed an inconvenient hassle for most waiting staff theredour unsmiling faces . An unpleasing environment altogether .    Some building work and room redecorating was being undertaken in some areas but was not overly obtrusive.    The hotel has a 5 star ratingunworthy in our opinion and would aspire to merit a 3.5 star rating in reality.    Lessons in good mannerscheerfulnesswelcoming smiling attitude and guest recognition with efficient service are vital in this businessexamples abound in Asia and the Middle Eastwhere 5 star is truly merited. We travel extensively Worldwide and stay mostly in 5 star Hotels and unfortunately Sofitel Marrakech falls below expectations.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: John N wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: First visit to Marrakech and we weren't disappointed. Hotel was excellent and made more-so by the friendliness of all the staff. Rooms were very clean and comfortable room service was prompt with food served hot by Atoul Mohammed who was most efficient. Facilities throughout are excellent. Particular mention should be made of the breakfast choice was varied and catered for all tastes staff were happy and attentive which set us up with a positive start to each day. We'd like to thank Fatima Rachida Karima Hosni and Bagdour for all their smiles and good humour. Great ambassadors for the hotel. The Orchard restaurant is a bit expensive compared to similar eating places in town - not the best value. Also wardrobe was small and inadequate.  John and Gwenda Newton North Wales.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Maather B wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: We were very excited to spend our third Valantine holiday in our favourite place ever ( sofitel Marrakech ) to meet again a lovely people like Farah  Fatma ( amlou lady)  Salah in Lawrance Resturant  and all sweet hearts in the So ( Sophia and others ) . However  we get disappointed with few points  first of all the room service was not as great as our previous experiences last years ( suprizingly  the cleaner was using our person stuffs like perfume or sweets ) . Secondly we had half board and dinner menu was extremely limited  and even with booking the table we were waiting for 40 min to get a table :(  Well  we were really very disappointed and me and my husband were wondering why the stander is coming down  is it new management ??? Specially in the So  it was totally dead every night and was a great disappointment ....  We still gonna come back to Sofitel to see again all lovely people with a hope of improvement in the stander of a five start hotel in amazing city like Marrakech ......xxxxxx
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Third visit to the Sofitel Lounge and Spa and Ive loved each one. Stayed in a junior suite overlooking the pool. The room was spacious clean and luxurious. Fantastic pool areas amazing breakfast and extremely helpful staff. Special mention to Rachida Abderahim FatimaBrahim Redwan and Chakira.    Already looking forward to ny next visit

We stayed in the sofitel at the end of january and can only say positive things about it. The hotel is beautiful- the outside pool area is stunning and we made great use of the heated outdoor pool. The spa in the hotel is well worth the price- had an amazing massage and you get the use of the spa facilities for the duration of your stay. We really enjoyed the hammam room in the spa which was a lovely escape from some of the bad weather we experienced in January. The room was a good size with very comfortable beds! The location of the hotel is perfect- it is a 10 minute walk from the medina but far away enough so that you can appreciate the relaxing hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff- in particular Fatima Hicham Rachida Abderahim and Kamal who made our mornings at breakfast even more enjoyable. The only downside would be the price of the restaurant in the hotel which we felt was quite expensive compared to other restaurants we ate at in Marrakech. Thank you to the staff for making our stay so lovely.

Review_Title: Great public areas, so-so staff, dissapointing rooms
Review_Text: We stayed here for about a week awhile back. Family of 3 (child age 3). Our main purpose was tourism and Marrekesh was about as "exotic" as we wanted go with a 3 year old in tow.    Public areas: All public areas seemed well maintained. Decoration is done quite well. It's a lovely hotel. Spaceous. Plenty of areas to sit and socialize. Outdoor lounge overlooking the 2 pools. The grounds are nicely done and well maintained. A couple of the obligatory "luxury" shops (Louis Vuitton a wine shop and a small clothing store?).    Babysitting: We wanted to take a few hours to do a couples spa and were pleasantly surprised to find out that they were willing to provide childcare for our daughter. While babysitting services aren't rare in luxury properties very few take children younger than 4-5. From the few moments of observation I was able to get it appeared that my daughter was kept amused and having fun.    Room: It served it's purpose but I found it a bit dissapointing. I think we had just a standard room with a king size bed. While the furnishings were decent they weren't anything to write home about. The carpet was actually loose and wavy. The heavy glass shower door was off the bottom hinge. The sink plug wouldn't go up. Sofitel is supposed to be Accor at it's best right?    Spa: The spa is nice. We took a few hours away from the daughter got a "couples" massage and used the facilities a bit. Better than average for hotel spa but not overly special either it's certainly worth taking a few hours to get away from it all.    Staff:  Concierge was top notch and helped quite a bit with planning (to include a nice day hike out in the Atlas mountains to include driver and guide).    Reception: Professional but not overly friendly. Mostly seemed to be suffering from the old "Stick up the A*s" syndrome.    Housekeeping: I can't complian here. Housekeeping was attentive. We never had to request anything that was overlooked. Turndown service is provided. Rose petal configurations on the bed and in the bathroom were a nice touch.    Tea master: I don't know what title this guy really holds but he was always friendly and willing to enter into a conversation. One of the more memorable people there.    Terrace bar: O.K. amount of seating but can get competitive at busier times. Service was always slow. I usually like to have a quick coffee and cigarette before heading out with the family. As such I'd leave the room 10 minutes before them (I don't smoke around my children)...Service was so slow that I started planning a half an hour..for a 5 minute coffee and cigarette break.    Breakfast: Good food. Fresh. Nice selection. Made to order area for eggs. Service was fine during slower periods but was a bit lacking during busier times. Option to eat on the patio is nice (should the weather permit of course).    Bar/Lounge: Nice area with a large terrace. Good for an end of the day drink. I think they had live music 2 nights during our stay.

Review_Date: Nadine V wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: Wonderful hotel delicious food very helpful personnel (sometimes too helpful: filling up glasses before you've drunk). Special thanks to Amal for delicious fruit juices and also to Bourguige Zanty Karime Anas Afra Harraaoui Farah and Rachida!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Big bustling business hotel with relaxing gardens
Review_Text: A good place to stay being near the medina but in a quiet location. Restaurants facilities and service are what you would expect from a busy chain hotel. They seemed to get very stretched at the weekend when it was fully booked particularly at breakfast. Room was adequate but noisy due to a Peugeot convention that was going on down the corridor.  Lovely relaxing gardens to sit in but why do they have the cruel practise off keeping exotic birds in cages dotted around the gardens as ornaments? Particularly heartbreaking were a pair of hawks who were clearly distressed cooped up in a tiny cage.

Review_Date: Edward M wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Title: Lovely hotel beautiful setting but one flaw.
Review_Text: Lovely hotel probably the best in Marrakech  all staff were very helpful. The location is perfect just a short walk into the medina. The interior decor carpetscurtainschandelier & furniture are superb . Rabi & Awa were very helpful in in the LOrangerie restaurant . One flaw we found was the accounting system. On check out our account seemed to have unexplained items added to it which took several phone calls to resolve. A mystery .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Amal Masoud wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: I had a very good experience in this lovely hotel during my last stay for a conference in the beautiful city Marrakech. Hotel alaso have a very friendly staff like #My Yousef who always my breakfast time at the restaurant more enjoyable...

I stayed at the Sofitel Marrakech Lounge and Spa for the 2nd time in February 2014 having previously stayed there in June 2013 (see my previous review).    I stayed for a few days in February 2014 with my partner.    Standards are slipping throughout.    The reception staff at Lounge and Spa are mostly young ladies arrogant and unwelcoming. If you're not proficient in French they tend to look down on you. That's not the first time I have experienced this from them. I experienced this in my previous visit. Worryingly they are generally rude and untrained. They insist on a credit card preauthorisation or cash deposit. They do not often raise a smile. They generally do not care. They do not know how to properly treat guests. I specifically remember Wafa and Fatima-Zahra being specfically rude at the Lounge and Spa reception.    No mint tea drinks snacks were offered during check-in. That was very disappointing.    Don't get my wrong on the surface the hotel is beautiful with superb objet d'art d√©cor pools and rooms. It is nicely located within the city as well. It is a short 15min/20min walk from Djema el Fna located near a Carrefour supermarket as well (ask concierge for directions).    The breakfast selection is vast but service is inconsistent. The jewel of the breakfast team is Fatima the lady who cooks and serves Moroccan cr√™pes (mssemen). She is a motherly figure and very kind caring and a special member of the team at breakfast. The majority of the young men and ladies who serve at breakfast are untrained and overwhelmed. They do not tend to the guest they must have their attention called for anything to be served such as coffee juice tea or water.    One of the pools is heated during the winter and Hicham is very kind and deserved recognition.    The rooms have superb complimentary toiletries Les Notes de Lanvin and Hermes. They are modern and comfortable. However bathtub grouting is peeling away and the lock on our door actually fell off during the stay.    Housekeeping is a deep concern.  The room was not cleaned in the evening and it was cleaned really late during the morning. Rooms need to be cleaned when the guests are at breakfast and when the sign saying 'please clean my room' is up.    Turndown service is done is 5pm when guests are trying to get ready for the evening. This is very inconvenient. It needs to be done after 7pm when guests are going out or going for dinner.    Mr Benkirane General Manager please look at:    - Training the young reception staff at the Lounge and Spa side.  - Training your servers at breakfast to provide consistent and dedicated service and not ignoring guests. They should come to guests not the other way around.  - Looking at the housekeeping situation. Turndown service is an early evening thing not late afternoon.  - You have an excellent member of staff in Fatima who cooks mssemen at breakfast. She deserves recognition.    I am staying again at the Sofitel Lounge and Spa again in April and I hope all these problems are solved.

Review_Title: Lovely hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff.
Review_Text: Having sorted out the accommodation on the first day we had a very good stay at the hotel which is well situated. The staff are very friendly especially Fatima our breakfast waitress who was very helpful and attentive.

Review_Date: Seamus M wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: Sofitel Marrakech is the best hotel in Marrakech. The staff are all very friendly and helpful always smiling and in good humor. The Palais Darkum is excellent for comfort and servics throughout the day and the staff members Aziza Hannane and Nezha are particulary good.

Review_Date: Margaret L wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: We had a lovely week here. Hotel was friendly comfortable and atmospheric but what really made our stay was the fantastic service from every single member of staff. They were kind friendly helpful efficient - everything you could want - from early morning til late at night without fail.  Breakfast gave an amazing range of food all fresh with many items cooked as required and we grew used to seeing Fatima's lovely smile and greeting as she prepared the crepes each morning. Rachida Mourad remembered our drinks preferences the waitress Fatima carefully made sure that we lacked for nothing and her colleagues Hicham Abderahim and Benayad (the Manager) watched carefully to make sure that plates were cleared away as soon as required that fresh drinks were supplied and that whatever was needed arrived straight away. This might sound a bit overwhelming but it was all carried out in such a relaxed and friendly way that the whole experience of breakfast was a pleasure.  Although we had only booked for room and breakfast prefering the freedom to experience different restaurants we did have several meals (lunch and dinner) in the hotel. All were good and beautifully served.  All in all a great experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: the service is quit poor and the room average but the hotel location is good. You feel like you're just a number. The pool is quiet good though and the atmosphere is relaxing - the value is not bad averall
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Cassidy A wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: Well I must say I've been staying here for a week and the service has been great everyone greets you with a smile and immediately your asked what drinks you prefer with your meal.  overall it has been a great experience dinning here. I highly suggest you come and experience this for yourself. You won't regret it.  Thanks to the whole team you guys were always great.  Roch  Jamal  Farah  Aziza  Ibtissam(patisserie)  Hicham

The hotel is beautiful. The rooms are also gorgeous and spacious but if you are there on business and need to do some work the lighting is horrible. Only other thing I would comment on is room service. The food was not good all 3 times I ordered. The hotel restaurants had great food so stick with that. Only drawback is none of them open until 7:30 p.m. If you like to eat early that's an issue.

Review_Date: christine w wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: Having stayed at other 5 star hotels in Marrakech this is the most impressive.Spacious and grand yet warm and welcoming with an abundance of Moroccan atmosphere.We arrived on an early flight and were pleased to be allocated an upgraded suite at 11.30am.Loulong on reception and Jinan the lady manager ensured our requests were met in a most charming and kindly manner.Indeed during our 5 day stay all staff could not have been more professional and polite.  Sarrathe guest relations manager was exceptional in her genuine caringensuring all was well with our stay.Our fabulous suite with sumptuous furnishingsdelightful decor and comfy bed had views of the Atlas mountainspool and gardens.The pleasantly warm outdoor pool and comfy cabanas were enticing.Also in the evening fire pots are lit to warm garden areasideal for romantic cocktails.Spa treatments well worth booking entitle use of sauna hamam and indoor pool.Fazima massage excellent.Breakfast selection and quality of food 1st class.Service quick nothing too much trouble.  Hotel restaurants very good but many others a short walk away so plenty of choice.  Moroccan hospitality and great service in abundance here.We so look forward to our return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: David F wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: To all interested in a pleasant stay in Marrakech i would definitely recommend the SOFITEL great staff and service. Special thanks to Zachary who got out of his way to make our stay even more pleasant.

Review_Date: Janet R wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: I have just returned from a holiday - my first time in Marrakech - at the Sofitel and although the whole experience was fantastic I would especially like to thank Rachida who was not only charming and friendly but also helpful in advising us where to visit. Fatima Chahira Hicham and Benayard also made us feel very much at home as did Zachary (the Training Manager) who told us to treat the place like home. Ezmokhtan from the pool service was also very patient with our basic grasp of French and always helped us with a sense of humour and Saffron made our restaurant visit fantastic after a slow start. The hotel was fabulous but made perfect by these people and I would definitely recommend a stay there because of them!  - Jan and Martin Goff from London.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is the third time I've stayed at this hotel. Let me say first that the staff is helpful kind and courteous. The rooms are clean and neat. Generally the hotel is quiet and good for sleeping. The food at breakfast and in the restaurantswhich I'll review seperatly is very good.  However Check in is an absolute disaster! They can not get it right. After a long flight all I want to do is go to my room take a shower and a nap. Not wait in the hotel lobby for hours. I was told the hotel was full and no rooms were available I was told that 3pm is check in time and there is nothing we can do. I finally got my room after 4 in the afternoon. Now the hotel was not full it was almost empty. I get the 3 pm check in but why wait until 4? Thius has happened every time (3) that I've been here.

Review_Date: Nadia W wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: Lovely breakfast supported by excellent staf named Fatima Berd Rachida Hicham Abderahim. Hotel rooms are very beautifull - big bed nice bathroom and seperate toilet. The hotel is very close to all interesting spots so you can walk al the way.

Review_Date: Danni C wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: Just returned from a short trip to Marrakech whereby I booked this hotel at a great rate due to low season. On arrival to the hotel our bags were taken and we were offered traditional mint tea to refresh after our flight. The hotel itself it very beautiful and the choice of both a hot and cold pools are a great asset. The hotel's success is due to some of the best people working there Fatima Hicham Quanfi Hamagl Abderarim Chahira and the manager Abdelillah are to name a few! During breakfast each morning we were attended to a lady called Rachida who did her upmost to ensure we were enjoying our day both at the hotel and Marrakech. Each morning she spoke with us asking about our travel plans for the day and guiding us where possible. This was a great help and she is a true asset to the hotel she made our stay that extra bit special.    Will be returning very soon! Good hotel and even better location!!

Review_Date: Olive M. wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: The building is huge and there are a lot of rooms but not enough staff (and extra beds)!!! I asked for an extra bed 3 days before my stay because we took 2 rooms for 5 people my daughter needed a bed they tell me. That all the beds are booked and that there are no more for my family: what? I mean how can there not be at least one extra bed per room? This is crazy. Then we get to our connecting rooms and there is a piece of plastic in the door and we can't open it so I call the lobby to ask for maintenance to send somebody up nobody comes I call 3 times and the third time the guy says to me ; " all you have to do is open the door" the door was locked with no other to open it then to call main tench to fix it finally maintenance comes and fixes it. Breakfast is good but nothing else is the lobby is grey and depressing the decoration is horrible if you want a nice hotel go someplace else!!!!!

Stayed here twice. I should have known what to expect after making email inquiries to the hotel days before arriving and receiving no reply. I even called the hotel from New York to ask for help making a restaurant reservation and when I arrived they had no idea about my call or what I requested etc. Arrived late on Christmas eve. Despite being Accor Gold members the reception asked us to complete lengthy questionnaires which asked if we wanted to become Accor members (um no we are already members). No room upgrade and the junior suite we had was a bit run down considering the price we paid: woodwork that was torn out of the bathroom door frame low water pressure alternating between freezing and hot water in the shower (we asked that it be looked at and nothing appears to have been done). We had reserved a king bed and found two twin beds which they then needed to squeeze together to make into one bed. Concierge desk was a bit of a circus which made me frustrated and made me resort to self-help to get things done. When we departed the first time the manager asked about our stay and when we gave our feedback he apologized and said that he would make sure our second stay was better. The second stay was a little better (working shower this time) but we were not dazzled as we had been at other Sofitels we have stayed in (like in Aswan and Luxor for example which were amazing). I just did not feel the warm hospitality of other hotels.    Nice things I can say: housekeeping service was good. Room service was very good (food was great). The property is gorgeous with nice views. Nice location (close enough to the Medina without the chaos).    For what people are spending to stay here it really should have been better.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I Was booked on a junior suite in sofitel lounge and SPA. Walted a lot of time for check in and finally Was given a rather dark Rez de chausee room. Complained and as a club GOLD front Office manager gave me for the next day a suite in imperial palace view swimming pool. Another story. Anyway great hotel great service but much confusion
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: YOURGEN M wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Title: dust mite on the matress... it must be clean
Review_Text: it was a great tripwe enjoy the city and the weather ...but we were lodged in a sofitel with no treatment for the mattress and it smell very bad.... so many client use the same bed and it must be cleaned by a special company at least once a year with certificate and sticker as i saw in turkey

Review_Date: Tony B wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: All you would expect from a five star hotel...efficient check in spacious room well appointed and extremely comfortable. As has been mentioned in other reviews the breakfast choice is magnificent with just about everything you could want or need. If you are looking for a more authentic and local feel and look then this probably isn't that a it's very much one for the business/spa traveller. A short walk to the hustle and bustle though for all things Morocco.... The night club is great but doesn't really liven up til midnight the food in there was disappointing and overpriced Suggs eat elsewhere and then go on. A short walk to a number if great bars and restaurants again more set up for western tourists but none the less very good. Overall would recommend but don't expect anything other than a large five star chain hotel.... Worth checking if they have a convention or conference there were 100 plus mainly men on a convention for two nights during our stay...

Of all the Sofitel I visited this one was the worst.  Besides the very friendly head of reception and the overwhelming breakfast few of the features are pleasant.    The worst experience was that the pool-guys put magazines on the chairs to reserve them and "sell" those during the day (which felt weirdly like some cheap low-class hotel in Mallorca). I spotted a few of them getting payed when they "offered" the chairs to guests who payed them. it's outrages that the guys make money by selling chairs at the pool. I would fire every single one of them.    The Spa is not included in the room so you have to pay extra every time you want to use the sauna or steam bath (why do they call it spa hotel?)    It's true that everybody is very slow and ordering your check or checking in took at least 30 minutes.

Not perfect but still probably the best all round hotel in Marrakech. Grand entrance and lobby a full suite of guest services in beautiful surroundings. Some shortcomings in the service but new front office manager Abdur Rehman handled them appropriately and was kind courteous and professional at all times. I think the hotel will continue to improve under his management. Was not impressed with his predecessor it is clear why she has been removed from the position.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful hotel in a beautiful settings
Review_Text: Marrakech is a stunningly surprisingly beautiful city. Not what I expected at all. Our visit in November was a great time to view this wonderful magical city.  The restaurants although not obvious are beautiful classy and the food at all locations was excellent. Tagines Couscous mint tea. Delightful treats. The souk a wonderful place and great to get completely lost in. Not being high season it wasn't imperative to book our restaurant reservations. The Lotus Club international was a great treat. Our concierge was very helpful at sending us to great venues. Our Hammam trip off the beaten track was a luxurious delight.  The Sofitel offered excellent service. As always with this hotel group the most comfortable beds. We so look forward to the comfortable nights rest and quality attentive service we receive at any of the hotels we have stayed at worldwide. A definite must visit. Can't recommend enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Markus D wrote a review Dec 2013
Review_Title: Nice hotel with a quite good service at the bar
Review_Text: Me and my girlfriend stayed at the sofitel in marrakech for 3 days. The hotel is really good with very nice rooms especially the beds are really good! What i really want to point out is the nice and personal service of two employees in the bar: awa one of the hostesses and said the man who is preparing the shishas in a perfect way. Very late at our last evening in this hotel i asked awa if it would be possible to buy a little bit of the wonderful shisha-tobacco and first she told me that unfortunately it's not possible. In first moment i felt really sad but what should i do. And than about 30 minutes later i got a call in my room. Awa was calling me and told me that she got a small present for me at the bar. When i went to the bar i few minutes later she and said gave me a small present with shisha-tobacco inside! I was quite happy and suprised! Really first class awa and said!! The only thing in the hotel which was a bit disappoinnting was that we stayed in this hotel for the birthday of my girlfriend and as i know it from a lot of other hotels you get a greetingscard or something like this on your room but unfortunately there was nothing. So this would be a nice thing for the next guests staying there for their birthday! But anyway it was a nice stay there!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My stay has been excellent and memorable. The staff of Gardens have served with pride professionalism and passion. The staff deserving of mention are Fatima Rachida Hicham Chahira Abdilah Karfi and Ibrahim. Fatima has a genuine smile and extreme willingness to serve. She makes effort to remember my name. The Chef Moutafa ( Karfi ) comes down to earth to serve customers rather than just directing his staff to do so. Keep up the great work.

Review_Date: michell d wrote a review Dec 2013
Review_Text: service outstanding people real nice and the food was amazing.  We enjoyed our stay and the city is so beautifull .Full with craziness and new stuff to enjoy .  we had tea and fresh orange juice yummy delicious.  will recommend this trip

Review_Date: Mammooshka H wrote a review Dec 2013
Review_Text: The best pool in Marrakech. The best breakfast in Marrakech. The best outdoor bar in Marrakech. The best communal facilities in Marrakech. The most disappointingly inconsistent standard of room in Marrakech. Accor hotels please sort out the rooms in this magnificent hotel. They are not of the standard one would expect of a Sofitel

Review_Date: Babul A wrote a review Dec 2013
Review_Title: Don't think about it......BOOK THIS HOTEL!!! Unbelievable! !
Review_Text: Let me start by saying I cannot understand why this hotel is ranked at number 204. The rest of the hotels in Marrakech must be out of this world because this hotel takes some beating. Everything about it oozes pure class.    I've stayed in Marrakech 4 times now and without a doubt this is by far the best.    Check in was smooth we were sat down and a member of staff came to us no waiting around at the desk. Special thanks to Sarra who accompanied us to our room and was extremely polite and courteous.    What sets this hotel apart from other places I've stayed in is the staff. They're all extremely friendly and always go out of their way to make sure your stay is pleasant.    Breakfast was huge so much selection and quality not to mention the decor of the actual room. Special thanks to the guys on the omelette counter nothing was too much trouble and they always asked how we wanted our eggs cooked. I didn't catch their names but they were excellent.    Special thanks to Fatima Abderahim Rachida Querfi and Redwane who all attended the to our every need. Always topping up our fresh juices and hot chocolate for my wife.    The location of the hotel is perfect set in a lovely neighbourhood - a Louis Vuitton store across the road says it all. It's a nice little 15min stroll into Jema el fena. Or if you have a lazy wife a 10dirham taxi ride which takes about 3 or 4 minutes.    Ahmed at checkout was also really polite and courteous and made sure everything was ok for our onward journey.    Me abd and my wife really couldn't find any faults the only thing that would have made it better was if the use of the pool was complimentary.    If you're thinking about booking this place then ignore the ranking my only conclusion is that it must have been poor a few years ago and the hotel has now invested in staff training as they all really are excellent ambassadors for Sofitel. Without a doubt one of the best hotels I've stayed in.    Thank you to everyone at the Sofitel. We will definitely be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: John H wrote a review Dec 2013
Review_Text: This is the second visit to the Sofitel but with a number of years in between.  The hotel has great style and is a prime position to enable guests to walk into the old city.  Breakfasts are served in the "Jardin" resteraunt and presents its guests with a wonderful selection of hot and cold items from a extensive buffet.  The staff were always extremely attentive and polite.    The "L'Orangerie" managed magnificently by Wiam was excellent with a combination of traditional and contemporary Moroccan cuisine.    The staff of the resteraunt were all exceptional and are a great credit to the hotel under Wiam's excellent managerial supervision.    Particular credit for attentive service  but not exclusively should go to Kabir and Karim however every single one of the staff are worthy of praise for their customer service and satisfaction.

Review_Date: Peter S wrote a review Dec 2013
Review_Text: An excellent hotel and very attentive staff. Mr Big Wiam Hicham Fatima and Rachida are true stars. Their patience in teaching us a little Arabic is beyond belief. Food and service excellent. Chocolate brownies for breakfast mmmm

The reception salon opening to the garden and infused with a beautiful rose scent is the first thing you see. Check in is part of the charm....no queue; but mint tea served with a smile and your details for registration presented in a folder to complete at leisure.  The only caveat is to beware of the ground floor bedroom with patio surrounded by thicket and no view. If you check in at night time you may not notice unless you inspect! It's also bang on top of the poolside cafe and adjacent to the garbage! Having refused this room immediately we then were given another room on fourth floor with superb views of pool.  Rooms are good and the bed is the type that you sink onto with a feeling of floating but also has a firm mattress; all down to a thin feather mattress cover (which I am currently tracking down as was so comfortable).  Breakfast had groaning tables of help yourself fresh fruit cold meats fresh pastries and a hot counter for your choice of eggs. An experience in itself and really no need for anything else to eat at lunchtime.....but then holidays are for indulging so why go without?  Poolside lunch can be served on your large circular bed lounger so no need to move!  Two pools and one heated for winter swimming.  Hotel is situated in residential area within Easy walking to the souks (about 15 mins stroll).  Altogether to be recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Excellent service by staff especially fatim zohra rachida abderahim hicham abdelilah and querfi redouan nezha all wonderful staff who made our holiday special we are celebratingour 50th wedding anniversary and having a wonderful time pam and bill hancock
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Superb breakfast buffet! Eggs to order crepes fresh fruit Hams cheeses pastries and much much more! Excellent staff Rachida and Fatima especially attentive indeed all personnel ensured one had a wonderful and stress free start to the day. We will be returning to this hotel without question

Review_Date: Agnieszka B wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: This was the best hotel experience we had so if you are visiting Marrakech this is the hotel you should choose! Thank you for the great service and unforgettable memories! Do not think about skipping the breakfast as this was the most welcome service of it all. Well deserved 5 stars!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Relaxing stay in Marrakech, away from the madness of Medina
Review_Text: We arrived at Marrakech and were immediately conned by a taxi driver for our ride to the hotel. We made the mistake of not agreeing a price with the driver. The conman pretended he didn't know English and grabbed our suitcases into his car. Once the journey was under way he said it was 180 dirham which is about 130 dirhams too much for a 15 minute journey. Make sure to agree a price with the taxi driver before boarding it. You should pay no more than 100 dirhams even though the true price is more like 50 dirhams.  The hotel itself is really nice and our standard room was adequate. However our first night was ruined by some hotel staff cleaning the tables and chairs outside our balcony with a jet washer at 1am in the morning. We spoke to the management the next day and they said that they were not meant to be cleaning at that time of night.  There's a nice heated swimming pool and the entire hotel grounds are nice as you'd expect from the 5 star property. However only the gym is free in the SPA area. Steam sauna etc. are chargeable. The prices are a bit ridiculous.  The breakfast is very French. Even though there's plenty of choice and lots of healthy options being British I missed the full English breakfast.  It's 15 minutes walk to Medina where all the madness start at dusk. You cannot walk past a stall food place or anything without getting hassled. If you take a picture they demand payment. It was all a bit too much in the end for me in the end. After experiencing the madness for couple of nights we decided to stay and relax at the hotel for the remainder of our 4 night stay. You probably don't need more than 3 days in Marrakech. Two nights would suffice.  We asked the concierge at our hotel to arrange a taxi transfer to Agadir and were quoted 220 Euros. So we declined politely and booked something for nearly half the price (115 Euros) with Taxido.net online. The Wi fi is free at the hotel and is reasonably accessible.  My lasting memory of Marrakech will unfortunately be the harassment we got in and around the Medina square area. Beggars start grabbing your arms as do the street food stall holders to pull you into their stalls. Not to mention some performers on the square demanding money because I took a picture. It was rather aggressive and I just paid them some money to get the scumbags off my back. We've been to other countries in this region (Egypt Tunisia Turkey) but never have we witnessed such incredibly aggressive behaviour by the local people. Nice is NOT a word to describe these conmen and vagabonds. I am refraining to using profanities in my review.  In conclusion I would say Sofitel hotel is a fine place to stay Marrakech is not a place I will be returning anytime soon or even my lifetime.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Lovely hotel 15 minutes walk from the medina but a million miles away. After the hustle and bustle of the souks it was really quite lovely to wander back to this little oasis. The pool area is gorgeous plenty of day beds to lounge on. Standard rooms are a decent size and with a lovely balcony.  Breakfast is a treat seriously good.  The service isn't bad but on Moroccan time.  The Sofitel Marrakech Palais Imperial shares the same common areas and pool but the accommodation in the Sofitel Lounge and spa is much better.

Review_Title: Our vacations in Sofitel Marrakech hotel
Review_Text: We had a wonderful time during our vacations from 22 November 2013 to 29 November 2013 at the Sofitel Lounge and Spa Marrakech. The hotel is beautiful and not far from the Medina. Its location made it easy to get to the souks and other sites in the old city. The swimming pool area was well staffed with lot of space for sun bathing. Spa and gym were first class and well equipped    The breakfast buffet was excellent and the hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. Particularly 1) Sarah at check in time in the reception ws very helpful caring and friendly  2) Kamal and Rashide in the breakfast room - Le Jardin were very friendly helpful and attentive.    Currency exchange service offered at the reception was at very competitive.    Staff and the food in L'orangerie would require bit of improvement. Quality there was not unto the usual standard of Sofitel. Bed Rooms should be vacuum cleaned daily cleaning    The day time concierge was not very helpful
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nektarios K wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: I had a wonderful stay (7 days) at Sofitel in Marrakesh! As soon as I arrived I was almost seduced by the beauty and attention to detail everywhere. The hotel is just gorgeous and the pool area absolutely stunning. The location is great only a short walk to the medina.  There is an army of staff everywhere and thy are extremely polite and helpful.  The breakfast buffet is anything you could hope for and more.  The room was luxurious with all the comforts cleaned twice daily.  I would definitely return it's worth it!

Fantastic stay at the Sofitel room spa facilities and staff friendliness excellent. A big thank you to Fatima Zohra Rachida and Rabii for looking after us and Chef Abdela for the lovely food! Looking forward to coming back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rory A wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: We had a wonderful time at the Sofitel Lounge and Spa. The hotel is beautiful and not far from the Medina. Its location made it easy to get to the souks and other sites in the old city. The breakfast buffet was excellent and the hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. Especially Hicham Rachida Fatinzehera Quefi and Hakeem. The gardens and pool were lovely. When we had an issue with our room the staff fixed it immediately and came back to check to make sure everything was alright. I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again the next time I'm in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Joan J wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: We stayed at the Sofitel Marrakech during a 2 week small group tour of Morocco. We typically do not stay in large upscale hotels but found the Sofitel excellent. The buffets which are usually so hum drum at most large hotels were just outstanding. The dining room decor was elegant and the choices that the food stations offered were staggering. I could not help taking photos of all of them! The service was also excellent with free WiFi and the front desk even offering to make change when we needed smaller bills and coins (a rarity we found in Morocco). The location was excellent for visiting the souks walking to both the medina and into the new town as well.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jonathan R wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Title: Much to like, a little to hate
Review_Text: I spent 6 nights in the Sofitel Lounge and Spa in Marrakech last week while there for conference. The fact of the matter is this hotel looks great from the lobby and public areas but the rooms are just standard hotel rooms.    Check in was a disappointment since I arrived at 3pm and my room wasn't ready until after 5pm. Considering that check out is 12pm and that check in is 3pm this is just unacceptable.    The room itself was neither a disappointment nor a surprise. Very standard size and furnishings. There was a flat panel TV but this is standard everywhere now. The Bose stereo system was a nice touch - it was easy to charge my phone and listen to my music at the same time. The workspace was adequate although the chair at the desk had no back. I would prefer an actual office chair. Nice big bathroom but still didn't have a separate bath and shower. Water pressure was terrible. Worst thing about the room was the bed. It was so horribly soft that I had serious back pain every morning. For some reason they soften it up by putting a feather comforter on the mattress. You sink into this thing like its quicksand. Horrible horrible bed. One of the worst hotel beds I have ever slept on.    The breakfast was very good - everything you could want. Coffee's pretty awful but I accept that Moroccans might like their coffee that way. I had the buffet lunch on my first day - barely ate anything was ridiculously expensive. 50 Euros for a nothing fancy buffet.    Public areas in the hotel are very nice and very fancy. Its a shame the rooms aren't renovated to reflect the opulence of the property in general.    Location is very good - its a 5 minute walk to the Medina and its also in the middle of the action in the Hivernage area.    All in all I think this is a good place for you if you want to stay in a property that feels 5 star but you don't have the big money to pay for a real 5 star hotel. It is after all significantly cheaper than other 5 star hotels in Marrakech.

Superb breakfast buffet! Eggs to order crepes fresh fruit Hams cheeses pastries and much much more! Excellent staff Rachida and Fatima especially attentive indeed all personnel ensured one had a wonderful and stress free start to the day. We will be returning to this hotel without question

Review_Date: Agnieszka B wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: This was the best hotel experience we had so if you are visiting Marrakech this is the hotel you should choose! Thank you for the great service and unforgettable memories! Do not think about skipping the breakfast as this was the most welcome service of it all. Well deserved 5 stars!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple
