You probably don't need more than 3 days in Marrakech. Two nights would suffice.  We asked the concierge at our hotel to arrange a taxi transfer to Agadir and were quoted 220 Euros. So we declined politely and booked something for nearly half the price (115 Euros) with Taxido.net online. The Wi fi is free at the hotel and is reasonably accessible.  My lasting memory of Marrakech will unfortunately be the harassment we got in and around the Medina square area. Beggars start grabbing your arms as do the street food stall holders to pull you into their stalls. Not to mention some performers on the square demanding money because I took a picture. It was rather aggressive and I just paid them some money to get the scumbags off my back. We've been to other countries in this region (Egypt Tunisia Turkey) but never have we witnessed such incredibly aggressive behaviour by the local people. Nice is NOT a word to describe these conmen and vagabonds. I am refraining to using profanities in my review.  In conclusion I would say Sofitel hotel is a fine place to stay Marrakech is not a place I will be returning anytime soon or even my lifetime.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Lovely hotel 15 minutes walk from the medina but a million miles away. After the hustle and bustle of the souks it was really quite lovely to wander back to this little oasis. The pool area is gorgeous plenty of day beds to lounge on. Standard rooms are a decent size and with a lovely balcony.  Breakfast is a treat seriously good.  The service isn't bad but on Moroccan time.  The Sofitel Marrakech Palais Imperial shares the same common areas and pool but the accommodation in the Sofitel Lounge and spa is much better.

Review_Title: Our vacations in Sofitel Marrakech hotel
Review_Text: We had a wonderful time during our vacations from 22 November 2013 to 29 November 2013 at the Sofitel Lounge and Spa Marrakech. The hotel is beautiful and not far from the Medina. Its location made it easy to get to the souks and other sites in the old city. The swimming pool area was well staffed with lot of space for sun bathing. Spa and gym were first class and well equipped    The breakfast buffet was excellent and the hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. Particularly 1) Sarah at check in time in the reception ws very helpful caring and friendly  2) Kamal and Rashide in the breakfast room - Le Jardin were very friendly helpful and attentive.    Currency exchange service offered at the reception was at very competitive.    Staff and the food in L'orangerie would require bit of improvement. Quality there was not unto the usual standard of Sofitel. Bed Rooms should be vacuum cleaned daily cleaning    The day time concierge was not very helpful
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nektarios K wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: I had a wonderful stay (7 days) at Sofitel in Marrakesh! As soon as I arrived I was almost seduced by the beauty and attention to detail everywhere. The hotel is just gorgeous and the pool area absolutely stunning. The location is great only a short walk to the medina.  There is an army of staff everywhere and thy are extremely polite and helpful.  The breakfast buffet is anything you could hope for and more.  The room was luxurious with all the comforts cleaned twice daily.  I would definitely return it's worth it!

Fantastic stay at the Sofitel room spa facilities and staff friendliness excellent. A big thank you to Fatima Zohra Rachida and Rabii for looking after us and Chef Abdela for the lovely food! Looking forward to coming back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rory A wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: We had a wonderful time at the Sofitel Lounge and Spa. The hotel is beautiful and not far from the Medina. Its location made it easy to get to the souks and other sites in the old city. The breakfast buffet was excellent and the hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. Especially Hicham Rachida Fatinzehera Quefi and Hakeem. The gardens and pool were lovely. When we had an issue with our room the staff fixed it immediately and came back to check to make sure everything was alright. I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again the next time I'm in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Joan J wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: We stayed at the Sofitel Marrakech during a 2 week small group tour of Morocco. We typically do not stay in large upscale hotels but found the Sofitel excellent. The buffets which are usually so hum drum at most large hotels were just outstanding. The dining room decor was elegant and the choices that the food stations offered were staggering. I could not help taking photos of all of them! The service was also excellent with free WiFi and the front desk even offering to make change when we needed smaller bills and coins (a rarity we found in Morocco). The location was excellent for visiting the souks walking to both the medina and into the new town as well.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jonathan R wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Title: Much to like, a little to hate
Review_Text: I spent 6 nights in the Sofitel Lounge and Spa in Marrakech last week while there for conference. The fact of the matter is this hotel looks great from the lobby and public areas but the rooms are just standard hotel rooms.    Check in was a disappointment since I arrived at 3pm and my room wasn't ready until after 5pm. Considering that check out is 12pm and that check in is 3pm this is just unacceptable.    The room itself was neither a disappointment nor a surprise. Very standard size and furnishings. There was a flat panel TV but this is standard everywhere now. The Bose stereo system was a nice touch - it was easy to charge my phone and listen to my music at the same time. The workspace was adequate although the chair at the desk had no back. I would prefer an actual office chair. Nice big bathroom but still didn't have a separate bath and shower. Water pressure was terrible. Worst thing about the room was the bed. It was so horribly soft that I had serious back pain every morning. For some reason they soften it up by putting a feather comforter on the mattress. You sink into this thing like its quicksand. Horrible horrible bed. One of the worst hotel beds I have ever slept on.    The breakfast was very good - everything you could want. Coffee's pretty awful but I accept that Moroccans might like their coffee that way. I had the buffet lunch on my first day - barely ate anything was ridiculously expensive. 50 Euros for a nothing fancy buffet.    Public areas in the hotel are very nice and very fancy. Its a shame the rooms aren't renovated to reflect the opulence of the property in general.    Location is very good - its a 5 minute walk to the Medina and its also in the middle of the action in the Hivernage area.    All in all I think this is a good place for you if you want to stay in a property that feels 5 star but you don't have the big money to pay for a real 5 star hotel. It is after all significantly cheaper than other 5 star hotels in Marrakech.

Superb breakfast buffet! Eggs to order crepes fresh fruit Hams cheeses pastries and much much more! Excellent staff Rachida and Fatima especially attentive indeed all personnel ensured one had a wonderful and stress free start to the day. We will be returning to this hotel without question

Review_Date: Agnieszka B wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: This was the best hotel experience we had so if you are visiting Marrakech this is the hotel you should choose! Thank you for the great service and unforgettable memories! Do not think about skipping the breakfast as this was the most welcome service of it all. Well deserved 5 stars!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Relaxing stay in Marrakech, away from the madness of Medina
Review_Text: We arrived at Marrakech and were immediately conned by a taxi driver for our ride to the hotel. We made the mistake of not agreeing a price with the driver. The conman pretended he didn't know English and grabbed our suitcases into his car. Once the journey was under way he said it was 180 dirham which is about 130 dirhams too much for a 15 minute journey. Make sure to agree a price with the taxi driver before boarding it. You should pay no more than 100 dirhams even though the true price is more like 50 dirhams.  The hotel itself is really nice and our standard room was adequate. However our first night was ruined by some hotel staff cleaning the tables and chairs outside our balcony with a jet washer at 1am in the morning. We spoke to the management the next day and they said that they were not meant to be cleaning at that time of night.  There's a nice heated swimming pool and the entire hotel grounds are nice as you'd expect from the 5 star property. However only the gym is free in the SPA area. Steam sauna etc. are chargeable. The prices are a bit ridiculous.  The breakfast is very French. Even though there's plenty of choice and lots of healthy options being British I missed the full English breakfast.  It's 15 minutes walk to Medina where all the madness start at dusk. You cannot walk past a stall food place or anything without getting hassled. If you take a picture they demand payment. It was all a bit too much in the end for me in the end. After experiencing the madness for couple of nights we decided to stay and relax at the hotel for the remainder of our 4 night stay. You probably don't need more than 3 days in Marrakech. Two nights would suffice.  We asked the concierge at our hotel to arrange a taxi transfer to Agadir and were quoted 220 Euros. So we declined politely and booked something for nearly half the price (115 Euros) with Taxido.net online. The Wi fi is free at the hotel and is reasonably accessible.  My lasting memory of Marrakech will unfortunately be the harassment we got in and around the Medina square area. Beggars start grabbing your arms as do the street food stall holders to pull you into their stalls. Not to mention some performers on the square demanding money because I took a picture. It was rather aggressive and I just paid them some money to get the scumbags off my back. We've been to other countries in this region (Egypt Tunisia Turkey) but never have we witnessed such incredibly aggressive behaviour by the local people. Nice is NOT a word to describe these conmen and vagabonds. I am refraining to using profanities in my review.  In conclusion I would say Sofitel hotel is a fine place to stay Marrakech is not a place I will be returning anytime soon or even my lifetime.

Review_Text: I spent 6 nights in the Sofitel Lounge and Spa in Marrakech last week while there for conference. The fact of the matter is this hotel looks great from the lobby and public areas but the rooms are just standard hotel rooms.    Check in was a disappointment since I arrived at 3pm and my room wasn't ready until after 5pm. Considering that check out is 12pm and that check in is 3pm this is just unacceptable.    The room itself was neither a disappointment nor a surprise. Very standard size and furnishings. There was a flat panel TV but this is standard everywhere now. The Bose stereo system was a nice touch - it was easy to charge my phone and listen to my music at the same time. The workspace was adequate although the chair at the desk had no back. I would prefer an actual office chair. Nice big bathroom but still didn't have a separate bath and shower. Water pressure was terrible. Worst thing about the room was the bed. It was so horribly soft that I had serious back pain every morning. For some reason they soften it up by putting a feather comforter on the mattress. You sink into this thing like its quicksand. Horrible horrible bed. One of the worst hotel beds I have ever slept on.    The breakfast was very good - everything you could want. Coffee's pretty awful but I accept that Moroccans might like their coffee that way. I had the buffet lunch on my first day - barely ate anything was ridiculously expensive. 50 Euros for a nothing fancy buffet.    Public areas in the hotel are very nice and very fancy. Its a shame the rooms aren't renovated to reflect the opulence of the property in general.    Location is very good - its a 5 minute walk to the Medina and its also in the middle of the action in the Hivernage area.    All in all I think this is a good place for you if you want to stay in a property that feels 5 star but you don't have the big money to pay for a real 5 star hotel. It is after all significantly cheaper than other 5 star hotels in Marrakech.

Superb breakfast buffet! Eggs to order crepes fresh fruit Hams cheeses pastries and much much more! Excellent staff Rachida and Fatima especially attentive indeed all personnel ensured one had a wonderful and stress free start to the day. We will be returning to this hotel without question

Review_Date: Agnieszka B wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: This was the best hotel experience we had so if you are visiting Marrakech this is the hotel you should choose! Thank you for the great service and unforgettable memories! Do not think about skipping the breakfast as this was the most welcome service of it all. Well deserved 5 stars!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Relaxing stay in Marrakech, away from the madness of Medina
Review_Text: We arrived at Marrakech and were immediately conned by a taxi driver for our ride to the hotel. We made the mistake of not agreeing a price with the driver. The conman pretended he didn't know English and grabbed our suitcases into his car. Once the journey was under way he said it was 180 dirham which is about 130 dirhams too much for a 15 minute journey. Make sure to agree a price with the taxi driver before boarding it. You should pay no more than 100 dirhams even though the true price is more like 50 dirhams.  The hotel itself is really nice and our standard room was adequate. However our first night was ruined by some hotel staff cleaning the tables and chairs outside our balcony with a jet washer at 1am in the morning. We spoke to the management the next day and they said that they were not meant to be cleaning at that time of night.  There's a nice heated swimming pool and the entire hotel grounds are nice as you'd expect from the 5 star property. However only the gym is free in the SPA area. Steam sauna etc. are chargeable. The prices are a bit ridiculous.  The breakfast is very French. Even though there's plenty of choice and lots of healthy options being British I missed the full English breakfast.  It's 15 minutes walk to Medina where all the madness start at dusk. You cannot walk past a stall food place or anything without getting hassled. If you take a picture they demand payment. It was all a bit too much in the end for me in the end. After experiencing the madness for couple of nights we decided to stay and relax at the hotel for the remainder of our 4 night stay. You probably don't need more than 3 days in Marrakech. Two nights would suffice.  We asked the concierge at our hotel to arrange a taxi transfer to Agadir and were quoted 220 Euros. So we declined politely and booked something for nearly half the price (115 Euros) with Taxido.net online. The Wi fi is free at the hotel and is reasonably accessible.  My lasting memory of Marrakech will unfortunately be the harassment we got in and around the Medina square area. Beggars start grabbing your arms as do the street food stall holders to pull you into their stalls. Not to mention some performers on the square demanding money because I took a picture. It was rather aggressive and I just paid them some money to get the scumbags off my back. We've been to other countries in this region (Egypt Tunisia Turkey) but never have we witnessed such incredibly aggressive behaviour by the local people. Nice is NOT a word to describe these conmen and vagabonds. I am refraining to using profanities in my review.  In conclusion I would say Sofitel hotel is a fine place to stay Marrakech is not a place I will be returning anytime soon or even my lifetime.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Lovely hotel 15 minutes walk from the medina but a million miles away. After the hustle and bustle of the souks it was really quite lovely to wander back to this little oasis. The pool area is gorgeous plenty of day beds to lounge on. Standard rooms are a decent size and with a lovely balcony.  Breakfast is a treat seriously good.  The service isn't bad but on Moroccan time.  The Sofitel Marrakech Palais Imperial shares the same common areas and pool but the accommodation in the Sofitel Lounge and spa is much better.

Review_Title: Our vacations in Sofitel Marrakech hotel
Review_Text: We had a wonderful time during our vacations from 22 November 2013 to 29 November 2013 at the Sofitel Lounge and Spa Marrakech. The hotel is beautiful and not far from the Medina. Its location made it easy to get to the souks and other sites in the old city. The swimming pool area was well staffed with lot of space for sun bathing. Spa and gym were first class and well equipped    The breakfast buffet was excellent and the hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. Particularly 1) Sarah at check in time in the reception ws very helpful caring and friendly  2) Kamal and Rashide in the breakfast room - Le Jardin were very friendly helpful and attentive.    Currency exchange service offered at the reception was at very competitive.    Staff and the food in L'orangerie would require bit of improvement. Quality there was not unto the usual standard of Sofitel. Bed Rooms should be vacuum cleaned daily cleaning    The day time concierge was not very helpful
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nektarios K wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: I had a wonderful stay (7 days) at Sofitel in Marrakesh! As soon as I arrived I was almost seduced by the beauty and attention to detail everywhere. The hotel is just gorgeous and the pool area absolutely stunning. The location is great only a short walk to the medina.  There is an army of staff everywhere and thy are extremely polite and helpful.  The breakfast buffet is anything you could hope for and more.  The room was luxurious with all the comforts cleaned twice daily.  I would definitely return it's worth it!

Fantastic stay at the Sofitel room spa facilities and staff friendliness excellent. A big thank you to Fatima Zohra Rachida and Rabii for looking after us and Chef Abdela for the lovely food! Looking forward to coming back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rory A wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: We had a wonderful time at the Sofitel Lounge and Spa. The hotel is beautiful and not far from the Medina. Its location made it easy to get to the souks and other sites in the old city. The breakfast buffet was excellent and the hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. Especially Hicham Rachida Fatinzehera Quefi and Hakeem. The gardens and pool were lovely. When we had an issue with our room the staff fixed it immediately and came back to check to make sure everything was alright. I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again the next time I'm in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Joan J wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: We stayed at the Sofitel Marrakech during a 2 week small group tour of Morocco. We typically do not stay in large upscale hotels but found the Sofitel excellent. The buffets which are usually so hum drum at most large hotels were just outstanding. The dining room decor was elegant and the choices that the food stations offered were staggering. I could not help taking photos of all of them! The service was also excellent with free WiFi and the front desk even offering to make change when we needed smaller bills and coins (a rarity we found in Morocco). The location was excellent for visiting the souks walking to both the medina and into the new town as well.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

In conclusion I would say Sofitel hotel is a fine place to stay Marrakech is not a place I will be returning anytime soon or even my lifetime.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Lovely hotel 15 minutes walk from the medina but a million miles away. After the hustle and bustle of the souks it was really quite lovely to wander back to this little oasis. The pool area is gorgeous plenty of day beds to lounge on. Standard rooms are a decent size and with a lovely balcony.  Breakfast is a treat seriously good.  The service isn't bad but on Moroccan time.  The Sofitel Marrakech Palais Imperial shares the same common areas and pool but the accommodation in the Sofitel Lounge and spa is much better.

Review_Title: Our vacations in Sofitel Marrakech hotel
Review_Text: We had a wonderful time during our vacations from 22 November 2013 to 29 November 2013 at the Sofitel Lounge and Spa Marrakech. The hotel is beautiful and not far from the Medina. Its location made it easy to get to the souks and other sites in the old city. The swimming pool area was well staffed with lot of space for sun bathing. Spa and gym were first class and well equipped    The breakfast buffet was excellent and the hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. Particularly 1) Sarah at check in time in the reception ws very helpful caring and friendly  2) Kamal and Rashide in the breakfast room - Le Jardin were very friendly helpful and attentive.    Currency exchange service offered at the reception was at very competitive.    Staff and the food in L'orangerie would require bit of improvement. Quality there was not unto the usual standard of Sofitel. Bed Rooms should be vacuum cleaned daily cleaning    The day time concierge was not very helpful
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nektarios K wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: I had a wonderful stay (7 days) at Sofitel in Marrakesh! As soon as I arrived I was almost seduced by the beauty and attention to detail everywhere. The hotel is just gorgeous and the pool area absolutely stunning. The location is great only a short walk to the medina.  There is an army of staff everywhere and thy are extremely polite and helpful.  The breakfast buffet is anything you could hope for and more.  The room was luxurious with all the comforts cleaned twice daily.  I would definitely return it's worth it!

Fantastic stay at the Sofitel room spa facilities and staff friendliness excellent. A big thank you to Fatima Zohra Rachida and Rabii for looking after us and Chef Abdela for the lovely food! Looking forward to coming back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rory A wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: We had a wonderful time at the Sofitel Lounge and Spa. The hotel is beautiful and not far from the Medina. Its location made it easy to get to the souks and other sites in the old city. The breakfast buffet was excellent and the hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. Especially Hicham Rachida Fatinzehera Quefi and Hakeem. The gardens and pool were lovely. When we had an issue with our room the staff fixed it immediately and came back to check to make sure everything was alright. I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again the next time I'm in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Joan J wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: We stayed at the Sofitel Marrakech during a 2 week small group tour of Morocco. We typically do not stay in large upscale hotels but found the Sofitel excellent. The buffets which are usually so hum drum at most large hotels were just outstanding. The dining room decor was elegant and the choices that the food stations offered were staggering. I could not help taking photos of all of them! The service was also excellent with free WiFi and the front desk even offering to make change when we needed smaller bills and coins (a rarity we found in Morocco). The location was excellent for visiting the souks walking to both the medina and into the new town as well.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jonathan R wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Title: Much to like, a little to hate
Review_Text: I spent 6 nights in the Sofitel Lounge and Spa in Marrakech last week while there for conference. The fact of the matter is this hotel looks great from the lobby and public areas but the rooms are just standard hotel rooms.    Check in was a disappointment since I arrived at 3pm and my room wasn't ready until after 5pm. Considering that check out is 12pm and that check in is 3pm this is just unacceptable.    The room itself was neither a disappointment nor a surprise. Very standard size and furnishings. There was a flat panel TV but this is standard everywhere now. The Bose stereo system was a nice touch - it was easy to charge my phone and listen to my music at the same time. The workspace was adequate although the chair at the desk had no back. I would prefer an actual office chair. Nice big bathroom but still didn't have a separate bath and shower. Water pressure was terrible. Worst thing about the room was the bed. It was so horribly soft that I had serious back pain every morning. For some reason they soften it up by putting a feather comforter on the mattress. You sink into this thing like its quicksand. Horrible horrible bed. One of the worst hotel beds I have ever slept on.    The breakfast was very good - everything you could want. Coffee's pretty awful but I accept that Moroccans might like their coffee that way. I had the buffet lunch on my first day - barely ate anything was ridiculously expensive. 50 Euros for a nothing fancy buffet.    Public areas in the hotel are very nice and very fancy. Its a shame the rooms aren't renovated to reflect the opulence of the property in general.    Location is very good - its a 5 minute walk to the Medina and its also in the middle of the action in the Hivernage area.    All in all I think this is a good place for you if you want to stay in a property that feels 5 star but you don't have the big money to pay for a real 5 star hotel. It is after all significantly cheaper than other 5 star hotels in Marrakech.

Review_Date: steve c wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Title: Fantastic experience where you get treated like royalty
Review_Text: This hotel is amazingthe room the staff the food the pool all faultless  The 2 pools are fantastic the hotel staff tend to your every need  Even have the choice to eat inside or outside and the place is spotless  Sun beds are amazing and the hammocks in the sunshine are so relaxing!  It isn't he cheapest but if you want quality service where everything is no trouble at all then you would it would be hard to beat the Sofitel. A true 5 star hotel and experience
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Isha A wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Text: One of the best Hotel‚Äôs I stayed in If you do stay here I recommend the ‚ÄúBreakfast Included‚Äù option as there was so much choice and service was amazing ‚Äì my favourite section was the smoothie counter ‚Äì he would make you anything you want!.    The room was very luxurious and the service all around the hotel was great ( while your sun bathing a man walks around offering fresh fruit and there‚Äôs a lady that offers free massages) I didn‚Äôt get a chance to use the Spa as it was very expensive but staying there was overall a relaxing experience.    On your door step you have Bars Restaurants Clubs and a Casino!

Just about to return from this lovely hotel. We will definitely return with the family next time. Lovely grounds and pool area. Would like more vegetarian options. However breakfast in Garden Restaurant amazing made only better with very good service and a special thanks to Fatimzehra also to Abderahim Micham Rachida and Brahim.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Brilliant long weekend if you want sunshine and luxury!
Review_Text: Similar flight time to The Canaries but I know where I would rather be! Sunshine luxury great service 10 mins walk to the walled city .... Can't wait to go back! This hotel has a beautiful pool with big chill out sun beds!

Another amazing stay at Sofitel Marrakesh.. Why do I go back because the hotel is as luxurious as it looks in the pictures and Im fussy ! I like 5 star to be 5 star and the Sofitel is exactly that.. The pool view rooms are lovely and the junior suites offer the extra room space. The Imperial Palace is traditional while the Lounge & Spa has a modern take on the d√©cor. The service in this hotel is impeccable a GENUINE smile and greeting from everyone from the Manager of the hotel restaurant staff pool staff concierge who recommends the restaurants suitable for what you want to eat that night.. to the Guest Relations Manager - Soufiane who made our stay memorable who couldn't do enough to make our holiday a great experience always going the extra mile for guests whether first time or returning guests .Youness the outside Guest Manager who always had smile for every guest around the pool poolside restaurant. nothing was too much trouble he also recommended the perfect restaurant !  My friends have now made Sofitel Marrakesh the only hotel to rebook in Marrakesh.. Superb.

Wonderful hotel lovely grounds wonderful artwork in hotel excellent staff good food in restaurant for both breakfast (extensive buffet) and lunch. Rooms really well equipped with only downside poor pressure in the shower. Wonderful service in hotel with helpful staff. Highly recommended.

Review_Date: Chris S wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Text: Very well presented hotel. Polite friendly and comfortable.Smells wonderful every time you go in. Good outdoor areas for sunbathing swimming or relaxing. Basic pool menu but what more do you need when soaking up the sun. Staff are caring and overall the experience is top draw.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Lovely hotel . The most attentive and polite helpful staff I have encountered for a long time. The odd room could do with a repaint and the shower pressure could be better . And if you get a room facing the pond take ear plugs for the nights because the morrocan frogs are so loud it's unbelievable . Maybe that's only in June or mating season or something. Overall great value for money and very enjoyable

Review_Date: Calum T wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Text: Had a wonderful two weeks at the Sofitel Marrakech. Decor facilities food staff and ambience were all excellent. The flowers and decor in the reception and lounge areas were breath-taking. There is a real feeling of luxury in this hotel which is very well-situated for walks into the city centre. The staff seemed highly-trained and motivated to give the best possible service. If I could afford it again I wouldn't hesitate to return. If you can afford it I don't think you could choose better for your Moroccan trip.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jackie G wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Text: I have travelled quite extensively and this hotel is up there with the best! not only is the hotel gardens and pool beautiful but the staff are so warm and welcoming and cannot do enough for you! the lunchtime buffet was also a treat and I will definitely return the next time we are in Marrakesh!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: paul a wrote a review May 2013
Review_Text: This hotel is amazing !!!! The service and the food are fabulous. Great pool area and sun beds to die for. This hotel is also in a great location (approx 20 walk from the madina) with lovley restraunts also within walking distance. I loved it here drinks are very expensive but you are to expect that with a hotel of this quality. Stay here you will NOT be disappointed
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Rooms are very nice : traditional style with modern technology (BOSE sound system for your iPhone!)  Breakfast is AMAZING !!!  The location is very central and the hotel garden & pool are very well kept.

Enjoyed our stay two weeks ago and overall the hotel was up to our expectations based on previous reports.i would try to get a pool view room as we had a mountain view and so sitting on the balcony was not an option due to the road noise. The room was fine but not quite five star compared to other hotels we have stayed in.Breakfast selection very good and food in general was very good. Service fine but around the pool area could be slow. Hotel was busy when we went and so getting a sunbed could be hard work at times as some people put towels on in the morning but then went down town for several hours. I think the price of drinks was over the top and you are a captive audience so be prepared to pay five pounds for a small bottle of beer and ten pounds for a Gin and Tonic. I think the overall impression when you arrive is very good but I think depending which room you get will be the difference in your overall score. We were in a large party of people and saw a few different rooms and some looked a lot better than others so I guess it could be work in progress. Overall worth a visit if you can get a good deal.

We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. While we loved the madness of the Medina Souks etc....This was a lovely tranquil place to return to.....We have never stayed in a five star hotel before so not used to having everything done for us ( Kids grown up and recently flown the nest ) but we really have had a lovely time and already planning to return. From Porter to Concierge to Poolside staff etc.....We have no negative comments about this hotel......Thank you to everyone for a wonderful stay x

Hotel was great overall especially the pool areas. Staff were fantastic and really went out of their way to please. The one note of caution is the rooms facing the road are very noisy and not really suitable for relaxing on the balcony with a book.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I am a return customer at the Sofitel due to the exceptional customer service and room quality at the Sofitel Marrakech.    I would like to thank Youness Chafik and Yasin who are the poolside managers for there attention to detail and excellent mannerisms.    Ahmed Defea the head moroccan chef was once again producing delicious cuisine with the restaurant staff delivering excellent customer service(Farah Hicham Anaz and Brahim).    I will be returning in June for my next visit to marrakech and recommend this hotel highly.    Antoine Winckler is running the best hotel in marrakech.

Review_Date: illinois travelere wrote a review May 2013
Review_Title: poolside glamour vs. tacky concierege and no shampoo for two nights
Review_Text: Plus side: lounging poolside on an Arablian Nights fairy tale couch/sunbed  Negative side: (a) really really horrible concierge; (b) housekeeping unable to read labels resulting in two nights without any shampoo followed by a smorgasbord on the last day of 4 shampoos 1 conditioner; 9 bath gels; and 3 lotions; (c) an oppressive floral fragrance piped throughout the hotel (which did nothing to counteract the indoor smoking odors) so if you have asthma or similar condition be forewarned. Not at all what I expected from Softiel.

Review_Date: Megan C wrote a review May 2013
Review_Title: Beautiful escape while in busy Marrakech
Review_Text: Beautiful oasis while visiting Marrakech. Although it is at the pricier end of the scale the lovely room and great service was well worth the money spent. Highlight is the fresh and delicious breakfast served every morning. Would gladly go back next time I'm in Morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Dorothy Janine wrote a review May 2013
Review_Text: This hotel is excellent and we had a great time. The only downside was we had booked half board with Thomson holidays but the hotel charged us for all of our meals apart from breakfast. Neither Thomson nor the hotel will take responsibility. Therefore we have paid nearly ¬£800.00 pounds for one weeks meals. Apalling!

Perfect location - a quick walk to the medina and the action. The service was spectacular - we asked for an iron and ironing board - and it was delivered within a few minutes. They surprised us with a turn down service my pajamas were on the bed - and when we returned from dinner they had arranged them in a flower pattern put slippers beside the bed and arranged a glass and bottle of water on the night stand. We enjoyed the free cocktails at the Manager's reception on our first night (I understand this is offered only on Mondays).

Review_Text: Rooms are very nice : traditional style with modern technology (BOSE sound system for your iPhone!)  Breakfast is AMAZING !!!  The location is very central and the hotel garden & pool are very well kept.

Enjoyed our stay two weeks ago and overall the hotel was up to our expectations based on previous reports.i would try to get a pool view room as we had a mountain view and so sitting on the balcony was not an option due to the road noise. The room was fine but not quite five star compared to other hotels we have stayed in.Breakfast selection very good and food in general was very good. Service fine but around the pool area could be slow. Hotel was busy when we went and so getting a sunbed could be hard work at times as some people put towels on in the morning but then went down town for several hours. I think the price of drinks was over the top and you are a captive audience so be prepared to pay five pounds for a small bottle of beer and ten pounds for a Gin and Tonic. I think the overall impression when you arrive is very good but I think depending which room you get will be the difference in your overall score. We were in a large party of people and saw a few different rooms and some looked a lot better than others so I guess it could be work in progress. Overall worth a visit if you can get a good deal.

Review_Date: jeannick O wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Text: I am used to the sofitel hotels but I must confess that the incredible quality of service given to customers by the personnel deserves to give a five stars high luxury to this famous hotel .From the reception welcoming you with fresh orange juice to the extreme confort of the bedroom and particularly the mattress the helpfulness and kindness of the waiters at the restaurants (including the efficient room service).The swimming pool is fantastic and the spa absolutely perfect.All bedrooms have a nice view but the best are facing the pool and the somptuous gardens.I recommand highly this hotel !

Review_Title: Pool day TOTAL rip off and were made to feel unwanted.
Review_Text: We chose to stay in a riad to experience some character and the real Marrakech. Having visited the Sofitel for an over-priced pool day we were so glad we did just that! We were told we were not allowed to sit at the tables at the pool-side bar for lunch and had to have it brought to our sun loungers. Having paid ¬£60 for usage of the pool area for the day and a further ¬£44 for a bottle of water chicken panini coke zero and a small cheese pizza and to not be able to sit at a table to eat is ridiculous! Considering the price of the food one would expect it to be magnificent however it was TERRIBLE. The waiter was very standoffish towards us. If they don't want people who are not staying overnight at the hotel to use the pool area then they shouldn't advertise it.

My wife and I stayed for two nights in the hotel on a recent business trip to Morocco. Although the entrance swimming pool area dining area etc creates a great impression one would expect much more from the rooms and staff. I heard the spa was great and looks impressive but we did not make use of their services due to time constrains.    Our room was in the "new" part of the hotel but the overall quality of the room was poor actually it was "scruffy" and rather something one would expect from a two star hotel. Many of the fittings in the bathroom (the shower head the mechanism which should open and close the run-off water from the bath) were broken carpets were dirty the room smelly and the toilet (separate from the bathroom) smelled like raw sewerage. The ceiling in the bathroom also was in seriously bad shape. I suggest that this hotel review their cleaning and maintenance schedules and procedures to ensure that one receives a fresh clean and properly maintained room.    Our room had a balcony but the view was onto a rubbish dump.    Although we arrived at 2pm our rooms were not ready and only got access to our rooms after 5pm. The staff generally was not very helpful or friendly and continued to serve me in French knowing that I (unfortunately) cannot speak French.    I will not recommend this hotel and suggest travelers look for alternatives in the same price class.

Review_Date: werner s wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Text: We would like to express our satisfaction with all the fantastic staff and the wonderfull athmosphere at the hotel especially we would like to mention Fatima Zehra Abderrahim and Azzdin for the service at breakfast!

Review_Date: craig watson wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Text: Travelled with my wife for a weeks break in March.    After a 20 minute check in process we were given room 062 ground floor looking onto a temporary fish pond in the gardens. This from is very dark and the temporary pond has a time controlled fountain due to it being full of fish from the pond being renovated. We asked right away to move room and were told to come back in the morning which I did to be told to come back in an hour. 4 times this happened during the morning/afternoon until I just waited at reception until the receptionist got the message I wasn't moving from there. This got us moved to another room. Now I didn't just ask to be moved I offered to pay an upgrade to get a room move but as I asked in English the request was not received so favourably.    The new room was as we had expected the rooms to be in this hotel.    The pool area is very well appointed indeed small cabana type areas and in general large bed like areas for sunbathing which are very comfortable.    We ate in the breakfast room restaurant upstairs pool bar and SO lounge. Breakfast we found to be disappointing by being a bit hit or miss over the seating and service choice is good unless you are looking for hot choices.    The other restaurants have good food but are limited in choices and are horrendously overpriced.    Biggest issue we had was that if you wanted to have a drink in the evening there was nowhere you could do this and not be crowded out by smokers. All of the bars public areas and some of the restaurants allow smoking come on you are a 5 star hotel surely one inside bar could be non smoking?    Hotel is in a good area 5 minute walk from the walled city and 20 from the new quarter. A few bars/cafes/restaurants within a few minutes walk that have more choice better quality and are half the price but not fair to mention them in this review.    All in all a good break but could so easily be improved by a non smoking bar and a little more consideration to the non French speaking independent travellers.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We could not fault this beautiful hotel. The whole place exudes peace and tranquility. We had beautiful large room with Verandah facing pool. We ate in main restaurant as had great choice. Food beautiful cooked and presented. Staff in whole hotel very attentive.    Flower arrangements pictures and various woks of art all over hotel and in grounds. Huge gardens with two swimming pools (one heated). Seating round pool was more than adequate not just the usual sun beds but cabin types hammocks etc    Excellent position as not far from main Medina etc but very quiet area.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Soyful A wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Text: We stayed here one night and dined in the restaurant. From the beginning to the end it was perfect.  I planned to propose to my girlfriend on the night of the 1st of March 2013 and had asked for a certain dessert and song to be played whilst having dinner.  The whole evening planned out as I had asked for you and she said yes!!  A big thank you to Antoine (Resident Manager) & Abdellatif (Restaurant & Bar Manager) that made this a night I will cherish for the rest of my life.  Food was amazing and so was the service hats off to you all.  When you pull up in the courtyard of the hotel you soon realise you are somewhere special.  We will be back soon!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Joanna D wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Text: I just came back from a wonderful weekend at Sofitel Marrakech Lounge and Spa. The hotel is typical but at the same time very luxurious and cosy. You have everything to feel at ease both in terms of accomodation but also food. More importantly the trip was made even better thanks to the kindness and professionalism of Siham who will always welcome you at each breakfast with a big smile to start the day with!    Thank you to the Sofitel team for this relaxing and perfect weekend!

Great service from Reda on concierge who organised us during our fantastic stay. Lucky enough to have had a suite and could have happily spent the 5 days just enjoying the decor spa and delicious food. Recommend the Chicken and lemon tangine yummy. Explore as much as you can 10 minutes to the Souks and main square 30 to Majorie Gardens
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Beautiful Hotel. Great facilities and good location to the main square. Staff were friendly and helpful - fatim zehra si kam and A Bedsrahim looked after us at breakfast especially well. Some good local restaurants if you don't want to dine in the hotel. Food and drink prices are typical 5 star prices so you may not want to dine in every night.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed here recently for a weekend break. We didn't get off to a good start as the receptionist refused to acknowledge the room up-grade promised by our travel agent. It took until the next day to resolve the issue and we were finally moved to another room (after being asked to sit and wait for nearly an hour) - requesting to see the general manage r eventually got things moving. The hotel itself was of a good standard and the staff friendly and welcoming. The food was also good - an extensive breakfast menu and a good lunch buffet. We dined one night at the Orangerie restaurant and again found the menu to be varied and interesting. Our only criticism is that the food is expensive and the choice of venues to eat in the evening is quite limited. The service in the restaurants was variable - despite the presence of many staff they failed to clear tables in a timely way and we had to ask 3 times for tea and coffee! The pool facilities were good and we used the spa which was great and offered a very good discount. The hotel is well located and not too far from the medina and main tourist attractions. Overall this was a good choice for a short break.

Review_Date: Andrew D wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Text: We stayed at this hotel for a week at the end of Febthe hotel is actually two hotels in one with all facilities the same for both. We arrived late but check in was smooth and we were quickly in our room.The room was fine with comfortable bedsgood size bathroom and powerful shower although may be a bit dated. The pool area is excellent with lots of comfortable double & single sun loungers we never had a problem getting a place. We had breakfast each morning on the terrace which was brilliant with great service and an excellent choice. we found the service throughout to be very good and very friendly despite the demands of some guests. The only slight issue we had at the hotel was the price of both drinks and food which we found to be expensive so we ventured to the extrablatt cafe a two minute walk away which was ideal for coffee and snacks.  The hotel is within easy walking distance of the madness of the medina a real experience and suggest everyone visit both during the day and at night good luck crossing the roads and with the friendly locals who suddenly become guides that want paying.  There are plenty of taxis available outside the hotel but make sure you agree your fair up front as they will try it on. Try a ride in one of the petit taxis for an experience they are shall I say less luxurious!!!.  On checkout they had charged for some items we had not had so be aware of that but on the whole we enjoyed our stay
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Okay check-in was slow but that's my only complaint! Otherwise we all fell in love with the setting the ecclectic mix of traditional Moroccan and French grandezza and the location. Lunch in the gardon lounging by the pool clubbing right next door - and the city center in 15 min walkinf distance! Too bad it was a business trip!

Lovely looking hotel with some great staff although we were two ladies we were given a room with a double bed back at reception we were told a twin bedded room would be ready later. We sat outside and had drinks two hours later our room was ready but unfortunately overlooked a road with lots of work going on! Although we arrived at the hotel at 2pm we did not get into our room until 4.30 so felt our first afternoon in Marrakech was wasted. Having said that the room was very comfortable with loads of hot water whenever we wanted a shower.

Review_Date: N R wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Title: Lovely decor, great location would comeback again
Review_Text: Luxury hotel wonderful reception area. We had a lovely room with balcony over looking the pool area. Staff were very friendly especially like to thank mint tea guy Hakim welcome door guys Khalid Taufiq and also Siham from the le jardin restaurant.  Great location only 10 min walk from main square.  Only down side the service was very slow you have to ask more than once to get what you want.  Spa was amazing but pricey... Ikram (therapist) was lovely.

Review_Title: Be careful not to get a room that smells!
Review_Text: I would like to start off saying I love Sofitel hotels. The location in Marrakech is great the pool and bar area terrific. However the room we were given smelled of sewers and the cleanliness leaves to be desired. I have heard the same comment from friends staying in a different section of the hotel so this is something to watch for. There are so many great hotels in Marrakech this is one city that I will skip the Sofitel.

This hotel was special and made our stay in marrakech excellent. It is in a fab area (just outside the medina) which has chic cafe bars and restaurants. The hotel provided a calm oasis amongst the crazy medina. The hotel is very relaxed and unpretentious. The staff were very helpful and there were plenty in hand at all times. The hotel gym is decent and heated outdoor pool is great. Only downside was the hotels food and drink prices as it kept us well away!

Review_Date: Karen sanders wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Text: I am here now with hubby on short 3 night break at Sofitel and on arrival first impression was great very attentive staff but we were kept waiting for our room which was a shame cos we were v tired after early flight. Didn't get in room till 4pm but now really relaxed. Had a guided tour of the city which was really great. Last night went to a raid restaurant Yakut (not sure) was beautiful decor a two man band to entertain with their original style music and food food food no menu just set 4 courses. Fab and full. We had upgraded room to a large suite loads of room and v comfy looking onto pool and view of Atlas Mountains and inbetween main road. Tonight the medina will be buzzing with people so heading there later. Tomorrowwe sit by the pool to chill out then Sunday home. A very nice break from the norm I would recommend for sun culture and relaxation
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Loved this hotel and now love sofitel
Review_Text: Had a lovely stay at this hotel. The staff ensured all of our rooms were kept close together.  The breakfast is amazing.. so much fresh food and smoothies. Yum!  The pool is really nice but you need to get in early if you want to get a sun lounge in the sun. Rooms are a great size. Can opt for a twin which gives you two very comfortable double beds if travelling with friends.  The spa is over priced so we didnt use this and instead went into town to enjoy a hamman. There a club and casino next door and the casino actually have a really good exchange rate to the GBP.

Review_Date: Nav Anwar wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Text: Really enjoyed my stay at sofitel on valentines weekend lovely hotel great friendly service  great big thank you to gentleman called abdessamia from room service who could not do enough for me this guy is a massive credit to the hotel and we have now become great freinds

Review_Date: Alison D wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Title: Beautiful hotel in a great location
Review_Text: The Sofitel is a gorgeous hotel with spacious rooms and a fantastic pool area. We stayed here for a week in February and were greeted upon arrival with delicious mint tea and refreshing towels. The hotel is located within walking distance to many great restaurants. We were even able to walk to the souks from here. The drinks are very expensive. However we found a grocery store also within walking distance that sold everything from food to liquor and beer. We had breakfast included in our rate. it was very good but sometimes it took awhile to get coffee. and when we requested bottled water to drink at breakfast we were given a pot of hot water for tea. Overall we had a wonderful stay and enjoyed our breathtaking view from our room of the Atlas Mountains.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Excellent staff and service especially achraf from the palais darkum Always helpful and smiling. The food was the best Moroccan traditional available two pools one heated and on cold with a nice fire in the evening. And top up on those complementary freebie drinks in the lounge and 11.30am at poolside

We stayed at the sofitel in February for 4 days and where impressed by the staff the location and the restaurants and pool. The staff are very polite and attentive whilst the restaurant food is delicious and tasty although very overpriced. The pool was beautiful and there is choice of 2. Location is brilliant in the new city circa 10 mins from the airport and 15 min walk to the old city square. Only issue is that we had a room where the air con was not working and the portable device did not work well - so good luck in the hotter months.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great hotel, great staff and lovely pool area
Review_Text: I stayed here on business/ pleasure in November 2008. Lovely grand hotel with really attentive staff.  Rooms big and plush and great room service. Pool area very relaxing. Spa treatments also very good.  Hotel only a very short taxi ride from the souks.  As work were paying for the trip dost didn't really come into it however I understand that the hotel is quite expensive. If you have the money to spend however I would recommend this hotel.

Review_Date: Sam H wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Text: We stayed at the lounge and spa side and we didn't regret  it's the modern part of the hotel  the room are spacious and bright with a modern decoration  we had a beautiful pool view . The breakfast buffet was amazing  And there is a beautiful restaurant called orrangery that I would recommend . The most impressive thing about this hotel is the staff  I want to give a special thanks to all the staff of the hotel especially Saad from the reception  farah from the garden and nisreen from the room service who spoke perfect English and was very attentive and helpful .

Review_Date: Matthew F wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Text: I stayed at the Sofitel Lounge and Spa in September and I could not have been happier with my choice.    I was travelling alone and as this was my first visit to Marrakech I wanted to make sure that I stayed somewhere close to the hustle of the medina but also removed enough that if I wanted a quiet day to relax by the pool I could do that as well.    The hotel is conveniently located in Hivernage and a short walk from the gates of the medina. It is situated in its own grounds and has two lovely pools. Upon arriving at Marrakech airport I was met by the hotel limo and driven directly to the hotel where I was greeted by the guest services manager. As I arrived slightly earlier than standard check in time I was shown around the hotel and facilities and invited to relax by the pool while my room was being prepared.    The room itself was spacious with a HUGE bed and decorated in a Moroccan style. The bathroom was big as well and very clean.    The pools are lovely and the perfect place to chill out. Make sure you get there early though as it can get quite busy and you might have to get a lounger further away from the pool.    The hotel also boasts a number of restaurants and a nightclub. The food is of a good standard and not overly expensive. I was also lucky enough to be invited to a private event hosted in the night club with a special guest of honor...whom I met. All done very well and I greatly enjoyed the night.    All in all the hotel was very good what you'd expect from an international chain such as Sofitel and the staff were very attentive. If you are travelling to Marrakech for the first time I would recommend this hotel.

Review_Date: Irina H wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Text: We had a great 5 days at Sofitel Marrakesh. The rooms are large and comfortable with big balconies and the facilities are excellent. Pool heated to 30 deg for winter bathing. The best aspect though was the friendly and attentive staff. We had dim lighting in our room and when we commented on this they put in additional lighting within the hour. My wife had a birthday during our stay and the hotel provided roses a birthday cake and a tray of goodies. Excellent buffet breakfasts. Can't compliment them too highly. The only reason I do not rate them 5 star is the exorbitant cost of the spa. But you can find alternative facilities down town at half the price. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: There are plenty of reviews for this Hotel so I will try and not repeat everything that many of the other reviews mention.    We felt the hotel looked very impressive on arrival and passing through the different areas of the hotel they are all beautifully furnished and the pool area was the best of any hotel we have staid in.    We found the vast majority of staff to be helpful pleasant and they went out of their way to acknowledge you. Our room was nice although on arrival the electrics weren't working and it took a while to sort it out. The bed was as we have always found a Sofitel amazing and I had slept very well. If you are a light sleeper you may want to take ear plugs other wise you will be woken up early by the prayer calls from the nearby mosque.    We found the breakfast to be great with a wide variety of choice particularly fresh fruit / smoothie wise. However if you are going looking for a full english type of experience you will be disappointed (we weren't).    We felt the location of the Hotel was fine. I would describe the area it is in as a hotel type district and there are many other 4 and 5 star hotels in the area. The district to me felt relatively new so if you are looking to experience some of the historic side of Marrakech through where you are staying its probably not for you. It is about a 10 - 15 minute walk to the main square or there are always taxis and horse drawn carriages waiting outside. We experienced very little hassle on leaving the hotel by the main entrance. The Concierge directed us to a cafe just a couple of minutes walk from the hotel called Cafe Blatt that we found to be great for a snack.    As to why I haven't given the hotel a 5 rating? There are a couple of reasons...    Because the hotel is a 5 - star I think we went with very high expectations and these weren't quite met. For example some of the corridor stairs and lift areas were a bit grubby. I also felt the bathroom was a bit of a let down. It was badly grouted the shower although worked fine had bits missing and the bathroom felt quite basic. All perfectly useable but for a 5 star I think we were looking for a bit more.    There were obviously some wealthy people staying at the hotel where as for us the break was a bit of a treat therefore we found the food and drink in the Hotel to be very expensive. I fully appreciate and accept that this is what you should expect in a 5 star hotel but we felt uncomfortable paying around ¬£6 for a can of coca cola and around ¬£8.50 for a small beer in the bar.    In summary we enjoyed our stay at the Sofitel and our holiday in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I booked this hotel for my husband's birthday. We stayed here in January for 5 nights. From the moment you walk in you are welcomed by the lovely and attentive staff which give you a very warm feeling about this place. The pool area is one of the most beautiful ones that I have ever seen the whole layout is extraordinary. The whole hotel is so clean and has a very fresh smell throughout. We stayed in a Junior Suite with a breathtaking view of the Atlas Mountains. Our suite was a good size and beautiful throughout. Everytime we got back to our room it was always cleaned for us in the morning and in the evening. Housekeeping did a wonderful job and paid attention to every detail.    The Breakfast buffet was one of the best I have ever had. Do not miss that! There is a very wide and large selection of juices fruits pastries breads cereals egg station the whole breakfast is just amazing!    The spa is so calm and relaxing. Definitely worth going there to spoil yourself!    A special thank you to Siham Zidane Ilham Ibrahim Farah and Fatima Zahra who made my husband's birthday even more special. Also to Othman the Assistant Front Office Manager who was always willing to help us and go out of his way to make us feel welcome. The hospitality given by the staff is so wonderful and I cannot thank you enough as to how much more special you made our stay with your warm gestures and finishing touches to add to my husband's special day. I would also like to give a very big thank you from me and my husband to the Resident Manager Antoine for his warm hospitality and everything that he done for us.    We will definitely be coming back here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Very family friendly but be warned the extras are very expensive
Review_Text: Stayed in January 2013 and was our first holiday overseas with our baby. If we had been nervous before hand there was no need as the hotel were very welcoming to our young family.    The hotel staff were incredibly welcoming and made a superstar of our son from the doormen to the cleaning staff. At breakfast everyday the waiting staff made a huge fuss of him and even kept him entertained one day so we could eat our breakfast together - a very nice thoughtful touch. Once the housekeeping staff realised our baby was a boy they changed the cot bedding to be for a little boy and left extra baby products in the room even checking what size nappy he took before leaving extras.    Breakfast everyday is fantastic - excellent large and varied selection (definitely try the moroccan pancakes with honey) all beautifully displayed and with incredibly attentive service (bringing you a basket of pastries and breads unprompted getting smoothies made up for you etc) even when breakfast is heaving at the weekend.    The outside of the hotel and communal areas are stunning with lovely fresh floral smells wafting in from the terraces. The pool area is large and the heated pool was lovely in January. There are lots of loungers and lovely day beds next to the pool fantastic place to hang out after your feet are tired from the souks. The bed in the room was very comfortable.    The hotel is about 15mins walk from the main square but very straight forward to walk and if you prefer there are taxis and horse drawn carriages outside to take you to the city centre. The calm of the hotel though is a nice break after a day in the mania of Marrakech.    The negatives.............  - The price of anything outside of the room booking e.g. dinner in restaurant room service drinks at the bar (a coke is 50dm (c¬£3.50 a can ) at the pool with a beer a similar price). It is a shame as if the prices were more reasonable then you would probably order more but we just went to the local supermarket (carrefour) instead which is about 15min walk away.  - No kettle or tea and coffee in the room (maybe this is a british thing). They did bring a kettle when we asked though.  - The air con didn't work in our room either (agreement with our tripadvisor reviews). We chose not to complain as moving rooms with a baby was too much hassle and manageable in January climate although imagine not so in the summer heat.  - The check in process was slow felt like a lot of paperwork to fill in. They kept insisting we had paid with an Amex card which they needed for our reservation. We don't own an Amex card and had booked through British Airways so this was just a bit of unnecessary hassle particularly when the room had already been paid for in full.  - Concergie slightly grumpy about helping us when a trip we had booked didn't arrive as we hadn't used the hotel provider

Stayed here January 2013. The hotel looks amazing inside and out. Is is very clean and smelled lovely inside. The pool area is excellent and is relaxing. The room i was given was very large with a nice lounge. Everything i could possibly need was provided. The housekeeping again were excellent and payed attention to detail. The room had amazing views of the pool area and i could see the mountains in the distance too. On the downside the service is not great especially for a 5 star hotel. The check in took way to long and service needs improving. i expected more from a 5 star. Luckily the hotel itself is luxury.

Review_Date: Ross B wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Title: Very nice hotel - let down by staff
Review_Text: Stayed here May 2012 with my girlfriend for 4 nights.  The hotel itself is very nice well kept clean and well furnished. The pool area is one of the nicest I have stayed at with beds for sunbeds! Made some of the hotels in Vegas I've stayed at look ordinary!  The location is good for walking into the town and I would recommend doing this at night rather then eating in the hotel. The prices for drinks food etc. in the hotel is very expensive compared to even top London hotels but you can eat or drink in the town for a fraction of the price so as long as you are aware of this you should be ok.  We just found the staff a bit rude and unhelpful. We were supposed to stay in the newer spa part of the hotel but despite a very nice roomthe air-con was not working (not much fun in 40 degree heat!). After being told it was the whole hotel that had a problem. After not sleeping for the night because of the heat we found out from other couples that they had been told the same but after complaining been moved to rooms that did have working air-con. Cue a whole day spent arguing with the unhelpful staff and 2 rooms later got a lesser room that was at least cool. A real shame that we will remember our trip by this wasted day!  The annoying thing is that I had read on trip advisor about this exact same problem from others and just dismissed it as people moaning about a one-off problem that would be fixed.  I could go on about the bad staff (having to ask more than once for everything being ignored at breakfast ordering drinks that didn't arrive being accused of getting too much change when I ordered a drink passed from staff member to staff member slow check-in etc) but you get the picture!  Personally if I visit Marrakech again I will try somewhere else - there are lots of nice hotels nearby that I'm sure value there guests a bit more!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Clean and efficient. Good food especially the Laurence Bar and Lounge.  Rooms average size but very clean.  Check in and out easy.  Centrally located. With no traffic it's 10 minutes from the airport With traffic it was a half hour!  Best breakfast buffet don't miss that!

Review_Title: Excellent hotel in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: We booked 4 nights in Marrakech and stayed in the Sofitel Lounge and Spa hotel. When you arrive for the first time the entrance is very grand and beautiful. There are two receptions one is Moroccan style and the other is modern contemporary.. both very special. The staff were great and the food and pool area were perfect! We visited the bars also and they were very swish!  The hotel is also in a good location and walking distance to the city.  The room we got though I would say was average it was almost like the whole hotel was 5 stars but the room was 3 stars. It was clean and everything but didn't have the grandeur compared with the rest of everything else!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed 6 nights at the sofitel over the new year fabulous hotel outdoor heathed pool made outdoor swimming very enjoyable and the sunshine was a bonus. Staff and food were exellent location for walk to the medina or to the new shopping area very pleasant 5 10 minutes away.

Review_Date: The Eating Elephant wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Title: A fantastic hotel, ideal for a relaxing break
Review_Text: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this Sofitel during December. Having read some previous reviews I was slightly apprehensive but our room was spacious immaculate and had fantastic views. The hotel was spotless and the staff were particularly accommodating especially El Moktar at the pool bar who looked after us well during our stay. The hotel is well located a 15 minute walk to the square where we ate on several occasions. I'd also recommend the open roof Skybar at the Delano Hotel directly opposite - good menu if you like sushi though we just popped over for a gin and tonic most evenings and the staff extremely attentive. Overall a great trip thanks to the high standards of the accommodation and service and an added bonus that it is such a short transfer from the airport. I'd also like to recommend 4x4 Camel which can be found on this site if you'd like a day trip ..... a hassle free way to get out and about and see the stunning Atlas Mountains. I will definitely be returning!!

Review_Date: zeinab o wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Text: My family and I thoroughly enjoyed our 1 week stay at the Sofitel for various reasons being:  1. It lived up to its 5 star reputation amenity -wise(roomsservice pools gardens play centre etc);  2. The staff were exceptionally hospitality and helpful-waiters & chefs went an extra mile to please(especially Adil Ibrahim Aziza Rachid Fatima Zahrah & Mourad);  3. In close proximity (walking distance) to other resturants & medina ; and  4. Ideal place to go with children (5 star play room) & child friendly staff.

Review_Date: Baber A wrote a review Dec 2012
Review_Title: great place, lovely staff, worlds apart but pricey for country
Review_Text: visited in early December whilst the film festival on goin the hotel was the hub to everything pleasant suprise lovely hotel from start to end from the check in to check out  Lovely touches with free mint tea all day long  we were room only but we were happy with this as the hotel n it's services were very pricey jus a 15 min walk away from the madina were everything was a fraction of the price so tip don't eat or drink from hotel much ull make a big saving the mini bar was also very pricey  but ithink the hotel must b the best in morroco as its defiantly 5 star thoughtout great escape

While strolling around in Hivernage me and my friend had a question about a club we couldn¬¥t find. While looking for the club we past the Sofitel Marrakech Lounge and Spa and decided to ask the guard. He directly asked a couple of taxi drivers but since they didn¬¥t know it either he advised us to go to the reception of the Sofitel.    Before we could get to the reception another employee already asked us if he could help us. We said yes and fortunately he could answer our question. After a couple of days in Marrakesh it was great to find out that people (in this case employees of a five star hotel) were still willing to help you without expecting money.    So a compliment to the staff of the Sofitel Marrakech Lounge and Spa.

Abs amazing experience. Beautiful hotel and staff that make your stay special. Ibrahim Fatima Zahra Adil Rachida Said Mourad Elham Chef Mustapha to name a few are fabulous hosts at the Jardin Restuarant (Breakfast Buffet). The pool area is relaxing and the heted pool outside excellent. Rooms luxurious. Brilliant stay!

Review_Title: Exquisite common areas, genuine Moroccon hospitality, average location.
Review_Text: A website error allowed me to book this hotel for $25/night so naturally I took the opportunity. I generally like Accor hotels and this Sofitel was quite lovely. The common areas the pool bars restaurants & spa were beautiful. Lots of staff who were very friendly & polite. The room which was very far from the reception was fine though it had seen better days & was becoming tired. It looked out onto a Louis Vuitton store so if you find yourself there ask to change. There was actually a lot of noise from a neighbouring bar & at 4am lots of talking outside in the street. I think this had something to do with the call to prayer. I would definitely bring ear plugs.  Breakfast was typical 5* offering hotel about 15 mins walk to main square or new part of town. Don't be fooled by taxi drivers telling you it's fixed price of 100D to the airport. Just walk away no matter how much they protest. I got one for 50 about 20m down the street.  If I'd had to pay $300 for this place I wouldn't have felt I'd got real value as I'm sure there are charming local hotels at a fraction of the price but of course for what I paid I was more than happy.

I had a suite room 173. It was spacious and had 2 big tvs and a pretty comfy bed. The main problem was the the room had a very strong mildewy smell. The staff sprayed mint water on the floor to fresh it up and I left the balcony doors open whenever I was there but the smell just permeated the room. I couldn't move because of the film festival so the huge hotel was booked solid! My colleagues didn't seem to have this problem in their room. Also the espresso maker was very difficult to work and they didn't replace the pods. I know others that had a hard time working that fancy machine. Luckily they serve fabulous cappucino at breakfast so I just took it there.

Review_Date: Naz I wrote a review Dec 2012
Review_Text: We really enjoyed our stay and were especially looked after by the staff especially  ibrahim Fatima zahra ilham ziendine mustapha and hakime.    Only issue we had was with a bad drainage smell in our suite on our last night we had to sleep with the bedroom door closed as it was getting late and my kids were asleep. As I write this we are trying to get this resolved...

Review_Date: Sunshine J wrote a review Dec 2012
Review_Text: The best thing about this hotel is the staff especially Imine at reception!! she was extremely helpful even before I actually stayed at the hotel. I called in advance to request for a room on the 3rd floor and she very kindly made this happen for me. Imine was really sweet and cheerful and her customer service skills in my opinion are 10 out of 10!!!    I also found all the staff at breakfast very friendly too.. I especially would like to thank Mustafa who cooked my omelettes just the way I liked them well done!! Also Anas (not sure if I have the correct spelling of his name) but he did the best smoothies ever! and final Fatama who always greeted me with a big smile each morning.    I would highly recommend this hotel it's in a great location and there's lots to do. I look forward to visiting this hotel again in the near future. My advice is to go and book your hotel now I'm pretty sure you will love it just as much as I did. - enjoy and have a wonderful time!

Stayed there from Nov 17-24 2012. Great and central location. Excellent service distinctive and tastefully ambience. Nice reception by management in a lovely hall which looks like a Amphitheatre. Nice morsel also on a Vernissage that is held once a week. Food and drinks for free very special party local partly international. Quality of the breakfast extraordinary Never experienced before .  Beautiful consumption area outside partly in a herb town. Lovely gardens 2 nice pools huge king size beds as sun loungers. Food and service good committed staff very friendly.  Weak points: Rooms at least ours ( 264) specially bath rooms need a renovation. Front desk hopelessly understaffed for early check out. That may course stress and trouble. According to our Taxi driver this happens all the time.  All over impression very good. Will come back
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A wonderful experience and revelation! The hotel is impressive but the outside areas absolutely fabulous. Seating lounging resting relaxing all catered for. It is like having all the furniture usually indoors except its outdoors. The breakfast buffet is the best I have ever seen and def worth having. Every fruit imaginable freshly cooked omelettes as well as full English freshly cooked crepes full continental and every bread you can imagine. The staff ratio about 5 to 1 guest are so polite courtious and charming. It is not cheap about UK prices for drinks etc but then again it is a 5 star hotel. Def need to have a guide if you venture out to explore the markets and recommend shopping at the government fixed price shops if you don't like being harrased and pestered around the markets.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Lovely Property. In a semi-private neighborhood- that has surrounding restaurants a casino and other hotels. Good Service! Enjoyed tremendously. I dont have much more to say than i enjoyed my stay wished I booked a longer stay here.

Review_Date: Beatriz Venturi wrote a review Nov 2012
Review_Text: I'm very disappointed with the service. I'm a gold participant of le club program and I didn't have a welcome drink or an upgrad. The worst thing was: they put us in a bedroom worse than I paid for.  We complaint several times and spent 2 days trying to resolve the problem.  I've paid for a superior room with bathtub in the lounge and spa the newest one. They put us in the palais royal in an old room noisy and with 2 twins beds together. We are still waiting for our luggages for more than 40 minutes.  Not what I expected.
