Definitely worth a visit. Great photo history of morocco. Don't miss it. Also great staff. Great rooftop cafe. Food was excellent. The curator charming. It's worth while buying some beautiful prints to take home. Enjoy. Highly recommended.

Review_Title: Friendly staff and beautiful common areas
Review_Text: The hotel is located outside the Medina about 20 minute walk to the main square Jemaa el fnaa.    The hotel has a beautiful exterior and reception area. Very beautiful art on display. Nice arabic perfume smell inside the hotel. Check- in took some time as we had to fill in some forms but we were offered washcloths juice and delicious macaroons while going through the ordeal.    We were a little disappointed with the room which did not quite add up to the otherwise beautiful lobby gardens and restaurant areas. The room was more four star and it was bit dated. It also felt a bit cramped. We had booked king size bed but was given to single beds that where put next to each other not as comfy as a kingsize bed. The lighting is not so good in the room at least not if you want to read. There is a safe a minibar bath tub and nice bathroom soaps from L√íccitane. The room was clean. We never experience any turn down service even though we were informed that this was provided.    Breakfast was nice and plentiful. Eggs to order crepes cold cuts pastries smoothie station etc. You can its outside or inside and the decor is very nice. We had lunch at the pool restaurant one day. Not so exciting menu your basic sandwiches salads and hamburgers. We had dinner in the room one night. I had the lemon chicken tagine and I did not like it....    The staff was very friendly courteous and professional without exception!    We spent only a couple of hours by the pool the pool beds are very comfortable. They had some weird entertainment by the pool with 3 guitar playing and singing men was walking around playing old hits. It was strange......    If you want something to eat between 5 and 7 in the afternoon it seems the only option was room service or to find a restaurant in the neighborhood maybe as nothing was open in the restaurant. The hotel is in a very quiet are with mostly other upscale hotels and a few restaurants and some upscale shops (i.e Louis Vuitton) so if you want some action you will have to go to the Medina.    The staff will address you in french but they do speak english.    Check-out went smoothly. Can be recommended if you like big hotels though I am sure staying in a riad would have been a lot more charming.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: zeljko o wrote a review Nov 2012
Review_Title: Inside the hotel an oasis, a crowd outside the hotel.
Review_Text: Marrakech once last position before crossing the Atlas mountains and desert today a city of terracotta modern buildings boulevards grandest hotels the Medina and the indescribable crowd.  I stayed In Marrakech with my familly the first days of January. In the evening and in the morning you will feel a little cold which disappears during the sunny day. Soffitel is really a great hotel. Very impressive whan you arrive. Huge and very cozy lobby with fresh mint tea friendly staff at reception will convince you that you're in the right place. The rooms are large enough with a terrace overlooking the Atlas Mountains. Heated outdoor pool excellent service at the pool as well enough sun to make you look for shadow under the umbrellas. The guys on the pool will keep your place for the next day. Small tip. Breakfast is excellent. Spa very good.. Night club with live music is the right place for relaxation. Near the hotel there are several excellent restaurants of different international cuisines. Mmmmmm !!! Fair price. Ask Concierge necessarily. Nice guys. My suggestion is to take a local guide who will show you everything worth seeing in Marrakech. It's very cheap. In Medina you will find a lot of nice things for the house. Price is different depend what you want to buy and what quality you choose. You should to haggle it's part of their tradition. I want to come back definitely

Review_Title: A great 5 Star hotel if you have the right room.
Review_Text: The hotel is very impressive when you arrive and we received a very courtious and friendly welcome and offered fresh mint tea.  Meeting our Kuoni representative in an hour we did not get a chance to really look at the room but were not happy. Our rep said he would see if he could get them changed but was told there were no other rooms available. Later we found 10 bad faults with our rooms definitely not 5 Star would not put up with them in a 3 star hotel. We went down to reception asked to speak to the Manager told him the faults and that if they could not give us the standard of room we expected we would go to another hotel. He then upgraded us and gave us 2 lovely rooms with which we were very happy. I must say the beds were so very comfortable.  All the staff were very friendly and efficient and they did everything they could to make our stay in Marakesh a memerable one.  We enjoyed the food at the hotel though had planned to eat out most evenings to enjoy Moroccan cooking to the full. We had no complaints at all with the food or service and enjoyed the entertainment at the night club in the hotel.  There are 2 swimming pools the one nearest the restaurants is cold but the 2nd pool is very warm. The Jacuzzi is not hot. The staff around the pool are excellent finding you a suitable sunbed and towels. The sunbeds are pretty fantastic.  Except for at first being given poor rooms everything else about the hotel its position style service staff and food made our visit to Marakesh a great experience and the Sofitel was a great choice of Hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Sofitel Lounge & Spa is a beautiful hotel located in Hivernage . The staff is very professional and friendly. We booked a Suite Prestige for 2 nights and got a good deal. The Suite was pretty big the bed very comfy but we did not find welcome fruits plat when we arrivedlike other 5 stars hotels and especially when you are booking the best Suite!  I will return to this hotel and highly recommend the Sofitel

Review_Title: Nice hotel, but far too noisy
Review_Text: I stayed here for a conference about a month ago. I found the hotel to be perfectly nice - restaurants and facilites were fine - however it was a real ordeal getting any sleep. I stayed in a room facing the road and between 2-4am every day there was loud shouting/talking dogs barking car horns and police whistles.On asking the hotel staff they said there was nothing they could do and that no other rooms were free. I was very unhappy with this and as there was no other option I toughed it out for the next few days. I was very glad to be leaving after this continual lack of sleep. I certainly will not be going back.

Review_Title: Good hotel with some bad points..
Review_Text: I stayed at this hotel this summer for a week with my girlfriend. We were undecided which hotel to stay at in Marrakech but after having the Sofitel recommended by some Moroccan friends and after looking at pictures and reviews we decided to book here.    The rate I got through my credit card company was surprisingly cheap (I can't remember exactly the price but it was around 160EUR per night breakfast included and special rates at the spa).    The first impression of the hotel was good as we were greeted warmly and the place looked very nice and well kept. Although we had to wait quite a long time to check in we were offered tea and local sweets during our wait.    The room was large although not very modern and not very clean: on my arrival I noticed that the rubbish bin was still partly full and there was an empty bottle of coke on the balcony. This really upset me as the main thing I care about when staying at a hotel is cleanness and hygiene.    The pool area was nice and relaxing an the service was prompt and attentive. Also the spa was good and there was a wide choice of massages.    The food at the hotel was overall good but not exceptional. I enjoyed the breakfast because of the very wide choice of sweets pastries fruits and hot food.    The concierge was at times arrogant and it felt like that he had some interest in the restaurants that he was recommending to us as some of them felt like tourist traps..    The So club was actually very fun probably the best night club in Marrakech.    Overall the hotel was good.. not exceptional but good.. I'd recommend the Sofitel to young people or couples who don't want to stay at a very posh hotel (La Mamounia) which would be more appropriate for older people but who still want to have the comfort of a 5stars hotel.  Would I stay here again? Probably I would try out other ones..
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I have just returned from a 5 night stay here and felt I had to share my views on this hotel.  I have travelled widely stayed in many wonderful 5* hotels but have to say this is probably one of the best. From the moment we arrived the staff proved to be courteous helpful and made one feel nothing was too much trouble.  On arrival at the hotel the local rep who met us at the airport tried to convince us that we had been upgraded to a superior room with pool view. On pointing out that this was in fact what had been booked anyway he became somewhat flustered and back peddled - I have read elsewhere that this has been the experience of other guests. In fact this tactic was quite unnecessary as the whole hotel is a delight and facilities are of an extremely high standard anyway.  Breakfast is an absolute joy and one could take all morning over it. The staff moved in and out of each other seamlessly noticing each and every used plate or glass. They remain friendly yet very professional and discreet - the best waiting-on at table I have ever encountered. Great choice of food and as much as one can possibly eat so keeps one going until the afternoon.  We didn't eat in any of the restaurants mainly due to preference to sample local restaurants but menus looked wonderful if rather pricey!  The room we had was on the 2nd floor and views were rather obscured by olive trees growing outside so a higher floor might be better. The bedroom and bathrooms are very relaxing and comfortable and most wonderful of all the room has a loo separate from the bathroom - great when sharing facilities.  Vast reception areas well kept gardens and fantastic garden lighting made this a fabulous refuge and escape from the chaos that is Marrakech.

Review_Title: An Oasis of Calm and Comfort
Review_Text: A beautiful hotel. The public rooms are so welcoming and intriguing that it is almost an effort to go outside into the sunshine. Guest rooms are spacious and well equipped and comfortable. A bed to get lost in. Room service provides a varied selection of pillows.  Gardens and pools are delightful and inviting. A serenity almost to match The Chedi in Muscat.  Food. Excellent choices. The Oasis by the pool provides daytime delights and is quite reasonable. L'Orangerie in the evening has an excellent choice of food and wines. Service is what I have come to expect from Sofitel. Caution. On darker evenings a 'romantic' table on the Terrace of L'Orangerie throws up a problem. The candles are quite inadequate to read the menu! Amusing to watch other guests confront the situation you have been in. Perhaps a Caver's Lamp might help.  This lighthearted carp aside I would recommend a visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: we had a package via Broadway Travel that included accommodation in superior pool view rooms at the Sofitel Lounge and Spa. The bedrooms were large and nicely furnished - the beds were SO comfortable! We were a group of eight and all of us commented on how fabulous the beds were! The bathrooms were large with lovely toiletries robes and slippers. Breakfast offered plenty of choice - fresh fruit smoothie bar omlette station crepe station cereals the usual hot selection on a buffet cheeses and meats and a wide range of bread croissants and pastries. A selection of teas was available and coffee served in cafetieres and left on the table! There are two outdoor swimming pools - a cold one at the Lounge and Spa and a (very) warm one at the adjoining Imperial Palais hotel. Sunbeds were mainly lovely double divan's with plenty of cushions and there were even some four poster style ones for those who wanted more shade than was afforded by sun umbrellas! there is plenty of staff poolside to serve drinks or food and even a man who came round cleaning our sunglasses! we had lunch a couple of days at the poolside restaurant a little bit expensive for what it was but that was compensated by the great service and quality and the ever smiling staff. we ventured into the Lawrence Bar late evening for a drink and there was a truly terrible singing combo on - one of the singers appeared not to know the words and couldn't be heard properly at the end of the room we were in although that was maybe a blessing!! Some of our group ventured to the spa and came back raving about how fabulous it was and how great their treatments were. We used the So Bar as our meeting place pre dinner a lovely place to sit and catch up on the day and enjoy a drink and later in the evening to watch the beautiful people go into the So Lounge (club!). Plenty of staff to help us get taxis and advise us on the price we should be negotiating with the drivers. We all agreed that it was a great hotel and we wouldn't hesitate in staying there again if in Marrakech...

Review_Title: Nice public areas, good breakfast, Mediocre/noisy rooms
Review_Text: We were supposed to stay at this hotel for 4 nights but checked out after 2. Here is the deal in a nutshell:    Good:  1 - Excellent breakfast and Moroccan restaurant  2 - Nice public areas good lap pool gym  3 - 10 minute walk to the main square in the Medina    Bad:  1 - Noise noise noise - There is a major casino next door which hosts super loud hotel rattling parties on Sat nights which go to 3 in the morning. We had a "Superior" room. They showed us a few (in both the (Lounge and Spa side and the Imperial Side) and all had noise problems of some kind. The noise isn't only from the casino there is restaurant noise (unless you stay up till midnight) and street noise. You can look at our other reviews we rarely complain about noise.  2 - The rooms are nothing special - Motel 6-like  3 - Very uneven service as mentioned by many other reviewers.  4 - Frankly it is infinitely more atmospheric to stay in a riad in the Medina. Like day and night.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An Oasis in the mahem of Marrakech
Review_Text: We were fortunate to find a good value package for our first trip to Morocco and not knowing what to expect were delighted when the somewhat shaky airport transfer experience deposited us at the front of the Sofitel. It was reassuring to be greeted by polite and smartly dressed staff and shown through to the reception lounge for a glass of Moroccan Tea (delicious). Here we had an efficient booking process by charming ladies. I liked that we were shown where the lifts were and told which floor and where to find our room. Nice not to be ushered around the place by some obsequious smurf as if you have had lobotomy a cringe we have had to endure in other 5* places.  Prior to leaving the UK we had made a request for a room with a view if possible. The room on the top floor had a giant of a bed - very comfy too - and a little balcony with smashing views across the pool to the Atlas mountains beyond. Thank you Meriem you excelled yourself. We found every aspect of the hotel we encountered to be clean tidy and comfortable. The staff were charming and helpful without being intrusive and always seemed to have a smile. There was an art exhibition in one of the halls for interest and Internet access available from a business room. The warm pool was great just the ticket as the weather was not kind and all the sunbeds hammocks and 'Bali beds' were clean and there were the plentiful towels.  We ate in l'orangerie first night and Fatima guided us through the menu beautifully. Tasty. We found the variety at breakfast was plentiful and I enjoyed trying the Moroccan dishes - something for everyone. One thing though an area in the outside seating that for us non-smokers and others like us could have enjoyed without the whiff of burning bush would have been welcome. I would seriously suggest this is considered by the Hotel. I saw at least one minor grump by a lady who asked the chap at the table next door not to puff over her and her food. She had my sympathy.  This hotel is ideally situated so we walked everywhere (crossing the main roads is cheaper than bungee jumping into crocodile pond and just as scary!!) except at night on our way back from the Souks when we used a taxi (staff will give you an indication of cost to assist with the Taxi haggle).  Thanks to the Sofitel and the staff our first trip was a memorable one and we will return - hopefully with our two little grandaughters.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: i had a beautiful experience in this hotel  we enjoy our stay staff wonderful !!  special thanks to all pool staff  specially younes who was very helpful and professional . thanks a lot to make our stay a amazing experience

Review_Title: Lovely hotel, Marrakesh was a big disappoinment.
Review_Text: We stayed at the Sofitel Longe and Spa for 4 nights returning on the 2Oth October. Our stay at the hotel was positive overall. The facilities are what one would expect from a 5 star hotel. Friendly staff large well appointed room huge comfy bed decent bathroom. Bed linen is changed every day and towels twice a day. The lighting was a bit on the dull side but that is an issue of style over function. There are no tea or coffee making facilities which is a shame but not unusual. Our room had a balcony overlooking the swimming pool and garden which we found relaxing. Unfortunately the weather turned cool and rainy which put a damper on our stay.    Breakfast was very good with plenty of choice. If you want ordinary tea be sure to ask for Liptons.    Drinks seem expensive and the price varies according to which bar you are in. Two gin and tonics can cost 220Dirhams about ¬£16.00. A 330ml can of tonic is ¬£4.25. However the gins are at least double strength so I suppose we can't complain too much. Beers are about ¬£4.00 for a small bottle. The So Bar and the Orangery have live music every evening for about 3 hours and are good places to relax and unwind.    I found dinner in the main restaurant disappointing but have never been a fan of "local dish" which seems to be an excuse for charging premium prices for low quality food. When I said I hadn't enjoyed the meal (lamb and couscous) the chef came to the table and was very apologetic offering to cook me another meal. His concern was genuine but I really couldn't face more of the same. I've back packed in India and had no problem with the food but this didn't float my boat sad to say. When I'm paying western prices I do expect quality ingredients not scrag end of neck overcooked vegetables and a mound of tasteless padding.    On a more positive note the staff were friendly and happily spoke to us in English. We experienced no discrimination on that score.    On balance I would recommend the Sofitel Lounge and Bar especially if as we did you can get a good deal from a travel agency. Marrakesh itself is another story altogether and those who are planning a trip should read the Marrakesh T.A. forum and take note of the negatives which although in the minority give a more realistic view of the city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I can say on average is was a good stay with good beds restaurant breakfast and staff but the overriding problem was the horrible AC noise from outside which completely made any time in the room impossible.  We asked to be moved. This took 4 days . The new room was great.  If you are unlucky enough to be put into the noisy wing I feel sorry for you.  Would have been 4 stars but for the noise.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Karen B wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Text: Very relaxing four day trip at Sofitel Loung & Spa. We were a party of 8 and booked superior rooms with pool view. Beds were really comfortable rooms were a good size with a great balcony area. Only negative comment regarding the rooms would be the lighting. There are bed side lamps and a lamp on the table but no central lighting so it is quite dark in the evenings when you are getting ready.    There are two outdor pools (one warm/one cold!) both which had plenty of sun loungers (individual and bed style) with staff replenishing towels regularly. There were quite a lot of flies when sun bathing by the pool which you are constantly brushing away but not sure how the hotel could remedy this?! Spa area was really stylish although needed to book treatments in advance - there was no availability for Friday afternoon/Saturday morning so I was unable to book but two other people in my party were able to secure bookings earlier in the week.    Breakfast choices were plentiful - egg station crepe station cold meats/cheeses salmon pastries breads fruit and yoghurts. Food was of a really good standard. I particularly liked the 'smoothie station' where they made smoothies to order. Lunch menu by the pool also had good choices and was reasonably priced. The bar area in the SO bar was nice & drinks were expensive for Marrakech but what you'd expect in a 5* hotel - vodka and mixer was ¬£8/¬£10 but Morrocan wine was reasonable at ¬£15 a bottle. Staff in the restaurants were really attentive.    There was an issue with one of our rooms (it was booked as a twin and upon arrival was a double). Reception were slow in resolving the issue. However the hotel Manager introduced himself asking how our stay was whilst we were at the pool and when I mentioned this to him it was resolved within 30 mins of the conversation.    Hotel is a great location 10 mins from the main square and 15 from the airport. Really enjoyed my stay and would definitely return if back in Marrakech

Review_Date: tony g wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Text: Just returned from 4 days at teh Sofitel in Marrakech.    Hotel was excellent just a few things to consider:    1. Learn French as they seem to get special treatment  2. Take some fly spray as its not relaxing sunbathing by the pool constantly being attacked by fly's  3. Don't tust the reception staff they can be very missleading promise things and change their minds  4. Get down early for breakfast    The Hotel is very much an oasis from the chaios outside
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: First impression was the building and the interior design of the building which was we were expecting for as a palace. On the way walking in we just hoped that our a-week holiday would have been unforgettable YES it was horribly unforgettable one.    At the reception the welcoming was SO COLD 20 mins to get the check in process completed and get a room key. A guy who was checking us in just left in the middle of the process (Dinner break?) and a young lady just took care of the rest without excusing or explaining anything to us and we started again. (She said you filled in the form and I will be back) SO unprofessional. No information about the hotel facilities given neither any anticipation of our expectation. We discovered by ourselves each day.    On the following day we asked where we could find the breakfast room a girl just point to the right and say it's just over there.    Poor service of the Pool bar restaurant even though the pricy item on the menu which we were ready to pay. A lot of staffs walking around doing nothing instead of giving attention towards the guests.    Many technical issues encountered during the stay the room was not at all what we expected. Bed was not comfortable at all A/C didn't work and etc.    Having walked and seen so many staffs on the corridor each day they just ignored us didn't even say "Hi". In general the service was horribly far away from what we call Luxury.    Very disappointing and highly not recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A good average Tourist and Business hotel
Review_Text: This Hotel has a good location and its Moroccan spirit with a touch of France has his charm. The choice of the room is important! Some rooms are very dark and noisy others charming with a great view of the palms and the Atlas Mountains. The service is ok sometimes slow and sometimes not that friendly like you think it will be in a luxury hotel. The charm of the lobby and the bar/ lounge is very Marrakech and relaxed. The pool and backyard is one of nicest in Marrakech. The Spa is excellent ! The sleep quality of the bed is excellent.

My husband and I (plus my sister and her best friend) stayed at the Sofitel Marrakech Lounge & Spa for 5 nights:  1.Breathtaking reception with cold and refreshing wipes and an easy check-in  2.Hotel was stunning beautifully decorated and clean with lovely aromas  3.The room was in need of refurbishment but generally comfortable although the view was less than to be desired and the noise of building works was annoying  4.The pool area was relaxing but got quite busy and the staff were sluggish to say the least  5.Breakfast was okay but had a variety of options    I won't be staying here again as I am used to a different sort of service but overall it was okay close to the souks and shops!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Bettina M wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Title: Nice place - at least at first sight
Review_Text: The Sofitel Marrakech is a beautiful hotel located in the Hivernage the trendy new part of Marrakech. The lobby and restaurants are luxuriously furnished and you expect five-star treatment from its appearence. Don't be disappointed if you won't!    In our room the carpet was stained two out of four lamps were not working the toilet leaked and the TV was out of order. You would think it takes one call to housekeeping in order to fix all this. No it doesn't. At times we had three officials in our room one as helpless (and as uneager to help) as the other. Except for the toilet nothing was fixed but a lot of promises were made some of which were repeated daily.    We made the same kind of experiences at breakfast: We were early guests and we had the impression that the service staff arrived at seven o'clock as we did: Tables were not set no napkins it took up to 15 Minutes to get a simple coffee... Many times a waiter just forgot what we asked for. There's plenty of staff everywhere yet it's unefficient and slow.    All in all it was a mixed experience: The hotel's location is great it is nice and quiet - and yet we did not feel welcome as guests.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: tricia m wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Title: beautiful building and good location with super staff
Review_Text: beautiful terracotta buildings on three sides of two outside swimming pools and garden area with bougainvillea flowing down the sides from the fifth floor and cheerful flocks of sparrows all around. Very helpful staff across the entire hotel and a yummy breakfast. convenient to walk into the old town (about 20 mins to main square). prices for food and drink in the hotel is high but there is a supermarket 10 minutes away to use instead. amazingly comfortable beds.

Review_Date: Samar H wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Text: We had a great experience in the breakfast restaurant. We were superbly serviced by smiling faces of Said Fatima Zohra Brahim Youssef Ilham Omar and Zaidan. We were overwhelmed by their dedication to serve me and my family while spending holiday.

We have just returned after a five night break at the Sofitel. We arrived approx 7-15pm and were met by four doormen who just whisked us off to reception on getting our room number all luggage etc was gone and we next found it in the room which overlooked the pool and Atlas Mountains. All staff were very friendly and efficient. At breakfast(which was excellent)FatimaFalim Brahim Zindine Ilham were really lovely and looked after us very well. In the Restaurant L'orangerie the food was very good and Siham and Saking who were our waitresses were a great team.  The whole experience was wonderful we shall have no hesitation to recommend this hotel.  D&J Ipswich
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Craig M wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Text: When looking for a hotel I marakesh I came across the Sofitel lounge I booked it imediatly knowing I can't go wrong. My experiences with sofitel have always been the best.The hotel is located in walking distance to the old city. We stayed four days ( just enough for merakesh if you have more time I would travel outside merakesh.) first day found local beer at the grand hotel tazi  A must stop befor heading into the market. We ate dinner every night in the market.the concierge booked our next three days. They were very helpful in planning fun and exciting things day two in the am we did camel rides and after lunch a five hour four weel ATV excertion through dunes and desert an excellent company. Day three we had a privet 4x4 tour to climb the atlas mountains our privet guild was Adil-Belgareh through new tours he became our friend that day I would request him the hotel is magnificent . And these are a good way to some fun stuff book everything through the hotel you can't go wrong
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed recently for five nights arrived on an early morning flight. Room was ready and booked in and by the pool before 10:30 am - fantastic. We had a room in the older part of the hotel but with a pool view probably a 4-5 minute walk to reception. The rooms were spotless towels and linen cleaned on daily basis and yes beds fantastic. Staff friendly and polite. Swimming pools lovely and always plenty of shade and beds. Breakfast is excellent. We had lunch at the pool restaurant and ate in the So Club on one occasion. Drinks and food are a little expensive but service and quality excellent. Location - approx 15 min walk to main square with pavements and generally well lit plenty of taxis but walk down street for a few 100 m's generally cheaper. The "Big Red Bus" has a stop outside hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the hotel and whilst not a Riad or within the City walls it was a haven of tranquility after a mornings or late evenings venture into the market and souks!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Sone good, some bad and some just plain ugly.
Review_Text: The good; superb bar service and very good restaurant great bed.    The bad; some pool staff seem more intent on catching up on gossip with their colleagues than serving guests.    The ugly; room not ready when we arrived. Not a problem we were given a voucher for a couple of drinks and told reception would come and get us when the room was ready. An hour and a half later I returned to reception to find our room was ready. They said our bags would be delivered to our room. Forty minutes later I went down to reception to find that our bags hadn't moved an inch. My laundry went missing. Two visits to reception drew frowns and assurances that something would be done. Two hours later I went myself to housekeeping and it was in my room within five minutes. No hot water on one day of our five-day stay. Yes no hot water in our room. Yes it claims to be a five-star hotel!    Despite all of this we decided to extend by an extra night. I asked at reception. They said "It depends if we have rooms available." I waited. I asked "Do you have any rooms available?" "I'd have to check" was the reply. I waited. "Could you check?" I probed. "I'm sure we have". I gave up and booked online despite the pathetic strength of the WiFi service. "Booking a hotel has never been easier" claims the Accor site. Unless you're using WiFi from an Accor hotel.    The Marrakech Lounge & Spa has undermined our confidence in the Sofitel group. I'm a Platinum loyalty card holder. I've been trying different hotels this week.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: H D wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Title: Room with a view of a green swimming pool and building site
Review_Text: The entrance to the hotel is impressive. So far everything else has been unimpressive. Our luggage took over an hour to be delivered to our room. And worst our room had a view of a filthy green swimming pool and building site. When we asked to move we were told no. We asked if the hotel was full and were told it was not. So we asked why we couldn't move to a room with a better view and were told 'this was the type of room we'd booked' which is funny as I don't remember 'room with view of building site' being a booking option ....

Review_Date: Jill M wrote a review Sep 2012
Review_Title: 5* WOW and the bed was like sleeping on a cloud
Review_Text: This hotel has the WOW factor from the moment you walk though the doors.  At check in we were seated and given mint tea and macaroons before being told that we had been upgraded to a junior suite ;). We booked out stay though an online offer and were Deffinatly not disappointed.  The room was large with a separate toilet to the bath and sink (good when there is 2 of you getting ready) the balcony overlooked the pool which played music most night but this was more soothing than irritating. The bed was fantastic and huge totally like sleeping on a cloud.  The pool area is good with seating and covered cabanas hand and foot massage available by the pool. Need to get your drinks from a waiter round the pool as you cant bring your own but the price wasn't too bad. 2 different pools 1 hot 1 cold with water sprays and jacuzzis.  Breakfast is fantastic with an aray of foods but not you Brits there is no bacon and egg here but there are inlets creps smoothies and meat platters.    We visited the SO lounge for dinner wich was fantastic.    NOTE; go for cocktails from 730 and get the nibbles (free) and the drink is cheaper then too    Over all this is 5* and if you can get this on a good deal snap it up worth every penny

Absolutely FAB hotel with outstanding levels of service from the many staff in the hotel. And although the hotel was fully booked for the seven days I was lucky enough to stay there you would not have known. It was calm and the environment they create in the hotel is relaxing and welcoming 24/7. And for me the subtle aroma of orange blossom was the icing on the cake. A wonderful enchanting first experience of Morocco - excellent location for trips / excursions. GREAT choice. Great 40th birthday present Thanks mum and dad. x

Review_Title: Wonderful experience but not quite 5 star
Review_Text: The Sofitel is rated as 5 star but don't expect the same 5 stars as you'd get in say the UK or the USA. Don't get me wrong parts of the Sofitel are 5 star the staff are exceptionally polite courteous and very efficient (I didn't open a door all week). The breakfast experience is also fantastic with the choice and service both being top class although I would have liked the options / food to be changed every few days but that's just being picky. The rooms however I feel are 4 star bordering on 3 with 'cheap' doors that drop on opening and with hinges that 'bang' when opened. Some doors such as on the TV cabinet were also fashioned out of older doors that looked wrong and didn't fit. With that said the rooms were clean of a fair size and well equipped (although no tea and coffee facilities which was sadly missed). Stand out features of the hotel are the sheer size of the place the reception areas the staff and the panorama of the Atlas mountains althoughfor me the real stand out feature is the experience. Taking everything into account this place is amazing and i'd definately recommend it just don't expect everything to be perfect things mentioned above plus slow wifi no spoons with cups waiters forgetting stuff etc but as I've said this is nit picking and won't bother you if you have the right attitude and a sense of humour. A few people were not happy (mainly Americans I have to say sorry) but not us we loved it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: excellent staff, rooms run down but comfortable!
Review_Text: on my last visit to marrakech i used sofitel pool for 4 days at about ¬£20-25 a day can not remember precisely so i booked my stay here on this visit. upon arrival we asked for a room facing gardens and pool area but were told that hotel is full which was a bit disappointing then had some building works done for two days in the room above us but when phoned reception and complained about the noise it was immediately stopped. room and corridors decor is a bit on a rundown side considering it's a 5* hotel reception pool spa and breakfast areas are beautiful.    breakfast is amazing with wide variety of breads pastries cured meats cheeses juices/smoothies fruits and freshly cooked foods on offer and the staff is the BEST and friendliest with exceptional service.......to mention a few that made my days happier are Aziza Fatima and manager Mostapha!    i love marrakech and there is so much that this amazing city has to offer but i dont think i will be returning to the same hotel again as i like to experience different things but thank you to all staff that made my stay here pleasant and enjoyable!    SO CLUB was a good to visit for one night but drinks (cocktails) are VERY OVERPRICED 200dhs and NOT as good as in other places like la mammounia for instance where for the same price you get the best cocktails in town or for 10dhs extra you get one of their signature ones with nibbles.

When we arrived at the Sofitel Marrakech my wife thought we can't be staying at a place as good as this. From the time we arrived all the staff showed impeccable manners in every aspect of customer service - we were their guests and we would be treated as though everything had to be done for our benefit and pleasure. In a busy and strange city for us visiting Marrakech Morocco and Africa for the first time the Sofitel was a great choice - the location for getting into the old and new city was ideal and after walking the streets and markets knowing you had such great accommodation to return to was a real bonus. The extra touches apart from what you would normally expect really helped the guests to appreciate their surroundings - the flowers in the entrance the herb garden the quality of the art all helped to make you feel you in somewhere that was run for the enjoyment of its visitors. On arriival we were upgraded to a beautiful room in the pavilion but were then offered another upgrade to an even better room the following day. You should also look out for the bar manager with the six inch high heels - quite a feat to walk in these at all.  Well done Sofitel - a great welcome and wonderful service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Dyan W wrote a review Sep 2012
Review_Text: I would like to use this opportunity to thank all the amazing staff at the Sofitel Marrakesh I have just returned from a 3 night break there and could not fault it. Beautiful setting gorgeous pools and impeccable service made this short break a trip to remember. Will definately return.

Sofitel Marrakesh - I have stayed in many 5 star hotels around the world - The Sofitel Marrakesh stands out from the crowd. From the minute you enter the beautiful reception to the amazing service it truly is a wonderful experience. The decor is luxurious the attention to detail is outstanding. The setting and beautiful surroundings amazing. But most of all the welcome for every guest is a delight to see. A hotel that has it all !!  I will 100% be reccommending this hotel to friends and family.

We had the pleasure of staying at the Sofitel for a week from September 16th. From the moment we stepped through the door until we left we were treated like royalty the staff could not do enough for you. The hotel itself is beautifully decorated to a very high standard We were lucky enough to stay in the Opera Suite which was fantastic with two seperate bedrooms a living room and three bathroom/shower areas. The breakfast was amazing with everything you could wish for including freshly made smoothies/juices at your request.    We ate lunch at the hotel every day around the pool and whilst it was more expensive than your average pool lunch this is a five star hotel. We had dinner at the hotel twice once at the SO Bar and once at The Orangerie. Both meals were of a good quality. There are some good place to eat near to the hotel too and in fact every meal we ate was fantastic.    We didnt take any treaments at the Spa but it was beautifully decorated and offered a good range of treatments. If I had to make one suggestion it would be to check your bill very carefully when you check out. They seem to have a habit of adding 'extras' that you have not received. There was no problem getting these items removed but you must check.    This is a fab base from which to explore Marrakech and I can't recommend this hotel enough! I will most definetely return!!

Review_Title: Great start poor middle great ending
Review_Text: We were picked up at the airport in a fab mercedes which cost 20 euros or 250 mad and well worth it to prevent the hassle at the airport. The journey took less than 15 minutes. On arrival the front entrance is spectacular we do however agree that the welcome does not reflect the usual 5 star welcome i.e. cold towel and welcome drink.    The receptionest was pleasant and he took us on a tour of the public areas of the hotel he informed us we had been selected for an upgrade which we were initially pleased about.    On arrival at our room we were dissapointed at the standard of the room which and initially breathed a sigh of relieve as I didnt want to think about the standard of room I had initially booked. We unpacked cleaned the room and made it presentable for us.    On the second day I took a walk to the Lounge and spa section (adjacent) which was spotless modern and clean. I asked the same receptionistif I could check my original room as I was unhappy with the upgrade. The initial room was awesome and I immediatelly asked to be "downgraded" (never heard off) I was unhappy as I had lost 1 1/2 days of my holiday cleaning unpacking dissspointed and then repacking and unpacking. I recieved a half hearted apology and an insistence that the room we had been given was an upgrade (no way).    I have to say from here the hotel began to shine breakfast was awesome although we ate inside to avoid the flies and wasps. The restaurant manager enquired about the service on a daily basis which was good to see. I disagree with others about the service at the pool area there were plenty of staff great service and managers on patrol regularly.    The pool area is the cleanest we have ever seen. The beds furniture and surrounds were washed and cleaned every day. The variety of areas for privacy or relaxation was amazing and one of the best we have experienced. Prices were as previosly stated expensive but the whole hivernage area was on par with London or Paris prices.    Some great restaurants in the vicinity (will write a review seperatelly). Asked the concierge where we could eat in the Medina and he looked at us as if we had crawled out from under a stone and made a comment like "well if you want to do the basic tourist thing thats fine" course we do we are tourists we want to experience the real deal. They must be on commission for recommending some of the restraurants and we didnt ask him again    Over all this place grew on us lessons leaned check the room booked and be satisfied that you have been given an upgrade. Eventually was one of the most relaxing luxurious stays.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Marrakech Sofitel is an incredible hotel which I can't recommend enough. I planned an event here in June 2012 for 80 international beauty journalists and the service they provided was amazing. The hotel has several beautiful pools and the design of the outdoor area means that you can always find a quiet sunbed. The restaurants are great and the buffet breakfast really does serve everything you could possibly think of - my friend ate 5 courses one morning. The standard of the rooms and facilities go without saying but for me the most important thing about the sofitel was the fantastic service from the hotel staff they really could not have been better so kind thoughtful helpful fun and just brilliant. They all personally ensured that my event was the best ever. Don't hestiate to visit.

Review_Date: Beata C wrote a review Sep 2012
Review_Text: Amazing hotel:) the whole experience was definetely worth every penny spend. We've stayed in a deluxe room and it was clean spacious and had great ipod dock where we could listen to our favourite music and charge our ipods. Food entertainment staff were all FIRST CLASS and they definetely tried to make our stay enjoable and well achieved this. OF course I cannot fault it and would recommend it to all my friends and family that will go to Marrakech as I am sure that hotel staff will make them feel very welcome too. Fresh juices in the breakfast bar were excellent as well! LOVED IT and we will most certainly be back.  A HUGE THANK YOU to all staff at Sofitel:):):)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Katherine M wrote a review Sep 2012
Review_Title: A really impressive hotel, fantastic customer service!
Review_Text: My friend and I stayed here for 5 nights in the first week of September 2012 and were really impressed. The communal areas lobby rooms and pools were incredible. Beautifully decorated very oppulent and the flowers (planted and cut) were absoutely stunning. Having worked in the hotel industry I know what it takes to keep a hotel looking like that and I was thoroughly impressed. The staff were very polite and friendly. For a hotel that size it did sometimes feel slightly impersonal but there isn't much you can do about that. The only thing that stops me giving it 5 stars is that it was so expensive! But there is a Carrefour 15 mins walk away and so we bought water wine and snacks from there. I would definitely recommend it for families couples or friends.

Review_Date: Mary C wrote a review Sep 2012
Review_Text: The Sofitel in Marrakech is a very nice "first world" hotel. It is clean very big with the various features you would expect. However the hotel staff could be friendlier and more proactive. Plus there are so many unique small hotels in Marrakech that are more beautiful cheaper with great service that I would not strongly recommend going to the Sofitel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Fiona K McCarthy wrote a review Sep 2012
Review_Title: Please Please take advantage of this wonderful hotel
Review_Text: I am at present staying at this amazing hotel.    This hotel came up as a bargain getaway six months ago - as I had previously visited this hotel for drinks I decided to book it and hoped it had not gone down in anyway. OMG on the contrary as the deal I got was so amazing I assumed WRONGLY that the place may need decorating or updating - how wrong was I.    Firstly I had a great flight on Ryanair at 6.30 am from Stansted = for me a big plus.    Secondly arrived and the hotel is 10 minutes from the airport = for me a huge plus.    Thirdly the room was amazing new clean and comfortable two happy bunnies for sure.    At 11am I was lounging on an amazing lounger catching rays happy days - cant be this good something must be a miss.    WRONG    Breakfast is amazing and quality - a stool for my beach bag - REALLY but thank you.    Service amazing - weather even better - cant find a thing wrong.    So my middle east replacement has been found - Sofitel Marrakech reasoanably priced amazing comfort and service 10 mins from airport - sadly and I am not proud but it is my third visit WE HAVE NOT LEFT THE HOTEL.    Why - why would you I have four nights five full days here - weather is amazing and possibly the last I will see this year = so chill and sunbathe OK I will.    Should you wish to adventure out please do = the medina is 5 mins away in a cab and well worth a visit - I will miss it this time however I will return again and soon.    Restaurants here are something else = very french influenced so very good - LOVE LOVE LOVE IT HERE.    sofitel is the way forward = enjoy xx
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Polona P wrote a review Sep 2012
Review_Text: i arrived frm another sofitel And i was so disapointed .i almost cried.i i wanted to leave th notel .i booked a room frm travel agent and prepayed it with orporate card on my name but i didn't bring my travel id ...t d the reservtion you need t have iata numbe nd sprcial number that you from them..it s mposible that a nrmal erson would reserva these.at check in they made a big fuss and they wanted t charge extra 145 for 3 nights...the room was dirty  you can see that it has better times ..the lobby and all other facilities ar beautiful .i am alergic to dirt and had to go irectly t pharmacy to get the mediction so that i could stay in the room breakfast .really nothing pecial and they charge you big money .....lets admit it is beautiful hotel from outside and it hides a lot of bad things inside ...i am so upset that right now. think. will nev agin visi ofitel because it s not mgnifique

When reception said that our room was not quite ready but it was a lovely room we thought yeah whatever! When we got to the room - wow the view was to die for! To the left the hotel covered in blooming bougainvilleas ahead the swimming pools to the right the walls of Medina.  Helpful & friendly staff. We had no problems with road noise which has been mentioned.Schoolboy French useful if talking to the cleaning staff!!!  Hammam sauna and gym - wonderful!!!  We absolutely loved this hotel!  Only a short walk to all the sights of the city.

Review_Title: Great place to visit for something different! Would certainly visit again!!
Review_Text: Our family really enjoyed our time here such a refreshing change from the more obvious holiday choices . The way of life & culture was a delight to experience. The hotel was comfortable & very clean the service was a little hit & miss & they did mess up by not collecting us from the airport & a few other things but they did try to make amends. The pool area was pleasant although we did have some shoes stolen (the pool is open to guests & it was suggested that this had been the problem) breakfast was super & in nice surroundings. We ate out every evening & found some real gems & great value. Not good for young children in my opinion but a perfect adult getaway!!

We have just come back after a lovely 5 days in Marrakech. We booked Sofitel as a part of a package that included flights breakfast and one session at the Sofitel spa. The hotel is conveniently located from the airport and the Medina in the new part of Marrakech. Check in was hassle free were offered a cold towel and iced tea on arrival whilst waiting to be checked in! Our room was spacious and comfortable with a balcony offering views of the pool. Our room was made up twice a day with a tuck-in service and rose petals on the bed every evening which was a nice touch! Breakfast was sumptuous with good variety of fresh fruit/fruit juices cold meat cheese eggs and bacon crepes and a variety of bread! We felt that breakfast was filling enough to skip lunch every day and that's what we did! The pool area was well maintained and spotless! The lounge areas were very cozy with the smell of sweet incense wafting all the time and mint tea on offer most of the day and evening! We did not eat in any of the restaurants in the hotel as they seemed expensive and had read bad reviews about them on Tripadvisor. But the restaurants seemed to have a good ambiance about them. The spa facilities were very good: included a hammam sauna and an indoor pool with a few rooms for the treatments. Our deal did not include treatments but got to use the other facilities which was very relaxing after a hot day out in the sun! The hotel is well located for the medina and the new parts of the city but do make sure to hail a taxi from the streets outside the hotel (not the ones standing outside the hotel as they tend to charge you almost 3-4 times the actual price!). The staff very helpful and friendly but would recommend doing the tours with independent operators suggested on tripadvisor. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again on a visit back to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a great relaxing holiday at this hotel very clean friendly helpful staff. Location was great lots of great places around the hotel to eat as eating in the hotel was very expensive and the choices not great. We did not book breakfast at the hotel there is a cafe 5 mins walk where we would have a lovely breakfastlunch and dinner for alot less price and much better food than the hotel. However I would strongly suggust that you plan ahead and do research about what you want to do and see whilst there do not use the concierge!!!! they will try and sell you anything! with a lot higher prices. We talked to the local people and they would recommend wonderful places to go. The pool area was clean yes I agree with some comments that the service was slow as there was not many staff serving around the pool area. We did not use the spa the prices are soooo expensive and the products and treatments are not all that! But we had a relaxing break just what we needed!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: For this price, I would stay elsewhere. For any price indeed
Review_Text: Location is the only thing good to say about this hotel. Everything else shows signs of very poor management; we were faced with inefficiency incompetence and dishonesty everywhere: at check-in restaurants concierge luggage check. Just few highlights of our stay. At check-in they could not accomodate us adequately or on time. Even when we paid a higher rate they put us in an awful location (we paid more for a better view and got a bunker view for our return stay). We spend 5 hours checking in and lost the whole day instead of finishing our errands on our return. Breakfast which was a buffet was covered in flies and cheeses were drying by the end of breakfast when we arrived. Bon appetit. Concierge was a peak of dishonesty as they misinform you to say the least on any inquiry. Concierge offers you however a VIP car VIP reservation VIP service. What they forget to tell you is that you are treated for a fool. I would check all information at the internet center yourself. One outrageous example yes there are trains and buses going around Morocco it is sad to know that concierge was never informed. Another it took them entire day to make a reservation for our dinner at a restaurant ("there are many restaurants at this hotel it is fully booked but we can get you a VIP reservation"). In the end we called ourselves and made a reservation at the last moment the only restaurant at this hotel was very empty and we had a very personal service just because we came.  There could be worse staysbut you pay for what you assume to be comfort and this is what you are not getting at this Sofitel. Try however Sofitel in Rabat which is quite a contrast.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nermine E wrote a review Aug 2012
Review_Title: Not Worthy of Being a Sofitel...they can not get anything right.
Review_Text: We stayed in this property from August 12 to the 16 2012. We were to check out on the 18 but paid penalties to change our airfare in order to get out of there. Basically the hotel is badly managed all around and it is reflected on every customer experience one gets. We were given a room where there is no hot water and the hotel staff knew about it but lied to tell us it is a problem in the whole hotel and they are working on it to be fixed momentarily. After two days of cold showers and bad food and beverage service delivery we complained to the general manager and we were upgraded to a suite and refunded one of the nights. We were happy that finally our miseries with this hotel will lessen. Well not the case the mattress on the king size bed in the important suite # 207 was high in the middle downward slopping on each side. One side had more of an angle than the other which gave us back pains and we could not sleep properly. What is the first basic thing in a hotel ...the bed...well a five star Sofitel does not have the management strengths and the quality control of their "bed" element among other things. The other very annoying matter is that the staff is not well trained and the staffing is allocated all wrong which has a repercussion on the quality of service delivery. For example one had one or two people to serve around the pool and 5 other just walking around asking guests if they are ok and if all is well but they do nothing else but PR. So even if you want to complain one does not know who are these people and what is their authority to resolve a matter. The empty plates bottles and glasses around the pool would not get picked up causing an army of bees to attack the items and the guests. One would place an order to eat and gets it missing the basic salt and peper and other stuff that takes 15 minutes to come around. It was extremely aggravating. The day we were checking out we went to the breakfast buffet that is supposed to open at 7 am and it was 2 minutes before 7 am well the man would not open the restaurant because of the 2 minutes and when he did there was no staff to be found and the buffet was not in a state of readiness at all. We went to the Orangerie Restaurant in the hotel one evening. It was a nice set up but awful food and bad service. They had a singer and dancers but the music system was not working well and was squeaking meanwhile employees including the general manager of the hotel are spending their time to ask you "how you are doing" (one gets 10 of those in one sitting) instead of actually managing putting the right resources in the right place and getting it right according to Sofitel's international standards. The hotel had lousy Morrocan food both at the Buffet and the Orangerie which is supposed to be their signature restaurant. The funny thing is that we ordered a chicken Taginne (a typical Morrocan dish) from room service and it was 10 times better than the one we had in the hotel's up-scale Orangerie restaurant!!! About he Spa I asked how much it would cost for a manicure and pedicure they said it is by the hour? so I was startled as normally any where in the world there is a fixed price so I got turned off. I can go on but I guess you get the picture!!! ugly indeed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Hugo W wrote a review Aug 2012
Review_Text: I've stayed 4 nights in 2012 at sofitel Marrakech 2 nights in "palais royal" and 2 nights in "lounge & Spa".    Sofitel standards mixed with moroccan design pretty nice.    50DRH for entering the spa. Which is very relaxing don't miss having a tea in there.    Breakfast is gigantic. Don't missed the opportunity to go on the terrace.    Only one bad point. Time to be served at the Lawrence restaurant....which was impressively long.

We stayed there for seven nights and we had really a great time in this hotel.Decorated in a very beautiful design service was excellent reach and tasty breakfast. Swimming pool area a very quite and nice one. You may find in this hotel all what you have ever asked to find a real luxury hotel.

We chose Marrakech as our honeymoon destination and stayed in Sofitel for the duration. We were really pleased with our choice as it was a wonderful hotel and the staff at Sofitel made our stay the best it possibly could have been. The service was excellent throughout. Every member of staffwhether it was a housekeeper manager porter or a member of the reception staff made a genuine effort to say hello ask how you were and ask if there was anything they could do to help you in anyway. We had breakfast included with our room price which we would highly recommend as if bought separately it is very expensive. The breakfast was exceptional and we could not believe how much choice there was! We had omelettes smoothies and crepes made to our preferences every morning and the quality of the food and service was excellent. Our room overlooked the pool and was very comfortable and luxurious. Room service was very prompt and nothing was too much trouble for the service staff. The hotel and spa were always beautifully presented with fresh flowers and everywhere was perfectly clean. There was a lovely ambience to the hotel and we felt very comfortable throughout our stay. The only slight downfall was the prices at the restaurant and bar within the hotel. We tended to eat out in the evenings as it was too costly to eat and drink at the hotel for the duration. The hotel was very quiet during our stay due to it being the month or Ramadan but this did not affect the quality of the service in any way what so ever!  An extremely memorable holiday we would highly recommend this hotel to others!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at this hotel for one night in July before catching a flight from Marrakech airport the next day. We were not very impressed with the service.    The front of the hotel and reception area are really beautifully finished but we'd clearly arrived at a busy time of day and had to wait until we could complete the check-in. We were also not offered cold towels as other people have described. There is a really nice man who gives out mint tea in the reception and he brought us some tea.    The pool area is really nice but was so so busy - completely packed with people in the afternoon and it was nearly impossible for us to find a bed. There seemed to be a lot of beds with old towels on or that people had left their stuff and gone off for the afternoon. It took a long time to get someones attention to order some drinks and then they took a long time to arrive. The food and drinks by the pool were the most expensive and overpriced that I had experienced in Morocco although the food was nice. The swimming pool itself is lovely. It seems like they should concentrate a bit more on the service of food and drink and not on a sunglasses shining service.    The room was fine and had everything you might need and the air-con in the room was good. The balcony was also nice with a comfortable seating area.    On the last day I wanted to eat lunch in the hotel. I wanted to eat indoors as the temperatures were very high and the only place to eat is in the buffet restaurant at a high price. The only other option was the pool snack bar which had no air-con. I only wanted a small sandwich and there was no-where to order one in the hotel and sit indoors (by this time I had checked out of room). I tried to sit just outside the reception area and get some food however the woman serving in the area was very rude. This left me with a bad impression of the hotel.    There is a small clothes shop in the hotel lobby and I bought a few things. The woman serving in the shop was really friendly and chatty.    We also stayed at the Sofitel Essaouira and thought that the Marrakech Sofitel did not come close to the excellent level of service provided at the Essaouira hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sandeep S wrote a review Jul 2012
Review_Text: Excellent hotel with excellent service. You don't even have to be on the check in desk on your arrival. Person comes to you with all the paper work to get you signed and you are also greeted with cold towels and Morrocon tea. Very lavishley decorated and very comfortable spacious rooms with everything you can think of. Swiming pool area is also excellent you can spend whole day there. Breakfast with lots of varieties. Can't fault in anyway. It also has good spa facilities.

We recently stayed at the Sofitel Marrakech and had an amazing time. We had originally booked into a Riad in the central Medina area but when we discovered that the air conditioning wasn't working (unfortunately at midnight!) we had to try to find somewhere else that would be able to help us with a room at the last minute. This was our fist time in a Sofitel and I must say that we were not disappointed.    I would recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to be able to quickly access the best points of Marrakech from a tourism perspective while still having a relaxing oasis to return to when they aren't out and about in the city and need a break from the heat.    Best Points:    1) The Pool: The pool is fantastic with large lounges all around the perimeter. Each lounge has multiple umbrellas for when you want some shade and there are plenty of staff to help you with towels the umbrellas and anything else you need while relaxing. Given that the temperatures are so high in July the pool was a real life saver as you could spend the morning hours touring the Medina and other historical places and the hot afternoon out by the pool relaxing. I think staying in a Riad at this time of year would be a bit of a struggle as they don't have the amenities of a larger hotel such as this.    2) The Breakfast: We had breakfast included in our room rate and it was fantastic. A very large buffet selection with fresh juices smoothies fresh made eggs and omelettes all types of pastries crepes etc. A great way to kick off the day before touring around town.    3) The Design/Standard: The hotel is beautifully designed and kept to a high standard. The staff were very friendly and said hello to us every time we passed by.    4) The Room Rate: The room rate (which included breakfast) was a great value and was actually less expensive than staying at many of the high-end Riads in the Medina. I have paid a lot more for hotels in the past that cannot compare to the standard of this hotel.    5) The Location: While technically not in the central Medina of Marrakech the hotel is very conveniently located just outside the walls of the city. It is a 10-15 minute walk or a 5 minute taxi ride (which are very inexpensive) into town. There is a taxi rank right outside the hotel so you can grab them with ease. Also because the hotel is well known it is very easy and safe to get a taxi back there at night.    Some Areas for Improvement:    1) Price of Food/Drinks: While I usually expect food and drinks within a hotel to be a bit on the pricey side I did find that the price of beers cocktails and food to be a bit higher than I would have expected. We mostly ate our meals / had drinks outside the hotel but it would have been nice to feel like we could have a few pre-dinner cocktails without breaking the bank.    2) Food Service by the Pool: The service by the pool was friendly and accommodating however we did find that it took some extra time for food / drinks to arrive than would be expected. Wasn't too bad but could be improved.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing hotel well worth a visit.
Review_Text: We stayed at this hotel in July for 4 nights. The hotel general areas are very nice reception breakfast room gardens are stunning. I have stayed at a lot of hotels but this has to be the best outside area sunbeds hammocks and large sofa beds around the pool are luxurious. Service around the pool was amazing too for drinks towels and the man cleaning sunglasses was just an added bonus as was the live singers each afternoon. Location is excellent too not far to Medina in a nice area with some good restaurants in walking distance. Only slight negative I would state is the hotel air conditioning was not efficient and struggled to keep the room cool. Service around hotel was generally excellent (pool bar was a little slow) but overall an excellent hotel and would def go back and stay if in Marrakech and would def recommend to friends.

My friend and I recently spent four nights at the Sofitel Marrakech Lounge & Spa we thoroughly enjoyed our time experiencing Marrakech. The hotel is situated in a perfect location for the medina it was approx 15min walk (slightly longer in the heat).  The hotel the surrounding grounds and the breakfast were outstanding. The service however was not so great! We felt it was very poor for a 5* hotel. The doormen were very courteous the ladies on reception were very rude and the service at breakfast each morning was very poor! We found that they were not very attentive at all despite lots of staff being in the restaurant. The selection and choice of food was brilliant! I've never experienced anything like it.    We were upgraded to a Luxury Room I really couldnt see or find anything luxurious about it it was most definitely in need of a refurb. The bathroom and furnishings were very worn out/tired looking. Again I didnt expect this for a 5* hotel.  As we had a 'Luxury Room' this meant we overlooked the pool. Every other night we experienced very loud music quite late in the evening which kept us awake.    Beware that the hotel staff are quite slow to respond I wouldnt say they were very proactive at all.  We had to chase three times for bottles of water to be sent up to the room over a space of four hours! To me this was unacceptable when you are in 43 degree heat!    Beware that to eat and drink at this hotel is quite pricey. We found a lovely cafe/restaurant just a short walk from the hotel called 'Cafe Extrablatt'. We actually saw quite a few guests from the hotel here. It's quite a busy/lively place to eat. Note that the drinks are cheaper on the ground and first floor if you drink on the rootop you will find drinks are more expensive as that is the only place you are allowed to consume alcohol in the restaurant it is more of a bar/lounge.

Review_Date: Scott C wrote a review Jul 2012
Review_Title: Spent an afternoon at the pool
Review_Text: On our last day in Marrakech my partner and I wanted a relaxing day by the pool. We were able to lounge by the pool at Sofitel for a small fee. It was quiet and relaxing on a super hot day. The pool attendants were attentive and friendly and made sure we were treated to great service. The hammocks on the lawns were also a nice place to relax. After the pool we stopped in the outdoor lounge for a cocktail and a bite. It was a nice afternoon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fabulous hotel, great location. Wonderful staff, very friendly.
Review_Text: Where can I start? The whole experience has been wonderful. You are welcomed by friendly smiling staff. Hakim the tea maker welcomes you with the most friendly smile and he makes the best morrocan tea. And I mean the best!!! The food is amazing too though we ate out alot as wanted to try authentic morrocan cuisine. The facilities are of high standards and if there is anything you cannot find they will try their best to get it for you. Definately stay here again. Oh and finally the smell of the morrocan roses in the lobby is infectious.

Review_Date: Corrie W wrote a review Jul 2012
Review_Text: Had a wonderful 4 night stay in a beautiful room at this hotel. There was an issue with the rooms when we arrived which was no fault of the hotel (the company we had booked with fault) yet they worked hard to rectify the situation anyway!    We were on a B&B basis and the breakfast was AMAZING!!! Better than any breakfast i've ever had in another hotel!    Overall it was a great hotel in an excellent location....My main fault was the cost of the drinks and the spa.

Review_Title: An Experience to forget - won't go back to any Sofitel
Review_Text: We took 3 rooms for the people of my company. They all were facing the street where 2 big discos are. Because of the noise of the people and the disco we spent a very bad night (Fights and police presence included). We have to wake early in the morning I left the room and went to work.  I found out that I had forgot the dressing case and my trunks.  I went back to the hotel at 6:00 PM. I asked them to check if it was there. After waiting for 30 minutes they told me that they hadn't found anything but that they would send somebody to check for the trunks in the balcony where I had left it. After waiting for other 20 minutes They said again that they would send somebody to check for it.  As I had to take a plane I asked them to check for it as soon as possible. No response. Then I asked them for the official book of complaints and assuming I was stupid they gave me an ordinary piece of paper. I then asked to talk to the supervisor but of course he was not there. I Am back in Spain now. I called them but they had me waiting for 10 minutes on the line and nobody answered.  For sure an experience I don't want to have in the future.  Sincerely:

Have just spent 5 nights at the hotel on our first visit to Morocco. We were glad we chose to stay out of the medina and at a hotel with a swimming pool as temperatures were in the 40s C during our stay. It is only a short walk to the square from the hotel but it was too hot to to do so and we took cabs there instead.    We had two rooms in the Lounge and Spa part of the hotel both were well maintained and clean with good air conditioning. The pool area was also well appointed. Our room rate included breakfast which was buffet style and very good along with a reduced rate on spa services. I had a massage which was just fine.    In short it's a good choice for Marrakech. The only real shortcoming is the lack of dining options especially if you have children. There is no extended hours cafe/light style food option surprising given that the Palace and the Spa are essentially one big hotel. The food at L'Orangerie was fine for the first night but afterwards we ate at some of the nearby cafes - ExtraBlatt Pepe nero in the medina and Amaia in the new town.

Review_Date: Shiblu M wrote a review Jul 2012
Review_Title: Book it! You won't be dissapointed.!!
Review_Text: Ok I'll keep this short and useful for you as much as possible. This hotel I booked through a uk travel agent was very good value for money. As it states its 5 star i believe it ticks that box    As you approach the hotel from outside it looks exquisite and the decor inside is also very nice. There are 2 receptions one (main) and the other is the spa. Please don't be fooled as spa and facility's such as steam and sauna all chargeable extras. I could see why as they are amazing and very clean    The inside of the hotel is very classy and stylish and outside is even better they have hammocks outside also they have 4 poster sunbeds outside too. The outdoor pool is very clean and not overcrowded. I would def book this hotel if I came to marrakesh again as the souks and the medina city all in walking distant and no need to fight with those pesky taxi drivers!     Please remember on your checkout prepare to have a heart attack if you used their mini bar in the room and also the local tax is payable. We paid approx 400dh for 7days worth of tax.    Tip the room service and it's garaunteed you will get first class service.

Have just arrived back from a four night break in the Sofitel Marrakech it was part of a deal and reduced price so can't complain about being put in a room outside a noisy bar and having a view from our balcony of the air conditioning units!  The hotel grounds and pools cannot be critisised as they are beautiful and kept very clean. It is a 15 minute walk to the Medina with many places to eat just ladies watch what you wear i felt more comfortable covering my shoulders and wearing cool trousers even though it was very hot.  Did eat in the hotel once found the food gorgeous but very expensive ¬£35 for the cheapest bottle of rose!  Most of the people there were French and we did notice that the service was much quicker for them than us sometimes we just gave up and went elsewhere must learn french then i can read the menus without guessing!  Will agree that you must check your bill at the end of your stay have heard nightmare stories so was diligent.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Tale of two halves could be superb
Review_Text: We arrived at the hotel for a 4 night stay as part of a deal. Having stayed in the medina a couple of years ago we were looking forward to staying in Hivernage. We were upgraded to a luxury room as part of the deal it was decorated in a Moroccan style was very clean with a huge comfortable bed. The toilet was separate to the bathroom but it was a bit small. The complimentary products were good though. We were keen to explore the hotel as we had read all the reviews and yes I am in agreement drinks and eats are very expensive. The one time we did eat and drink we were overcharged both times plus had to wait over an hour for a pizza round the pool therefore vowed not to make this error again. We also attempted a drink in the Lawrence bar but were ignored by the staff so decided to take ourselves and our dirhams to La Mamounia which was on the doorstep.  Breakfast was included in the price and it was wonderful as were the staff at breakfast. I did not use the spa facilities therefore cannot comment. I would love to give this hotel an excellent rating but it is flawed which stops me from awarding the max. I hope one day these flaws are remedied as it would have been lovely actually staying in the hotel and enjoying it to it's full potential.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at this Hotel as part of a deal with Zoo travel and were delighted when we arrived a stunning Hotel. Probably the best we have stayed in abroad. I agree with the other reviews on this propery but here are a few tips.....This is four star Hotel with four star prices for example the breakfast if not included in your deal is over ¬£20 a head and a 50cl bottle of water in your room is ¬£2.00 Drinks are over ¬£9 for a cocktail and wine was very expensive. Sandy coloured Cabs are good value but you must agree a price before you start around 20 dn for a short journey and don't get one from just outside the hotel they will want over double ! Head about ten min walk straight out from the hotel on the right is a carrefore shop witch sells every thing you need and the local wine is very good and cheap. finally be ready for a very slow customs at the airport. Overall we had a fantastic break
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Excellent Hotel the breakfast was the best I have ever had from a hotel omelettes pancakes eggs done anyway you want hot doughnuts mint tea superb salmon sliced for you. I put on lbs. The poolside restaurant was not quite so awesome. But the Carrefour is not too far away if you are peckish.  The staff at the pools were excellent and had great places to loll about in sun or shade as you wish.
