The beds were a delight very comfortable and wonderful sheets duvets etc. but see intervening door quote.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I booked a 3 nights stay to celebrate my daughter's 21st birthday in Sofitel Palais Imperial  The hotel is plain beautiful with amazing d√©cor. The scent of the magnificent rose display in the lobby is unforgettable. The rest of the hotel is also sweetly scented. It's very clean and there's a myriad of staff greeting you and genuinely happy to help you and make you feel at home.  Our room was overlooking the pools which was a great view as the swimming pools area is pleasure to the eyes and a heaven for relaxation and sunbathing as well as enough shaded spots for customers preferring this. I enjoyed swimming for an hour every day in the longest pool especially around 10/11 am when it wasn't yet busy .  The breakfast provides a lot of different choices so much that after a 3 nights stay I hadn't managed tasting everything! My daughter was happy to have warm crepes every morning.  We had diner at the hotel restaurant L'Orangerie' one evening. We choose a Moroccan and a French set menu. It was good and filling but pricey and not a gastronomic discovery. Soft music was played (Bubl√© Seal) that I enjoy at home from time to time but in Marrakesh I would have preferred some soft Morrocan music. Luckily the room had a very good sound system (BOSS) and I could choose a radio with the kind of music I wanted to hear and you can use your ipod on the system.    We visited the Medina; a very busy place in the evening which was 'ok' for the experience but I preferred Gueliz. We went to the newest commercial centre Carrefour but it didn't impressed me.  Our best experience was the visit to "Planete des Epices" that we found by chance walking outside the Medina in streets that are less tourist attractive. The herbalist gave us a 'lecture' about the healing properties and how to use the different spices herbal teas and Moroccan essential oils which is of special interest to me. We gracefully accepted a glass of hot and honey sweet Moroccan tea and a 10 minutes neck massage each given by a qualified kinesitherapist.    Thanks to Sofitel Palais Imperial Marrakesh its staff and the people of Marrakesh my daughter has had an unforgettable experience for her 21st Birthday.

The hotel is about a 20 minute walk from the square in the medina so is well placed.    The public room are beautifully appointed. The gardens have lots of different types of loungers some with shade. The breakfasts were good. Drinks were very expensive but there is a supermarket ten minutes walk away.

Review_Title: Let down on the last day!
Review_Text: Nice location in the new part of Marrakech walking distance from some fine dining restaurants as well as the famous square in the Medina which boasts souks restaurants and a lot of hustle and bustle!    No issue with our stay in general; friendly staff clean stunning decor throughout and an impressive selection at breakfast.    However it was a major let down on our last day when there was little flexibility offered by the reception staff to delay our check out time as our pick up was at 5pm which would mean a 5 hour wait on hotel premises without a room. We pleaded on 2 separate occasions and were offered a 1 hour delay only despite the fact that we had an unwell 2 year old to have to manage for all that time. A male member of staff promised to try and get us into another room for a few hours and said he would call our room shortly to confirm no call was received.    Having checked out we sat in the reception area for our 5 hour wait with our very upset and screaming daughter who was also exhausted by this time with nowhere to have a nap. It was uncomfortable to say the least as the lobby was filled with guests checking in/out as well as groups of people who were clearly trying to have business meetings. Not only was it unfair on us and others guests but I doubt it painted the image nor atmosphere that the hotel management would hope for. Yet the reception staff seemed untouched - possibly as we had checked out now and would be gone in a few hours.    Only one of the female staff did seem sympathetic and asked if she could offer our daughter a drink or a cake although that was no use to us at the time and we had to bear the pain.    This was our second stay at a Sofitel in Morocco within a space of 7 months (first time was in Agadir) and I must say that this end experience has spoilt it.    Mr and Mrs Chel  UK

Review_Date: Eric G wrote a review Jun 2012
Review_Title: bad service, inefficient staff, poor design !
Review_Text: This hotel and its staff do not deserve the brand Sofitel at all  - the staff at the reception is inefficient and not listening to you at all: i booked a deluxe room with a view of the swimming pool ; the first room they gave me was a room on the first floor with a view on the air conditioning ; when i came back to change the room the 2 ladies at the reception said i can see the swimming pool on the right of the air conditioning and probably behind .... i needed to show my platinum status on Accor program to get a new room  - any request take at least 30 minutes ... when they even remember the request : i need to ask 3 times to take the luggages in the car !! at least they did not loose anything this time !  - the design is ugly old and the rooms are quite dirty especially the bathrooms  - the windows did not work properly and despite the calls they were never repaired  - it looks more like a 3 star hotel for vaccations group .... in terms of space staff and design  - be aware the view of the swimming pool include the view of a very nice and noisy 2 way roads quite busy ....  If i have an advice do not go !!!!

Review_Date: Sanaz B wrote a review Jun 2012
Review_Title: Amazing experience, recommend it for sure
Review_Text: Amazing hotel beautiful rooms great service warm welcoming atmosphere frinedly staff great location. there was 7 of us and we all had a great time nice spa too.

Review_Date: Julie C wrote a review Jun 2012
Review_Text: Let me give congratulation to the wonderful trip and stay in Sofitel SPA & Lounge the goal was to take time for my self and to have good trearapy for my body and soul.  Thank you specialy to all the ambassadors and specially to Batoul and Karima who made me stay great and so french " Je ne sais quoi" and so " Excellence".  To all best regards

Review_Title: A hotel with a real sense of occasion let down by average rooms and attentive but slow service
Review_Text: Positives: fantasic pool and common areas. Plenty of attentive friendly staff. The rate for the room was reasonable given the standard of the hotel. There are some nice touches - when they saw that we had a baby a special baby care pack including nappies wipes baby bubble bath creams and a mini baby robe was delivered.    Detractions: After seeing the the fantastic reception and pool space the room was a bit of a let down. The carpets and some of the furnishings were marked - and grubbier than I'd expect for a hotel at this end of the market the bathroom door catch was broken and couldn't be opened from inside if shut fully but otherwise it ticked all the usual boxes without really wowing you.  The main detraction though was the hiddeously expensive food and drinks. Over $100 for 2 buffet lunches not including drinks. The mini bar pricing wasn't too severe but it was hard to feel anything but gouged everytime you ordered something to eat or a drink. You can buy the same beers at the supermarket down the street for 20% of what you might stump up here. They also cheekily charge $30 to use the Sauna (like its not part of the hotel!). Overall if you plan to do lots of sitting by the pool I'd reccomend here - but only if you don't mind spending as much again and then some on food & drink. (the service by the pool tends to be slow. Expect to wait a while for your uber expensive drinks)

Review_Date: Marie O wrote a review Jun 2012
Review_Text: An excellent hotel not far from the madding crowd and Medina in Marrakech. Luxurious accommodations lovely pool and excellent restaurants.  Highly recommended.

Hello there i had fabulus week in sofitel h√¥tel i wana start my greeting to meriem asatach from th√© booking service and all the staf as they was so helpful and kind i had good felt because of the moroccan hospitality i didnt felt foreigneur it was for me good experience and im so happy and i want back to this hotel as i consern my house and if u want feel this felling please visit this h√¥tel with all my best

Excellent hotel and lovely helpful staff? Expensive for food and drink but luckily supermarket nearby and restaurants shame that you have to pay extra for spa facilities even though it is part of the hotel the bedroom was very clean and bed really comfortable only downside was the bath it very hard to get in and out if you happen to be short (my jhusband is 6ft tall and he had problems!) breakfast was nice a lot of variety enjoyed the fresh fruit and juices
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Claude L wrote a review May 2012
Review_Text: Thank you for the Hotel experience and the wonderful welcome and of all Ambassadors and specially for Batoul who has so careful and helpful for our comfort and stay.  We will advise any one to stay there in wonderful Sofitel spa and lounge.

Hotel was fantastic plenty of seating area's with parasols. Pool area's there's plenty of sun loungers towels are placed on the beds. The Hotel is very clean Plenty of indoor seating area's. Stayed in room 442 it was huge compared to some other rooms. Best bed I've slept in.  Only downfall it's expensive cost 6 euros for 2 ice- creams ( 1 scoop each ) Make sure you check your bill they try to add extra on the bill. Good choice of food for Breakfast & lunch. Ate out on a evening. Service is slow at times. Supermarket close by so buy your water etc  Would stay again at this hotel only approx 15 mins from Airport.

Stayed at the Sofitel for 2 days. I really enjoyed the grounds the hotel was really beautiful. The only bad part was the slow service at the pool and terrace. Took a really long time to get drinks (40 minutes for tea!!). The rooms were very lovely cleaned twice a day. The pool area is very clean and large many seating space. The room service was not bad. The lunch was also good. The hotel is in a prime location right near the casino SO night club as well as Theatro. SO is really a great club and hotel guests don't pay cover. This hotel is great for those who want to be in a more modern and fancy part of Marrakech. For those who want authentic stay in the medina

Review_Title: Hot, clean lazy.....in a good way!
Review_Text: We stayed a week in Marrakech at this lovely hotel for which this review is long overdue :-/    We stayed in August which ment some of the hottest temperatures I have ever experienced. The hotel was awesome upon our arrival our bags were taken to our room while we checked-in. Cold towels and some fruit while we organised the room- which had been upgraded due to my partner celebrating a birthday during the holiday - compliments of the hotel!    Our room was cool and relaxing which was the perfect escape from the some 40 degree heat. An enormous bed and balcony.    The pools are first class with large loungers/couches and beds. Staff can't do enough for you I don't think I opened a door the whole week!    This is a relaxing holiday and hotel there is not much to do and the heat really takes it out of you. The hotel is expensive.... We ate at the pool a couple of days and the restaurant one. Lunch in the restaurant was very expensive and not really worth it to be honest - 90 quid for two.    Awesome if your looking for a week of nothing the real noise an fun is only a 15 min walk.... The hotel itself doesn't have much to hold your attention.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: maureen g wrote a review May 2012
Review_Title: Too expensive for such indifferent service
Review_Text: Certainly not a great hotel. We stayed here because my husband was attending a conference and this hotel was selected by the organizers. Although we arrived at the official check in time we were forced to wait over two hours which was excruciating as we were tired and growing angry watching newer arrivals go straight to their rooms. I had to call four times until someone finally showed up to make the twin beds they assigned us into a king. Also had to call several times until they send a repair person to fix the television. The people at the front desk and the concierge were very busy during our entire stay and barely polite. On the plus side the room was comfortable and attractive. Nonetheless we could have stayed in a fabulous riad for the price we paid for this standard rather charmless large hotel.

Review_Date: Jo A wrote a review May 2012
Review_Text: This is a very overdue review of our honeymoon hotel but anyway...    We visited this hotel in Sept 2011. We wanted a short haul flight that took us somewhere very hot. The area Hivernage is close to the Medina but you are able to retreat back to the hotel and away from the madness.    Rooms: The hotel provided us with a complimentary honeymoon upgrade to a superior room which was very kind with THE most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The room itself was spacious and well presented. The only downside was that the hallway where the wardrobe is was very poorly lit so you could just about see what you were wearing before you stepped out of your room. Our balcony overlooked the pool and the terrace bar so when we returned in the evening we could listen to the band/music from the bar.    Pool: The pool area is very clean and well maintained. The pool is surrounded by sun beds and a few loungers. We regularly saw guests that were offended that they were expected to use a lounger rather than the more desired beds. The pool area is very much the place to be seen...lots of people with money talking loudly on mobile phones trying to get everyone else to look at them. It cannot be helped though by the end of our stay I even found myself peering over the top of my book at every newcomer to see what shoes bag hair-do and gadget they had. One highlight of my trip was to witness a lady put on her 4 inch heels teeter 8ft over to the pools edge take the shoes off and get in to the pool and do the same when she got out.....I giggled so much I that I dropped my catalogue pose that everyone has to adopt whilst sunbathing at this hotel. The pool itself is a good size and very refreshing in the heat.    Food/Drink: Great food. The prices for food and drink are very high at this hotel. Considering the quality of the food you get in the Medina the prices at the hotel really are not justified regardless of the clientele. We visited Cafe Extrablatt which is 5 mins walk many times for breakfast and lunch. There is a supermarket 10 mins walk from the hotel if you run out of anything. It's also handy for getting extra water bottles for ¬£0.30 if you get fed up of spending ¬£7 on bottles around the pool.    After days of trying to find it we actually found a lovely place that had been recommended to us Cafe Arabe. Great place in the middle of the medina.    This is a great hotel but not for anyone who is looking for a casual break in shorts and flip flops. This is a top hotel in one of the richest parts of Marrakech. Therefore it caters for the upmarket residents and clients. Looking back I had been slightly naive and hadn't researched enough about the area. This hotel is in the equivalent of Beverly Hills and whilst we had a great time it could be slightly intimidating. The prices do put you off too and you go on holiday to relax not to see if you can afford to have something to eat where you're staying.    The only bad experience we had during our stay was at check out. We were asked to pay the bill which we wanted to check as the prices had been so high and we found that someone had had a meal at the So Lounge on the night we arrived and charged it to our room...¬£150. I explained to reception that we had never eaten at the So Lounge and I definitely remembered where we ate that night as it was our first night. Reception showed me the receipt that was kept with the rest of the slips you sign for and said 'yes this is in your folder'. I pointed out that the slip didn't have a signature on it and asked to see the manager of the So Lounge. After discussion they agreed to take it off our bill but if I hadn't have gone through the bill as I'm sure most people wouldn't if they were used to these prices we could have been very out of pocket.    Everything said this is a very good hotel. If you like Dubai etc but don't fancy travelling that far for a short break then this would be perfect for you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I endorse the comments of other reviewers as to the high quality of the location staff rooms pool area and breakfast (which was a wonderful experience when taken on the terrace). Bar prices were however exorbitant. So much so that as a matter of principle we simply didn't buy anything - so both the hotel and we ourselves lost out a little (although we did feel very virtuous). Overall though a very good hotel which I would certainly re-visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Excellent hotel to stay at in Wonderful Marrakesh!
Review_Text: Just arrived back from Marrakesh and stayed at the Sofitel Hotel.  Had always wanted to try Marrakesh and was not disappointed.  The hotel is in a great locatipn has a wonderful pool area bar and club.  The breakfast was buffet style and there was a great selection.  My only critisisms of this hotel are that the service is slow tables not fully laid at breakfast. Although the staff were extremely pleasanr.  The rooms are just a little on the small side. We had a twin room and the beds were pushed together.    Other than that its an excellent base in Marrakesh.    The Medina is an experience. The clubs and bars are of good quality and have great live bands.  I can see why its gaining a reputation amongst the young and trendies.

Great service great food lovely rooms beautifully decorated.....very relaxing pool area with comfy beds. Service was a bit slow....but I suppose you are in Africa...no-one seems to be in a hurry in Africa. Breakfast was fantastic too. Great location...would defo stay here again. Great little touches like buggy's and car seat available so you dont have to bring yours from the UK...and all very clean and new looking. Cant wait to take the hubby & Baby there...

Nice location walking distance to medina. Incredible decor throughout. Rooms large and comfortable though carpets seemed a bit dirty (maybe just old); ours had small balcony with partial view of mountains but overlooking employee entrance so a bit noisy. Restaurants very good though wine prices high (as in most Moroccan hotels). 2 very nice pools in lovely setting and large jacuzzi that never seemed to be used. service at meals a mixed bag - sometimes overly attentive and sometimes hard to get coffee. Were able to get caleche from door to medina or to gardens.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: jen A wrote a review Apr 2012
Review_Text: Stayed 5 nites at Sofitel on business. From the moment I walked in til I left I felt welcomed by the staff. Room was great beautiful view of the pool and gardens. The guest manager Mr. Soufiane Mazzouj was beyond helpful. He helped make our official stay perfect--taking care of all details offering restaurant suggestions upgrading rooms taking care of our business requirements. Enjoyed wine and hors d'oeuvres out on the patio--the Sommelier was very helpful with suggestions for Moroccan wines. The local wines and food are really delicious. An absolutely great stay relaxing beautiful! Would definitely come back with family. Looks like they also do a great job taking care of kids so that parents actually get a nice break!

we arrived late at night with a quite atmosphere the entrance is grand and amazing the lobby is beautiful and luxury and the staff are just as amazing.  there wasnt a long wait to be checked in we were shown to our rooms swiftly and the luggage was sent to the room asap.  we ordered room service as soon as we arrived and it was to a good level off standards.  we booked two double rooms and they were both on the same floor side by side which was good.  we asked for an extra bed in one off the rooms however there was an extra charge for that which was a down side however the beds were so big it made up for it.  talking off the beds they were SUPERB! i wish i asked which make they were as it was like sleeping on a cloud the most comfortable bed ive ever slept in.  the view off the hotel was amazing!! looking onto the pool and the mountains in the distance.  the bathroom could have been bigger but it was okay.  the rest off the hotel is amazinggg!! beautiful elegant and very clean. the pool was also to die for. really big not so busy and not many kids so its nice and quite too.  the pool guy/life guard was really friendly called Aziz. he was really friendly and kind. always brought over fresh towels and took a few pictures and videos for us.  the pool food was also really nice however slightly pricy.  the pool has sooo many seatings and your confused were to sit as every seating is beautiful that you want to lay everywere.  during the evening many people lounge outside and its a really calm atmosphere so relaxing peaceful and heavenly.    nothing bad to say at all! i would deffo stay here again if i was visiting marrakech! :)

Review_Title: Lovely hotel, expensive extras, no communication
Review_Text: Stayed in the Sofitel sometime last year. It's a good base to explore Marrakech - it's 5 mins to the city walls and allows you some rest-bite from the incredibly intense city centre.    The pool grounds and hotel are absolutely lovely.    Dinner drinks or anything else costs an absolute bomb. So you'll need to be pretty loose with the cash if you want to dine here.    The room air-con was weak and I asked for it to be looked at three times. Heard nothing back from them so I presume this is standard. Not too warm but I would have preferred another couple of degrees cooler.    The bar found it extremely odd that I wanted to take a drink back to the room with me and enquired what I was doing with the glasses (I brought them back once finished). Not particularly welcome for a drink of that expense.    I left a ¬£100 lighter (stupidly) on one of the swimming beds and even though I come back 2 mins later the guy clearing up said he'd not seen it even though he'd cleared our towels away. I've since emailed the hotel TEN times about sending me a reply saying they don't have it (for insurance purposes) but they just ignore me. Despite them replying previously about another issue.    Bit of a let down as far as the correspondance goes.    There was also a couple of items on the bill that weren't ours and I had to get sorted out. They didn't quibble though.    I won't be going back nor will I chose a Sofitel in future if I can help it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Didier V wrote a review Apr 2012
Review_Title: Nice hotel, good stay, but quite expensive
Review_Text: Our stay for two people (my girlfriend and I) was great. The hotel is comfortable the rooms are very nice the two swimming poolsare big and the swimming pool area is well maintained. The only bad point was the prices of the extras (drinks food...) The price of the rooms was OK but in the end it cost us more for the food and the drink than for the rooms. I need to add tht we did not eat a lot and drink a lot. We had an average consomation with a few drinks a day and we ate at the hotel restaurant 3 times. Otherwise we were in the city. The location was just perfect!  So good experience but carefull with the extras!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Neil P wrote a review Apr 2012
Review_Text: This hotel is second to none and Marakesh is a holiday destination for people who want to experience the real world we live in. we felt nothing but respect and love in this hotel the facilities were excllent and the prices were reasonable. The poool was excellent the night club a bonus and the food was outstanding the breakfats was brilliant. we had a junior suite and were treated amazingly!!!! go check out this hotel you wont be dissapointed

Review_Title: Nice hotel - service could be better and extras are expensive
Review_Text: Nice hotel well located and lovely pool (one heated) and gardens. The rooms are nice but the service is a little patchy. Extras are expensive. Breakfast is great but the rest of the food is expensive and average. Free wifi  TIP: members of the Accor club get a free drink and if available a upgrade so worth joining before your stay.  TAXI TIP: walk round the corner to hail a taxi as the ones waiting outside will overcharge you as they waited    DETAILS  Location: very nice area (hivernage) and walking distance to main square and souks  Rooms: nice rooms very comfortable bed bathrooms are nice. Shower is a bit of a pain as it floods the bathroom water pressure is not great and water temperature varies. Nice occitane products - shower gel shampoo and conditioner - no moisturiser. Good hair dryer. free water everyday  Wifi: free but very slow if you want to download newspapers or bigger files.  Food: Breakfast is very good with a great choice and some of the best fresh orange juice. The bar with live music is lovely but drinks are expensive. Lunch by the pool is nice but not a lot of choice. Dinner is very expensive for Marrakech and average.  Common areas: beautifully decorated and lovely fresh flowers. Sofas everywhere.  Garden: beautiful garden two pools (one heated) and a jacuzzi - very comfortable lounge chairs hammocks and mattress with pillows.  Service - service is in general good but varies some downright rude others charming. The service at breakfast goes severely downhill if no supervisors are around. Room service varies a lot - some days great others we had to ask the room to be re-cleaned  Prices - prices are on the very expensive end for food and drinks. It is one thing by the pool where you get the service however minibar is outrageously expensive.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great hotel but extras are way too expensive.
Review_Text: The hotelier very ice located in one of the most exclusive parts of Marrakech. Yet it is walking distance from the main square and other city attractions.  The outdoor pool area is great with a wonderfully comfortable lounge area.  The room was spacious and so was the bathroom - the shower though was not well insulated and the floor ended up flooded all the time.  It is a five star hotel and it goes without saying that the extras are expensive: however we took a half a liter Bottle of plain local water from the minibar and they charged it 80 MAD which are almost 10 dollars - sorry this is way too much.  The hotel restaurant (dinner) is average and could be better.  Breakfast is excellent and luckily included in the room rate.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Super surroundings let down by organisation service
Review_Text: We have just come back from a nice trip to Marrakech over the Easter break 2012.    The short summary is:    Be Aware:  - double check every booking you make. be very specific about what you want and need. it is unlikely that they will ask questions but rather just assume.  - If you get a taxi transfer from the airport specify how many bags you have. Golf bags especially!  - taxi payment is to be made to the driver not the hotel. odd but that's how it works.  - 'guides' for the city are nice friendly and good if you are prepared for the 25euro fee.  - negotiate the price of taxi's outside the hotel. it's like a cartel out there but they will go down by 1/2 of the original quote especially if you arrange for a return journey.  - if you take a spa don't let them rush you into a massage treatment before stating what kind you want. It seems they are in a big rush according to my partner.  - this place is expensive compared with any local place (even very nice places) for food and drinks. Double espresso by the pool is 7 euro typical lunch by pool is about 18 euro typical main course at restaurants is 22 euro  - no coffee / tea in the room  - some of the water in the room is complimentary but not well indicated. Check first.    The good:  - lovely hotel. great location and surroundings.  - friendly staff that are happy to 'try' and help.  - spa is relaxing and nice to have on site.  - Gym is well equipped  - pool area is fantastic well staffed and has wonderfully big beds.    the long version:  The sofitel is a beautifully laid out hotel the amenities are 5 star especially the pool and back yard which is something between a traditional garden mixed with all the luxury of a Nikki beach concept. It feels like the place has lots of history and you can see that in the depth of surroundings. - This is by comparison to some of the newer hotels outside of the city that have less developed surroundings and gardens.    BUT:  The service is the let down and it's is not through lack of trying. In fact the pool area is very well served as are the restaurants onsite but it's the house keeping reception and generally poor communication (not language) and timeliness that drags the whole experience down.  Things started poorly when we arranged a taxi service via the reception before we arrived and this came as a small 4x4 that was unable to fit our luggage and had not baby seat which we specified. ow were they to know how many bags we had? well they just had to ask but it is not our responsibility to take the initiative of telling them. So we waited some 30 min for another car to arrive.  Next was the payment of the taxi which we were under the impression this was a hotel service therefore we pay the hotel. Not so... and this poor communication was another let down. I think it is our right to question anyone saying 'you pay the cash to me' when you have arranged a taxi through a hotel. Anyway not big stuff but it is easy for them to improve.    We were then offered an 'upgrade; to the adjacent and apparently more expensive sofitel imperial but after we arrived in the rooms one can summarise that they are:  - traditional Moroccan decor  - no bigger than the sofitel spa and lounge rooms based on Sqm but actually feel smaller due to poor layout.  - older (feel less fresh)  - have smaller balconies    So we asked for a transfer the next day which was duly taken care of but this took an age and as with our first upgrade there was no baby bed and this took about 45 - 60 min to arrive. Participial frustrating since we specifically said it is important it's there when we arrive.    things from there were pretty smooth but when ever we had questions or room orders the length of time was an eternity and give the number of hotel guests I was surprised.

Review_Title: A definite oasis from the hustle and bustle of the medina.
Review_Text: We came here on a four day package which I guess was cheaper than many of the other guests paid. A 5 star Hotel and an experience for sure. A complete change to the hustle and bustle of the Medina and an oasis in itself. The staff are many and very attentive although we found one of the receptionists perhaps less so. Depending on which room you are in we were 283 you may experience some road noise from Ave de la Menara. I suspect if you are on a lower floor there would be less noise than ours on the second floor. We had a great south facing balcony overlooking the gardens and towards the Atlas Mountains. The gardens are wonderful with two large pools one of which is heated and lots of seating on offer and of many different varieties including hammocks. I suspect many guests spend all day around the pool and do not venture out of the hotel which to a point you can understand why.    Our breakfast was included and the selection was excellent and there was a choice of seating inside or out. Finding a table was never an issue even though we were told that the hotel was full.    Location wise the hotel is about a 5 minute walk to the nearest entrance to the Medina although this involves crossing at a major junction so take care and if possible cross with a local. You will then have about a 10 minute walk or 15 minute stroll into the main square which includes passing the Mamounia Hotel. It is a nice walk through the gardens of La Koutoubia.    Apart from breakfast we did not eat in the hotel but we ate in restaurants close by and recommend them if you do not want to eat in the Medina ‚Äì they are Extrablatt (roof terrace) and La Table du Marche. We had drinks by the pool one day which were a touch pricey but I guess that is to be expected.    My wife would also highly recommend a spa treatment at the hotel ‚Äì blissful!    If we ever returned to Marrakech we would certainly consider staying here again.    Any questions please send me a message.    Enjoy your stay.    Brian - homeexchange50plus
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An Oasis in a bit of a crazy city
Review_Text: Came here for 4 day trip.  Lovely hotel good location and nice room. Loved breakfast disappointed at price of casual lunch more expensive by far than same standard 5* in Dublin Ireland which is saying something especially when you compare wages here versus Ireland very disappointing.  Another complaint I would have is having agreed to 60 minute Spa treatment and questioning why I only got 50 minute treatment was told all treatments were less 10 minutes as the relaxation & tea after were included in treatment time. I have had Spa treatments in many hotels around world and NEVER was given such an excuse for short treatment. Obviously did not book another one.  Also was not shown around Spa and as Staff did not speak great English never did find out if it had Steam or Sauna!!!  Hotel grounds lovely pools etc.  I think as a 5* Hotel there should be tea/ coffee making facilities in rooms.  So overall by noting comments above and making necessary changes Hotel could get 5 rating as things stand I can't give it at present. One last thing I had read on Trip Advisor that there wasn't a heated pool but did manage to spot one on my last day although the jacuzzi was still cold.

Review_Title: Very good hotel but does lack some 5 star qualities
Review_Text: Stayed here with my daughter for 4 days. Enjoyed hotel but did feel that much was overpriced such as 2 sandwiches at lunchtime (even though quality excellent) costing near enough over ‚Ç¨40.  No tea/ coffee making facilities in room expected I. 5* hotel.  Breakfast was included and was excellent. Also evening in So Good restaurant with music show was excellent enjoyable show and good food. Need to just be bit more realistic with prices for lunches & snacks don't like to be treated like captive audience!!!  Most of staff have not got great English but are nice.

Our visit was part of a deal. Flights transfers and four nights B&B at the Sofitel. This hotel is beautiful and very well located for the walled city of Marrakech. The grounds are lovely though compact with two pools one of which is heated. Breakfast is excellent. A very easy walk to Marrakech city walls. Our deal also included 40% off all Spa treatments and I had the best massage I have ever had in beautiful restful surroundings.  Only downside. Drinks are very expensive but this is a Muslim country.  But there are three excellent licensed restaurants minutes away from the hotel.

Review_Title: Serenity in the midst of Moroccan hustle
Review_Text: We stayed with a group of 11 from Thursday through to Sunday. The hotel is perfectly situated if you want to go wining dining and clubbing. Marrakech in itself is small enough to be everywhere within 15 - 30 minutes but the Sofitel's location is ideal because you are at walking distance form the best places in town. The staff is kind and helpful the rooms are good enough and the beds are fantastic. Good spa with excellent specialist staff. The pool area is serene as can be in any busy town great pool beds chill atmosphere and a luscious garden. The lounge area between the hotel and the pool could you more staff at times. The wait for drink is simply too long on average. Breakfast is good enough not outstanding. Attached to the hotel is Club So. The place to be according to some. The interior is good staff is great and the band is good enough. BUT the singers are dreadful especially the girl (Asian appearance) who is great looking with great legs but the most terrible singing voice. Can't understand how this tight playing band can cope with this woman in front. Absolutely out of line. Night life starts late all over Marrakech people start dripping in after 1.30 - 2 Am. Does not work for me at least not for 3 nights in a row. In all I would recommend the Sofitel but I would at the same time recommend to check out other hotels as well.

This is a lovely hotel staffed by helpful and friendly people. There are two pools one of which is heated. There are a range of sun beds all comfortable and plentiful.  The reception areas are well furnished with lovely flower arrangements.  We were in the basic room which was fine as was the bathroom. However I would recommend upgrading as the view from our balcony was not the best we were offered two other rooms but neither room was as nice and the view not appreciably better.  Breakfast is excellent and can be eaten inside or outside. Being a French hotel the bread and croissants etc are great and there is a good choice of other food.  The hotel is 10-15 minutes from the airport by taxi and a 10-15 minute walk from place jeema el fina (the main square).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel is a peaceful haven in the middle of Marrakech. There are so many five star hotels within this area and the staff at Sofitel strive to be the best. They are so welcoming and helpful nothing is too much trouble. The Hotel itself is very beautiful with the best sunbeds I have ever experienced at any hotel. The breakfast is an array of the most wonderful produce - try the beignets frreshly cooked in a steel drum.  Would not hesitate in returning and look forward to my next trip to Sofitel Marrakech

Review_Title: An oasis in the craziness of Marrakech
Review_Text: Check in was efficient and rooms clean and tidy. Lovely balcony but rooms in lounge and spa part can overlook the back of the hotel which isn't as attractive. The best bit about the room was the bed. Sofitel have a lovely squishy mattress topper and amazing pillows. Hmmmmm....just had to recreate the experience at home by putting a light duvet on top of my mattress! The hotel is two in one and the Imperial is grander and the main reception is filled with red roses everywhere! The pools are fantastic. One is heated so fine to swim in even on a grey day and in the rain. Only problem is that the prices of food and drink are over the top. A cocktail is around ¬£15 and a champagne cocktail almost twice as much. Luckily for you the Director has a cocktail party on Monday nights so get in there and grab your complimentary drink! Similarly the spa is v expensive. Around ¬£100 for an hour's massage. All in all a great stay though. Great to get out of the hussle and bussle of the 'big square' and have a drink. The food at L'Orangerie was nice and esp. the dessert trolley and service good. All the staff are very good and acknowledge you all the time and I was pleased to be called 'Mademoiselle' once! Great if you want a bit of space and calm and somewhere to escape to. Very near to airport etc. etc. as already mentioned. Soundproofing a bit dodgy and did witness a domestic and some passionate activity! Oh well...all part of the holiday fun :)

Review_Title: Sofitel was a lap of luxury in comparison to the hustle & bustle Medina.
Review_Text: Sofitel was a lap of luxury in comparison to the hustle & bustle Medina. The breakfast was scrumptious and the smoothies were a good start for a day of activities to be experienced in Marrakech.  The reception staff were very friendly and gave guidance on the local area and expectations. There were always enough sun beds for the period we were there.  The spa prices were a bit high however the complimentary massages given by the pool were enough for our group.  A great place to stay in Marrakech - LELO 2012...

Review_Date: Adriano A wrote a review Mar 2012
Review_Text: We used the SPA at this property and it was a truly magnificent experience. The attention to detail and the courtesy of the staff is second to none. I suggest that you book your treatments in advance as this is a very popular establishment both with tourists and the wealthy locals.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Michael G wrote a review Mar 2012
Review_Text: This hotel is phenomenal; but its not the absolutely beautiful traditional moroccan architecture or the amazing Moroccan tea or the two beautiful pools or the amazing restaurants it was the UNBELIEVABLE level of customer service provided by a very attentive and wonderful staff. Stars amongst them were Khalid at the concierge and Leia from Guest Services. They attended to our every need with fervor and enthusiasm and were not satisfied until we were satisfied. My girlfriend and I are frequent travelers and have stayed in many a hotel in our day but this one was one of our most memorable experiences. The room itself was not anything ostentatious but you don't go to Morocco to sit in your hotel room. Dinner at L'Orangerie was exquisite breakfast was wonderful and I just can't mention enough the unbelievable customer service every step of the way. So Happy.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great Location for the Medina and Souks
Review_Text: My friend and I spent a three day mini break here in March 2012.    We had a superior room overlooking the pool and booked bed and breakfast only.    The hotel room was lovely a wrap around balcony a seating area two large single beds which felt a bit hard at first but which proved to be comfy and enough drawers and cupboards to meet our needs. I liked the rose petals on the bed and towels on our arrival. The room had a free safe too and we had two bottles of water provided each day.  The first night we reported that the door to the balcony could not be locked and this was fixed within an hour of us reporting it. The following morning we realised our aircon was not working and reported that - again it was fixed promptly. I think those two incidents are however indicative of the hotel - lovely but just a little tiny bit tired. The room was also quite a walk through the hotel from reception. OK for us but for older people this might have proved a problem.    The breakfast was buffet style with choices to suit everyone including Morroccan foods (a kind of donut which I tried and which was delicious and a kind of breakfast soup which I didn't try) as well as eggs every which way croissant cereals fruits smoothies etc. We had enough to eat every morning to ensure we did not need to eat lunch!    We had read other reports of the high price of food and drink in the hotel and so did not even attempt to buy any there. I guess that is what you would expect from an up market hotel and there are plenty of other eating options close enough.    The pool area was fantastic always enough places for us to flop down on to - hammocks loungers large beds and enough opportunities to sit in shade if we wished. I only went in once but the pool was large and the sun made it not too cold!    The staff all dress in traditional garb they were helpful and friendly and all spoke English and French (at least!) I could get used to having the door opened for me!    The hotel's location cannot be faulted. It is far enough away from the square to be quiet and in a lovely up-market location while within walking distance of the Medina and souks. There was a 6km jogging route nearby which I would have tried if I had packed running gear. Certainly it looked lovely and flat!    I would go back to this hotel if I went to Marrakech again provided the price was right!

We flew to Marrakesh to celebrate my wife's and my birthday. We booked the Sofitel because of good reviews on Trip Advisor. We were not dissapointed.  We were greeted by staff in traditional dress and taken through to the sumptious reception area to wait to check-in.  We had a superior room which was very big with seperate seating and dining area neatly laid out with fruit and sweets. The bathroom was a bit tired as the grouting was coming up around the bath and the marble water-stained. We had a view over looking the pool and gardens.  The pool area was fantastic with sofas hammocks and beds to lie on and plenty of attentive staff. There were two pools one warm and one very cold...but good for doing lengths.  The was an excellent Hamman and spa which we enjoyed on Saturday and Mrs M had some treatments and massage.  The food by the pool was very dissapointing for a 5 star hotel the salads were poor and the club sandwich dry.  We did not have the expensive breakfast but went across the road to the cafe where they did excellent coffee Juice and pastries for c.‚Ç¨30 for 4.  The hotel was a quite luxury away from the hustle of the Medina do not be surprised about how shocked you are going from 5 star to the street - this is a third world country.  We ate at Le Comptoir near the hotel on saturday which was very lively and excellent Bellydancing we ended up at the Hotel Club (next door) which was great fun with lively band and a great place to spend my birthday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful hotel in great location with wonderful facilities
Review_Text: This is probably the best hotel room I have every stayed in! Absolutely beautiful hotel. Great room really helpful staff and good food. It is rather expensive though more of a luxury trip as food and drink isn't that cheap.    You can hire someone to take you round the souk which was just great and only cost us about ¬£15 for the day. I went with a friend so as two girls I would definitely recommend this.

I was very fortunate to have a sales conference at the hotel. It's close to the airport 15 mins but far away not to hear planes all the time. Great location to walk to the centre and visit the markets. Local people friendly overall. Couple of great bars with live music within 5 mins walk.    It's a real resort hotel everything you need. Superb restaurants great swimming pools a spa and nice bars.    Service was very good staff friendly and rooms large and luxurious. Staff spoke good English French and probably a couple of other languages.    Only down side Cost for food and drinks was very very expensive. Guess that's what you would expect for a five star hotel.    I enjoyed the hotel and location so much I might surprise my wife for a long weekend. Fabulous!

Review_Date: Rebecca B wrote a review Feb 2012
Review_Title: Beautiful hotel, but lacking in information sharing
Review_Text: I stayed at Sofitel Marrakech Lounge and Spa which may I say really does live up to its five star quality in terms of the quality of decor and the over-priced breakfast. The hotel has a number of restaurants and there is a bar which has live music daily and the food is fair. The manager of the bar is very nice and made our stay worth while. Although the hotel doesn't advertise it this bar offers a three course menu which is free on a monday.    I booked this holiday through Expedia and got a fair deal I suppose although we later met other British tourists who paid significantly less for their hotel by booking with booking.com. They were provided with breakfast at the Kensi Hotel and free cancellation fees..anyway there are a number of international television stations in English Arabic and French so if you do get bored at least there is back up. The room was luxurious and staff seemed very friendly and helpful I must say. On arrival we were given a cup of Moroccan mint tea which was delicious and our luggage was taken to our room. Unlike other hotels there is no pressure to tip staff although it is welcomed if offered. The Spa is chargeable i.e. ¬£20 for a heated swimming pool but the gym is free there is an out door swimming pool but due to the weather it was too cold to use.    The breakfast menu is extortionate so if you don't want to pay ¬£19 per person for an extravagant continental menu then bring extra supplies for your room. There is a safe which the hotel recommend you use and a mini bar which we used to keep our water cool. There is complimentary water given daily.    The hotel is a standard distance from the medina approximately twenty minute walk and seven minute taxi ride. Now for the not so nice information....so if you are picking a taxi up from the outskirts of the hotel ask for a price before you get in the taxi as the drivers are likely to quadruple the price of the fare. Apparently the fare is based on a per person basis and you can ask the driver to put a meter on. Be stern with drivers as they can become very obnoxious and if you hate being lied too (like me) prepare yourself to get into a few arguments. Something to bare in mind is that drivers believe you're rich because you're a tourist so where possible if you are going back to the hotel from the medina or anywhere else for that matter DO NOT tell the driver that you are staying at Sofitel as they WILL charge (say you're staying somewhere closeby i.e. Place de L'Hivernage Novotel or on the hotel strip). When you come out of the airport there will be a host of taxi drivers willing to prey on fresh blood so be stern call the hotel before you leave England to get a quote on the taxi fare from the airport to the hotel. They tried to charge us 250Dirham at first but I wasn't having it and walked off. The driver later asked what appeared to be the taxi operator the cost who then told the driver to charge us 150Dirham please note that this was still over the limit the cost was meant to be 100Dirham....and I don't like being ripped off!! The same occurred when we were going back to the airport the concierge representative ordered a taxi and told us the cost was 100dirham when we arrived at the airport my mother paid the driver 150d but he looked confused when she gave him the money and had the cheek to ask for 200d. I rightly cursed at him and he quickly ran into his car shocked by my tone (I'm not recommending this btw).    So the medina is a beauty but certain areas are a tad mucky so if you have OCD beware. You definitely need to be able to haggle whatever price they quote you for an item offer them a quarter of that and then make your way up. Hotel cleaning staff are paid roughly 20d per day (I've been told) so think about your hard earned money before you throw it down the drain.    And lastly anyone booking through Expedia please be aware. A so-called Expedia representative by the name of Ahmed (HE WORKS FOR SAHARA TOURS) left a list of excursions with costs and a time to meet him. For your 'convenience' he will meet you at the hotel reception at either 10am or 2pm. The cost were twelve times more than the excursions should have been. For example the city have set hammam's at 7dirham plus massages vary at about 40/50d. Ahmed charged myself and my mother a total of 800dirhams this included a ride there and back in the worst taxi known to man (although the driver was very nice). The massage was wonderful as was the hammam although it was cold when going in and coming out of the steam room and into the massage room partly due to the weather. On leaving we couldn't understand why all the staff crowded around us like we were royalty we later found out that it was because we had probably paid their food bills for the month ahead.    Then we were coerced by Ahmed into going on a trip around the medina. This was a pointless trip as the tour guide Abdul was beyond lazy he took us to the La Bahia palace (entry fee 13d) and told us the bare minimum about the architecture and meaning of its many intricacies. As such I earwigged a few tours and learnt a great deal. Instead Abdul sat outside under a fig tree living the life. Then we were attacked by local hustlers trying to sell us metal bracelets which were already rusting...Abdul sat watched and laughed. Then he took us to a pharmacy in the medina where some tourists were pressured into buying things. I said no but others weren't as strong willed. This pharmacy over charges so be aware that Mr Abdul also gets his cut from taking tourists to these little spots even if they bare no significance to you. I've uploaded a picture of him for your convenience (he's wearing the camel colour jacket and 'suave' shades)    So as you can see a very colourful country I wouldn't recommend going in January as it was freezing (picture walking in england in sandals in the middle of december not a good idea). Apparently june/july is a lot better and there a number of riads which are clean and close to the medina saving you a great deal of money and arguments (if you're like me). Believe it or not I love this country despite the Artful Dodgers and Nancys the food is beautiful most people are kind and loving and the architecture is amazing. Definitely recommend going but make sure you purchase the lonely planets tour guide or the time out tour guide of marrakech before departure.
This is by far the best hotel in Marrakech.  Fantastic hotel in a beautiful country.

Stayed here for a romantic weekend with my girlfriend. Wanted to treat her to do something special so was prepared for the expense. First issue was my airport pickup wasn't waiting for me and then I had booked a king superior and they tried to give me a twin standard... I complained and the lovely hotel guest relationship manager gave me a complimentary Mercedes chauffeur for the weekend. Got my room (amazing) and they put rose petals on the bed. When you order room service dont expect it quickly! Spa was incredible. Excellent masseuse and private spa couples suite. Tea dates and rose water in a jacuzzi ticked the 'romantic boyfriend box' speed up Sofitel and I'll be back!

Wonderful service throughout.    Excellent location with lovely gardens and pools.    Very poor food in the main evening restaurant which was cold as with the main lobby but admittedly we were there during something of a cold snap.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Hotel is spotlessly clean and very elegant with a nice lobby and lovely surroundings. The gardens are beautiful and the pools are very grand. There are lots of comfy sofas hammocks and loungers and beautiful flowers and palm trees. There is one main pool which is unheated and therefore ice cold (nobody uses it). The other pool is heated but still too cold - the hotel needs to be less stingy and increase the pool heating.    Room was modern and clean but there are some issues:  1) It was freezing cold - heating did not work and they never fixed it even though we called 3 times  2) No separate shower cubicle in the bathroom and the water kept changing between hot and cold  3) No kettle or tea/coffee making facilities - unacceptable for a "5* hotel.    Room service was AWFUL! 450 dirhams for a lunch that arrived cold and was disgusting quality. Don't recommend!    Spa was good - it costs 250 dirhams per person for a 2 hour session including access to the hamam and they also bring you tea and dates which is a nice touch. 30 min massage was 500 dirham and was relaxing. Watch out though - was a bit disturbing to walk into the sauna to see a 20 stone French man slobbed out naked on the top bench.    Breakfast was weird - disgusting duck sausages and random mushrooms mixed with some disgusting yellow liquid. Lots of nice carbs such as muffins and donuts but the hot food was disappointing.    Service at the hotel was good everyone said hello and was very helpful and pleasant.    SURVIVAL TIPS FOR MARRAKECH!  1) As soon as you step out the front of the hotel you will be POUNCED ON like fresh meat by tramps and rogue "tour guides" offering to show you the city. There is one particular scary man who has a fake ID and claims to be from the ministry of tourism. Take no notice and walk away from him! It is disgusting that the Sofitel let people like this loiter outside the hotel - other hotels have armed security guards who remove tramps and rogues from the front entrances. The Sofitel gate staff seemed happy to let these dodgy harassers remain.    2) Every street you walk along you will be approached by locals. EVERY ONE will claim they are from "your hotel" to try and make you feel safe in their company. They will be wearing suits and will try to offer a tour of the medina or atlas mountains (or better yet they will offer you DRUGS!). They are LIARS and must be avoided - ignore them and walk away with confidence.    3) The medina/main square is DISGUSTING and NOT for the light hearted! Monkeys get beaten up to perform for selfish tourists who want a photo - before settling in for some entertainment think about the torture these monkeys go through. Henna tattooists try to tattoo tourists even without their permission just to get money. They will stalk you until you pay and can be very aggressive. I cannot understand how people eat here - there is ZERO hygiene and I saw one man with filthy hands cooking foods for tourists. People follow you everywhere if you stand out as a tourist it's VERY disturbing.

We stayed at the sofitel for two nights on the 28th janthe location is perfecteverything is within walking distancewhen we arrived at the airport we got into a small yellow taxi outside which did not have a meterit was a very shabby taxi and we were overchargedit was our first time here so didnt have any idea how much it would cost but i did ask at the hotel reception when we arrived and we were charged probebly around ¬£5 extra!the hotel itself is beautifulvery chicour room was not ready so we went out to lunch down the road at extrablatt and took a walk to the squarewe got back to the hotel about 3 hours later and we had to wait another 30 mins and when we got to our room it had twin beds so back to receptiongiven another room which we discovered was already occupied!!the guy who carried our bags ran back for another roomhe was very appologetic anyway.Lovely roomlarge bathroomking bed and little balcony overlooking a small garden with a pondsuch a beautiful hotel you could not find faultthe pool area is amazingthe best hotel we have ever stayed inthe only thing that bothered me which has nothing to do with the hotel was that as soon as we walked out one of the guys at the gate tried to persued us to let him be our guide which i had already read about in my guide bookhe didnt look too happy when we refused!everyone wants to be your guide and men would walk along side us and pretend that they worked at the sofitelthey must watch from a distance and follow you and they too would ask where your going and try to persuede you to go a certain cafe ectit does get annoyingwe would change direction and say were going somewhere elsethen we got ripped off buy a guy selling dohnutsstraight away i said no thankyouaround 5 times lolthen he asked where we were from and held out a dohnut and said here gift for youafter trying to refusei took itdidnt want to but didnt want to offendhe said try iti took a bite(he had also given a "gift" to my husbandas soon as i took a bite he rubbed his fingers together!!! so lesson learneddo not accept a gift as nothing is free here and they will want more money than what its worth!!! we ate at the night market on one of the stalls with all the localsi was a little dubious at first but the food was amazinglittle spicy sausagesbig baps to mop up minced tomatoonion and herb saucemixed grilled kebabs and really cheapcost us around ¬£7 for the two of us and that was with mint tea toonow i dont drink english teacoffee or herbal tea but the mint tea here is deliciouswish we had eaten on the stalls both nights!i loved the souksthey drive you crazy trying to get you to look at there stuff but just carry on walkingsmile and say no thank youwe were followed in the soukssomeone will say market this wayagain everyone wants a piece of youone guy tried to tell us to go somewhere and as we turned away my husband saw him signal another guy and he followed uswe left the souks and went back to the square where he then went back!! you really dont need a guideand apart from going to and from the airport we did not use a taxiwe walked everywhere but saying that we walked from our hotel to the la menara gardens to the majorelle gardens and that took us about an hour or so!! we took a calech back and asked him to take us to ben youssef schoolhe dropped us at the souks which we then got lost!!! we returned the next dayjust ask the souk workers and they will tell you where to find it.My other gripe was the leather bags i bought at the soukhe`s starting price was 350 dirham and i got it for 95 dirham!!! but one of the bags i discovered when i got home smells like animal poop!!!like its just left the tanneriesbought it for my 7yr old daughter who refuses to go anywhere near it lol!!all in all we had a great timean experience i will never forget and i would definately recommend the sofitel.oh a great tip we were given by an english couple were if you get lost in the souks just look up to the satellite dishes and they all point to the kotuobia moskfollow that direction and it will lead to the square!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: excellent location nice sized clean rooms with balconies. Outdoor heated pool which as the sun was shining was a real plus! Spa lovely with good treatments. Not the cheapest for food and drinkbut no different from the 5 star hotels in London. The highlight was the excellent service throughout.

Having stayed in a few 5* hotels this one is not one of the best. Some things were great some were downright poor. But overall a nice stay. We travelled to Marrakesh for Christmas. Arranged a hotel car to pick us up and although this was obviously contracted out the driver was very efficient and informative. Would recommend this over a local cab especially when arriving for the first time.  Check-in was very easy and quick and we had a free upgrade as Accor Platinum members. We had a junior suite which was very large and comfortable and had views of the mountains and over the pool. Some rooms were right by the pool and I imagine not be very private.  As per others' reviews the food is pricey and not of great quality at the hotel. Better to walk to the square and try the local food for about 1/4 the price. The Breakfast buffet is large and impressive though. Room-service is a total disaster. Very poor quality and takes an average of 40mins-1hour!! Wanted a nice breakfast together before my wife went off to the spa. It turned up as she had to leave (couldn't change spa time as it was busy) so she had to have it cold later and I sat there by myself. Very disappointing -especailly when it happened twice!  Location is great and is a pleasant walk with easy directions to the main square.  Would not stay here again as there are some very high quality riads that I was not aware of prior to booking. However if you want the resort style trip with a great pool and relaxing area then this is good and still handy to all the action
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Elegant and traditionally styled Five star hotel with a very French flair.  The hotel is beautifully presented and the service is on the very good side (not quite excellent but very good nonetheless).  Meals at the hotel are expensive but there is ample alternative restaurant choice close to the hotel.  A great convenient location makes this hotel an excellent chokicenfor any Marrakech stay.

I went to Marrakech for the 1st time in mid january with my best firend for my birthday I had been recommended to stay at the Sofitel by a friend who constantly returns...I have got to say apart from the prices being quite high on food and drinks everything else was perfect very good service very friendly staff who don't expect a tip but would appreciate it...and absolutely beautiful decor and all round features and hotel with a luxury and comforting feel would definately return without a doubt u will enjoy it and by far NOT regret it stop hesitating and BOOK now : )

Stayed 2 nights in deluxe room overlooking the pool.  After check in my account was "*closed down" so that they forced me to pay cash all the services.  A lot of working noise coming from the roof. The food was really terrible but the worst thing is the room service. This place deserves not more than 4 stars. Generally speaking all the stars given in Morocco are too much. Breakfast in room was 2 cups of bad coffee 2 miniature portions of marmalade some not so fresh pastries all that for 27 Dollars PER PERSON!!!  For a small amount of money you can stay in Mamounia  far better:
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alexander S wrote a review Jan 2012
Review_Title: Great Breakfast, poor room service and staff
Review_Text: I'm still staying in this hotel. The breakfast buffet is great! The waiters there excellent but forget about the room service people and reception:  It is the second day we ordered some french fries. Yesterday it took about 1 hour to get the simple ordinary fries!  Today the first attemt took about 55 min! The freis where cold! The second attemt is still after 60min on the way!  The receiption staff is friendly but incompotent! Our claim about noisy room was noted but they never followed it!  The breakfast buffet is very well organized and the staff very helpfull and capable. It seems they have a good manager keeping a strong eye on them!  I would say the whole service desire just maximum 4Stars and never 5Star!  If you stay for one or two days good choice with a good price. For longer stays don't waste your money.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Luxurious comfortable hotel it makes you feel at home. All staff are smiling to you and very helpful.  Very professional staff especially a lady called Loubna from the reception she has the character of managers she knows how to deal with the guests and she is always available whenever help is needed. And I‚Äôm pretty sure that one day she will have a very high important post in this hotel.  From the beauty of the hotel I felt I did not want to go out as there is everything there from food to spas and even pub. I was told that Sofitel Marrakech has the best lounge in Morocco which is called So Lounge a very good place to be.    The only problem you will face is the check-out part you will not be willing to do the check out and leave such an amazing hotel!

Review_Title: YOU GET EXACTLY WHAT YOU PAY FOR
Review_Text: Excellent hotel with professional staff and superior rooms.

Review_Date: Faisal A wrote a review Jan 2012
Review_Title: Unwelcoming Body guards at the front gate
Review_Text: What an experience at the entrance you get your first shot of unwelcoming experience with large men - about 6 or 10 of them looking at you and in French tell you "Pay entry fee" about $25USD and for what just to sit at the lounge and be charged another $25 for every drink. I will defiantly avoid such a place and prefer to go to a place where they are more welcoming.

Review_Title: Great way to spend new year..but eat elsewhere!
Review_Text: Just returned from a five night stay at this hotel after a trip to Marrakech for New Year. Great hotel in a prime spot between the new city and the Medina. Lovely rooms nice staff and good service but the BUT - and it is a big BUT - is the highly overpriced and not very good food. We arrived late so ate there on the first night in the Orangery restaurant - mediocre and very expensive. Breakfast was not included and we made the mistake of only eating it there on one day (there's a great cafe two mins away with better food and a fraction of the cost). Over ¬£20 each for a below average breakfast? No thanks.. However on the plus side pools are beautiful and the sunbeds among the best i've ever been on - definitely one to go to again..
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great Hotel in magic destination...People watchers paradise!
Review_Text: I have to say that my experience of Sofitel prior to my visit to Marrakech had been of rather ordinary overnight stays at dodgy airports! But this hotel is fabulous and the staff are helpful and charming. The layout of the pool area is excellent....but watch out for the first pool; it is not heated and the mere fact that no-one is swimming in that pool is the giveaway.    There are only two negatives. Firstly the lavatory paper is of a post war quality that does not stand up to the hotels' otherwise very high standards. I recommend a trip to L'Orangrie the upstairs restaurant which is managed by a lady called "Wiam" who is constantly yearning attention and I would imagine spends a good deal of time caning the miiror. She has the annoying habit of chastising the staff in full view of the diners. It is quite good entertainment....but a touch unprofessional. Perhaps a name change by proxy to "Iam" may be apt!

Review_Title: Poor service. Waited for three hours to be checked in.
Review_Text: Having come from a riad in fes this commercial brand of hotels has previously lived up to its name in other cities. Not so in Marrakech. I was made to wait a couple of hours and the service was the furthest thing from welcoming. The rooms are beautiful (we stayed in three separate rooms-another drama with checkin) and the location central. The service was shocking and not what I expect from a five star hotel.

Review_Date: Pollie S wrote a review Dec 2011
Review_Title: Best hotel I've ever stayed at
Review_Text: Can't put into words how fantastic this hotel is. We found that nothing was too much trouble the staff are extremely friendly and attentive but still manage to offer a discret service so you don't feel overwhelmed. We were lucky to receive a free upgrade to a suite which was truly beautiful and really quiet we never heard any other visitors from our room even though the hotel was busy. We stayed on a half board basis and was pleased we had the breakfast choice is great and I loved the fresh creeps made in front of you. A good choice of either french or traditional morrocan cuisine for the evening meal all of which as delightful. Really loved our stay here and would highly recommend it to fellow travellers
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here for a week in aug 2010. We arrived at 01.00am my first impression of the hotel was wow it really is amazing it looks like a palace from outside and the attention to detail with everything in this hotel is paramount- service is 1 st class doors are opened for you everyone smiles - the room was really nice had an issue as the room we were in was in the traditional side of the hotel which faced a rOad and there were some building works going on so  Was quite noisy I put up with it for a night then called reception and they arranged another room for me on the other side of the hotel where there is an awesome Art exhibition! Very modern ~ they moved all my bags within 20 mins! The pool and gardens were really stunning there was a dj Playing from afternoon till late - at night he had lights shows and the music was really nice he burnt us a few CDs as we spoke with him and told him how much we liked his music!  This hotel is top class it was absolutely boiling whilst we were in morocco but as soon as you entered the hotel you forgot about the mad weather and the city hustle it was very relaxing especially in the lounge (enterance) as they had loads of chairs sofas and a guy Playing v soothing music on a harp kind of instrument they also would give you free mint tea to drink we often would sit there for 20 mins or so when we returned to hotel - the staff were all really nice just watch out for the concierge desk as this hotel is 5 star the prices can be sky High for excursions we booked a tour guide for a day from them for our first day this guy tought us the ropes as everybody tries to rip you off all about bartering!!! Don't get a taxi from the hotel as they will charge you 4 times the price walk sound the corner and flag down but agree price before you jump in we paid between 3-5 British pounds from there to the new city or the market which is fine - our first night we paid 30 pounds to get back to our hotel!!! Glad we got the tour guide just to teach us a few tricks' watch out for the tour guides as if you want to go shopping they will take you to certain shops where they get commission if you buy! We got ripped off so badly he took us to a chemist with all the herbs etc and the guy in shop was giving us a presentation which lasted about 1/2 hour and showed us the benefits of certain herbs and spices! In the end all the stuff he showed us he wanted us to buy! We really were in a predicament and even for me it was really hard to get out of it without buying anything in the end we bought some stuff but it left me feeling quite angry and from  That point I knew I had to wise up to the tricks!  We booked to go quad biking in the desert with our hotel this was an excellent trip thoroughly enjoyed it  We visited the new city often walked around had coffee lunch or dinner it is much nicer than the market some really nice places to eat also fixed price the price you see on ticket is what you pay! So it's hassle free shopping! I'm not a massive fan of the market as There is a real hard sell from the shop keepers which I don't like if you are just browsing they force items on you - it's hard just to walk in and browse!  We wanted ro go to oureka valley so decided to arrange ourselves than through hotel we found a decent looking taxi with air con! Trust me if you have been to Marrakech you will know what I mean! We asked the driver how much to take us there agreed a price which was 1/3 of what hotel wanted! This trip to oureka valley was lovely it was much cooler there as we went to the mountains we tried climbing to see the waterfalls I gave up as it was way to hard for me in the heat my husband carried on to the top!!! We found beautiful gifts for our family from the little shops there - An artist was writing names in Arabic  which was so Beautifully done we bought some!  This holiday was real eye opener very much what you see on tv in regards to the market however there are plenty of things to do we stayed 5 nights and it was about right - the only thing I would changes about our trip is to travel when it's not so hot as some days we would either only leave hotel mid afternoon if we had gone in morning somewhere we came back to hotel for a siesta! As it was really hot during peak between 48-52 degrees  Definately would reccomend this hotel it's worth paying more to escape the craziness outside to the sanctuary of this hotel! Hope you enjoyed my review

Review_Title: 2nd visit for business trip, same strong points, same flaws
Review_Text: I was upgraded to a suite this time which was very substantial but I felt the decor needs a bit of an overhaul. For instance the floor of the shower was plastic and bouncy not what you expect in a 5 star hotel.  The service is still a bit inconsistent - I asked for a cup of tea with lemon by the pool and had to remind them 3 times to bring it. A 15 minute wait is unnacceptable. Also whilst there are plenty of staff at breakfast I again had to wait too long to get fresh coffee.  Cleanliness is top-notch as is the location and the pool areas are great. Spa is a bit pricey but very attractive.  The hotel hosted a magnificient poolside evening party for the trade show I was attending and they did it fantastically well. The ambience was amazing and the food was stunning. Service was excellent for this too. As I said in my first review if you are coming to Marrakesh for pleasure most people would prefer a luxurious and authentic riad to a large property but at least you feel like you are in Morocco here.

We stayed here for 3days in November. The hotel surroundings are beautiful and only a short walk(10mins) from the famous square. Don't pay for the breakfast here there is a great place straight down the road (extrablatt) where you pay between 4-8 euro depending on your wishes. The 2pools are great one heated. There are a lot of French people there and sex & the city wannabes  but if you don't mind than that's fine. I personally loved this hotel and it's grandeur whereas my husband found it too big stuck up and impersonal. Just goes to show same plac different opinions. Gym has all the kinesis equipment but it's more for show and the gym is hardly big enough; more a extra part of the spa. The spa looks beautiful and inviting but the prices are at a high European price range so didn't have any treatments. Drinks are expensive and at average 5* hotel rates. Although 5 euro for a coke/7Up is too high. They must not know that the rest of the world is in economic crisi; which basically means they loose their clientele for food/drinks down the road. We saw quite a few people saying at this hotel going to xtrablatt for breakfast and lunch. Rooms are nice. The beds are just fabulous . The shower over the bath doesn't work unless you ave a very flexible spine and enjoy doing backbends! The detailing in the furnishing could be better(more 3/4* decoration definitely not 5*). when we were there there was a distinct sewer smell and we had to change rooms as the smell was unbearable in the first room. Staff are very good porters and waiters. Front desk staff are professional; can't say they're friendly. The obviously misunderstand acting classy as needing to be aloof; something you wouldn't get in a true 5* hotel. Nevertheless; these things don't bother me and I actually quite enjoy not having to have unnecessary chit-chat; my husband wasn't that enamoured by it all. I do recommend staying here and would return here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Michael C wrote a review Dec 2011
Review_Title: One of the best hotels we've been to
Review_Text: Just returned from 5 days break. What an excellent hotel - accommodation friendly helpful staff and a perfect location. The amenities are first rate and the breakfast a sumptuous feast! Walking distance to Jemma El Fna and the central medina area as well as the trendier neighbourhoods of Hivernage and Gueliz. Can't wait to go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Grand entrance convenient walk to the markets impeccable upkeep in all common areas and in rooms. Poolside restaurant service was painfully slow but otherwise staff and amentities excellent. There were so many nice seating areas to just pause and soak in all the sights and sounds.

Review_Date: Ian C wrote a review Dec 2011
Review_Title: Great hotel, one of the best.
