Review_Text: Stayed here for 5 days at the end of November really nice hotel very luxurious feel to it room was well appointed let down slightly by the poor home made MDF furniture and fittings. The breakfast was first rate anything you could possibly want first thing in a morning!  Good location 15 - 20 minute walk to most attractions or a 20DR taxi ride.  Pool area was excellent lots of loungers and beds to laze the sunny days away topped off by a nice heated pool. The lunches and drinks can get a bit pricey especially when you've just returned from town and paid 4DR for a freshly squeezed OJ and they want 65!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Good hotel, but still not as I was expecting
Review_Text: The location of the hotel is excellent as it is only 15 minutes walking from Jemma El Fna and close to airport as well. These were the two really good thing I noticed about the hotel. The service of the hotel was ordinary. When we checked in we were give a twin bed and was told that they will change the bed to king size double bed but it never happened for the next four days despite of requesting the reception more than one occasion. There was no complementary tea making facility in the room (all the hotel I stayed in in Europe and Asia at least had the option of making your own tea in room). So we had to order tea everyday morning instead. One day when we came back at night after a long day we found that the magnetic key is not working and had to go to reception and wait there to activate the key again. When we were checking out I was charged for using the mini-bar which I never had and had to tell the reception to make a correct bill. The ambiance and atmosphere of the hotel was excellent the rooms were cozy and the quality of sleep was good. The rooms has a nice specious balcony with two sofa and a small table and two chairs which makes it a perfect place to enjoy the morning tea or an evening drinks with a nice view of the mountain. But which matter most 'the service' was not up to the hotel's reputation. All in all it was a good stay and I will recommend the hotel for a holiday trip to Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Luxury hotel away from the craziness of old Marrakech
Review_Text: With a fair degree of trepidation after reading the Sofitel Marrakech Lounge and Spa's TA reviews we booked a 3 night stay in late November using American Airline points (about 22000/night and the rate included breakfast). Here are the key points of our stay    1. Location: The Sofitel was situated on the edge of the "Hivernage" district of Marrakech and was close to a city (ie medina) gate so it was an easy walk to the Koutoubia and Djemma el Fna as well as to the Gueliz district (ie the "new city"). I loved coming back to a quiet luxurious hotel at the end of the day and was very glad we chose this over a riad in the old part of Marrakech.  2. Staff: The staff were very friendly helpful and most spoke very good English.  3. Amenities: The Sofitel was a rather large property and had 2 pools large dining terrace herb garden spa small fitness faciltity and several bars. We mostly ate in the L'Orangerie restaurant which was chicly decorated in subtle tones of silver and dove gray.  4. Room- We requested and were given an upgrade to a beautiful room on the 3rd floor which had a balcony and faced the pool area. It was predominately decorated in white and silver and thus felt very tranquil. Our room contained all the usual amenities (flat screen tv minibar etc) and lemon verbena toiletries by L'Occitane.  5. Food- The breakfast buffet at the Sofitel was superb and in addition to the usual breakfast foods it featured omelettes cooked to order and a juicing stand. Their filter coffee and cappucinos were delicious and their pastry area featured the best croissants and pains aux chocolats I have ever eaten!  6. Wifi- The Sofitel had free wifi however the connection was weak and it took quite a while to hook up to it.  7. Airport Transportation- Not knowing what to expect at the Marrakech airport we booked a car through the Sofitel which cost 25 euros. In hindsight I wish we'd just caught one of the plentiful taxis at the airport as the std taxi rate from the airport to the Sofitel was only 150 dirhams (ie. USD $15).  8. Important Tourist Tip- When going to the souks before leaving a stall make sure to check your bags after making a purchase to ensure everything is there! After an intense bargaining session with a particular vendor he handed me a bag which was missing one of my purchases. When I called it to his attention he was unabashed and scowlingly put the missing item in.    Thumbs up to the Sofitel Marrakech! I would be very happy to stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nigel R wrote a review Nov 2011
Review_Text: Very luxurious hotel although beware when you book a Superior room thinking it is special it is not! It is the standard room! We had to change our room as the first one offered was above the air conditioning plant and therefore too noisy.  The breakfasts are excellent the pool area beautiful and the restaurants good.  It is very close to plenty of other restaurants and easy to walk into the centre (15mins)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel is excellent. The pool areas are beautiful and relaxing with plenty of sun loungers  beds hammocks and cabanas they also have small hammocks for babies the attention to detail is stunning. The staff are attentive and the rooms are pure luxury. Only downside is  the drinks etc are very expensive but what can you expect in a five star hotel. If you want pure luxury this is the place to stay.

Review_Title: Fantastic swimming pools and sun loungers
Review_Text: We travelled to Marrakech purely to stay in this hotel and use its swimming pool facilities having previously visited it for a day. The pool area is amazing. Lots of choices of sun loungers from shaded cabanas hammocks to sofa loungers. They even had a hammock suitable for my 3 month old baby. The pools are exceptional and very well maintained. My only complaint is about the standard and cost of food in the pool side restaurant. The food is very poor - however as others have mentioned there is a very good cafe outside the hotel. We ate all of our meals there including breakfast. This place is very reasonably priced.    The public areas of the hotel are beautiful with lovely paintings and statues. There are wonderful fresh flowers everywhere.    We had some issues with service. I had emailed in advance to ask for a cot from my son. This was not provided until the 2nd night of our stay despite various members of staff saying that it was on its way. Also the service at the pool side was very slow and it was difficult to get anyones attention.    The room was very nice but nothing outstanding for this category of hotel.

Review_Date: Andy V wrote a review Nov 2011
Review_Title: Fab, luxurious hotel but crazy expensive on food and drink
Review_Text: Currently staying at the lush Sofitel and it really is a gorgeous hotel. We've been on a crawl around some of the top 5 starred hotels in Marrakesh and apart from La Mamoumia which you can only really afford if you're crazy rich we reckon this is the best.  Our room is gorgeous beds are so big and soft gorgeous bedding lovely free 'smellies' in the bathroom we feel well looked after and it's so relaxing. The pool area is also totally lush big beds to relax on heated large pool and regular large pools the decor around the place is so spot on and done with real elegance. Life here is truly 'magnifique' as the sofitel tag line goes.  Only down side is that the restaurants and bars in this hotel are CRAZY expensive which seems a bit mad as in the many hotels restaurants and cafes just a short walk away food and drink is much much more reasonable so we've been exploring those for breakfast lunch and dinner. My advice would be get one of the 'stay 2 nights get one free' type of deals that sofitel often do on their website stay here enjoy all the complimentary bits and bobs and free facilities (Most things in the Spa are extra) but explore locally to eat and drink as you'll save a packet.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The staff is wonderful the rooms spacious and nicely decorated. The breakfast is great and everything is fresh. Also the lcation is great a few minutes away from all the god restaurants in the area and clubs in town and the medina. We also loved the swimming pool area. Very nice    Downsides: the restaurant for lunch by the swimming pool is very expensove and not very good. The carpet in the room is very dirty.

Review_Date: Susan b wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Text: Having stayed at Sofitels before we thought we know what to expect. The hotel is situated just outside the Medina in the new part of town which means familiar surroundings sot to speak. We were here for a few days to familiarize ourselves before going to experience the real Morocco in the desert and what turned out to be a stay in a riad.  This hotel is large with several wings of rooms so there is a bit of walking to get to our room which was on the main floor but on the side of the hotel so it was quiet. Nice comfortable very decent size clean room. Nothing special but decorated in a Moroccan theme. Separate bathroom and toilet which was a bit of a novelty.  The staff were ok a bit standoffish and snooty but we really did not require anything from them so it was no big deal. We met a very nice taxi driver on our second day and he offered to be our guide while in Marrakech. We arranged a fee up front so there were no surprises at the end of our stay. This proved to be a very good thing as he worked with us exclusively and showed us not only the city but also the Atlas mountains which is about an hour away.  We also chilled out by sitting by the expansive pool which was beautifully landscaped BUT beware of the exorbitant prices. I know this is a first class hotel but it is not situated in a very high rent city/country so how they can justify $7 cokes and $16 cocktails is totally beyond me. I though must say in their defense their prices are typically found in many restaurants that are far too expensive to justify where they are.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Katie S wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Text: Our main reason to go to Morocco was to get some sun and relax - Sofitel's gorgeous pool and facilities made it such a special weekend. It's not too far from the Medina and there are also a number of really nice restaurants close by. We had fabulous meals at The Red House (gorgeous traditional Moroccan) and Mai Thai (lovely Asian).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: For our first visit to Marrakesh my friend and I booked at the Sofitel Hotel. I had heard from many of my customers in England who had visited Marrakesh and stayed at the Sofitel on how wonderful a hotel it is and we too decided to book.    The hotel is nicely situated not too far from the airport and the centre. It has a fantastic presence and an elegant facade. On arrival we were warmly greeted by the receptionist (Loubna) who was very polite and professional. We arrived before check-in time due to a very early flight and were very tired having had no sleep the night before. We explained to the receptionist and she kindly allowed us to check-in so that we could freshen up. We even got a courtesy call to make sure we were happy with the room a very nice thought. The room was fantastically decorated with a Moroccan theme and lovely views over the pool area.    We were very impressed with the swimming pool area with 2 large pools and fantastically constructed sun loungers. Not the cheap plastic ones you get at some hotels. The pool area was so good it was like being in peaceful oasis of peace and relaxation away from the hustle and bustle of Marrakesh. We found the service around the pool area 1st class whenever we needed anything. There was even a guy giving free foot massages to re-energise those aching feet.  I have stayed in many 5* Hotels having travelled and worked all over the world and Sofitel Hotel in Marrakesh is definitely one of the best. I will be staying there again whenever I am back.  Overall nothing was too much trouble for the staff who went out of their way to make sure we enjoyed our stay even when my friend had forgot his comb and asked if they had one. One was promptly dispatched by Loubna.    Merci Beaucoup Sofitel Hotel Marrakesh.

Review_Date: Bernard G wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Text: I travel Europe on business.  This hotel exceeded my expectations.    After a flight from London I arrived at the hotel and was greeted by a friendly doorman who showed me to a comfortable sofa. A young lady came up to me and asked for my passport and of course my credit card. Whilst she was sorting out my paper work I was offered a scented towel to freshen up and a mint tea as welcoming gesture. The General Manager came up to me and introduced himself. A relaxing and much more informal way of doing business.    I arrived 1 hour before my official check in time. Rather than be told to wait I was offered a tempory room until my room was ready. Here the Sofitel exceeded in care and concern.  After an hour I went back to the reception desk and was given my room key. (Swipe card.)    The young lady who gave me my swipe card also took the trouble to explain where everything was. ( A lot more than take the lift to the third floor and turn right!!!!)    The staff are extremely polite and always say "Bon Jour" in a respectful way.    I would highly recommend this hotel.  You may read about the high prices but the quality is always an important factor to me    Comfortable bed nice clean room and bathroom. Great facilities.    Take it from someone who got a massive refund from a famous hotel on an island in Venice lagoon.    I will return a big thank you to the staff who were great.

I'm afraid my hotel room and safe were broken into and the staff did not manage it well at all. There were many issues but in summary it took a long time for the staff to take us seriously they tried to dismiss the idea that it happened at all and the escalation procedure to get to management was extremely slow.

Resort style hotel with every amenity you could want. Could comfortably spend a couple of days just lazing around! Location is not ideal but not sure exactly where would be good in this curious City. Service was superb

Review_Date: shirley G wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Title: great hotel, but some negatives, read below...
Review_Text: Great hotel beautiful rooms IF you take a surperior room. the pool is beautiful And big.  everything looks classy and beautiful but too bad that the hotel alows people to play their own loud music at the pool and allow topless woman and people with loud en anoying behaviour. Not verry relaxing and stylish. the prices of the minibar and restaurant are madly expensive. Its to silly to expect people to pay so much even if you can afford to stay at the hotel. Down the street is restaurant "extrablatt" verry good food and chic admosfere for one third of the price you pay at the hotel. But if you are a snob and dont mind paying tooo much for your food please feel free to do so.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sherri M wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Text: When you are least expecting it Sofitel staff may surprise you. On my last day and just before I left for the airport I had a surprise visit by one of the chefs recomending a light lunch at the beautiful garden terrace. I ordered a glass of Rose compliment of Moroccon vinyard. The lunch the wine the service and the ambienace just made me think I DONT WANT TO GO HOME!!  My 9 day stay at Sofitel was full of surprises the little flowers left on my bed side the rose pedals spread over the bathroom floor the note from the general manager and more simply made a big difference. The purpose of my trip was business and it felt like holidays....

Review_Date: Shaun W wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Text: Booked as part of a package this hotel met every requirement we could possibly have and more. Located within walking distance of a couple of restaurants but plenty of taxis available to take you further. Great pools with sofas to lounge on so if you can get it as part of a deal go for it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rina C wrote a review Sep 2011
Review_Text: My cousin and I went to Marrakech for a five day break in September 2011. We didn't realise until arrival that both the Sofitel Lounge and Spa and the Palais Imperial are connected giving us full access to use the utilities of both hotels. The grounds of the hotel were beautiful with full access to two pools and a jacuzzi. The hotel guests were of a mix of ages and cultures and all the staff were more than happy to help. One of the best clubs "So Good" resided within the hotel providing a sheesha lounge bar and club. Perfect for a good night out! I would highly recommend this hotel for visitors to Marrakech. We could have easily spent another week within the hotel!

Review_Title: Great hotel, great location, but one tip to give you........
Review_Text: This is clearly one of the top 5-star hotels in Marrakech. Excellent infrastructure (heated pool!) excellent service (like in many other places in Marrakech) good food a reception area that is so inviting and a great atmoshphere. we nipped over to the El Saadi hotel next door. It has the atmosphere of a bus station!  My tip is the following:  - The building complex really consists of two hotels (the Sofitel Palais Imperial) and the Sofitel Lounge and Spa). Why spend more money getting a room in the Palais Imperial? It costs around 100-150 US dollars extra but you use the same facilities and the rooms are not much different (we stayed one night in the Palais Imperial and the rest of the time in the Lounge and Spa where the rooms are nearly of the same standard).    Try to get Meryem to help you at the reception. She is so friendly smart and a real professional.............

Review_Title: Great hotel, great location, not very good service
Review_Text: If you plan to go to Marrakech don't look any other hotels. This is a great place to stay in a wonderful neighborhood near nice restaurants close to the Medina and to other beautiful hotels such as La Mamounia. The rooms are very comfortable with good amenities. The pool is very nice and has beautiful places to spend a nice afternoon. However the service of this Sofitel is not the best. They took ages to do the check in the suggested a not that nice local guide and they were not as friendly as most Moroccan's are.

Review_Title: Good time at Sofitel Marrakech Lounge And Spa
Review_Text: This a large 5 star hotel. Maybe not Thai 5 Star but 5 star and very good all the same. Close to old Marchesh. You could walk it but it‚Äôs only ¬£4 in a taxi. Lots of pleasant helpful staff. Large good accommodation. Big pool. Hammocks and giant chess set in the grounds Nice restaurant. It seemed to be the social centre of the new hotels district. Non residents came in for lunch and dinner. Connected next door is a very nice Night Club with a live music dancing and tables for dinning. Down side? Breakfast is ¬£20PP. but outside are two nice restaurants that charge ¬£4PP A Poolside bottle of beer is ¬£5. Baby sitting service that works! We loved it. It played a big part of making Marchesh a great holiday. Paid the hotel ¬£25 collection from the airport for 5 people. Worth it!.

Well we're just back from a week at the Sofitel.    The beautiful reception area is typical of the rest of the hotel with a wonderful aroma and with all members of staff always willing to assist and with a warm response at any time of the day.    The rooms were a lovely size and the bed was large and extremely comfortable. Our room didn't have a particularly good view but we didn't care about it to be honest.    The pool area was extremely well looked after with plenty of sun loungers and sectioned off areas.    It takes about 15 minutes to walk to the souks and although we could have taken a taxi for a small price we enjoyed the walk.    When there during the day we ate at L'Oasis which is their poolside restaurant. The staff were always very friendly and although there wasn't a huge menu there was a good mix of salads grills and other items and the complimentary fresh bread and olives were delicious.    We are never worried about breakfast but we were aware from talking to other guests that it was very expensive and not particularly inspiring. On the occasion we wanted something we took a short walk to Extrablatt which is a cafe just a couple of minutes up the road which was ideal.    We looked at the restaurants in the hotel but there were as others have mentioned extremely expensive. Fortunately there are a number of good restaurants only a short walk from the hotel and obviously loads more the further you go into the main town. We also found the local carrefour so that we were able to have large bottles of water and snacks in our room without the excessive cost.    I looked at the prices in the spa and they were like the food over the top and I ended up going to Les Bains de Marrakech which is fabulous as well as being a great price.    During our stay there was a yearly dinner / dance party for the staff which was held at the bottom of the area where our room was. We were given notice that it was taking place on the day with apologies from the management however having a band playing very loudly from 19:00 - 00:30 in an area where guests sleep isn't ideal and it would have been nice if they had given the rooms who were disturbed by the noise something as thank you for instance a couple of drinks or a free lunch.    Two things that were were very pleasantly surprised about were that that wifi and the gym were complimentary something that was extremely welcome.    We would definitely return there again and like some of the other reviews feel the only reason why I haven't given the hotel a rating of 5 is due to the excessive prices for food and drink
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We visited this hotel and all i can say is wonderful wonderful excellent. The staff the food the service cleanliness i would definitely return to this hotel. A wonderful selection at breakfast helpful informative staff. The rooms are not luxurious but they are clean and the bed is so comfortable i thoroughly enjoyed the experience great pool and great pool furniture and within walking distance to the souks and a main shopping area. My husband and I loved it and so did two other couples that we met one on honeymoon and another celebrating their 27 wedding anniversary.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Robbie S wrote a review Sep 2011
Review_Title: silly things let it down a bit, but incredible place
Review_Text: My partner and I stayed at the sofitel recently on a trip to Marrakech. We stayed in one of the hotels superior rooms which have a stunning view of the hotel's pool and Marrakech's atlas mountains.  upon arrive to the spa resort you are greeted by every member of staff you see and there is a serene calmness to the place and a relaxing aroma that makes you feel at ease.The room's were finished to a high standard like every part of the hotel.  originally we planned to spend two days here before going on a journey to to the desert for a couple of days and then upon return we would stay in a riad but the Sofitel was so breathtaking we booked an extra 3 days because we knew it would be the perfect place to relax after the desert.  The hotel is very central walking distance to the main square and plenty of restaurants in the local area.  however there are a few things which kept the hotel from receiving a 5 star rating from me. the first room we stayed in the bath was broken. at poolside the staff were in a world of their own completely ignoring people and forgetting to bring people's orders. the room service is very expensive and the quality of food doesn't match the prices sadly. we also had a problem with birds getting into the balcony and messing all over the seating area. We asked three times for it to be cleaned and it was never done! Breakfast was also a disappointment  These are the only things that stop me from giving it the full rating that i truly want to give. it was a lifetime experience and I would stay here again in a heartbeat.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Leeandra Jade wrote a review Sep 2011
Review_Title: Simply Stunning can't wait to visit again
Review_Text: From the second we arrived we was given outstanding service. We were greeted many times by the Guest Services & General Manager throughout our stay. This hotel is for everyone & caters to every need! The breakfast was amazing with everything you could possibly imagine & the pool & bar facilities were terrific! Our room was a Junior Suite which was very comfortable & had a lounge area & a balcony with views over the pools & gardens.    The Sofitel was in a superb location (5 minute walk to the main square) & the concierge were a great help for booking tours taxis etc...    You will not fin a better hotel in Marrakech then this & fantastic value for money!!!    I can't wait to go back & visit plus theres a Louis Vuitton in the hotel too... Bonus;-)

We ended up at this hotel by default after having spent one uncomfortable night at a Riad in the Medina. That experience is a whole other story but we were just keen to get to a decent hotel for the remainder of our long weekend stay and the Sofitel served the purpose well enough! Unlike a Riad you at least had a serviced pool area where you could escape the heat in the middle of day with a drink in hand. You get a very comfortable bed in a decent sized hotel room with working air-conditioning and room service.  I found the staff polite enough but not really very attentive to your needs. You had to stand around the pool for 10 mins or more and wave down the staff to get you a towel same too if you wanted food and drink. I would have expected in a 5 star establishment that the staff would be trained to anticipate the guests needs I don't think it acceptable to be constantly waving down the staff! Same too in the terrace bar having ordered a bottle of champagne after the bottle was delivered to the table and poured into one glass not once did they refill our glasses we had to pour our own champagne for the duration of the bottle. Again waving down the staff to order food etc. There is plenty of staff but again not using their initiative. It was quiet odd??  Anyway the hotel was a much more pleasant experience than the Riad. Riads are NOT hotels and are NOT luxurious they are simply guesthouses with few if any facilities which is not good at the height of summer.

Review_Title: Excellent hotel, with a few minor glitches along the way
Review_Text: The hotel facilities are excellent - wonderful foyer and entrance a range of bars and restaurants onsite boutiques calming spa etc. Finished and furnished to a very high standard. The rooms have a little less attention to detail - still reasonably luxurious but the finish was not as sleek (ours was a superior room). Beware the shower may randomly change temperature. This is a 5-star hotel that has taken the luxurious elements of the culture and integrated them. If you want a more Moroccan experience a Riad is the best way forward. It had all the elements of luxury - turning down service etc.    The service was very hit-and-miss occasionally. Drinks can take a while to arrive and you have to ask for service rather than wait for it to be offered. I found that the servers were not too obliging but you have to remember that 1) the heat slows people down 2) the culture can be very relaxed. That said at times they could come across as very rude and others very accommodating. The prices are expensive - around 5/6 pounds for a fruit juice and 8/9 pounds for a cocktail (however I think this is worth the money as they were fantastic). Expect 5-star prices. Tip - order a measure of spirit and you receive the mixer free.    We had an issue requesting a double room as a gay male couple - despite checking before we flew we were given a twin room. When we asked for a double they kept reiterating that it was a twin room as it just did not register that we wanted a double. There were other gay couples there but you cannot show affection in public for obvious reasons. I certainly felt an undercurrent of discomfort with some of the staff. Many speak English - when we spoke French they responded in English so I just stopped trying. The hotel is around a 10 min walk from the Medina.    I would stay in this hotel again but not go back to Marrakech. 5 days was enough. The 5-star standard was welcome after days in the city. Wear closed footwear into the city - some of the puddles are what you suspect them to be!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: If you want an authentic Maroccan experience do not go here but opt for one of the Riads in town.  If you also want to pamper yourself and have access to the best pool in town do go here.  Yes prices for drinks etc. are steep but are to be expected from a place that has a Vuitton boutique and Hermes toiletries.  We stayed with our 1.5 year old and that worked very well. Excellent baby gear and baby-sitting service can be provided by the hotel.  Management and front desk staff are terrible but the rest of the staff is good if you leave a tip now and then excellent.  Food in the restaurants is average and overpriced but there is an excellent restaurant around the corner (Table du March√©) . Up the street you can go to Comptoir Darna for upmarket Moroccan food with bellydancers (experience is worth the price not the food) and trendy lounge bar or to the good eu style caf√©.  Souks Medina and square are an easy 15 minute walk away and also the new town is very doable by foot.  All in all we were very happy that we chose this hotel. Enjoy the luxuries that come as standard and go elsewhere to satisfy gastronomic needs and enjoy authentic Moroccan experiences.

Review_Title: fantastic luxury room and hotel - eat/drink elsewhere
Review_Text: We are leaving tomorrow and have experienced a wonderfully relaxing week here. It is an oasis of calm compared to the marrakech medina. Staff excellent and very friendly rooms large and comfortable and pool area beautiful and luxurious. We ate at cafe blatz for breakfast (2 min walk) each day for ¬£5 compared to ¬£22 for hotel breakfast! and for evening meals mainly in town to enjoy the experience although there are some very good local restaurants around the hotel. The main square in marrakech is amazing and initially quite scary-but the locals are all very friendly (with perhaps the exception of the snake charmers who damand excessive money for wrapping a snake around your neck). The atmosphere is unlike anything we have previously experienced -frantic/crazy/lively/wild/noisy/ but completely intoxicating and everytime we returned to the hotel each night thinking 'thats enough' ...we were compelled to return the following evening to try it all over again. keep an eye on your money but it seems safe as anywhere else. Always approach the locals in a friendly manner and you will invariably be met with the same in return-would recommend the hotel and the marrakech experience as definitely 'a must do experience'
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: 6 of us stayed here in three superior rooms in July 2011 and we loved our stay. The staff were very helpful and friendly. As others have commented service by the pool was quite slow but they have addressed this and it seems quicker than previous comments. The prices by the pool were fairly steep (45 MAD = ¬£3.80 for a bottle of water or 60 MAD for a 330 ml Coca Cola) but they are served to your poolside chairs. The staff could not have been more helpful and laid out towels by the pool and umbrellas etc. Pool very clean and area beautifully kept by gardeners. The rooms were big with towels changed 2 or 3 times a day. Hotel restaurant (l'Orangerie) was expensive around 200 MAD for a main course. Location was excellent only a 15 minute walk to the main square and perhaps 20 minutes to the Souk. We would highly recommend the nearby restaurant the Cafe du Marche where we paid around 1100 MAD for 6 of us (we had no alcohol)

This is a lovely hotel in a good location.  Check in was a little slow and our room wasn't ready at 6pm however we were upgraded to a junior suite for the inconvenience.  The room was large and very well furnished with a huge terrace.Hermes toiletries are provided in the junior suites.  The public areas are beautiful.  The main pool was busy and loud but the second pool area was lovely and peaceful.  Breakfast had a good selection but service could be a little slow.  Service in the bar area was extremely poor.  My main complaint about this hotel is how expensive drinks and food was.  I expect 5 star hotels to be expensive but I still think it is massively overpriced in relation to the nightly cost of the hotel.  I visited La Mamounia whilst in marrakech and was surprised to find only a slight difference in the cost of drinks between the two hotels.

We only stayed for 3 nights thank goodness otherwise we'd have needed a 2nd mortgage! It's well-situated not too close to the hustle and bustle of the city. We arrived late at night they tried to fob us off with a twin room (why would we have booked a twin room as a couple?) I was not happy at all eventually they gave in and gave us a free upgrade to a junior suite in the traditional part of the hotel. The room was nice but not amazing. It was an odd layout and there was no sink in the toilet which seems unhygienic. The bath was a bit chipped. It was nice to have Hermes products though!    The pool area was really good - really comfy double-beds and the pool was lovely. However the pool staff were really lazy and would stand around chatting. Not many people spoke English in the whole hotel which was pretty irritating - we got the impression that if you didn't speak French they didn't want to know. On the Friday we noticed a DJ setting up behind our sunbed. About 2pm he started blasting dance music. We had to shout of the pool boys (I had to shout of one of them 5 times - he was either deliberately ignoring me which wouldn't surprise me or the music was so loud he couldn't hear me) and asked him to get it turned down. The DJ reluctantly turned it down slightly and as soon as we got in the pool he turned it up again. We asked time and time again for it to be turned down. Then a group of annoying French people had their own speakers next to us and started blasting their music. Again we had to tell the pool boys to tell them to turn it down (they just kept walking past them acting like they hadn't noticed). It got to the point where we couldn't stand it anymore and I went inside and asked to speak to a manager. She did apologise and said they were trying to create a pool-party vibe. We said we could understand that if we were in Miami (which we've been to and thoroughly enjoyed - it's not that we're party-poopers) but not this hotel! We also said 2pm is far too early for that and also told her about how poor the pool staff were. She said she would take that on board.    We went out that evening and I asked the same manager if she could get us a hotel taxi (no way was I getting in one of the local tin-can taxis again!) and we waited for ages for it. She told one of the men outside to get it for us so we followed him and he tried putting us in a local taxi. I was really annoyed that we'd waited for ages when we could have just walked out and done that ourselves she just made the excuse that English wasn't her first language. We finally got a hotel taxi (¬£25!!!). The driver was actually really good and guided us to the rhiad we would have otherwise struggled to find.    The biggest problem with this hotel is the cost. It is extortionate! Breakfast is ¬£25 each - we ended up going to Le Table Du Marche around the corner which was OK (not that much cheaper really). Lunch ended up being really expensive e.g. Beef kebabs were ¬£25 a can of coke was nearly a fiver. We aren't cheapskates but it really ruined our enjoyment as we had to constantly check how much things were. There were also no shops nearby so you couldn't just go out and buy some cans and bring them back - there was no room in the fridges anyways.    I wouldn't recommend this hotel unless you don't mind being ignored and ripped off!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Decent hotel in a decent location
Review_Text: The hotel is fine. Not too far from the old city (but too far to walk in the extreme heat). There is a cafe nearby but no other decent food. Staff was always helpful. The buffet breakfast was acceptable but nowhere close to exceptional. DO NOT EAT OUTSIDE unless you love bees. The pools were nice. I never felt the rooms were properly cleaned but did not witness anything to support the feeling. Next time I will stay in a riad. The massages were good but the spa was average.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I don't even know where to start. I'm ctually here now for one more night and I'm trying to find a way to check out early due to the lack of service here.    First the good things so I'm not completely bashing the place. We are in a superior room so the size and location are nice. Also the size of the pool and lounge searing are plentiful and relaxing. Ok. That's about it.    Reasons why I wouldn't recommend this place to anybody:    - when we came to check in we got here early at 1230. They didn't have a room ready Whig was understandable since check in is at 3. But the manager came out and said that we can have lunch and come back as our rooms would be ready at "3". When 3 came around they didn't have rooms ready so my husband asked for the manager- they stalled and finally he came out and said "remember I said 3 or later". First off she didn't say that and neither does our hotel confirmation. They ended up scurrying and giving us the first 2 rooms that were ready (we are a party of 3).    Second= the pool was amazing. And the fact that they had a spa was the reason we chose this hotel amongst the Riyadhs. I love going into the spa at night or when it starts to get cooler. Oh don't get me started- this spa was a good size and appeared as a spa with the signs that sai no children and it appeared that there were jets for bubbles- but the spa was the same temperature as the pool at ALL times. We asked the staff to turn on the bubbles and heat and they turned on the bubbles for 3-5 minutes which it would automatically turn off. It NEVER got warm. When we asked about the heat they said that they only heat it up in the winter. The next day we were in the spa and it was cooler and other people were asking for heat- we asked for the manager and the same one from the day before came out with her greeting as "remember meeeeee?". I didn't know how to read her obnoxious comment but after asking her for the heat she flat out said no and that the spa does not have the ability to be heated. I find. This hard to believe since the last guy said they only heat it in the winter. I don't like being lied to. Then she said assured me that all jacuzzis are cold basically calling me crazy. I decide to not use the facility anymore and go back to the room about 10 minutes later. She apparently was watching me and came running after me offering access foe 2 of our 3 guests access to their spa where they have a hot tub. I thought that it was rude that she would split up our party even after I mentioned we were a party of 3 adults. Then she offered me to go to the managers bar and have a drink and "think about it". Thy was my last straw. Alcohol or unlomited soft drinks is not going to change how I feel to split up my party. Also there were kids in the spa the entire time- I have wonderful picture of it I will display when I get to the states.    Next complaint is very few people here speak English or Arabic for that matter. French is the main language. We attempted to call the concierge to find out how to retrieve phone messages. We got transferred to housekeeping the restaurant and the spa just because nobody speaks English. When we finally retrieved our phone message it was my family expressing concern whether I was even there. They had a difficult time reaching our room- A half hour on their dime. For a 5 star hotel they should have somebody who speaks english available at all times.    Lastly I'm having breakfast now that's costing an arm and a leg for a Buffett when I know I am not going to eat that much. They told me to go to the cafe terrace as I can order a la carte. I walked there with my friend and the staff were talking to their friends for a good 5 minutes before helping us. We looked at their pastries on display in their glass case which I will post a picture of- and the pastries were SWARMED with bees (which I'm allergic). When somebody came to help us I asked what was on their menu an they mentioned the pastries- I asked the "ones in there with the bees on it???". Her reply was simple "if that bothers you I can go to the kitchen and get you another one.". Really?????? Gross! Definitely not 5 star quality.    Needless to say I'm unhappy with this hotel. I've jotted down the general manager's name and will be writing a detailed letter as soon as I get home. Their managers are worthless so I'm hoping he may he a tad bit better. Whatever you do- avoid this hotel at all costs - you're wasting your money.

We went to this hotel in November to celebrate a special birthday and I'm very glad we did. Only a 15 minute walk from Jemaa el Fnaa square and most of the other attrractions this was very conveniently located. The rooms were large with one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in and the decor and atmosphere of the hotel was lovely. From the moment you enter into the hotel lobby with its rose scented fountain and your welcoming glass of mint tea served by silk turban clad waiters you feel as if you are somewhere special. The pool area is beautiful with intermittent "fountains" in one of the two large pools and an array of different sun bathing possibilities; hammocks big double beds four posters and the usual suns loungers. Towels are brought to you by the kaftan wearing attendants and are on hand for a drink from the bar. The only thing I would complain about is the bar area which lacked atmosphere and was expensive. There was entertainment in the form of a group one night but it finished rather early and the bar became empty as a result. Apart from this would highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: craig s wrote a review Jun 2011
Review_Text: Gorgeous hotel with great service and amenities. We were upgraded from a Junior suite to a grand suite which overlooked the beautiful pool. Fresh roses in the room rose petals on the towels in the bathroom. Great amenties beautiful furnishings gorgeous lobby and great service. If only I loved the city of Marrakech more (dirty crowded chaotic). I may come back and never leave the hotel!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a 5 star luxury hotel without doubt..    what we liked:  room size and beds.. beds are sooo comfy- lovely spacious bedrooms - we were in a huge room with lounge and 2 bathrooms- great views overlooking the pool and excellent (and well needed air con!)  pool - lovely setting 2 pools great choice of sun loungers- including large double beds.  staff- friendlyhelpful and ever smiling. efficient service throughout (except bars)  so lounge- the nightclub is great fun with live music (though be warned - plenty of smoking indoors still in Morocco!)..  breakfast- great selection  spa treatments- an upmarket and sophisticated spa- i didn't try it this time but my friends did and were very complimentary  be warned though- service at times can be a little slow (by western standards)... we found this mainly when ordering drinks in the bar  some drinks are pretty expensive even for a 5 star.. 27 euros for a kir royale.. really??!!    Overall the experience was wonderful and the hotel had a lovely resort style luxury feel to it- well located - only 15 minutes to airport and 5 mins to the Medina/souk..with some great bars and restaurants close by...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel lobby is beautiful the rooms are nice and comfortable but most importantly the staff is lovely and very helpful.  We arrived and our room could not be ready before a few hours. Since we have a baby and could not wait too long in the lobby they offered us a room in the palais imperial which was ready immediately. We agreed but upon arriving to the room it turned out to be a street view room with a lot of noise from the street and some works going on in the area. We called the reception and complained. They said that the hotel is fully booked and it is very difficult to find us another room. But my wife went to the lobby and told them that it was uncomfortably noisy for the baby. The manager Hayat was extremely helpful and she managed to upgrade us to a Junior suite with pool view. Very quiet and enough space for a couple with a child. This has really made a big difference and made our stay very enjoyable.  The breakfast buffet was great a large selection of excellent European and Moroccan food. The staff are so smiley professional helpful and genuine: all of them. We felt at home all the time.  The pools are very nice and there are enough "beds" around to sit down and sun bath. The spa is very nice too with a hammam. The most important thing about this hotel is that whatever you need the staff will help you and if you buy or eat things the price is not a rip-off like it is usually in other hotels.  We will definitely go back.

First of all the beds were extremely comfortable.  The service was extremely helpful - I lost my passport at the airport and the concierge had phoned everyone in town to help get it back within 15 minutes. Our safe wasn't working so the serviceman came out straight away and fixed it. Everything was done to ensure we had everything we needed.  The only real issue we had was the price of food in the hotel including the 15 euro charge to bring a 10 euro breakfast to our room! And the price of a club sandwich by the pool was 25 euros. Obviously this is a premium hotel but this seemed a bit steep. So we went to the lovely little cafe 2 minutes up the road for breakfast.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: ONE OF MY FAVOURITE PLACE IN THE WORLD !
Review_Text: I've staid many times in this hotel and i have to say that they really know about excellence service to their guest. Staff are very helpful welcoming. The hotel is absolutely wonderful in term of design. Staying there will be a total evasion. The concierge is the best all my stay at this hotel he took care about my car rental and really made things easy for me. Checkin in the morning had my car available at the hotel in the afternoon advice about spas clubs restaurants etc... This is one of my favourite place to stay in the world. All the services provides by the hotel are just excellent ! great job really !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Sofitel Lounge and Spa is very close to the limited sights of Marrakesh ‚Äì walking distance or a ¬£5.00 cab. It is a great looking hotel in the international style with a Moroccan twist. Perhaps 15 minutes by cab from the airport. It is located on Marrakesh‚Äôs park lane if you will and there are some good restaurants and cafes nearby (head to Caf√© Blatt for breakfast Comptoir for supper with belly dancers at circa 22.00 but if a man alone or with other guys be aware that you may subtlety be set up with a working girl by the house ‚Äì all quite charming but not for free) and night clubs. The Hotel Hivernage restaurant is great and less expensive than the others.    The Sofitel itself -    We asked for twice and waited twenty minutes for a menu at the terrace bar ‚Äì it never came we got up and left. The very important wake-up call requested and agreed the night before never came a porter telephoned for - never came. Nothing in terms of service is ‚Äòquite right‚Äô minibar not refilled ‚Äì and it would have been used by us. Put simply Sofitel really miss a trick with this one ‚Äì so much more money would be spent in the hotel if they could just get the service right. When the wakeup call issue was discussed with the desk those behind it entered into an argument amongst themselves with no apology I just walked away ‚Äì really not what you expect in this class of hotel.    Very irritatingly you need to approach a pool attendant to get a towel for a lounger and even if you request a menu one might never come (the only time I requested a menu from a pool attendant it simply never arrived the attendant more interested in chatting up five Moroccan girls - I don‚Äôt blame a young guy for it but he should attend to business first). Sometimes it is a struggle to get anything done in this hotel ‚Äì and at this level it isn‚Äôt on.    The hotel is certainly clean and tidy and credit must be given to the maids who clearly do an excellent job. The bar / restaurant prices are western five star ‚Äì five star deluxe. Indoor pool and ‚Äòspa‚Äô which is only a hammam and a sauna is ¬£25.00 each per visit (massages etc. are extortionate; you would think you were at the Paris Ritz). Generally the hotel is full of rich Moroccans (who from what I encountered have a rather imperious attitude when it comes to service which isn‚Äôt pleasant to watch) doing business and loafing around loads of French and a few Brits.    The hotel not considering the service is five star by any standard Louis Vuitton boutique a jewellers etc the pools and gardens are beautiful (the heated pool really is very warm at all times) and the nightclub is like something from Scarface ‚Äì very cool.  For the money ‚Äì we paid ¬£1700 Inc. flights for two from London for five nights it is just OK I would probably try somewhere else next time but that is reflective of the service and not the quality of the hotel or room itself.

Review_Title: Poor service, dull rooms and overpriced
Review_Text: Stayed at sofitel marrakech for 5 nights and the experience was far below expectations. The rooms were uninspiring and felt like a 3-star hotel. We were allocated a room directly opposite the air con units that hummed constantly they would only move us at an additional cost.    The room service menu is extortionate and the food is average. Although the reception area is very stylish the service in all areas were pretty poor. The pool bar is a joke staff ignoring you having to ask several times to be served. This went on time after time.    The pool is very busy and we found it difficult to find any space.    Sofitel looks like a 5-star in the pictures but the rooms service as well as the high prices for food and drinks make it a poor option to stay at.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Not a 5 star, but there's something to be said for large hotels
Review_Text: Other reviewers have summed it up - perfectly good hotel but not a 5*. Lighting in the rooms was dim the bath amenities don't include body lotion service in the lounge/bar is inattentive at best. There were also a lot of bees around which happens when there are gardens but it wasn't reassuring to see them buzzing around inside the food display cases and the staff doing nothing about it.    Our room was fine - a long walk from the entrance but quiet and comfortable enough. We were in the Moroccan wing - so the room had a little bit of flair and a nice little balcony overlooking the pool. One odd thing was how the bathroom was split up - right when you enter the room there was a toilet bowl in a narrow dark room on the left then you went through a small hallway with closets then you were in the bedroom and the bath/shower and sink were off the bedroom (i.e. not connected to the room with the toilet). Not bad just different although it would have been nice to have a sink in with the toilet too. The rooms in the other wing may have had a more standard layout. We got at least one English TV channel.    We never ate breakfast at the hotel we instead walked either a block over to the Extrablatt or ate at La Table du Marche across the street both of which were a better value than the Sofitel. It was an easy walk into the Medina and nice to be out of the insanity. The public areas of the hotel are indeed spectacular. We didn't try the casino.    While a riyadh would certainly have more charm one thing to keep in mind is that many of them (at least ones we researched) required at least a 30% non-refundable deposit (ouch). With the Sofitel we could have cancelled with no penalty a day or so before which is nice to know if your travel plans aren't set in stone. It's also nice to have your taxi drop you (and your luggage) right off at the hotel's entrance. Also in a large anonymous hotel you don't have to share breakfast with the people you heard in the room next door the night before....
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel does have some good points. The location is superb with only a 5 minute walk to the Medina the pool area is lovely and the food is delicious.    But....    The paper thin walls/ceilings and eccentric AC mean that you are unlikely to get much sleep. There are some nice touches as they strive for luxury but they need to get the basics right first such as providing quiet & temperate rooms.    The service is generally slow and surly which adds insult to injury given the ridiculous mark up on food & drink (¬£5 for a coke!). If you do stay here then have lunch at the superb Cafe Extrablatt 150m away and dinner in one of the many surrounding restaurants or street food at the Djemaa el Fna.    Overall If you are looking to come home rested and refreshed then stay somewhere else.

Review_Title: Beautiful entrance hall, gardens and pool, but, some of the service was bad..
Review_Text: Luxury rooms are not luxurious - no shaving mirror small miniscule balcony woken every night at 4.30 am by groups of men outside the hotel shouting and tooting car horns!? 'Oh right' - was the response I received from reception -'perhaps it's men partying'.    The cot bed looked like a dirty laundry basket.    There are lots of staff but try and get a coffee at the pool bar within 10 minutes of asking and you'll be very lucky- you can only get one sent over to you - 30 mins later!    Incorrect menus put out for the main restaurant in the evening - we wouldn't have eaten there if we knew it was a buffet.    Asked room service to send up a menu to our room - it didn't ever turn up!!    In my opinion there are too many rooms and not enough manners.    Spa prices were extortionate so went to the Hotel Hivernage opposite.

Review_Date: Lhotse H wrote a review Apr 2011
Review_Title: Great hotel for Medina adventures and escapes
Review_Text: I travelled to Sofitel Marrakech after staying at the Sofitels in Agadir and Essaouira. Sofitel Marrakech is a great hotel oasis in the big big city. The hotel itself is stunningly beautiful the pool and restaurants are great and the service is fantastic. We were happy to horse carriage over to the medina and to escape the same way back to the hotel to cool off in the pool. The LV store in the lobby is a dangerously nice touch. Our favorite spot was definitely the Sofitel in Agadir especially the service there but Marrakech is a must-see and the Sofitel is a must stay; if you are not inclined to roll your suitcases and weary children into a fancy riad in the medina.

Just back from 6 days at the Sofitel and I dont have a bad thing to say about it. Location was perfect for us close enough to enjoy the sites while still being able to chill out by a luxury pool. Lots of places to eat around the hotel. Yes bar prices are not cheap but inline with other 5 start hotels. Staff were attentive and friendly.

Review_Title: In a 5* Hotel, Everything Should be Nicer than in my House
Review_Text: I've stayed at this hotel twice and would stay there again because it really is a lovely hotel. The common areas are beautiful and the service great. Check-in was relatively quick and they bring you hot towels and tea while doing the paperwork. They provide l'Occitane toiletries a nice touch.    My complaints are minor but the point is that there shouldn't be any complaints about a 5* hotel. The hotel is large and the first time I stayed there my garden room was about a mile from the reception area. The room was very nice but we requested a baby crib and could barely squeeze it into the room and I could swear that what they actually gave us was a laundry cart with a mattress in the bottow. It was so deep it was nearly impossible to lean in to get the baby out!    My second stay was just this month and I had a 3rd floor room. The bed was extremely comfortable and I got the best sleep I've gotten in ages. But the room itself was pretty blah with all-purpose carpet and plain rather thin bathtowels. In a 5* hotel I expect little things like the bath towels to be nicer than what I have at home. On this trip I ate at the "So" restaurant -- overcooked steak nothing special -- but it was a conference dinner so for conference food it was OK.    I'd stay there again for business but not for a romantic holiday or typically Moroccan vacation.

We just returned from a good stay at the Sofitel in Marrakech. Perhaps it was the less interesting option. The hotel is very good & there are many many staff around. But it lacks a little soul & having seen in one of the riads where I went for a spa treatment next time I will stay in a riad to have a more authentic experience.  Lots of food choices & the room was well equipped. But it is sort of in the middle of nowhere. Yes its the hotel district but its not the new town and its not the old town. So it felt like we spent 4 days walking & walking.  But overall a perfectly good stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: When we arrived (@ 11h30)  the room wasn't ready and there were some problems with the VISA-system. After letting us wait for about a half an hour the room was 'ready' and the VISA problems were solved. Once in our room we checked the minibar and noticed that it was not completely filled. Also the shower gel in the bathroom had already been used. Some small problems we could life with... But when I decided to take a shower the real problems began. After about 5 minutes in the shower the bathroom was flooded by water and the water temperature was changing all the time. On our second night we arrived in our room @ 20h45 and we noticed that the room hadn't been serviced. The beds weren't made up the towels hadn't been replaced ... So we went to the reception to notice the problems but the lady at the reception just gave us an extra key for our room (???). Thats also a real problem: there is some staff that can speak English but most of them only speak a little French (but even in French they don't always understand you). After explaining the problem in English AND french they told us they would send someone to our room. So we waited again for about 45 minutes till someone arrived. He told us the lady of the housekeeping had already left the hotel so he made up the bed. We told him the room was messy and needed some cleaning so he left the room and after again a half an hour he came back with another guy. They cleaned the bathroom and put roses in the bathtube (to please us I think..) But they didn't vacuum the room (photo) didn't clean the closets ... So we called the supervisor and she did appologize for it and she promised to deal with all the problems the day after. The 3rd day the room was clean but the shower still wasn't fixed and on the bed the bed linen was worn out (photo) and the bathrobe was dirty (photo). I can go on like this forever with all the small problems that make this hotel not worth it's 5 stars! Also the price for breakfast and drinks is really too high. 25 euro for a breakfast?! In the city you can have a really good one for about 2 euro!  So to conclude the hotel really has to do something about the quality of the rooms the speed of the service and the language knowledge of its staff otherwise they will have to deal with a lot more of negative comments in the future I suppose...  It has to be said that Sofitel tries to keep its name high by sending appology mails saying they will deal with the problems or by giving us some biscuits and slippers. But that's not the way you treat unhappy customers! Just give them some biscuits and they will shut up? Think again ;)

Review_Date: Carly Brad wrote a review Mar 2011
Review_Title: Lush hotel with fantastic pool area but felt uncomfortable at times
Review_Text: The hotel is beautiful this goes without saying. Staff were welcoming upon arrival and greeted us with hot towels. Speedy check in service and went straight to the room with no problems. Baggage took a bit of time but can expect this when arriving in the evening.  Room was lovely. Comfortable beds and very spacious with towels provided and bath robes and slippers provided.  Didn't use mini bar due to how expensive the items were. Worth buying a bottle or two at the airport before you depart as alcohol in Marrakech is very expensive and very limited.  Had breakfast the 1st morning in the hotel but very expensive and not much choice. ¬£20 per person and orange juice is limited. Not available to help yourself - all waiter service.  Found some lovely restaurants within walking distance from the hotel. One called Extrablatt which is across from the hotel on the right hand side past the Novotel Suites. Very reasonable prices open at 8am in the morning and close late in the evenings. Had breakfast every morning here and an evening meal on the first night. It's almost as if it's the TGI's of Marrakech! Staff very welcoming and quick service.  Another restaurant we visited was around the corner from the hotel. Attached to a hotel so served alcohol at reasonable cost. I wasn't best pleased with my meal so I complained and didnt have to pay - however my friends meal looked reasonable so don't rule this one out based on my opinion!  A lovely Thai Restaurant just up from ExtraBlatt. This is highly recommended and food was stunning. A lot of choice bit more expensive but food was good quality. We booked in the day which is also recommended as it gets busy past 8pm.  Weather wasn't the best. We stayed for 4 nights 4 days and we only got one day good sunny weather. Rained a lot (still fairly warm) and cooler at night so cardigans/jackets are a must! Rainy season is end of November through to March so be prepared!  Took walks daily. Everyday we seemed to end up somewhere different. New town in Marrakech was ok. Some shops like Zara and Etam but not much more. Lots of cafes to sit at though to people watch which is always good if your a nosey person like me!  Took a Marrakech Bus Tour on one day as well. These come in either 24 or 48 hour passes - would only reccommend 24 hour pass otherwise you will just end up wasting your money. We felt we managed to get around most of Marrakech in a day.  We didn't however do the Mountains but got told it was a trek on the coach their and back for only an hours stay so we didn't bother.  Overall the hotel and staff were lovely. However we did feel uncomfortable at times walking through this hotel as Tourists as this hotel was more aimed at Business. Lots of business men and women and very expensive for food and drinks but made us want to venture out more which was good.  Pool area fantastic. Comfy beds and towels available throughout the day. One warm and one cold pool. Not many families. Mainly couples/group holiday/business.  Overall hotel lovely with casino attached to the side but wouldnt go back only because of the cost when you are there.

This is a very good 5* hotel attentive staff and very good service. Certainly an air of luxury and a high ratio of extremely helpful staff. Check in was very smooth we arrived at mid day and shown to our room straight away. If I stayed here again I would request a room with a pool view the garden view rooms had a view of the back of the hotel which was a dumping ground for old furniture and carpet making our balcony unusable. The bedroom was nicely furnished and the bed linen of a good quality. Room service delivery was very prompt. I would not recommend eating at the pool restaurant very poor value for money. Breakfast is also very expensive have coffee and croissant on the verandah much better  value and lovely views of the pool and garden. The pool area was excellent with very comfortable sun loungers/beds with staff always willing to set up your bed for you. I enjoyed my stay here and would certainly return.

Out of all the 5 star hotels we viewed in Marrakech this was the most geared up for families. It was light and airy unlike the other dark and mysterious 5 star hotels so we feel we made a great choice. There is a lot of walking to be done none the least from reception to our bedroom (at least 6 or 7 minutes). However the bedroom had black out curtains and was silent therefore we had fantastic deep long sleeps in very comfy beds.  The Sofitel is located just outside the main walls of the Medina even so a steady 15 minute walk to get to the main square which is the only place to congregate at night unless you have chosen to go to a restaurant elsewhere in the City. There was no service or area of the hotel that let itself down we were very impressed with the service and friendliness of the staff at all levels. It was a great relief at breakfast to be attended to the instant you sit down and the hot drink of your choice bought within seconds. I usually hate buffet breakfasts in hotels all that running around looking at various stations searching for cups and spoons bowls and eggs. The breakfasts are expensive with not the widest range but the foods available were available in various different formats i.e. fruit came in fruit puree fruit slices fruit smoothie fruit pressee fruit yoghurt fruit fool etc. The eggs came in 10 different ways. On saying that the eggs also came via crepes and pancakes. There were various cereals some cold meats and cheeses and many varieties of yoghurts breads and cakes.  There are two swimming pools in the grounds - one heated during the winter months. The exterior grounds were fantastic palms and plants hammocks huge 4 poster sunbeds and loungers - it was beautiful plus pool towels on tap. There was a kids club should parents choose to use which had everything they could desire and well attentive carers who seemed fascinated by the children. They were having the best time. My only disappointment if there has to be one was the bar area outside in the evening. There was a lack of service along with a lack of atmosphere (although the weather was not too warm to be hanging around outside) and the extremely expensive cocktails that finally arrived after huge long waits did not seem worth it. They also came with a lot of sugar involved which is kind of strange but then they like to use a lot of sugar in most of their dishes (check their teeth in Morocco!). Thankgoodness for the gym which is free to use and although not huge selection of equipment there to use it was definitely a bonus. And lastly outside in the hotel front gardens they have electric go karts for the kids to use which was kind of cool. The stay at the sofitel really completed our holiday worthwhile.

hotel staff were lovely did everything for you. the sofitel is luxury and comfort at its best  close 2 the main jemme al fna but such a contrast  madness outside with busy roads and hectic markets but haven inside i found. food is expensive in sofitel but cheap restaurants within 5 mins walk . rooms very comfortable beds are hard to get out of they're so snug. i loved it and will definately be going back....
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I find it very strange that people can critisize anything about this hotel.    Everything was faultless from the time of arrival to departure - yes the costs are quite high but then again you are in a 5* hotel.    If you work out that a pint of lager comes in at around ¬£15 and a semi-decent bottle of red wine is over ¬£70.    I would recommend this to anyone and would go back again without fail.    Staff cant do enough for you are always polite and even though English isnt in their top 3 or 4 languages they will still get someone to help any situation.    Only downside - if you are eating in the 'disco restaurant' - make sure you book a table - bcos all of the local money bags are there Fridays and Saturdays - unlike us who turned up and expected as a guest to have a table ! :-) ................. and ......... the staff still made room for us !    Lee London UK
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Near the airport and great intro to the city the air is beautifully scented.
Review_Text: This hotel was our first stay being close to the airport  The air is beautifully scented and the pool is amazing .The management staff is very french.  But it is a beautiful hotel.Breakfast is a wonderment make sure you sit outside and have breakfast overlooking the herb garden.  I only stayed one night as i was moving into a riad for the week.

Review_Date: John K wrote a review Jan 2011
Review_Text: This hotel looks like the discarded leftovers of a W property. The bed was inattentively painted a tacky silver and the room was cramped and dull.    We called for a box to have some of our accumulated souvenirs sent home; after 3 or 4 separate phone calls to different staff members each of whom assured us they'd send a box right over we never got our box. On one of those calls the staff member mentioned that the hotel did not offer a mailing service but that he would be contacting a third party to come get our stuff and would call us back. He never did. We left early the next morning and had to find some temporary packing material at the airport to get our stuff safely on the plane. Fortunately an airport baggage-wrapper attendant was far more helpful than the Sofitel and shockingly our souvenirs survived 2 connections back to the United States.    The room service food was really poor but the hotel wasn't all bad: the Sofitel luggage-handlers and doormen couldn't have been more gracious. Sofitel would be better off letting them run the hotel than such an uncaring and inept front desk.    There are many better hotels and riads at which to stay in Marrakech.

Review_Title: Lovely pool and garden!! umm.. that's it really...
Review_Text: I chose this hotel on the recommendation of a friend who had stayed there in the summer. He raved about it so we decided it was worth a go however it seemed we did not have the same experience. All in all its a very beautiful hotel with a stunning pool area which is well kept and offers plenty of large sun loungers which were very comfortable and more like outside beds. The gardens are lovely and there is also a relaxing terrace however as we were there in December we only got to make use of the pool and gardens on the first day after that it was too cold or too wet. The weather played a big part in our enjoyment at the hotel which is obviously not their fault.  The rooms were nice and the beds are extremely comfortable. Service is so so check-in seemed to take forever and overall attitude was ok but better if you could speak French. We noticed a big difference in how they treated French speakers over others. Breakfast was ok lots of lovely fresh fruit but some of the hot items were awful. One tip - avoid the lunch buffet its very expensive and not worth the money.  The Location was not bad a bit of a walk into the old town but not too far. There are also a small selection of very good restaurants a short walk from the hotel including Comptoir and La Villa which were both excellent.  The Spa was very nice a little expensive but this is to be expected.  Biggest complaint was the smoking! The reception was smokey and the bar was so bad we could only manage one overpriced drink. I guess in the summer more people are outside so its ok but as it was very cold everyone was indoors.  I was a little underwhelmed but all in all its a good hotel maybe not a true 5* standard but if you are looking for a nice pool then this is the one. I hated Marrakech with a passion and will never go back but this hotel is a little oasis.

Very disappointed by this hotel.    I had the worst food ever especially at pool restaurant. Every guest was disgusted by the food there.    Worst service ever you can wait for room service hours and never show up !!!    You hear every heartbeat from your neighboors room !!    Never back there  not worth the 5 star price.    May better choices in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: When we arrived as this hotel that first thing we noticed was the Lamborghini's and Ferrari's parked outside and upon entering we were quickly ushered to a seat and served Mint tea while the super attentive staff checked us in and filled out the forms on our behalf. The pool area is very attractive and really does look great with an unlimited number of seating/bed/hammock options in or out of the shade. Attendants wait poolside to meet your every demand and deliver a cold beer without you having to move a muscle.    The food we had both for breakfast and dinner really was top notch if not a little over fussy with the amuse-bouche at dinner maybe. The Veal Tagine really was the best we'd ever eaten!    One thing we noted was that everyone around us seemed to have a lot of money be very well dressed and we even ran into a few famous faces. So remember to pack your glad rags as you will certainly feel like you need them!    If you don't feel like splashing out in the restaurant then we would recommend eating in the bar (not well advertised) ask and they will get you almost anything - we enjoyed a bowl of fries on our last night so that we could fit in the buffet breakfast.    Be warned that the constant presence of hotel staff can be a little overbearing (the only safe place being your hotel room) and not everyone's cup of tea.    Avoid the modern part of Marrakesh as its bland and underwhelming but the old town is fantastic and full of culture (but perhaps don't wear those hot pants - generally muslins aren't overly keen of displays of nakedness!).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: we had some issues with the rooms firstly the carpets etc in the room were not so clean  quite dirrty and old secondly we had 6 rooms and all of us had a problem with the shower  the cold and hot water was just switching on by it self  one time you had very cold water and the second minute very hot water  this was really frustrating also the other thing is that we had to pay to use the steam and sauna facitlity in the hotel this is really strange..

Review_Title: Absolutly Beautiful, Truley deserves it's 5 star status....
Review_Text: I am a travel agent who travelled here with a friend and colluege for a weekend break We travelled with the tour opertor soverigne and as we pulled up in our luxury car we were blown away by the Sofitel the entrance is on to remember! Stunning water fountain surrounded by lovely looking and smelling rose bushes.  A red carpet sweeps the steps and as you arrive The door men are there to take you suitcases and open the doors. Never did a day go by without any member of staff not greeting you as they walked passed. The customer service at this hotel is amazing!  When checking in we were offered a seat and given hot towles and traditional morrocan mint tea which is stunning. The concierge at the hotel made him self aware to us and if you have any needs this is they person to talk to he can organise meals out from tradition morrocan to a 5 star al a carte resturant. A variety of Excurisons Senic walks tours Ask and he will get you an answer.  After waiting we were shown to our room we stayed in the traditional side of the hotel and the room was out of this world! We had room 279 overlooking the stunning pools and gardens. The room had two huge beds with the most comfortable matress and pillows i have ever slept on!! A couch tucked away in the corner with a lovely window with little doors we also had a balcony with a table and chairs on which was a delight to sit on and sip on a glass of champage as we watched the world go by. The bathroom was stunning with traditional orange colours We had a bath with shower over head which was very powefull and perfect tempreture! Towls re stocked daily and fresh rose petals scattered on the floor it was such a magic touch!  There was complimentry bath robes and slippers to use through out our stay which was very usefull as we forgot our own!  We were booked onto bed and breakfast basis you can choose from english to morrocan to burber to continental breakfasts so plenty to choose from and explore morrocan food Every item cooked to perfection! Freshy squeezed orange juice is free flowing as is tea and coffee you can choose to sit inside or outside on the amazing terrece over looking the pool and gardens.  We ate just once in the hotels resturant which was very resonable priced - Over negative comments about the hotel being expencive its a 5 star hotel with 5 star customer service 5 star food so you truley do get what you pay for!  We ate in the orange resturant which cost ¬£60 per person for a main course a dessert and a bottle of wine (bareing in mind we had one of the expencive bottles) so very very resonable!! The food was stunning! We had Lamb cooked with rosmary and caramilised onions! Outstanding.  This hotel also offers room service which again is resonable priced very nice and very quick to get to your room.  The staff at the hotel work really hard to please every single customer that walks though the door the customer service here exceeds expectations.  We tipped most staff around 20-50 dirhams a time which is 2-4 pounds We tipped a bit more for staff members who truley did something special for our stay.    This hotel is proberbly the best i have stayed in truly spectacular in every way!!!

Review_Title: Nice Hotel but poor communication skills
Review_Text: This was our location for a four day golf tour. The pool area and lounge are very nice and breakfast although often busy was very good. The Hotel is near to the golf courses city and nightlife. Comfortable rooms and friendly staff. The bar service was slow and they could have had a lot more business from our group if they were more efficient. Unfortunately I left my camera in my room after I checked out and only realised when I got home.
